text: The good side: batman.The bad side: flash.How is it possible in a Flash movie that the worst part of the entire thing was the Flash? The cheap CGI, the plodding scenes, the cast member who is more notorious for arrests than for skill.And we have no relief from this, for while the creative team was given carte blanche on cameos, we get only the one Flash--when we should have had a significant beat to thank those that carried the franchise for so many years with fans.Meanwhile, most fans undoubtedly went for Batman. Keaton rocks it. And we get two other live Batmen, with the final one perhaps the "reset" to the franchise we've been promised?An older actor now, but certainly popular and suave. Plus, he's had the suit on before. (Sorry, not giving spoilers, though I'm pretty sure people know which three live Batmen returned to help out.)A slight distasteful moment as we even were given two Batmen from beyond the grave.But, honestly again, why is the best thing about a Flash movie, Batman? And was that where the huge budget of this film went? Because otherwise, it felt very CWDC. (Or worse, made me long for Grant's Flash--the superior brand.)

title: It was Worth the Praise! The Flash was so enjoyable!!!
text: Really really enjoyed The Flash!! The movie was Soo funny and even emotional!! It truly lived up to the praise it got by people like Tom Cruise!!In part due to the outstanding double performance of a lifetime by Ezra Miller, this film took to great emotional and humourous heights!!! He truly filled his role with all the perfect witty humor and so much heart and seriousness!!! The lightning injected action was Soo cool at times! And the Batmans especially Ben Affleck and Micheal Keaton near equally complimented him in making his first film a truly resounding and profound one!! Barry Allen's pain for his mother could be felt and the plot was very well built involving genius and overwhelming use of time travel that really built for shock value and connected the overall plot very well!!!Andres Muchietti really grew out of his IT fame to deliver an outstanding spectacle that was truly the MOVIE EVENT it was hailed to be!!! And the DC cameos were just blissful, pure fanservice to the history of DC in Film!! Despite all the troubles and deplorable decisions of Warner Bros. To Superman and Henry Cavill, This film came out as truly special and very pleasing!!!The Flash was truly a must see thrill ride for DC!!!

title: what did i just watch
text: I've always loved the flash from the comics to even the flash series. But this. I dont even know what to think. Let me give you the jist. Mid acting, cheesy jokes, and just barry just being i dont even know.I will start off with the acting. It wasn't good at all. There's not much more to say. Because it wasn't the best i felt like the characters were shallow and almost undeveloped.I laughed a couple times throughout the movie but not a lot. There's really not much more to say except nicolas change as super man? I dont know what was going on there.There was super girl in it to but she wasn't a great either. I feel like she was just there and didn't do anything else.I really liked the newest batman and some other DC movies but this felt like i could compare it to captain marvel. So overall i thought the movie was fine it didn't stick out to me but i never got bored and as long as it kept me entertained. 6/10.

title: How there are people givin to this 8-10?
text: This movie makes me appreciate what made Tim Burton with his Batman in every way. This movie really REALLY looks ugly. And i'm not talking about the CGI. It is ugly in a every level. It feels visually a crazy expensive youtube video. The lack of any aesthetic, goal, or real use of cinema language or real acting... it is crazy how forgettable this is.I enjoyed a lot watching again MIchael Keaton and is sad this is the last time i will watch him being Batman. ¿Remember Spiderman No Way Home? How the director and the script understood the characters in the best way possible. This is not happening here, Michael Keaton and cameos are used for clickbait and trying to save a project with a protagonist who is a piece of crap in real life.Oh, btw the humour and the """""JOKES"""", ffs. Maybe if you have 10 will laugh i guess. Super dumb and bad timed jokes. My advice is, don't pay for this. Is not worth it your money and also, your time.

title: The Flash is a lot of fun but nothing out of the ordinary!
text: A fun ride throughout the multiverse but nothing out of the ordinary!The Flash is a fun watch and has some great comedian scenes but it has it's problems.I'm not fully convinced by the CGI, character developments and didn't really felt bounded with it's characters.The hand on hand & chasing scenes on the other hand were wonderful and so great to see on the big screen, the third act action scenes were more of a mess and hard to follow. The same goes for it's storyline it's so overloaded with fan service and the introduction of characters that it becomes hard to follow.The Flash is a overall good movie but not the best DC one yet as being said by the critics.

title: The SFX...
text: I just wanted to say that after having watched the first 10 minutes I'm really surprised by how bad the SFX was at many points. For some reason the quality reminded me of the live action children's movie Ben 10 from 2007 which I believe aired on Cartoon Network.I've only watched 10 minutes but I can't stop having this disgusted face on my face over how terrible the quality is. The Flash's suit looks like it's made out of play dough or the material they make Stretch Armstrong from. The babies... Don't get me started on the babies.The acting is not much better. It's like if the teenage crowd from Tumblr tried to write a quirky relatable character in 2012.Watch this moviewith friends to make fun out of. I think this is the only acceptable use of this movie especially when you take into account the massive budget.

title: Little Good Mostly AWFUL
text: The few who are praising this movie must really be overly loyal fanboys or easily impressed limited thinkers. This movie is simply not very good. The factors that hurt it the most are the extremely poor computer generated images (CGI) and downright awful special effects as well as a genuinely unlikable lead character. We all know about Ezra Miller's offset insanity and criminal behavior but in front of the camera his Barry Allen is as agitating and annoying as any character in recent memory. Surprisingly, the Supergirl character wasn't bad. What was good was Keaton's Batman and unfortunately he wasn't suited up very long in the film itself. Overall, this is not worth any sane person's time or money.

title: Fun and Action-Packed, With A Good Story
text: I saw this at a Warner Brothers screening a couple of weeks ago. While the film has its flaws, in the end it tells a human story filled with fun action set pieces, and humor. Characters have motivation, story mostly makes sense, and was nice to not have any hidden agenda. The humor mostly worked for me and doesn't fall much into bathos (think Marvel humor) but gets corny at times.Acting - Ezra Miller playing two characters, and exhibiting a range of emotions called for, he does surprisingly well. Sasha Calle was really good and hooe to see her do this character again. Michael Keaton steals every scene he is in and it doesn't feel like it's been 30 years since he donned the cape and cowl.Supporting characters are fine. Zod could have been any villain and isn't given much, but Michael Shannon does great with what he's given.CGI is hit or miss, but mostly a hit. No spoiler, but if you remember the dancing baby desktop animation from the late 90s, prepare for that to be a meme in reference to a scene from this film. That was a laugh out loud moment.The story mostly works and don't have any real complaints except it felt too long. Trimming 15-20 minutes out would take this up a star.The screening was full (of course it was, it was free) and a cross section of fans and casual viewers, I'm sure by design. The reaction during and after the film was very enthusiastic.

title: Cheap copy of a cheap original
text:
It's just a collection of bad sequences, why would you think that this is the best idea to get into the speed force , i can't fathom the amount of tr*** gfx trying to erase a good foundation with this bad gfx , someone should have told them that doctor strange in the multiverse of madness sucked badly to just try do so
It's just bad & it could have been way better even the after credits scene is bad & meaning less you could have hinted anything any common Flash rivals there's so many of them & there's so many ideas to throw at the movie instead you dropped an empty movie with hollow characters that at some point you will wonder how they convinced them to come back for that dumb movie.

title: it's good
text: The Flash (Ezra Miller) discovers that he can travel back in time. Despite a warning from Batman, he decides to use his new power to save his parents. Suddenly, everything changes and he is ejected to a time before he got his speed powers.As a movie, this is actually really good. I had a lot of fun and it's a lot of nostalgia. If I had any suggestions, I would not do the CGI fake renditions of the old characters. The film should just use the old footage without modifying them. Ezra Miller is quite funny. Michael Keaton is back. This is a good comic book movie.The issue is really everything around and outside of the film itself. I'm not even going to discuss Ezra Miller's problematic issues. The DC universe is going through a messy turnover and I don't know which character is staying and which is changing. This movie is obsolete before it gets out. None of this matters. It's a sh14 storm outside, but I choose to review this without the sh14 storm. It's a good movie.

title: Great
text: I've not been a fan of the DCEU or whatever DC's answer to Marvels MCU is called. But i love Batman and the time travel stuff here sounded fun so had to check it out.The movies actually way better than i thought it would be. Its way funny, and there's plenty of action. Not too mention those expected nostalgic moments and in jokes. In alot of ways the movies an absolute dream for older DC fans. And despite the controversy surrounding star Edza Miller. I've got to be honest and admit that he's great in his double role here. Though DC should move on now.I did enjoy the movie alot more than Justice league, Batman v Superman and all that. But of course it still has its cons. Some of the CGI is poor and a twist towards the end almost takes down the whole thing. I'm being genuine and just admitting i liked the movie. But i also hope DC goes in a new direction now and makes even better individual movies going forward.

title: Good movie
text: I've thought about this one, and I feel like this is a simply good movie you could watch.It's overhype made me disappointed by my first viewing, and I felt as if it relied to heavily on random things happening and not worrying about the rules.It's simple description of the rules actually helps the movie and the viewer be able to enjoy the show without holding many questions throughout the runtime, which did allow me to enjoy the movie more.The CGI isn't as bad as people say, but definitely could be better, and the acting, especially super girl, should be given nominations. I would say Ezra deserves one as well, but he seems to be too busy at the moment.My favourite part of this movie is the story it tells. Barry has such an interesting story which brought me into the movie and feel connected to tue events on screen. The comedy can get overwhelming, but definitely keeps quiet during scenes that it should.Definitely not perfect, but better than mediocre.

title: Mediocre and overrated
text: When I read about all the stuff that Ezra was accused of I was kind of shocked, but the. Obviously he's a box ticker and not charges happened so this film came out. The fact they stood by him made me think this performance would be mind blowing.It's not, at best he'd be a side kick, he tries the Tom Holland stuff which is already pretty tedious, his voice is nasally sounding and monotonous. He hasn't got a great range of expressions, I just thought he was definitely replaceable, I'd not be desperate to get him back, he had no chemistry with anyone and just felt out his depth. I don't get what he was doing with the performance.Some of the cameos were cool, film is way too long, drags in parts and it's a very weak story for such a long film, the emotional stuff kinda works as the mom is great. But this is one of the worst superhero movies I've seen, along with venom 2 and immortals.Cgi was terrible, games do it better.

title: It was a really fun movie, cant understand all the negative reviews
text: The story was really well written, nothing too crazy or special but was entertaining. Didn't get bored at any stage of the movie, and isn't that was a good movie should be about.CGI was decent enough, definitely not as bad as some of reviews are making it to be.Performance was good from everyone, especially Keaton.Fan service is amazing, you will love it for sure. That doesn't take away the fact that the movie at its core was kept light and fun, and there was never a bad moment in the story. It was never just about fan service.Overall a really fun movie, go watch it. Ignore the negative reviews.

title: Not bad, not great either
text: Considering how underwhelming DC has been with their Cinematic Universe, The Flash manages to exceed expectations and deliver a pretty enjoyable movie. Acting is not excellent, especially for a movie that's supposed to be the biggest DC movie this year. However, the biggest question mark remains the CGI/VFX, with some speeding/time travelling scenes looking borderline ridiculous. The fighting scenes, on the other hand, are nothing short of amazing. The plot follows the already well known story of Barry trying to change his past by saving his mom, resulting in a catastrophic change in timelines. Nothing new, but yet manages to keep the attention for the full length. A must watch for the fans of the Flash.

title: A below average uneven, unbalanced structure less mess
text:
What happened? What universe am in that this film is getting 8s 9s and 10s from audience members?The Flash is pure fan service for the sake of fan service, and it's not even good fan service. All of it just serves as a distraction, and poor excuse for terrible writing, terrible storytelling, and atrocious pacing.When this movie starts, you better brace yourself because it doesn't stop! Maybe this is intentional? Maybe it's supposed to be fast and chaotic as to give audience members a feel for Barry's life. But that can't be because any sane person can see that is the poorest form of storytelling. This film jumps from scene to scene with no cohesive thought or balance. They took a collection of scenes and let a monkey edit everything together.The only time, the only time this movie actually stopped, and showed some sense was in its conclusion. Barry finally stopping and seeing the chaos and destruction he had caused in the multiverse, but because everything beforehand was set up so poorly that it just didn't matter anymore. Then that ending just threw whatever good was in that sequence away in the dumpster.Now, NOT everything here is bad. The best this film has going for it are the performances. Ben Affleck as Bruce Wayne/Batman was great. I was very happy to see him one last time as the caped crusader. Michael Keaton's return was also great, though the explanation of why he was the way he was during his introduction was so weak. Ezra Miller (despite the trash human being, he may be) still does a great job as the Flash/Barry Allen. Michael Shannon's return of General Zod while great was just why? He was absolutely inconsequential in this film. Literally, any villain could've been in Zod's place. But I suppose it could be perceived that the real villain of this film was Barry himself, I guess. Lastly Sasha Calle, I enjoyed her immensely in her small role as Supergirl/Kara I don't know if they have decided to have a Supergirl in the future of the DCEU, but I will be more than ok to see her reprise this role. Also, all the good moments this film had were in the trailers.There are other issues I have with this film, such as the CGI. While it wasn't poor, I hated the style. It looked so fake and cartoony it just clashed with everything else in the film. During the opening sequence at the hospital the babies literally looked like dolls. It was hideous it bordered on uncanny valley levels of bad. My friend laughed at it continuously, and I'm pretty sure that sequence wasn't meant to be funny, or at least if it was, I didn't find it funny. Which will lead me into another issue, comedy. Nothing was funny here. All the jokes were so poor and ill placed. I couldn't tell when the movie was serious or if it was supposed to be joking. The audience I was with barely laughed either.Then there's the run time. I felt the entire 2 hours and 24 minutes, and for a movie that was so fast-paced, it was incredibly slow. In the middle of the movie, I looked at my phone to see only 1 hour passed. I couldn't believe I had another hour and 20 minutes to go.Uh, what else... there's a post credit-scene that's used for comedic purposes but was unfunny and a waste of time to sit and wait for.Overall I can't recommend watching this atrocious poor excuse of a DC film but if you like fan service for nothing more for the sake of well fan service and can turn your brain off to literally everything else then I'm sure you can have a good time.I don't know how my fellow audience members felt about this movie but I'm almost 100% sure I heard one individual say "this sucked" as he walked out so maybe I'm not alone just in a vast minority.IMDb: 3/10
Letterboxd: 2/5Watched in Theaters.

title: We need Zack Snyder for this one too!
text: Wow, the Flash really knows how to run circles around his enemies! And in this latest movie, he runs circles around the plot too! But don't worry, we need a Zack Snyder cut to fill in those plot holes. Despite that, it's still a fun ride. The action scenes are electrifying, the humor is on point, and the new characters add a spark of freshness to the franchise. Plus, who doesn't love a good time-traveling adventure? Just make sure you don't blink or you might miss some of the plot holes. Overall, I give this movie a solid 7/10, or as the Flash would say, "it's faster than a speeding bullet but not quite as satisfying as a hot fudge sundae."

title: Unexpectedly entertaining
text: I can't believe how much fun this was. Went in with no expectations but immediately won over by the very funny opening sequence.True it is a mish mash of better movies (and even Father Time from the Doctor Who books) but it hangs together pretty well, I laughed loads and had a huge grin at the nostalgia scenes.A winning central performance overall. Ezra Miller makes a good fist of something Tom Hardy has made his own - playing off convincingly against another version of himself. A lot of the gags fell flat but enough landed to put it head and shoulders after the vast majority of comic book movies.

title: DC's problem child has finally released, and it's... Good?
text: Everyone and their grandma already knows about this movie's troubled production, mainly focused on a certain actor's criminal affairs (not naming any names). This halting the release and had people wondering if this would even release at all or just be one of DC's abandoned projects. But through many hurdles, the movie is finally out and all I can say is that it's good... for the most part.To get this out of the way, Ezra Miller is a horrible person and I obviously don't condone his actions or behavior. I wouldn't even object to Warner Bros. Just cutting their loses and shelving this completely, almost like a certain other project (not naming names). But to stick with it even despite the controversy so quite admirable. This was made before the allegations surrounding Miller, so I can't exactly fault the production before it was public knowledge. Luckily the movie was enjoyable enough for me to believe who I was watching was Barry and not Ezra.The story itself is pretty basic when it comes to time travel movies, which isn't all that impressive in the superhero genre, but I can say that I enjoyed the movies ideas of using the multiverse and exploring it through the concept of time travel. For the most part, the movie doesn't completely fail like most blockbusters which try using time travel and eventually break the rules they themselves set up. Except for one end gag that certainly raises a plot hole, but I digress. For the most part, they use the time travel/multiverse gimmick to tell a more personal story of Barry wanting to save his love ones. Not wholly original might I add, even the Butterfly Effect does it better, but within the superhero context, it certainly was an attempt I can applaud. Especially for having some genuinely sad moments here and there. I just wish the movie focused more on that aspect than having to have "epic battle" with faceless henchmen and super villain. It would have made the story a lot more memorable for me if it Soley focus on Barry's dilemma regarding his past.Next is the visuals, whoo boy... were they pretty rough for this movie. I seriously was wondering if I was watching a movie or if this was a presentation for Injustice 3. Especially towards the beginning, it was pretty hard to not notice some of the animation, even Barry himself looking like a video game character. Now, not all of the CGI is in this rough state and has a couple of moments where it actually counted, but these moments are very few and far between really awkward looking animation. But, since the movie doesn't take itself that seriously, wonky CGI helped the humor land a lot better then it could have on its own.Finally, I wanna get into the acting of the movie. First off, Micheal Keaton as Batman stole the show for most of it. Despite having not as much screen time as our main lead, he has may more presence then most of the other actors. This sadly goes for Sasha Calle as Supergirl. She doesn't have a whole lot to do in this movie, which is a shame with the marketing hyping her up and had me excited to see her with Keaton's Batman. I guess you need something to distract from having a real villain in your cast. Speaking of which, Ezra was actually fine in the movie. The premise of paring him with a younger more annoying version of his character weirdly worked for me. Don't get me wrong, the movie really hammers it home about his obnoxious personality and it can get grading at points. But having his foil be a older Barry that's self-aware of his stupidity made the dynamic a little more bearable and had some pretty good jokes. Don't know if it made me forget about his crimes after the movie though.Anyways, The Flash could have been a disaster and through all the odds, all the allegations, and all the negative publicity around it, it somehow wasn't a dumpster fire. Was it the best superhero movie ever made? Nope, that belongs to Spiderverse. Is it the best movie DC has ever put out? No, Dark Knight still holds that one. Was it an enjoyable movie you could probably have a few laughs at and have a good time? Maybe? I don't know, I'm tired.

title: Best DCU movie.
text: Good action. Good pacing above all. And a compelling story too. Has more heart than any other DCU movie so far. The only movie that comes close is Zack Snyder's Justice League.The negative publicity surrounding Ezra Miller doomed box office success. But I still recommend that you watch it. Someone called it a "masterpiece." I think it was the Warner Brothers CEO. Within the context of DCU, this is as close to one as you are going to get.Sure Ezra Miller is a jerk. But a movie is much more than its lead. The thousands of staff that put this movie together make it worth watching. You won't regret it.

title: Continues to make me question the decision to reboot DC
text: Aside from The Snyder Cut, this is the best movie in the DCEU in at least the last 6 years. It's fun and awesome, filled with so many cool scenes and connections. It feels like a DC fan thinking of all the craziest ideas they would want to see. The well-placed comedic moments all work. It's highly entertaining.I watched The Snyder Cut again before this movie, now knowing the plans to reboot with James Gunn. I don't understand why they would make this decision. They have built something special and there is so much more they can do with it.And this is coming from someone who has been repeatedly underwhelmed with most of the recent DCEU movies. I don't mind hiring James Gunn to run things, he's proven himself multiple times over. But why in the world would you start from scratch? How have we not seen a Ben Affleck Batman movie? He IS Bruce Wayne. Why would you not keep Henry Cavill when he wants to stay? It's baffling.I guess there's no point dwelling on what's out of my control. But if there is any possibility to make them continue rather than start from scratch, I think it would make a lot of people so happy.My personal list of DCEU movies I will continue to rewatch: Man of Steel, BvS Ultimate Cut, Wonder Woman, Zack Snyder's Justice League, and The Flash. Now that's a damn good pentalogy.(1 viewing, opening Thursday UltraScreen 6/15/2023)

title: All of that for that?!
text: I was happy to see both Michaels back as the Batman and Zod. Sadly Zod sole purpose felt purely utilitarian. I expected Batman to act as kind of a mentor that would show the correct path to Barry but he was just there for fan service. How flashpoint occured felt rushed and extremely childish, there is no wisdom coming out of it at all. It made the character weak in a way that rips all respect and empathy you can have for the hero. It's just simply impossible to connect with him even though he can be funny. Ending did not help at all and showed a completely immature character unable to manage his trauma. Extremely weak representation of loss and growth.

title: One of the best DCEU film ever
text: I just don't understand the hate regarding this movie. It got charms, funny and heartfelt moment just like GOTG VOL. 1. I find this movie very entertaining with nostalgic hit because I am a fan of comic book films. The downside of this movie probably the visual effects as it seems unpolished in some scene but it's not that bad compared to previous DC adaptations. Personally for me the best part of the film is The Flash and Batman (both of Batman) which I guess is for fan service but it does its purpose. Overall, the movie deserve much more box office and people should definitely go see themselves.

title: What were they thinking?
text: Anyone who says the CGI was bad clearly did not actually see the film. It is awful. It looks as if several effects houses worked on several different scenes, each using different software or methodology. It is SO jarringly bad. Remember the awful Cavill mustache removal debacle? Or the Tron 2 Jeff Bridges deaging fiasco? That was nothing compared to this. Its as if they inserted the unfinished workprint, or substituting the storyboards for dailies. The acting and storyline is fine. The CGI is atrocious. If this was a 10 million dollar movie then okay. But this is a CGI effects driven movie. Instead of having Ezra act both Barry parts they periodically did that about 20 percent and it was completely believable. But The other 80 percent is bad bad bad. I mean fans were miffed when mustachegate occurred. To paraphrase the Joker, "if they think that is terrible, wait"'ll they get a load of this." The chronobowl scenes were the absolute worst. Did they not learn from Snyder Cut Justice League? Fans will wait And pay more for it to be done right.This could've been a top notch movie beating out Spiderman No Way Home. Ezra Miller was great. Heck all the actors were. But the CGI...the technology is there to do it perfectly and it isn't new...why put out this embarrassing mess?

title: Cinematically epic, but a rushed story
text: I was extremely lucky to be able to go to the world's first public screening for this movie for free in my own actual hometown before the official release date, which was an incredible opportunity! We were informed that this version wasn't the final version, specifically the end of the movie, but I think that also included the visual effects in general, because some of it looked unfinished, and I have also read on different medias that the VFX team just had wrapped the visual effects a couple of days before. At the end, it felt close to complete, though.Anyway, this movie, about Barry Allen who uses his super speed to change the past, is an okay action movie. The concept itself is alright - to go back in time to change the past. Nothing new, but we were able to see some familiar characters and events, and that was a nice touch. This was a big deal, but I felt that the story, or at least the execution overall, was a little poor for this concept. The reason is mainly because of the pace and the simplicity. It felt quite rushed, and I think the big picture kind of missed something. I just couldn't settle down properly in several scenes, and then it sometimes could be hard to catch some important elements. I think most of the action scenes were great, though, especially with their fantastic sound effects and the sound design. However, when some scenes actually didn't feel that rushed, I think the comedy unfortunately took too much space from the seriousness, even though it was funny sometimes. This movie didn't take itself too seriously, but to me there were also too much of the "funny" parts. Anyway, no matter how bad or good this movie was, it was a crazy ride, especially on the big screen.In conclusion, the concept was familiar and the action scenes were great, but the story execution was a little poor due to rushed pacing and too much comedy. The movie was an enjoyable ride, but there were some areas that could have been improved upon.

title: Good film
text: Good lord, all these stuck up people and their fussing about a fine film. Yes the CGI could be better, but it didn't take away from the film. Interesting plot, great characters (for the most part, General Zod was a bit meh), and plenty of humor and emotional moments. It kept you guessing on what would happen next and I liked that. I thought Ezra did a fine job carrying the movie, especially as two versions of himself. I liked that you weren't ever sure what version of a superhero you would get next. They paid great homage to the past versions while keeping all of them true to themselves. The only thing I found disappointing was the new Supergirl, she felt rather nerfed. But it was necessary for the plot, so.... All in all, I enjoyed this movie.

title: The family dynamic, comedic content and solid characters make this film worth a watch
text: The Flash (2023) is a movie my wife and I saw in theaters last night. The storyline follows Barry Allen discovering while as the Flash he can go back in time and change things. He thinks using this power to save his mom and keep his dad from going to prison is a good idea...until he gets trapped in that time without his powers. He will need to call on some old friends, who end up being new friends in this universe, to help him stop an invasion, get his powers back and get back to his universe.This movie is directed by Andy Muschietti (Mama) and stars Ezra Miller (Fantastic Beasts and Where to Find Them), Ben Affleck (The Town), Michael Keaton (Beetlejuice), Sasha Calle (On Swift Horses), Michael Shannon (Take Shelter) and Ron Livingston (The Conjuring).The storyline for this picture is well written and had a lot of clever intricacies. The cast was outstanding, well selected and the characters are fairly well presented. I will say they could have written a better script for Keaton and Supergirl was just okay. The CGI was out of this world...but overdone in too many scenes. I enjoyed the opening sequence with the babies, every scene where Flash runs and the costume was great. However, the world where he chooses timelines was way over done, especially the end where the show multiple universes and the impact of his actions. However, the family dynamic, comedic content and solid characters make this film worth a watch. I would score this film a 6/10 and recommend seeing it once.

title: Great movie !
text: Love the storyline ,So fun to watch. One of DC's best so far !Ezra Miller really is perfect for the part. The CGI was pretty bad at times though. The reason i accepted it was my reasoning of Barry running so fast that our vision would see things in a different sense.The humor in this movie was great. Although, I was the only one dying of laughter at 1pm on a Tuesday afternoon in this theatre.I just wanted this movie to have an 8/10 because its great and i like it . GOOD STORYLINE. Fun to see old batmans in it from different timelines. 100% yes recommend go see it for yourself . Thanks for reading.

title: The Flash wastes no time
text: DC's take on the multiverse lacks the same allure as Marvel's, but die-hard DC fans will still find enjoyment in this film.The Flash wastes no time in setting the scene, which has both positive and negative aspects. On the positive side, the fast-paced plot immediately grabs your attention, but the negative aspect is that the quick start took a while to resonate with my emotions truly. Overall, DC, you've created a movie that's enjoyable but falls short of being truly outstanding.I must admit that DC movies are usually more miss than hit for me, but this film manages to provide enough screen time for other DC characters like Wonder Woman and Batman to shine without detracting from the main star. The plot is a bit hazy, with Barry Allen attempting to change his mother's fate by running away from his problems. It's relatable in a way, but in all seriousness, he runs so fast that he ends up time-traveling. This opens up different universes, adding a sense of uniqueness and drama while contributing to Barry's growth and the emotional impact of realizing his mother's fate.As mentioned earlier, DC fans who have followed all the Batman and Superman movies from years past will have a Leonardo DiCaprio-pointing-at-the-screen moment.One of the film's highlights is the action, although there aren't many fight scenes. The scenes where the Flash runs or saves the day provide an enjoyable experience. There's a particular scene with Batman that made me appreciate his fighting skills even more. Additionally, the comedy is a bit cheesy, but that's what we expect from Barry Allen. I had a few laughs, but in some scenes, it was evident that they were trying a bit too hard for a chuckle.The film's faults lie in some of the clearly visible CGI, which looks off. The apparent threat in the movie wasn't as strong as other elements, especially when compared to the antagonist in the Flash series. There were certain aspects that left something to be desired. The pacing during the interval felt stale in comparison to the beginning and climax of the film.This year seems to be all about cliffhangers, as the movie ended well and is worth watching, especially for DC fans. I would rate it 3.5/5.

title: This is so bad!!
text: Rarely writing comments and reviews. I stopped watching this movie after 30 minutes. I couldn't beliefe how often this movie took me out of the movie itsel. The Flash from 1990 was so much better and easier to beleave then this one. The worst CGI i have ever seen, more bad then FatF, Transformers or all the other movies that call themself movies. You need to use Michael Keaton as Batman (he was great as Batman back then)to get you a story?a shame for DC to evan try this. DC and all the movie creators that work on such a "product"i wish you all to go broke,loose your money and find your soul again. This is an insult for the the whole world.

title: A surprisingly good film despite prevalent issues
text: Let me start off by saying that I initially refused to watch The Flash particularly because of Ezra Miller's criminal history. But I gave it a chance and watched it and despite the negative reviews, I have to admit that by all means, it isn't a bad film and actually lives up to the hype that was built since the first trailer released.Most of the characters shined in this movie with their stellar performances and it was emotionally satisfying to witness how far Barry Allen has grown since his debut in the Justice League.Michael Keaton's return as Batman was absolutely spectacular and nostalgic and watching him back in action after 2 decades complemented by the use of Danny Elfman's theme was a treat and fan service executed perfectly.Some of the major issues the film had included some weak and sloppy CGI, annoying dialogues and jokes from 2013-Barry, and a couple of plotholes that still left me puzzled in the end.Regardless of the problems and Ezra's criminal shenanigans, The Flash is a decent film and a popcorn flick that can be watched to have a good time. It delivers well on the nostalgic elements, sheds more light on the DC multiverse and even gives a fitting conclusion to the DCEU in favour of James Gunn's new DCU reboot.

title: Don't listen to the reviews.
text: People literslly took away stars because of "bad CGI"? This is probably the best DC movie apart from the Batman movies. Really enjoyed the story and effect. Please don't listen to the other reviews and watch the mocie. You won't be disappointed. I was doubtful about the movie at first since most DC movies just aren't good and mostly are for children, but this movie caught by surprise and i was really hooked on it from the start of the movie until the end of it. I already recommended the movie go my friends and some of them who watched it also enjoyed the movie a lot. Btw the CGI reviews are so lame because i didn't even realize that there was bad CGI because of the story was so good. Only people who focuses on the CGI will spot it so are you there to watch the movie or to keep an eye on the CGI lol?

title: Hero movies are more than just hero movies
text: I needed that. As I stared at the rolling credits, it was noticeable that the lights were not being put back on. Darkness still surrounded me in an empty cinema. My mind steered away to reflect. Memories flashed before me. How my life was like years ago and how I've shaped as a person since then.In times of despair, humanity endures. I'm reminded of my peers, my fellow friends, lifting each other up to achieve wonders. Hero movies are more than just hero movies. It's a constant gift. And that gift reminds me of how our imagination is beautiful. We all find our way to steer on our paths. The darkness surrounding me in this cinema did eventually disappear... and the light returned. As it always does... when we believe in each other. When we fight for the beauty of this world. The shadow is a passing cicle. These stories of good are the type that shape us.Keep fighting the good fight. Continue to be your best selves everyone. Please, continue to create. We can achiece that awe.

title: Just a OK Superhero movie
text:
The Flash, (Barry Allen) plans to use his super speed to travel back in time to save his mother. But Bruce Wayne tries to warn him of the consequences."Barry, if you were to go into the past, any interaction you have with your parents or yourself, you step on the wrong blade of grass, you have no idea what the consequences to that could be" - Bruce WayneBut Barry really believes he can fix everything and save his mom."You could also destroy everything" - Bruce Wayne
Well Barry does go back and changes the past, and it seems to have worked. But as he is returning to his time, Barry is blocked and is literally knocked back by an unknown speedster.Trapped in the past, Barry interacts with his parents, and he meets his younger self! Barry's interference with the past has changed the future and created an alternate world! A world without a Superman, Wonder Woman, or Aquaman. No Justice League! No superheros! And now General Zod is coming to destroy the earth"I created a world with no meta- humans and now there's no one to defend us" - BarryThe two Barrys are now the last hope the earth has. But maybe there is someone that may can help them... a older retired Bruce Wayne."Yeah. I'm Batman." - BatmanBarry convinces Bruce to be the Batman again and help them to save the world and reset the future."If I can't undo what I did, if I can't get back, there may not be a future! - BarryBased on the DC Comics, The Flash is a OK movie. At times Barry's dialogue is a bit goofy and just silly and annoying. Also the CGI is shockingly terrible! However the story becomes very interesting when the Batman enters the picture. Michael Keaton is so awesome again as a older retired Batman. I wish he had more screen time.The storyline is a good idea and I like the humor and seeing all the superhero cameos from the DC universe. But I think the Flash is much better in the Justice League and not his own movie.Cast - Ezra Miller, Michael Keaton, Ben Affleck, Michael Shannon, Jeremy Irons, Sasha Calle, Ron Livingston, Maribel Verdú, Kiersey Clemons.

title: Batman was the best part of this movie
text: While this movie is entertaining it doesn't introduce any new ideas. It basically rides the trend of every superhero movie that has come out in the past year. They all have a story that deals with time and multiple timelines. This movie unfortunately was released after "Spider-man: Across the Spiderverse" and it basically does a lot of what that film did but it did not do it better.There are many scenes where the faces of the characters (mostly the flash) are obviously CGI. There are also scenes where The Flash stops time and it just looks very animated. Namely the scene that involves multiple babies. This didn't take away from my experience but it was noticeable on numerous occasions. There was also a Spanish song used during an emotional scene that didn't fit. It was very random and confusing.Ezra Miller was enjoyable playing different versions of himself and showing his range as actor. He delivered some serious emotional moments as well as some silly comedic moments.Sasha Calle as supergirl felt like a weak attempt at including "Superman" into the story and this film would have worked better without it. I didn't hate her character, she was just okay.General Zod was another character that didn't work in this film. I understand why he was included and how he was used to tie together this multiverse idea but he wasn't exciting.The character I had the most fun watching on screen was Batman. Every version of him was just amazing and exciting to see. Every scene that involved Batman felt crisp and well done while The Flash had many clunky scenes. On a side note, Michael Keaton's involvement in this film should have been kept a secret. The trailers continue to show too much ruining movie experiences.There were some cool cameos in this film but as I stated before it has been done before. I expected more from this film considering the amount of times it was delayed. There were some cool scenes and action sequences but this movie needed a better story. The characters just weren't strong enough for the audience to care about them. Sometimes less is more but sometimes a character has such a small role that it's much better not to include them (Iris West).In the end I just felt like I've seen this movie already with different characters. I still look forward to the next film I just hope it goes in a different direction and leaves the timelines alone.

title: Satisfying end to the DCEU
text: This is a generally fun movie that I think is quite rewatchable following the flash on the DCEU's take of one of the more famous flash story arcs.The tone of this film is much lighter than some of the other DCEU instalments but there is still heavy subject matter being addressed. The comic relieve doesn't feel too forced and some of the sillier things is in line with things I remember from the flash comics.The acting was on the better side of the comic book movies although I didn't feel as much chemistry in the relationship of Barry and Iris than say what they had in the longer justice league movie.This was an enjoyable watch.

title: The Flash
text: The Flash finally makes it on the screen. Warner Brothers were hoping people will forget Ezra Miller's various brushes with the law.By the time it was released in the cinemas. The audience had already seen Spiderman: No Way Home and Dr Strange 2 so were familiar with the multiverse and fan friendly cameos.After appearing in other superhero movies, The Flash gets his own standalone film but with various other superheroes thrown in.Barry Allen (Ezra Miller) goes back in time to exonerate his father. He was wrongly convicted of killing his wife when Barry was a child. His dad claimed he was out shopping for a tin of tomatoes.Despite warnings from Bruce Wayne (Ben Affleck) not to mess with time. Barry places a can of tomatoes in his mum's shopping s his dad does not have to later go out.Only time has changed not only from the moment his mum did not die. The timeline has changed entirely.In the new present there is another Barry Allen who is more of a slacker. Eric Stoltz was not fired from Back to the Future. Batman is played by Michael Keaton and there is no Superman.For someone like me, Keaton was the pull. The chance to see his take on Batman one more time, over 30 years after he last played the part. There is a portion of the film that is purely for fans with multiple Superman's including a CGI Christopher Reeves.The plot which is mainly borrowed from Man of Steel is really not that interesting. That is a shame, The Flash has a lightness of touch. It has a lot of nostalgia value but the main story is lacking.

title: Who cares CGI? It's an amazing Movie!
text: "I absolutely loved the Flash movie! I have to say, I don't mind the use of CGI, no matter what people may complain about. In fact, I thought the CGI was acceptable, adding to the overall emotional and fun experience of the film. The story between the mother and son was particularly well-crafted, tugging at my heartstrings throughout the movie.I must admit, there were moments that brought me to tears. The filmmakers really knew how to tap into the emotions and create a truly immersive experience. But it wasn't all tears, there were also plenty of moments that had me bursting out in laughter. The balance between heartfelt moments and humor was spot-on.The movie also had just the right amount of action. It kept me on the edge of my seat, eagerly waiting to see what would happen next. The pacing was fantastic, never dragging or feeling rushed. The action sequences were visually stunning, making every moment a thrill.Now, I have to address something. It's disheartening to see so much hate in this world, especially when it's directed at actors for their real-life mistakes. We're all human, and we all make mistakes. Let's focus on the talent and hard work that goes into creating a movie like this, rather than nitpicking and spreading negativity.In conclusion, The Flash movie deserves a perfect 10/10 rating in my book. It touched me on an emotional level, made me laugh, and kept me thoroughly entertained throughout. It's a reminder that we're all flawed, but that doesn't diminish the incredible storytelling and craftsmanship behind this film. Kudos to the cast, crew, and everyone involved in bringing this amazing movie to life!

title: Pretty big mess with some occasionally good moments
text: Despite his personal failings in real life, I actually like Miller as an actor and think he did a good job here. Unfortunately, apart from him and Keaton, much of the rest of the film felt phoned in. Even the production values were surprisingly poor. A lot of people are complaining about the CGI and justifiably so - this would have looked bad 20 years ago so it's pretty inexcusable in 2023 from a studio with this kind of resources at its disposal.Casting felt really off even in some of the smaller parts, with many of the actors (looking at you Ron Livingston and Sascha Calle, among others) feeling like they weren't even up to the task of delivering in their limited screen time. Some of them (Shannon is an example) were so flat that you had to wonder whether they were even in the film at all and you weren't just seeing some AI rendition of their likenesses ripped from previous films.The plot, at its core, would have been alright if this wasn't several films back in the line of superhero movies that tried to play with time travel and alternate realities. I can't speak for everyone else, but I've definitely found it increasingly difficult to care about these free-for-all cinematic universes. The saving grace of this film is that there's at least some emotional resonance driving Barry's decision to go back. It still pales in comparison to the gravitas driving End Game, for example, but it was something. Unfortunately here the reality jumps just become tiresome by the end of the film and the relentless fan service isn't enough to hold it together.All in all I was a little disappointed in this. The DCU doesn't have a great track record at this point but I was kind of hoping based on the trailers that this might be one of their better entries. Unfortunately it ended up being just another poorly executed mess. It wasn't Black Adam bad, but it wasn't that good either.

title: Made it worth the wait
text: This movie does a few things incredibly well:Tells an origin story after a character has already been established, introduces and develops characters effectively, making real the gravity of a very serious situation while also hitting on your heart strings all while keeping up a really nice pace.The action is really well done and not over the top. The story shines.Buckle up for a fun ride. Such a great movie. I had high expectations going in and they were definitely met.If you've read the comics or kept up with the flash movies or series you'll definitely recognize some of the storyline used in the movie. If you've never seen it, you'll enjoy it just as much.Great movie.

title: Keaton is an ecstasy, CGI is unfinished, Good Movie
text:
Keaton is an ecstasy, Sasha Calle a very good surprise, Miller just doing what he knows how to do...good performance...Thing that take away some points... the CGI in some scenes... What were they thinking when they left the baby or Speedforce CGI scenes unfinished? First time in my life that I see a movie that is so noticeable that it is unfinished... Was it related to money? Was it related to launch time?I try to think like a businessman and I don't get it, I try to think like a fan and I don't get it, I try to think as an investor and I don't get it either...
Hope Keaton and Sasha play their role again in a new movie because the did it very very well...Just go see it and enjoy a nice movie.

title: Utterly terrible
text: The worst superhero I have ever seen. It makes Antman 3 look like a masterpiece- even worse than Ben Affleck's Daredevil, and I never thought that would happen. Save your money.Michael Keaton who was a pretty good batman back in the day seems bored although he is still a much more entertaining character than the Flash himself. Two Flashes were presumably meant to function as a ongoing comic routine, but is just desperately unfunny. The actress who acts Supergirl also has a solid screen presence, and a film with a decent script and reasonable CGI might be worth catching if involvement in this fiasco doesnt destroy her career. All in all, 2 and a half hours you won't get back.

title: Surprisingly enjoyable DC romp!
text: With some of the recent disspointing entries to both the Marvel and DC franchises (not naming names), as well as the reported issues with Ezra Miller, I went into The Flash with very low expectations.I had a day off work, and armed with good word of mouth from a, generally over-critical, friend, I booked my ticket on a whim while picking up a few groceries.It did not take long for the film to suck me in, with good humour and action packed set pieces that consistantly landed.Sure the CGI isn't the best, but the story itself as well as the great writing makes up for it.There are a few surprises and easter eggs (a real love letter to the DC universe) that really add icing to the cake on offer.I'm glad I made the impromptu decision to watch this at my local cinema.I look forward to what James Gunn can do with the franchise moving forward.

title: A soulless nostalgic play
text: The Flash other than being an over hyped mess, also manages to have the most soulless screenplay in years, not to mention the the disgusting 3rd act cameos all made from some early 2000s PS2 tech. The characters have no heart, it's trying to make me feel stuff but the dialogue is always just sooo weak. Most of the movie is just failing to get the audience to laugh and cheer at some line or cgi head from DC's past. As a die hard flash fan , I am awfully dissatisfied, and would even honestly say the CW did it tons better with Season 1, and The animated Flashpoint movie even captured 10x the heart this one did.

title: Underwhelming ....
text: Barely an okay popcorn movie .... No ,it doesn't serve the DC universe as a whole that much ....and no , it's not epic or crazy fun ... The cameos are just actors collecting their paycheck and nostalgia tickle ( just like Spiderman no way home )....generic multiverse / time travel plot ...man , we got really used to these !....the only reason you're gonna enjoy this movie is Ezra Miller ...dude is a menace to society lol but he ( or they ? XD ) is so charismatic and such a good actor... I love him as flash just like how I love Ryan Reynolds as deadpool ... also Michael Keaton at 71 years of age makes a really good batman !...enjoyed seeing him as usual ....

title: Fan Service Solid Fun
text: While it is somewhat disappointing that this iteration of the DCEU is ending, I think this is worth a watch for almost any DC fan. You don't really have had to watch any of the other DCEU movies to enjoy it just have an understanding of who the villains were in those movies and basic general timeline of the DCEU. It was an unexpected awesome sendoff for one of the main characters in the movie. If you're totally unfamiliar with first Batman movie a lot of the nostalgia won't resonate with you. Despite all his personal issues Ezra Miller is a good actor and pulled off the quirky lead of this movie perfectly. However it you are tired of time travel/multiverse gimmicks to fix bad script mistakes in previous movies, I recommend waiting till this is available to stream as a part of a subscription. A very solid 6 and higher if you were invested in this universe and liked the first Henry Cavil Superman movie. And a can't miss if you liked Michael Keaton's Batman.

title: Fantastic movie
text: In my opinion, one of the best comic book movies ever made. I came to see this movie for Michael Keaton's Batman - and I was not disappointed. For me, Keaton steals this movie. Ezra, well - with all his ongoing issues, I can't lie - he was brilliant in this film. He's clearly in need of help in his personal life - but as an actor - he is a genius and extremely talented. Great cameos from past DC superhero's. Some of which will surprise you. Loved the story as well. My only criticism is - if I'm being picky is - sons of the CGI is a bit ropey - which I was slightly disappointed with. Other than that - this movie is flawless. I highly recommend it.

title: A Dazzling Adventure Hindered by a CGI Misstep
text:
Finally, I witnessed the much-anticipated "The Flash."
Let me tell you, this flick packed a punch, mostly soaring high with its electrifying storytelling and captivating performances. Yet, I can't help but address the elephant in the room - the atrocious CGI in one particular section. It's like they reached for the stars but stumbled into a digital abyss. But hold your horses, because this film deserves a fair shake beyond its computer-generated blunder.Once you look past that blemish and dive into the rest of the movie, prepare to be blown away. The actors shine like supernovas, delivering remarkable performances that will leave you in awe. The action unfolds in epic proportions, sweeping you into a whirlwind of adrenaline-fueled excitement. The writing flows like a mighty river, effortlessly guiding you through a sea of emotions. And amidst it all, the humor lands with impeccable timing, providing much-needed levity, while the drama strikes chords deep within your soul. Oh, and let's not forget the delightful brushstrokes of nostalgia that grace the screen.It's perplexing, though, how a film that spent ages in development could stumble in such a crucial area of visual effects. Perhaps the tumultuous real-world events overshadowed the significance of refining those rough edges. It's a regrettable misstep because this film has so much to offer. I, for one, am tired of the superhero shuffle, yet "The Flash" manages to break the mold and captivate.The Flash 2023 may stumble in one section, but it ignites a spark that resonates throughout. Prepare to be enthralled by its pulse-pounding adventures and immersive storytelling that transcends the shortcomings.

title: Has the world list it's mind?
text: Has everyone forgotten or been so spoiled to superhero films that they've turned like milk in the sun towards the genre? This film was great. This film was awesome. This film was for the story lovers and film fans alike. The public needs to recognize how lucky we are that we get amazing comic storytelling like this? Comic fans should really learn to chill on liberal storytelling. Superhero movie fans should chill on the technology and CGI that was really really good. This was a good long movie and totally fulfilled bang for buck delivery. It saddens me that there more than likely won't be another but I am wildly thankful for this one.

title: The Flash can't save the DCEU.
text: Better than expected but still not good enough. The Flash does many things right with a story that takes itself seriously when it needs to, but also delivers many funny moments. The movie has tons of action and truly gives you the sense of speed you would expect from a Flash adaptation. Ezra Miller is surprisingly good here, and if you can look past his off-screen controversy you might find Miller's performance really enjoyable. If this is a deal-breaker for you then his portrayal of Barry Allen isn't going to win you over because you're basically getting a double dose of Miller. Most will probably say that Keaton's Batman was the highlight of the film, and I have to say that this part definitely hit me with nostalgia berries. Sasha Calle's Supergirl was fine, she looks great for the part but I wanted a little more depth from her character.We need to talk about the CGI though. To say the visuals were sub-par would be a vast understatement. There are times when the visual effects actually look pretty good, but then there are too many times where it looks absolutely cartoonish, especially whenever they try to fully render people or animals. For a film that cost over $200 million to make I have to wonder how much of this went to the visual effects. The director trying to hand-wave this away as a "stylized choice" just sounds like a poor excuse for these terrible CGI sequences. There are new PS5 games that have better graphics than this. It felt like an assault on my optic nerves.Aside from the bad VFX, there were some interesting cameos, some of which made me wonder how much footage Warner Bros has sealed away from the public. The plot does get a little messy and it feels more like a send-off for the DCEU rather than a true Flash movie. I thought the villain didn't get enough attention since they were trying to spend so much time handling the multiverse aspect. It's almost like there were 2 or 3 separate scripts being mashed together for the story. I certainly liked this more than Shazam 2 and Black Adam. This film is already expected to bomb like those other two did though, so I think James Gunn and WB need to seriously consider doing a full reboot of the DC Universe. This movie came out way too late in the Snyderverse era to be truly relevant, and with the new DC film universe on the horizon too many people will find it hard to care about a film that won't really matter going forward.

title: That 3rd act was awesome!
text: This movie was fanfu**ingtastic! From the moment the film begins, it takes you on a wild, adrenaline-fueled ride. Andy Muschietti strikes the perfect balance between intense action sequences and quieter, character-driven moments that allow the audience to connect on a deeper level to both versions of Barry.Keaton coming back as the Dark Knight was incredible. I've seen Batman in theater re-releases but seeing him in action in a new adventure was an incredible experience. Sasha Calle was and hopefully will continue to be Supergirl in the new DC. She was amazing! The suit looked incredible and even her fight scenes were just beautifully created.The Flash is a must-watch for any fan of the genre or anyone seeking an unforgettable cinematic adventure. I saw it in AMC Prime and I don't know if they just switched out speakers in my theater but damn did I feel every single hit, music beat and special effect. The Flash combines thrilling action, engaging storytelling, and mesmerizing visual effects to deliver an experience that will leave you wanting more. Believe me when I say this, you are not going to want to miss this in theaters and especially miss out on that 3rd act! Prepare to be swept away on a rollercoaster of emotions, as this film transcends the superhero genre and becomes a testament to the power of storytelling. 1 post credit scene that wraps this adventure up. I'm looking forward to what DC has up next. I have faith in the new DC leadership to finally get this right. Too many great stories out there in the DC library to not make it to the big screen. Great flick!

title: I had the luck to see this film early
text: I were lucky to get to see this movie early. I really enjoyed watching this movies, I found it very hilarious with some heartfelt moments here and there. Also there were some surprising appearances in this movies that made me happy. Also I loved seeing Michael Keaton as Batman and the Tim Burton music. It was fantastisc. Also Sasha Calle was also really good and Ezra Miller too. All these three actors made the movie highly enjoyable. This movie though had it's moments with a lot of whacky CGI which could be hilarious aswell or a bit annoying. The third act wasn't as good as the previous two acts of the movie. I must say I still liked this movie it had so many moments that made me laugh quite hard, much more funnier than any ordinary marvel film and that is really refreshing for me.

title: Despite the CGI, it's one of the best DC films within the past decade.
text: Funny, witty, great action, better humor than most Marvel movies and superb dialogue, even though some of dialogue felt a little bit forced or paced, and some of the CGI looked a little wonky in a few areas, especially towards the end, but overall, the plot, action scenes, cameos, characters, acting performances, especially from Keaton, Miller, Shannon, Affleck and Calle and the ending and post-credit scene solidified this movie as one of the best DC movies I've ever seen and if you're a DC fan, I think you're in good hands with James Gunn and Peter Safran in charge. Only thing about this movie I didn't like: no appearance from Henry Cavill as Superman/Clark Kent :(

title: Best dc movie in awhile.
text: Good movie. Refreshing to see a super hero movie not built with the Disney MCU in mind. Michael Keaton and Ezra miller have great performances. Super girl is a strong character and I hope we see more of her. There's a bunch of Easter eggs for all the comic fans Ben Affleck does great also. We need more movies like this. Not sure why this review needs six hundred characters because I am not a professional critic. But I guess I'll keep writing becaus I really like this movie and I feel like most of these websites are biased towards the bigger corporations. When Disney gets bad reviews it's considered "review bombing". Any other movie that gets bad reviews is just a bad movie.

title: DCEU's Messy Multiverse Is Saved By Super Fan Frenzy Cameos
text:
The Flash (2023) :
Movie Review -Horror film specialist Andy Muschietti attempts to exorcist the DCEU from the dark clouds with their latest superhero saga, "The Flash". DC is pretty late to join the multiverse zone compared to Marvel, but they had something that Marvel didn't have. Yes, No Way Home did bring Sam Raimi's nostalgia back, but we can never forget that DC's Superman and Batman are far older and better known than the MCEU. The Flash tries to cash in on that nostalgia goofed up in a multiverse defined by time travel with a reference to the iconic "Back to the Future". That's how crazy things are here, but then there's a lot of crazy fun too. The Flash doesn't hit like a lightning bolt, but fair enough to provide you with a kick. Yes, it's too messy to enjoy, but the whole point of getting your logic right rests peacefully with that twist in the end.The Flash has a super-pacy opening sequence as The Flash (Ezra Miller) is called by Alfred (Jeremy Irons) to help The Batman (Ben Affleck) save the city from a disaster. There is a sweet cameo by Wonder Woman (Gal Gadot) to make the opening sequence even better. The Flash then unknowingly unleashes the power of travelling back in time. That gives him an idea to prevent his mother's death, but it traps him in an alternate reality without metahumans. To save the world from General Zod (Michael Shannon), Barry enlists the help of his younger self, who has now got his powers, to turn things back to normal. A screamer follows as he meets the Batman of that universe, played by none other than Michael Keaton. A Kryptonian castaway, Supergirl (Sasha Calle), joins this super team to beat the mighty Zod since there is no Superman (Henry Cavill).You know, Doctor Strange could have fixed things in "Infinity War," but he didn't. Because he knew that some things cannot be fixed; they are inevitable. He did travel and saw everything that could happen or could have happened from a different perspective to realise a universal law of factuality. MCEU did not bother showing us all his attempts that might have failed; rather, they just finished the whole thing in half a minute. But the DCEU has made a whole multiverse film on the same topic now. The Flash is about the whole process-every different attempt he would do to change things in the past so that his present, aka future, can be different. But little did he know that he was giving birth to new problems and new timelines. Technically, it's a child's play to watch a whole movie based on this idea and that too, for about 145 minutes. But like I said, the entire strategy somehow finds a solution in the end, even after the so-called happy ending, which is highly deceptive.The Flash has some things going against it, and Ezra Miller's performance is the most visible thing out of a whole bunch. We are used to the first Barry, so we know what he is and how he is at times. But the second Barry, aka the younger version, is not just irritating but also childish on occasion. Ezra is the only guy who has a full-fledged role in the film, so his failure as an actor does great harm. Sasha Calle couldn't have replaced Henry Cavill in any universe, but in her own small role, the cute little girl has done somewhat decent. Ron Livingston hardly appears, Michael Shannon isn't used well, Maribel Verdú walks in between, and Kiersey Clemons is barely noticeable as Barry's wannabe girlfriend. Ben Affleck disappears after a good start, but maybe that's why we love Michael Keaton so much. Seeing two Batmans together would have been a dream moment, but was it practically possible? Keaton wears the suit and cape again to take us back to the 90s' memories, so we should be thankful to the old man.The Flash was a difficult film for the visual effects experts, as they had to create that circular handler that is the centre of this time travel. They made it like a sports ground, so I'm not sure how people will take that. Though it starts looking better with every next viewing, especially in the climax. The cinematography and background score are okay with less effort to be remembered. The Flash slashes through many rough jokes, while some are hysterical enough. I mean, who cuts horns from Batman's mask? To sum up the negatives, I'd say The Flash is a pretty overslaughed and overlapped flick. Those Supergirl smashes look cartoonish; those "I am The Flash" and "I am The Batman" quotes are too outdated now; even the villain's conflicts are radical now. Some fresh meat and fresh beer, and this popcorn flick could have been so much fun. Andy Muschietti comes from a horror background to make a superhero-horror drama in DC's new wave. The horror is different from monster-driven and ghost-driven films, though. Overall, it's a decent attempt, if not good, uplifted by some crazy fan-driven cameos and nostalgia. Going in for the old Batman? Well, don't be so sure that you'll only get him. *Lips locked*RATING - 6/10*

title: Don't understand the hate
text: This was a fun movie. People have gotten too used to being Yelp reviewers and Karen's behind their screens they feel entitled to sit there after lazily doin nothing and viewing this film. Was it the greatest one? No, but it was fun. Get over yourselves people. At it's heart it's a superhero movie that goes slightly awry and that's not a bad thing.Part of the story gets lost in the craziness of it but it all ties in and does a good job of tying up its loose ends. It's a fun movie with some fun storylines and nice throwbacks. Enjoy it and stop waiting to be wowed with your cynical minds. Take it for what it is and go on with your lives.

title: It's a decent movie but...
text: The Flash is a very messy movie, filled with plot holes, dreadful CGI, and a bland story. However, it is entertaning for the most part. I have seen taglines calling it the best DCEU movie, and one of the best superhero movies of all time. It isn't, in fact it isn't even in the top 20. It would rank above WW84, but below Aquaman. It's plainfully average.The good things about the Flash is the acting - especially by Ezra who gives a great performance as Barry. Now I will try and keep all the chaos from the actor's life out of this review, since I'm here to talk about the movie, and nothing else. Ezra is a very charasmatic actor, and it shows here through Barry. Barry is a very compelling character here, he has flaws, and conflicts which help drive his motivations. Michael Keaton as Bruce is also amazing here, despite him not having a great deal to do. Sure the action scenes involving Batman were remarkable. Seeing the 80s Batman perform that kind of hand to hand combat was a delight to see. Sasha Calle as Supergirl was.... meh. The character doesn't do that much and she doesn't have that much screentime either. She is just there. I would like to see more of her, as I think she would fit well, but overall, she was.. ok I guess.The bad is clearly the CGI. It is awful, and I mean awful. I have read the director's comments on it, and it's nonesense. The visuals are horrific and take you out of the movie almost every time. The story is predictable and plain, but there are some emotional moments here and there. The music is generic, the cinematography is fine, but nothing special.Overall, The Flash is average, it won't win any awards or be remembered. It was a mess, which tells me there is a much longer version out there, since it rushes from A to B.6/10.

title: Fun, entertaining and emotional with excellent performamces
text: The Flash is a confident and fun superhero movie which is funny and exciting, with great action pieces and a surprisingly emotional story.Ezra Miller's performances as both older and younger Barry is so layered, with immaturity, awkwardness, confidence, sarcasm, and maturity. Sasha Calles is an excellent if slightly underused Supergirl and both Ben Affleck and Michael Keaton seem to be enjoying playing the caped crusader again.It's an accessible film for movie goers who don't read, or don't care about the comics. There are some crazy moments, but the dialogue is crisp and story is very moving, with themes of family and loss, finding connections and understanding one's place in the world like some other DC movies of recent years.

title: Entertaining !
text: I think this movie was quite entertaining , it delivered some action some and some escapism. What more can one want from a popcorn flick ?I feel like some of the other negative reviews were overly harsh and perhaps had too high expectations. Furthermore after watching the last 3 Marvel offerings I have to say that this movie actually made sense in comparison. Its miles better than any Marvel 'junk' out there - and they have made some real junk lately !That being said it is quite quirky and random at times and tries too hard to deliver a laugh. For an action comedy you have to go heavy on the action and add in a gag or two at times , simple. This director doesnt quite get that concept.All in all it was a fun outing . It was so good to be back at the movies after such a long time !

title: Ezra Millers annoying version of Barry Allen but twice as much
text: As a huge fan of Marvel and DC i was very much looking forward to this one. Granted, I did not enjoy the fact that Barry Allen was reduced to a comic relief type of character in «Justice League» but i still enjoyed the Zack Snyder version regardless. I was hoping DC would continue down that same path of a slightly darker and more brutal universe, but it was not to be. The Flash is absolute garbage. The «multiverse/time travel» storyline has been beaten to death already by Marvel lately, but this is easily the worst iteration yet. Ezra Miller portraits a very awkward Barry Allen that appears to be «on the spectrum». It was bearable in the last movie, but not in this one.. There's just to much of him. Batman and Supergirl make appearances, and both do fine showings.The cgi in the movie is abysmally bad. So much so that I can only assume they recognized they had a flop on their hands and decided to dramatically cut costs.I strongly recommend skipping this one.

title: This is one of the best DC films in recent times
text:
I want to say right away that this is one of the best DC films in recent times
The movie is not focused on the battle against the villain, it's more about the story,
the character's development, and his journey, and it's cool.As for the plot, I liked the beginning of the movie, the new Flash costume looks
not bad, the motivation of the hero is clear, unfortunately in our time we lose people close to us people close to us, and there is a desire to bring them back.Then the time travel begins, and we can say that the rest of the story may
seem simple, the scriptwriters have twisted the comic book story, I expected something more dramatic, which could give more emotions.The principles of time travel are described in terms that are understandable to everyone, but they don't they don't try to go into something deeper. The jokes were funny, but not everything was were not all on point.The downside is the graphics, some moments are more like a video game than a movie, and it a little bit off, but in general the movie is tied to the story and not to the explosions and everything other.I liked Ezra Miller's performance, he plays 2 different people well, from Michael Keaton
It feels like he wanted to return to this role.As for the cameos, the number of them is interesting, I wouldn't say that there are a lot of them, but the selection I liked it, especially the man who played his role here.Moving on to the movie's music, I liked it overall, it turned out well, but it's not a case that I'll add a lot of songs to my playlist like I did with "Spider-Man: Into the Spider-Verse", I can single out the soundtrack that plays closer to the end of the movie, it's a good song.The end of the movie was both sad and left a positive impression right before
before the credits roll.Overall, I liked the movie, I had a good time watching this movie,
it's funny, entertaining, it has a moral that you can understand, my rating
this movie is 7/10.

title: Ho Hum
text: Another slam bang superhero movie with tons of special effects and very little logic. These days if you are stuck with what to do when someone dies, simply have people go back in time and change things. They do it in the Marvel world and they do it in The DC world. It's very convenient for the writers. Not so for us viewers who have to deal with the past, present and future personae of every character.And of course, there are all the cameo appearances of the actors who played the heroes in previous movies. They truly go overboard here, but I won't spoil it for you.Every time I go to the superhero movies, I walk away so disappointed.

title: Saviour of the Universe...
text: Barry Allen has been tempted to go backward, to do absolutely everything and all at once that he could, to quite subtly depose, events surrounding tomatoes, to recover something precious, from his childhood; but his quest has had results that mean spaghetti, has turned the future and the past into confetti, torn the fabric of the world, a multiverse becomes unfurled, a great cast, born of the past, will guarantee; that there's wonder and amazement at the start, with batty stuff that's later strewn and pulled apart, lots of super boys and girls, might just leave your head in swirls, in a story that has lots to share, impart.

title: Sasha Calle's Supergirl is the best thing about this
text: I went to this primarily to see Michael Keaton again as Batman, and Sasha Calle as a new version of Supergirl. Keaton was great as always -- he is such a skilful actor -- but the only problem was that he had less to do and say than I was expecting (having o/d'd on all those trailers that featured him so much). Could have used more of the best Batman ever, but obviously the scripting choices didn't go in that direction.But now Sasha Calle's Supergirl? This Kara Zor-el is a strong, free character with her own agency who can and does stand independently of the others around her, and Calle plays her perfectly. In just a few scenes, Kara is developed as a character of depth and complexity that we end up caring about. She's the best takeway from this rather fractured movie. The Supergirl suit, adapted from the style of Henry Cavill's Superman version, is just great, and so are the renditions of her flying scenes, which I don't take for granted. For any superhero with flight as one of their powers, it's critical to get those right. Those scenes are smooth, powerful, as good or better than anything we've had before. Just the bits with her 'standing' in midair -- it all looks very natural. The battle scenes too. And it doesn't matter at all that she's not the blonde, blue-eyed version that every previous Supergirl has been as long as the nature of the character is honored. (but Nic Cage playing Superman?
