text: I was excited to see Michael Keaton's awesome return has Batman, and being paired with The Flash and Supergirl. But when I finally saw the movie, it only got interesting when Keaton came into the picture.Barry Allen (Ezra Miller) discovers he can run back in time, and decides to stop his mom from being murdered. But unwittingly creates a paradox in his world.Ezra Miller does well in the dramatic parts, but when it came to the funny moments, it simply goes in really annoying silly moments, that make ask what is this, I mean some of the funny moments with him worked in Justice League (2017), but really goes over the top here. The effects are just too over the top, some parts good, others just too cartoony. Now Michael Keaton coming back as Batman for me, is the saving grace here, and Supergirl ( Sasha Calle) also bring some enjoyment to this.The ending to this, gives me little hope for any future DC movies to come. But let's see what the future holds.

title: Not bad...
text: Not fantastic either but definitely not bad. For once, I can actually say (when a Marvel and DC movies come out in the same year) that this DC movie is way better than the last Marvel flop (hello Guardians of the Galaxy!) I regretted to see.The story line is not entirely bad... multiverse and all, adding the superhero twist of sorts made it somewhat more relatable and believable. Director Andy Muschietti did a good enough job to make this DC movie worth watching. Ezra Miller was ok, he wasn't that impressive but he was engaging at the very least. Best of all, Ben Affleck's part in the movie is very small. So win-win!

title: Pretty entertaining!
text: I must say I think The Flash is the best DCU offering in years. It has its flaws, plenty of them in fact, but for the most part it is a thoroughly enjoyable and engaging experience.The story at its core is very good, following Barry Allen as he seeks to 'fix' the past, which proves to have significant effects on reality as he knows it. It zips along at a decent pace and is full of great humour (easily the funniest superhero film in a while across DC and Marvel). I do think there are some superfluous characters added in and a few too many meaningless cameos, which detract from the fact that the story stands on its own quite well!In an attempt to separate the person from the performance, I must say Ezra Miller is fantastic in this. They play two versions of Barry that bounce off of each other so well, and they really do make the film.I also think the whole thing has quite a nice energy to it. It is tongue in cheek and fun and just has an entertaining vibe to it.My major gripe though is that this film is just too effects heavy, and they aren't particularly good effects either. The opening sequence is laughably bad and looks more like a video game cut scene, as does everything in the speed force. I don't mind a film being effects heavy, especially a superhero film as that is par for the course, but when they are this bad it really does break the immersion in the experience.Another gripe would be that all of the action is very messy. It is shot in a way that is very disorientating and it never feels particularly fresh or engaging. Aside from a couple of cool Batman sequences, there really isn't anything to write home about where the action is concerned, which is a real disappointment.I do also think the film never really manages to find its emotional core. The script is too eager to find its next gag instead of building emotion and real stakes, which just seems like a real missed opportunity. There are glimpses into the more emotional story that this could have been, but they aren't enough.After a slightly shaky start I found myself really enjoying this film. It's messy, sure, and is riddled with bad CGI, but these problems never really get in the way of what is otherwise a pretty entertaining experience.

title: Years of uncertainty rewarded
text: Back there, reading the Wikipedia page of DCEU, I saw the first mention of The Flash movie, which was programmed to be released after Justice League (along with a Cyborg movie, which... whaaat?). And then the movie, originaled directed by Zack Snyder, was a disaster. Even with the many attempts to restore that cinematic universe, nothing concrete was reached (the Gunn anouncments are still far from see the light). But in the middle of all this chaos, The Flash continued in development, even with the massive tornado of chaos and crazyness called Ezra Miller remaining on the leading role. Came the hype, and I don't bought that hype (Tom Cruise watched the movie and loved? Marketing to me). After all this years of MCU, we are more than tired of knowing that the expectation is the mother of disappointing. And then the bad critics came out... Ahh, but I'm a person who likes to see to believe, to see to criticize with my own voice, and damn... Tom Cruise was right! The Flash is one of the best super-heroes movie ever, with a beginning that reminded me of a good episode of Justice League Unlimited focused on the Flash, and it developed spectacularly, and I hope to see Ezra Miller back on the role, they is amazing on the character. Ah! One more thing. A little spoiler... I REALLY WANT GEORGE AMAZING CLOONEY BACK ON THE NEW DC UNIVERSE! No more. Somebody get me Andy Muschietti's number, please?

title: I'm a fan and I feel served.
text: Directed by Andy Muschietti, The Flash follows Barry Allen (Ezra Miller) tries to save his family by travel back in time but when his attempt to change the past inadvertently alters the future, Barry becomes trapped in a reality in which General Zod has returned. His only hope to stop him rests in the hands of a retired Batman, an imprisoned Kryptonian, and an alternate version of himself.Finally, the Scarlet Speedster got his big screen solo outing and it's everything that I wanted it to be: fun, heartfelt, thrilling, and even refreshing. Andy Muschietti never directed a superhero or an action movie before, but he surely knows how to direct a scene, he has the potential and I honestly can't wait for more. My excitement paid off since this is my most anticipated superhero movie of the year. Barry's story arc is truly the heart of this movie, running into his younger self makes him realize at the end and just accept the grief of the incident that took his mother also his growth becoming more mature. Despite all the ongoing controversies that still surround him, Ezra Miller is undoubtedly talented and showed their acting range, playing two versions of the character that have distinct personality from each other. Miller's performance proves once again that the actor is still worthy to play this iteration of the Fastest Man Alive.It hurts me that we may never get a chance to see Batfleck kicking arse in his solo flick, even if this is his last appearance as the Caped Crusader, he definitely reminded me how badass he was and still is in that intense opening sequence. Michael Keaton is back, and the same goes for him if this is indeed his swan song, he absolutely will leave a mark on both old and new fans' hearts. I don't have much to say about Sasha Calle performance (she's gorgeous tho), she nailed it regardless. Too bad it's probably one and done for her as Supergirl. For a movie that relies heavily on CGI and a budget is around 200 million dollars, it's hilarious how it looks unpolished, sure some are great but also some are just laughably bad. The third act is a bit overwhelming yet surprisingly awesome.The Flash is an ambitious time-travel extravaganza that serves its fans with unexpected cameos, it's big in terms of scope and scale. Agree to disagree, The Flash is one of the better DCEU movies in recent years.

title: It was alright, but not for Erza Miller!
text: This movie was worth a watch because it has inspired the original DC animated movie - Justice League: Flashpoint. And it tells a pretty good story about the Multiverse, just like in the cartoon! It would've been very cool of Dylan O'Brien could replace Erza as the Flash or Grant Gustin returning as the Flash.Erza Miller is no longer my Flash, no way! But I was very excited to see Michael Keaton returning as the original Batman that brings back the original 80s Batman movies with Tim Burton, and the most beautiful actress Sasha Calle who plays Supergirl in the first time live action, she was phenomenal and incredibly fantastic for this part. Her performance was beautiful. I really hope DC hires Sasha for a Supergirl spinoff!The Director of "IT" Andy Muschietti did a really good job directing it. And the writing was good and the story was pretty much different from the classics. This movie was not that bad, well except for the poor CGI tho. But not bad!8/10.

title: DC tries to catch the multiverse train but misses
text: So the DC tired to cash in on the multiverse trend and the attempt is forced, rushed and half baked. Stakes are low, effects are sub par and acting is bad. Perhaps the worst part is dialogue which is so bad and cringe maybe an AI could have done a better job. Everyone thinks SFX is the worst part of the movie but it's actually the writing. Direction is bad and choppy with the movie and the end result is a chaotic mess. Why they had to drop Superman from the movie and rather bring on an entirely new character? When Marvel did multiverse they didn't just drop their established characters but DC just took the multiverse idea and went haywire. Now it's a pattern with DC that they will bring new characters in big projects and they don't have the skill to introduce them in a way that can impact the storyline positively. Case in point is Cyborg and now Superman's cousin. Come on DC!!!

title: Finally DC got it right
text: I had an absolutely joyous experience watching this movie. It's a breath of fresh air as it doesn't overindulge in drawn-out, monotonous fight scenes that often come across as mind-numbing. Instead, the emphasis of the narrative is directed towards the development of characters, the infusion of humor, and the invigorating spirit of adventure that permeates the whole film. If you consider yourself a movie enthusiast, there's no doubt in my mind that you're going to absolutely adore this cinematic experience. While I don't typically gravitate towards superhero flicks, much less those originating from the DC universe, this particular movie surprised me with how enjoyable it was. The sheer fun factor was undeniable, and I found myself delightfully engrossed throughout the duration. It has certainly set a new standard for how superhero movies can be both entertaining and character-focused.

title: Again, WB doesn't know who it wants the audience to be
text: Whoever said this was "the best DC movie" is greatly mistaken. The story had potential, but was poorly executed with forced humor that was highly unnecessary. Not saying all of the humor...you can tell where it was forced and not required. Ezra Miller did great acting. I just feel like the movie had a lot of potential that was not met or executed in many areas.All of the acting was pretty good. Poor CGI (yes, the speed force was supposedly intentional) looked like a step above made for tv movies, some of the dialogue was forced, and the opening sequence was terrible. The movie doesn't know if it wants to be serious, funny, epic, marvel, for kids or adults.

title: Should not be missed
text: I had very high expectations when I went to see the film and they were almost all exceeded.The movie "The Flash" is about Barry who wants to save his parents through new powers, but he got into trouble.But the plot has a very big problem with the villain of the movie, because he should not exist at all (you will understand me later). The graphics are sometimes very bad and blurry but Barbara Muschietti said that it is the layer of Flash and that it should be.I think it's nice to see Michael Keaton back in the role of Batman and Sasha Calle also did a good job in the role of Supergirl. Ezra Miller should not be forgotten either, as he added dramatick well to the film.I think if you like the DCEU and superhero movies in general, you should definitely watch the film.

title: Beginning of Multiverse in DCEU
text: Well written Script. Simple Story but interesting screen presence. Good Story Mode. Great Action Blocks. Michael Kaeton and Ben Affleck - Mass Entry as Batman, both performed well. Ezra Miller - Good Performance, Scored well in Both Comedy and Emotional Scenes. Other Characters contributed well. VFX - As usual First Class. Cinematography - Great. BGM - Kept Engaged. Logically acceptable in many places. Missing in-depth story is a slight drawback. Big Applause to everyone who worked in This Flash Film.Beginning of Multiverse in DCEU. Satisfy all level of audience. Mix of all commercial elements. Definitely another good film from DC. Flash do well in the Box Office. Hope, it will become Big Blockbuster Hit for DC this year.

title: One of the better DC movies in recent years.
text: The Flash has enough action, heart and humor - not to mention fun cameos - to make up for any drawbacks.Worlds collide when the director of both "IT" movies sat on the chair of the first comic book movie about the fast young teen in the DCEU. Andy Muschietti showed us a good amount of unique director chooses that enchanted the feeling from the comics. As Michael Keaton brings back the old Batman, with the same vibes, Ezra Miller pulls not one, but two fenomenal performances. The pacing was great and the screenplay was actually good for a comics film (which I am not the biggest fan of).The flash is funny, fittingly fast-paced l, and overall ranks as one of the best DC movies in recent years.

title: So much fun
text: It's just what these movies are supposed to be - fun and fast and pure entertainment. They take it the extra mile with all the fan service and cameos, that's fore sure, and they're all enjoyable and take you back down memory lane. And Batman is just wow, both versions! It's like they finally remembered how to write him being cool. Obviously it will be quite bitter sweet with the announced "reboot" - but hopefully there is still a chance to incorporate some of these charters. Although I hope not Supergirl - by far the "weakest link", could have been just fine without her and can't say I was particularly fond of how she came across or how they portraid the character.

title: Do you know what this symbol stands for?
text: The Flash certainly came out late for a movie about a character who can move at an unfathomably high speed. The Flash now serves as one of the Snyder-verse's final movies in 2023, a eulogy for Zack Snyder's era of DC but also, strangely, for all of the comic book to cinema adaptations. The outcome is disorganized and odd. It's a cheerful, carefree movie that is overtaken by corporate hagiography and serves as a commendation for a number of films that fizzled out.Given everything, the worst thing The Flash could accomplish is feel tedious. The movie's two-and-a-half-hour runtime does, however, go along at a commendable pace. Given that it features one of the most complicated stories in a recent run of superhero movies that are dreadfully lacking in multi-versal explanation, this is even more astounding. Christina Hodson's script keeps the story firmly focused on its protagonist's emotional journey and treats the finer points of its metaphysical world-building as flavor, an excuse to do some extremely comic book things, even though it lacks the clarity or resonance of, say, Spider-Man: Across the Spider-Verse.Barry Allen is briefly reintroduced in the opening as a full-time forensics lab analyst and occasional Justice League on a personal quest to exonerate his father, Henry, who has been wrongfully imprisoned for the murder of Barry's mother, Nora. When Barry finds out that the last significant potential breakthrough in his dad's case would not clear him, the narrative really gets going. In a moment of despair, Barry learns that if he runs quickly enough, he can outrun the speed of light and go through time, where he may view history in a ring of space-time he refers to as "the chronobowl." Barry resolves to time travel in order to stop his mother's death and his father's imprisonment, disobeying Batman's caution about the dangers of changing history.The Flash is a buddy comedy in which Barry teams up with a younger, more annoying version of himself from the past. Despite this angst-filled premise, director Andy Muschietti cleverly infuses the movie with a Looney Tunes sensibility, reintroducing Barry in one of the funniest opening sequences in a superhero film to date.The majority of the movie takes place in a new timeline that Barry invents, where the choice to save his mother has repercussions that threaten to destroy the DC film universe's very foundations: General Zod makes an appearance, just like he did in 2013's Man of Steel, but this time there is no one to stop him. Batman, the character portrayed by Michael Keaton in Tim Burton's 1989 Batman and its sequel, is the only known superhero in this reality, and Barry is compelled to reenact his superhero origins with his younger self.At this point, The Flash ceases to be a movie and transforms into a number of other things, some of which are downright cynical. Making Keaton's Bruce Wayne/Batman the main supporting character in the movie is obviously an act of nostalgia, but Keaton does a good job in the part. The Flash, however, doesn't stop there. Like Barry, the filmmakers go too far, too fast, and too crazy, almost losing control of their movie in a jumbled mess of meta-commentary and eulogy as they reflect on the history of DC movie adaptations as well as the Snyder-verse, which started it all and is soon to come to an end.

title: A fun movie full of fan-service.
text: Ezra Miller is fine in the film, he maintains the leading role from the beginning to the film, being a fundamental piece in the comedy of the film that works very well, unfortunately I cannot say the same of the drama that has a bad development and is not the best thing about the film.About the Batmans, none of them stands out more than Maicon Keaton's, perhaps the best thing about the film, certainly the one I liked the most among the fan-services and elevates the film in a certain way.But the third act of the film leaves something to be desired, and all the concepts of alternate realities and universes have very limited development. There is a serious problem with the film which is the graphics and effects clearly not finished.But overall, the fan-services that cause pleasant surprises (some unnecessary ones), the comedy, Ezra Miller's protagonism and Michael Keaton's Batman outweigh all the problems.

title: Perfect send off for the DCEU
text: As the final installment in the extremely convoluted DCEU, The Flash is a perfect send off for the DCEU encapsulating all of these films at both their best and worst. An overblown third act, CG overload, awful cameos and a villain ripped straight from a video game are all here and accounted for but it's also funny and fast paced film with a really solid emotional core.This is easily Ezra Miller's best performance as Barry Allen/The Flash. Thanks to the multiple performances the film can have it both ways, still indulging in the constant quips that can be grating in the younger Barry but wisely balancing it against the older Barry who has to mature and mentor his younger self.Michael Keaton is the best part of the film. He returns to the role like he never left and even though its nowhere near as rewarding as his previous two outings he still gets enough to do, is funnier than before and has a standout fight that makes up for him spending the third act almost exclusively in the cockpit.Sasha Calle doesn't get a lot of screen time, coming into the film quite late but thankfully she's more than capable of leaving a lasting impression, bringing both the stoicism and hopefulness to the character. Its a shame the film makes it pretty clear she won't return because she deserves to.Andy Muschietti's direction is bold at best and bland at worst. The title reveal is delightfully playful and the film isn't afraid to embrace the abilities of its characters leading to some inventive shots but also means a lot of it can comes across feeling floaty and weightless.The CG is actually awful (not the vfx artists fault), it rarely looks good and so much of it looks surprisingly unfinished. The music by Benjamin Wallfisch is fine, a lot of it is good in the moment without creating any memorable themes and there's plenty of callbacks to Danny Elfman's iconic score (probably too many to be honest).

title: Delightful and Surprising
text: What we get in this timeline of The Flash is epic. We encounter comic moments as well as heart-felt moments. But, most entertaining are the appearances of previous Batmans, such as the familiar Ben Affleck Batman, the outstanding Micheal Keaton Batman, and even a surprise George Clooney Batman. This movie includes multiple past characters into the storyline in a natural way.The story is fast-paced and requires brainpower to keep up. The CG characters are pretty rubbery in appearance, but it does give fan service to Christopher Reeves, Helen Slater, and many other characters from the DC Universe. The Flash is a fun ride packed with action and humor.

title: A bit of a let down, if I'm being honest
text: "The Flash," starring Ezra Miller and Michael Keaton, promised to be a thrilling superhero film. However, while it had potential, the movie ultimately left me with mixed feelings.One of the highlights of "The Flash" was its good premise. The concept of a superhuman with the ability to travel through time had the potential to deliver an exciting and mind-bending experience. The initial setup and the references to the character's origin story were intriguing, leaving viewers eager to see how the story would unfold.Unfortunately, the plot twists failed to deliver impactful and meaningful punch to the story. The acting performances were just okay; Ezra Miller and Michael Keaton did a decent job, but perhaps they weren't provided with enough material or direction to create meaningful emotional connections with the other characters, the audience, or the story as with some of the best Superhero movies that I have seen. Lastly, the movie suffered from bad and recycled CGI, taking away from a genuine and immersive experience that breathes new life to the thrills. Even the time travel bubble which was meant to be cool looking, reminded me of some of the CGI that had already been used in the Green Lantern and Thor. Just not original enough for me.Since I'm a die-hard Flash fan, I felt entertained and I loved the addition of some of my favorite characters, and the actors who played them. So, it definitely wasn't the worst movie. It was better than these childish superhero comedies that I've seen (Deadpool, Shazam, Guardians of the Galaxy, Thor Ragnarok, Suicide Squad). Better than some of the flops like Green Lantern, Black Adam and Batman vs Superman. It just didn't have the depth and originality that I had hoped it could deliver.

title: One of the DCEU's Best
text: Unfortunately, we have all experienced heartache of some kind. Few comic book characters understand that better than Barry Allen, aka super-fast superhero The Flash. When he was just a kid, his mother was murdered in their home and his father was wrongly convicted and subsequently sent to prison for the crime. In the character's self-titled debut solo film. Flash uses his powers to travel back in time and prevent that tragedy from ever occurring, inadvertently becoming trapped in this alternate timeline he created. When Kryptonian General Zod arrives and threatens Earth, our hero must gather whatever protectors he can find to defend the world in which his family is happy. As the synopsis suggests, 'The Flash' is a very heartfelt, emotional film due to it being about loss & trauma and having the power to change it. The scenes between Barry and his mom in particular are equally wholesome and heartbreaking since we ultimately know her fate. Ezra Miller delivers a phenomenal performance as two different versions of Barry Allen; the main one more mature & serious and the other an 18-year-old carefree goofball. Their dynamic is delightful, with the latter version responsible for much of the film's humor. Surprisingly (and welcomed), 'The Flash' is one of the funniest comic-book movies I've ever seen. The jokes are perfectly placed and I can't even count how many times I laughed out loud from beginning to end. Another highlight of the film is Michael Keaton's Bruce Wayne/Batman, who proves you're never too old to kick ass! After 30 years, he slips back into the role like a comfy pair of Bat-slippers and cements his place in the Batman Hall of Fame. Keaton clearly loves playing the character, and that passion radiates from him whenever he's on-screen. 'The Flash' also features Ben Affleck's swan song as his iteration of the Caped Crusader in a fantastic, albeit bittersweet, send-off. Rounding out the film's ensemble of incredible characters is Kara Zor-El/Supergirl (Sasha Calle), who utilizes her limited screentime to enhance every scene she's in. Her role is like the parmesan cheese on the plate of pasta that is the movie: not too much as to overpower the entire dish, but enough to still appreciate it. After seeing Sasha's debut performance as the Girl of Steel, I truly hope she continues to play the character going forward. Now, while the movie is outstanding, it's not perfect... although the good FAR outweighs the bad. My only two criticisms are that, while Flash's powers are portrayed in really cool, visually interesting ways, the CGI resembles PlayStation 3 graphics at times (specifically in an otherwise cheer-worthy sequence towards the end) and the villains feel a bit wooden and generic. Overall, while it took nearly a decade to make it to theaters (ironic, huh?), 'The Flash' is well worth the wait. Full of heart, humor, and great performances, the film stands out among the hit-and-miss DCEU as one of its best offerings to date.

title: DCEU Film #13: The Flash
text: In the Flash (2023), we witness the end of the DCEU as we know it. Those films now enter, into film history, as part of the era, that depicted the rise of the comic-book film, in the early part of the 21st century. Now, the next phase of DC's theatrical division moves onto it's next incarnation, in the guise of James Gunn's new DCU, which should launch in 2025. The Flash (2023), ends a 13 film run by the DCEU, that began with the Man of Steel (2013). So, being a Flash film, you already know, that this will be a perfect moment to use the character, most pivotal, in all the stories DC has used during its history, to reboot its brand, either on film or in print. This is a perfect way to segue from the current universe to the next one coming. As seen in the trailers, you also know, that this is a time-traveling film. Barry Allen decides to go back in time and save his mother. It's the quintessential Flash story. We also know this will be another example of a multi-verse film.So, as this swan song opens up, we also are reminded of the off-screen problems of it's star, Ezra Miller, as Barry Allen, the Flash. Trying to remove that from your mind won't work, because, unfortunately, knowing this, helps enhance his performance. It's an eerie parallel, that is felt in the film, especially since he runs into a younger version of himself, who wouldn't really be considered totally stable, especially by the end of the film. So, removing real-world problems from the equation, the star's performance is not a problem in this film. With that in mind, we move onto the supporting cast. Many characters in the film have to stay top-secret here, but two characters we do know from the trailer is Ben Affleck and returning champion Michael Keaton, as our main Batmen. Barry Allen turns to his Bruce Wayne (Affleck), to get support for his idea, to go change the past. Once Barry gets to the past, it turns out he has entered the wrong universe and while searching for Batman, he finds the Bruce Wayne from the Tim Burton universe, Michael Keaton. Both Batmen do a great job with their performances, but I felt Keaton was held back a little too much. He felt too subtle.The plot also harkens back to that beginning film, the Man of Steel (2013) and utilizes elements from that film, in order to give us an idea of when this takes place. The day the Kryptonians attacked Earth. This brings back Superman rival, General Zod (Michael Shannon), but gives us a new hero, Supergirl (Sasha Calle). Basically, this boils down to a multi-verse disaster in the making. Forget everything you know, heard or believe, when it comes to the concept of time-travel. This is most evidenced by the shot the writers of the Flash (2023), take, on Marvel's concept of time-travel, as seen in Avengers: Endgame (2019). It is a subtle joke, that speaks volumes. The humor in the film is quite good. It is that infuriating aspect of Ezra Miller's Flash, that is appealing. He was the comedy-relief in the Justice League (2017), much like Paul Rudd was in the MCU's Captain America: Civil War (2016). So, it's not a surprise, that the Flash (2023), has lots of comedy moments.The Flash (2023), isn't a bad film, but it isn't a great one either. The multi-verse plotline, along with the main plot of Barry attempting to save his mother, coupled with having to world-build another universe in two hours and a plethora of characters roll through, makes for a messy situation, unless you are knowledgeable enough to understand what is going on. Fortunately for me, I have been following DC since the 1970s, so none of that bothered me. It could be confusing for those, who don't know the comics or all the movies from the past that well. The strong point of this film stems from the swan song aspect of it all. Knowing that things will be changing for DC makes this a strong homage to the past ten years of the DCEU. Love them or hate them, whatever the sum total of all 13 parts were for you and for film history, the Flash (2023), is strong enough to entertain and put a decent closing to this era of DC comics theatrical films.7.2 (C MyGrade) = 7 IMDB.

title: Surprisingly good
text: First off, I understand as well as anyone that DC has shot themselves in the foot with their cinematic universe over and over again. It's been nothing but bad choices ever since Man of Steel.After the decision to kill the "Snyderverse" it made no sense that they even completed production on this thing; what's the point? Ohh Warner Brothers...AND I'm a huge fan of the much better DC animated universe, and The Flashpoint Paradox in particular, and this is a fair adaptation of it! This did a better job of fan service than the last season of Picard! I don't like Ezra Miller, and I feel they even addressed that in a satisfying way. The effects were very good. The CGI cameos were a lovely treat.I think the only reason it was such a flop was because of the circus both DCEU and Ezra Miller separately became, and people knew this wasn't going anywhere. That and all the spoilers that were baked in before anyone could see it. Can you imagine if you didn't know Michael Keaton was in it?? Which is all a shame, because although it has a lighter tone, it's the best movie in the DCEU since Man of Steel, and I guess that makes it fitting that it's the last: book ends with a whole lot of trash in between (with the exception of the first WW which was also pretty good). Aaaaand I'll always be bitter that Batfleck never got a solo film.

title: Disappointing after all the hype
text: I was very excited about this movie but tbh I left the theater very disappointedI DID love Sasha Calle's performance and Michael Keaton in this, but Ezra Miller's performance did not deliver. It felt like they'd have preferred to have been doing a stoner comedy than a Flash movie. Barry had none of the geeky charm usually found in the character and was instead obnoxious and whiney.I'd dig a spin off with just Supergirl and Keaton's Batman as adoptive dad. Actually, I really want a solo flick for Calle's Supergirl because her performances were excellent, and the depth of the character is so rich and has so much to offer, but that ending left me feeling like we're not gonna get the chance to see her again.

title: So bad
text:
I rarely write reviews ...
But this movie was so bad, I just have to get my thoughts out.Let me start by saying I am generally very easily pleased. It takes a lot for a movie to incur such a negative reaction from me.There's so much that's bad about this movie.#1 is Ezra Miller. He's so bad. How does he audition for this role and someone seeing him act says "Yeah, seems good!"? HOW?! Incredibly annoying, mind-blowingly cringey.But even that aside, almost everything else is bad as well. The dialogue, the story, the CGI ... oof. Bad on so many levels.Keaton reprising Batman was the one redeeming factor. What a waste. I'm embarrassed for him.

title: Enjoyable Popcorn Flick
text: I was among the lucky few to see this in IMAX in a special sneak screening the Monday before wide release.Let me start by saying that I had a good time with the Flash. Keaton, Calle and Miller were all outstanding and carry this lighthearted romp. Warner was wise to focus on Keaton in the marketing bc having Keaton back in the cape and cowl is essential to making this whole endeavor work.That being said, if this is indeed Keaton's last turn as the caped crusader, it will be somewhat of a missed opportunity for not placing him in a full on return to the Burtonverse bc the world/Gotham that Keaton's Batman inhabited was such a defining feature of his iteration of Bats that it feels like a shame not seeing where that exact continuity went.But, that's another universe/timeline.The humor and fun that Keats, Calle and Miller inject into this flick are it's super power and the film coasts on their merits, and a few cameos, to its detriment.

title: Nothing memorable
text: The Flash 2023, the film in question is a work that fails to distinguish itself from the mass of similar films. The plot is predictable and offers nothing new. The characters are often formulaic and lack depth. The direction is mediocre and fails to bring the story to life.Despite this, the film has some strengths. The action scenes are well choreographed. Also, the special effects are of good quality and contribute to a good viewing experience.In general, the film is unmemorable and does not leave a strong impression. However, if you are a fan of superhero movies and are just looking for a light-hearted experience, this could be the movie for you. The film itself isn't anything special though.

title: It's got it's problems, but...
text: It has its problems. It has a lot of problems. Some are hilariously terrible. But if you can look past them and watch it for what it is, a heavily overpriced popcorn movie, then it's a fun 2 1/2 hours.It is hard to root for a character played by a total dirt bag of an actor. Beyond that most of the problems with this film are textbook studio interference. I think after Summer 2023's very expensive flop fest, studios will begin to right the ship, or one can hope. Will this finally get Warner's attention to let artists be artists, and realize it doesn't have to cost unspeakable amounts of money to make? I hope so. I waited a long time to watch this one, knowing the issues it had and the baggage it brought. Having finally watched it (with my brain properly shut off) I must admit it's a pretty fun film. Keaton fully brought it. The movie could've been so, so much better, and that's the gut wrencher. Comic fans will hate it and I get it. There's a lot wrong canon-wise. I'm not a comic fan myself but know and appreciate the characters. I imagine the studio decided the demographic of this movie are non comic fans, and they're the ones who will really like it. If you can watch it for free or a low price, I'd recommend it. Don't go spending a lot, though. There are better options out there.

title: Blatant fan-service, and I'm here for (most of) it
text: How do you get a guy like me to go see a Snyderverse movie? Apparently, bringing back the OG Batman is the way to go. It's a pretty shrewd tactic marketing-wise, and it worked; I took that bait hard, and Michael Keaton is unquestionably the movie's shining star.It's not a bad movie overall, but it's just as messy as its production; a wonky opening with an incredible second act and an absurd finish.At its heart, this is a mother-son time travel story, and a pretty good one; it's just the mechanics of which (and some of The. Worst. CGI*) that are questionable. Ezra Miller, for their part, does a solid job here, and I wish they weren't a garbage person in real life. I was utterly floored by Sasha Calle as Supergirl, big fan.But it's Keaton's joy in re-donning the cowl that dominated my attention. He's back in action without missing a step and it is thrilling. He's the key to the movie's replay value, I can guarantee it.*Not all that comfortable, ethically, with the array of cameos in the final moments. It was a bad call, Ripley!

title: Surprisingly heartfelt and a lot of fun.
text: I enjoyed it from start to finish and having watched it a few hours ago now I'm still finding myself thinking about it constantly.To say what I thought would be too long and spoil a lot. The action, story, performances, nods, Easter eggs and more were all done so well.I'd highly recommend it, something about it is very special and had me smiling, laughing and feeling things throughout.It deserves ALOT of praise. The actors were all fantastic and I would pay to see more Supergirl in a stand-alone movie. I went in excited having grown up in the 80's and looking forward to Michael Keaton returning as well as supergirl in a big budget modern take which did not disappoint.Saying anymore would spoil too much but it deserves to be rated well so I had to contribute to the rating. If you're a fan of the stories, actors or the original Batman or superman movies I would say relive the good old days and enjoy this one.A massive well done. Great movie and a fun ride!

title: A fun popcorn movie
text: After watching this movie, all I can say is that I don't think that It is the bomb. That other reviewers are saying instead and this is my personal opinion. I think that this is A Fun movie And it definitely was worth waiting for I thought despite what ezra miller Has done he did a pretty good job of betraying the flash And I thought even I was in high school when I watched michael keaton's batman I do think that he did a fantastic job returning and a definitely Gave his batman a lot to do And it was very cool. I also did like the message that this movie has And I hope that There will be a sequel.

title: Surprisingly good!
text: I wasn't sure what to expect given all the mixed reviews, but I was pleasantly surprised.Despite the fact that I don't like Ezra Miller, his performance was surprisingly good. The writing was also great, this is a fun movie to watch, it has you laughing throughout, whilst also having a deep emotional core. The humor was similar to that of dungeons and dragons honor among thieves. While there where a lot of complaints about it being just a fan service, it didn't seem like that to me. Yes, it did have things that fans enjoyed, but you can still enjoy it without knowing too much about DC. There were a lot of complaints about the end being chaotic, which was what I was expecting when I went to watch it, but it wasn't really chaotic. And despite the comments about the cgi, while it wasn't avatar way of water, it wasn't that bad. Also, Michael Keaton was a great Batman, and I think Sasha Calle is my favorite supergirl. Over all, a good film.I almost didn't go see it, but I'm glad I did. Definitely worth watching:)

title: What The Hell Was That?!?
text: This movie was absolutely trash and the CGI was laughable. I feel totally justified to not have wasted the money to see this in a theater.With all the source material to draw off of and again DC fails to have a competent storyline or script. Between the predictable momentum and the ever increasingly weak script I found it hard to stave off the boredom.The jokes were juvenile and not very good even with such a low bar to overcome. The only thing missing was a giant starfish. (Not a spoiler)If you go into watch this pile of burning garbage with the hopes of a glimpse into the new James Gunn DCU you will leave disappointed.

title: The Michael Keaton show
text: The latest movie in the DCEU franchise,The Flash, lived up to the hype created by the trailers. Michael Keatons reprisal of the role as Batman was truly captivating and delightful to watch. Although I wasn't born when he portrayed Batman, I watched those movies dozens of times when I was younger. The moment he showed up on screen I couldn't contain my excitement and it brought me back to my childhood. The fact I knew he was going to be in the movie didn't change anything. The reusage of the Danny Elfman theme made it all complete and gave me goosebumps. It perfectly complemented the movie and enhanced the overall experience.This movie is the DCEU version of No Way Home, delivering a grand spectacle packed with action and nostalgia. It was fan service at its finest. All the cameos worked for me and runtime didn't bother me. However the dodgy VFX did bother me a bit, but it didn't ruin the overall experience.I can fully recommend The Flash. It is a must-see for superhero movie fans, offering something for both the older fans with a lot of nostalgia and for the newer fans of the franchise with thrilling action and strong performances.

title: The best DC movie
text: The best DC movie. Loved everything. Almost a Justice league movie. Not a single boring moment and loud cheers and applauses in the Imax. A Real life Flash movie which I was waiting for a long time and finally got to experience it in the Imax. The cameos were great. Ezra Miller has proved why he is the best casting for the flash. Loved Ben Affleck and Michael Keaton. Loved all the cameos. The emotional touch in the movie was fantastic and almost made me cry. It is a wholesome family entertainer so you can watch it with your entire family without any issues. I see lot of people complaining about the CGI but it is extremely good.

title: Questionable CGI, Keaton's Batman was the highlight
text: Okay, so let me start off by saying the obvious... This was overhyped which to me is a big shame. I love the character Flash and to see this not living up to the hype is kind of sad. But with that said, it was still pretty entertaining though, although it had dodgy CGi. (Really Hollywood? You got so much money and can't even do proper CGI? Embarrassing)."The Flash" is based on "The Flashpoint Paradox" very loosely. When I say very loosely, basically everything after Barry going back to save his mom changes from the original source which is nice and original and all, but I feel like they would've had a much better time if they followed the original source to the tee. Watching Ezra Miller on the big screen after all the criminal things he had done was kind of uncomfortable but he was as usual pretty funny in his role. (I do not endorse the actor, but I like the character. Just clarifying). Michael Keaton back as Batman was incredible and for me the highlight of this movie and by the looks of it most of the people who watched this agrees. The different easter eggs were amazing and the score was fantastic. But honestly, this could've been SO much more and so much better.

title: DCEU END
text: Long on fan service and littered with incredulous plot manipulations, "The Flash" will work for DC diehards but only mildly entertain everyone else.While director Andy Muschietti's time-travel crowd pleaser doesn't blaze any new narrative trails, it does result in a fun superhero nostalgic dive, for the most part.Definitely wanna see more of Sasha Calle's Supergirl in the future. One of the major standouts in the movie. Really liked her.34 years after he first played Batman on the big screen, Michael Keaton returns to the role (and the big screen) and he doesn't miss actually he is MVP for me.Batfleck is back he showed for a short amount of minutes but i enjoyed seeing him for one last time.In the end, The Flash triumphs through its ability to connect emotionally and deliver moments of genuine humour. These elements, coupled with impressive action, make it a worthwhile watch.

title: An amazing comic book movie made with love for comics
text: Engaging and highly enjoyable, with a well-developed plot and great character development. The film has a strong sentimental tone, which creates empathy with the protagonist and his actions.The action scenes were excellent, with all the actors and choreography well-directed. The characters truly shine when they need to.I won't give it 5 stars because the special effects were lacking. While the "speed force" sequences looked intentionally strange, the real action scenes shouldn't have had that issue. However, it stands out, especially in facial expressions, reaching the uncanny valley for some characters.In conclusion, the movie is good for an afternoon watch and enjoyment. If you've been a DC fan for a while, you'll love everything they show and explore. Additionally, the message of "not all problems have a solution" is highly motivating and truly evokes emotion in the viewer.

title: A fan service
text: Yeah, it wasn't too shabby at all. I mean, who wouldn't get excited to see Michael Keaton reprising his role as Batman? It was like a blast from the past and definitely brought back some nostalgic vibes. But, gotta be honest, the CGI left something to be desired. It just didn't quite live up to the high expectations I had. I was hoping for some mind-blowing visuals, but it fell a bit short.Now, let's talk about those unexpected cameos. Oh man, they really caught me off guard! One of them was downright crazy. I won't spoil it for you, but let's just say it was a delightful surprise. And there were a couple of other cameos sprinkled throughout the movie that added to the excitement. It's always fun to spot familiar faces in these superhero flicks.Now, when it comes to Barry Allen, I couldn't help but notice how much more awkward he seemed compared to his Justice League appearance. I guess they wanted to emphasize his quirky personality, but at times it felt a bit forced. Don't get me wrong, though, there were still some scenes that had me cracking up and they definitely left an impression.All in all, I'd say it's a classic popcorn flick. You know, the kind of movie you grab a big tub of popcorn, kick back, and enjoy for a couple of hours. It's not something you'd watch over and over again, but it definitely delivers a good time. So, yeah, worth a watch if you're in the mood for some superhero action and a few laughs, and then you can move on to the next adventure.

title: The Flash - A Decent Film
text: I have watched the Flashpoint paradox animated movie and when this movie was announced, I thought that the flashpoint paradox storyline is going to be adapted. But then realised that this one is going to have a completely different storyline. Ezra miller's performance is really good. Michael Keaton has still got that charisma he had when he first played the role of Batman. CGI could have definitely been better. The pace of the movie is good. The villain had literally no impact on me personally. Because, when watching a movie I usually want to get a clear picture and motive of the villain so that I can get myself engaged in the movie personally to a much deeper level. This has not happened in the case of this movie. This one is my biggest complaint about this film. The emotions are portrayed very well though. The direction and screenplay are good too.Finally, this one may not be a masterpiece but at the same time, not as worst as it was projected. Can give this one a try.One time watchable movie.

title: Ezra Miller was fantastic!
text: This movie is just so enjoyable. I can't tell you how much fun I had with this movie. Ezra Miller knocked it out of the park! I understand he did some strange things recently, but hey, who hasn't done something dumb in their life that they regret. It's nothing more than human imperfection, something we are ALL guilty of. Ezra Miller has apologized for his behaviour, and I hope that people can give him another chance, provided of course he continues to make efforts on bettering himself. His performance was excellent, and I'd love to see him return as The Flash.As for the movie, it's just so much fun, and me and the audience laughed all the way through. Some people have talked about the CGI. Although not perfect, as someone who appreciates good CGI, it was fine. There's just so much going on, I think what they achieved here was amazing, and executed very well. Like in the movie, I personally wish I could back in time and relive the experience for the first time over and over, because this Super Hero movie absolutely blew me away, and I assure you that if you're like me who relatively enjoys all the big Super Hero hit movies that have come out these past years, then you'll absolutely love this one.

title: Must watch
text:
A new different direction from the usual dc movies
Great acting by Ezra miller loved to Micheal Keaton back with I'm Batman 😁,sasha cale is looking good as Kara zor'el aka Supergirl.Dc approached a different perspective for their movie and flash hype is real and alive just dc needs to slow down the spoilers in their trailers just to keep the money making scenes reserved for audience to bring the twist in theatres which will shock the audience and get them into a discussion with their knowns that will spread the word and popularise the flash movie just like Marvel does with their movies i hope flash will succeed in Box office.

title: Fun, no dull moments. Ezra Miller was perfect as the namesake.
text: The Flash was a fun movie. No dull moment, keeps you engaged and was pretty light hearted affair even though it dealt with Flashpoint. Some surprising Cameos and Ezra Miller's action keeps the boat afloat. Glad that they didn't veer too far off the path from what fans love about the flash and the antagonist. The CGI was on point, pacing was perfect. Makes a fan wish there was more to this.It's a sad affair that Ezra got caught up in controversy which ultimately is gonna affect this movie box office run. Fingers crossed and I hope it doesn't. DCEU we currently know ironically ends with the energy it should've started with.

title: Worst movie of 2023
text: What a freaking mess this is ... Acting is dumb af and all actors doing worse than imagine. Keaton getting old and it's shows, his action scenes are some of the worst thing I see Batman do. Andy is the worst superhero director ever and visuals are bad as hell. It got piss filter too. Final scene looks like VFX project of a 10 yo, it was unfinished, over the top it was filled with some unethical cameos of dead actors. This movie makes fun of death of real people. Story was messy as hell and watching this can give people headaches. My theatre was empty af and when the final scene comes up one of the person said "seriously no way they spend 200 million on this movie" .

title: The Flash Is Another Impressive And Exciting Takes On The Multiverse, And It's One Of The Best Films Of The Year
text: You Wanna Get Nuts? Let's Get Nuts, goddamn right this movie is nuts, The Flash was a fresher and definitely the best movie in this three weeks of big major releases (Across The Spider-Verse and Transformers: Rise Of The Beasts), The Flash is another impressive and exciting takes on the Multiverse which are the thing that they loved to make right now, Ezra Miller outside of his real life behavior, man he is a damn good actor, he really is, it's not easy to play two roles at the same time and he nailed it perfectly, the rest of the cast including of course the one and only Michael Keaton returning as Batman and man did he still got it, Sasha Calle performance and appearance was really pleasant, the action are solid, the score are solid, it was a well written story, well written dialogue, and it's surprisingly funny, the comedy is mostly work, and the rest of the cast was also great, it's an engaging story with a very good character study, the special effects are great and talking about special effects it was in a way also the major problem i have with the movie, which is the CGI on literally every human in this movie, it was too CGI, it's too animated, it looks too plasticky and too jelly, it wasn't great, and i'm hoping it's gonna improve but it's literally the whole movie that the the CGI on the human was just too animated, if it's intentional then i'm still much prefer if they make it more realistic, and besides couple of slow scene and some decisions, overall The Flash was still an incredible journey, a wild trippy adventure with good dark serious theme and story, impressive effects, action, and some amazing performances, it's a pretty exciting experience in one great movie, The Flash is one of the best films of the year, and at last all i can say about the surprises was that it was mostly worth it, all the cameos was great but there is this one jaw dropping long sequence that are just NUTS!, and that is all i can say, go watch The Flash, if you can only choose one between the three i'll say pick The Flash, it's more than worth it.

title: Not top tier DC, but still an enjoyable yet flawed film
text: The Flash is a film I didn't expect too much from going into it but coming out I did enjoy it - for the most part. I definitely had a few issues with it and I don't agree with the premature claim of it being one of the best superhero movies ever, but it's fun enough.Starting off with the good, Ezra does a great job as our main Barry. He brings plenty of heart and emotion through his performance and you really feel his internal struggle. Michael Keaton's return as Batman is an obvious highlight and whilst I wasn't alive when his films released I still got that nostalgia kick seeing him back. Sasha Calle made a strong impression as Supergirl, tho underused, I enjoyed her. It was nice to see Batfleck back one last time, I loved his speech about scars making us who we are. The action was pretty good, particularly the opening action sequence in Gotham which was a lot of fun.Now as for the issues I had with it. Firstly, the CGI is not great and at multiple moments looked like PS3 graphics. This then leads me onto the cameos, some of which were dead actors brought to life via CGI which did not look good at all and on top of that I just had a taste issue with bringing back dead actors.Then there's the humour which was a 50/50 split with what worked and what didn't. An example being the lasso gag which wasn't funny and they've done before. Lastly, there's young Barry who I liked sometimes, but other times he got really annoying and put me off his character.The Flash isn't a top tier DC flick for me but it is a mostly enjoyable ride nonetheless.

title: Not even Keaton was able to save this for me
text: Full disclaimer: I wasn't going to watch this one if it wasn't for them handing out tickets at the entrance of the cinema (well, if the session was almost empty, at least make some by selling popcorn since you have to do the viewing regardless, I guess). I grew up with DC comics (and Marvel, lets face it, we all have a preference but we would read whatever we got our hands on), and I wasn't lining up to see this movie, after what I got to see of Ezra's flash in the other movies, not even being his first titular movie. Well, didn't help all his problems with the police, kidnapping allegations, etc., but that wasn't my problem with his Flash, his Flash in Justice League rubbed me the wrong way and boy oh boy it just dialed up to one thousand in this titular film. His Flash is cringe, a complete moron almost, a mockery of Barry Allen. How can someone fail so miserable interpreting such a famous character, specially when he had the luxury of having an interpretation of the Flash that he could look to for inspiration (Grant Justin... sure, I have some things to criticize about his Flash but compared with Ezra Grant's Flash is a masterpiece of perfection).Not even Keaton performance saved it for me... this is so bad that not even all the nods and easter eggs made it worth for me. It was painful, so painful I walked out before it ended.Ezra was a complete miscast, his Flash is egregious, so bad it makes the Green Lantern look like a masterpiece.

title: Fun and full of surprises and heart, but little more (7.5)
text: This is no doubt one of the better superhero films I've seen in a while, and I'm thoroughly impressed with how much I enjoyed Ezra Miller here considering all the recent controversy surrounding him. "The Flash" is a perfectly entertaining movie, but little more, which is a shame considering it had immense potential.The various cameos and Easter eggs are a real treat, but they all overshadow the real story of the film: Barry trying to save his mother. "The Flash" is at its best when it explores the Allen family and it's too bad the story wasn't as focused on this as it was fan service and nostalgia.Don't get me wrong, the nostalgia factor was awesome. Michael Keaton's Batman steals the show for sure, and Supergirl was pretty interesting despite her lack of background. But all the nostalgia made for very hollow storytelling, especially since the actual story, Barry trying to save his mother, that got us there in the first place was far stronger.All in all I highly recommend you see this film, especially if you were a fan of Keaton's Batman.

title: Good story, but lacking in CGI
text: Ezra Miller does a really good job in the movie.His co-stars also does a pretty decent job in the movie portraying the characters.Unfortunatily, the whole movie looks rushed when it comes to CGI/VFX department.Wish they would actually use time to make everything good in the movie, not just the plot.Loved the ending of the movie when you see all the characters.Unfortunatily in most movies that comes out these days, there is something lacking when it comes to superhero movies.DC seems to be missing out with the plot these days, but this is actually a really good one when it comes to story.

title: Very Good movie hurt by bad CGI
text: The hype around this movie was too surreal so when this movie actually came out, I lowered my expectations instead of believing the hype. Now, this movie is nowhere near being the greatest movie of all time, but it is a really great movie overall. The action scenes were very clever in how they explored the flash's powers and how useful it can be in stressful situations. The action scenes with Batman were very entertaining because we got to see michael keaton prove that he can still be one of the best batman ever. The emotional scenes really carried this movie for me because they hit close to home as someone who's scared of losing his mom. The only real bad parts of the movie were the cgi and someof the jokes were cringy.

title: Mediocre
text: It had some funny moments. Michael Keaton was a gem. I was surprised at how much I liked the parts with Ben Affleck'a Bruce Wayne.Overall, the film lacked heart or reason, which is pivotal when trying to sell you on the Flashpoint storyline.I didn't buy the impatient, selfish, and jerky Barry Allen from Miller. We get it, he's a fast guy living in a slow world, but the opening act worked way too hard to get that point across. It's one thing to be hangry and late, it's another to make that the problem of your sandwich shop guy.Frequently, it seemed as if Ezra Miller forgot how to act or speak like a human being. Very strange and stilted and difficult to connect with.The plotting was choppy and the script felt unnatural at times.The CGI was terribly inconsistent regarding quality.There were some great ideas here, just very poor execution.

title: Not gonna, Keaton was the ONLY reason I went to watch this film.
text: I really wanted to enjoy this film to the max. I have been a DC fan since the 1980's when as a kid I first saw Christopher Reeves as Superman. Later came Tim Burton's Batman, complete with Michael Keaton in the starring role and I've been hooked ever since. Fast forward to the cheesy '90's and the TV version of "The Flash" which I also loved.Then came this latest "The Flash" movie. Wow. Ezra Miller. Gosh I found him an annoying character to watch. It really was a chore for me. When the lead character irritates one so much, then there is a problem. The first hour or so I slogged through. Some of the slow mo scenes honestly reminded me of the original 1978 Superman when Clark is running next to the train...it was that bad, as back then they did not have modern technology to make things look good (DC needs to go and watch Marvels "X-Men Days of Future Past", a certain Quicksilver speed scene and see how it can be done properly!). For a movie about a speedster, there really were next to no actualy speed scenes, just terrible slow mo scenes!Finally, the big reveal that most of us were waiting for when a certain caped character returns - complete with original music score by the great Danny Elfman. I had chills, goosebumps, whatever you want to call it, nostalgia was there and I was loving it. No, this is not the next Batman movie, but it really could have been. Loved the easter eggs and cameos so look out for those too!

title: A Flash in the Pan: A Disappointing Adventure with Lackluster Storytelling and CGI
text: The most glaring flaw in "The Flash" was its poorly constructed story. The plotline felt disjointed and struggled to maintain a coherent flow, leaving critical character arcs unresolved and neglected. Key moments lacked emotional depth, failing to forge a connection between the audience and the characters. For a superhero movie, it lacked the gravitas and resonance that fans have come to expect from the genre.Regrettably, the misuse of CGI further compounded the movie's woes. Action sequences, which should have been the film's highlights, were marred by glaringly obvious visual effects, reminiscent of a low-budget production. The poorly rendered scenes detracted from the overall viewing experience, making it difficult to become fully immersed in the superhero world we once loved. Foundation.

title: Could have been so much more!
text: I can't help feeling that a potentially great movie has been lost along the way! If its true that a lot of content was removed as we're led to believe by the new regime at WB then fans have been denied a more rewarding experience. Michael Keaton is the best thing in it and was under used in my opinion and whilst the Supergirl character is enjoyable and well performed Henry Cavill would have added much to this movie but I feel politics at the top level denied us this. What we have is actually enjoyable and at times has real heart to it . Ezra Miller gives a solid performance but this could have been potentially been one of the great movies in this genre . Some nice cameos but one in particular is totally unnecessary but all in all a sense of frustration at what could and probably should have been !

title: It is very challenging to write anything about this controversial . . .
text: . . . picture, because if you mention Bat Man your comment will be jettisoned, silenced, muzzled, squelched, stymied, censored and totally suppressed. At least that's what happened to one of my reviewing colleagues in late July, 2023. He cannot figure out if he was banned for denigrating a percussionist, or for being too scientific by typing in the word "echolocation." Maybe that term is enough to short out the fragile, overly sensitive spellchecker used here. Because my acquaintance did not know that THE FLASH is considered as big a flop as HEAVEN'S GATE, ISHTAR, PLUTO NASH and HOWARD THE DUCK rolled into one, he did not even mention its status as one of Cinematic History's biggest flops.

title: FUN AND ENTERTAINING!
text: This movie is long but one of my favorites. It's funny and well worth theatre prices. Ezra Miller did a great job and we were entertained the entire time. We'd actually go see this one again. I don't get why DC hasn't figured it out yet, but all these actors are perfect for their roles, it's the writing that fails them. But this movie made so much sense. The way they pulled it all together, without giving a spoilers, trust me, you will find it fun to watch. Especially if you like and understand superheroes of today and the past.*Also, there is a post credit scene at the very end. (No mid credit)👏🏻👏🏻👏🏻👏🏻👏🏻👏🏻👏🏻

title: Flash 1st cinema movie.Overall entertaining; CGI standard require improvement!
text: The story is good, some scenes create a climax plot, Audience like it or not is a matter of personal taste and opinion.Ezra Miller has a solid performance. Even though his private life and negative news keep coming, it can be seen that he has put a lot of effort into this role. The performance is absolutely solid, and the continuation of the entire DC Justice League and the characteristics of the role of The Flash are being potrayed.Michael Keaton's Batman is fantastic. Not only just continuing the classic style, but the batsuit is also upgraded to match modern feeling. However,Keaton did look much older compare to his glorious day back in BATMAN(1989) and Batman Return(1992), and it is unknown whether he will appear in other movies as Batman in the future.Fans who like DC movies will definitely be able to satisfy their wishes , but the visual special effects standard are unstable, some scenes are well done, and some scenes are overdone, but it is still acceptable as a means of expression and to progress with the story, but I think there is room for improvement.As a sci-fi superhero movie, this movie is worth to watch. It is very entertaining and suitable for the whole family to watch. But it may not be suitable for people who don't like sci-fi movies. But in order to make the film not so dull, the movie also has a lot of humour to ease the heavy atmosphere.What is the future direction of the DC superhero movie? I believe DC will depend on the box office results and popularity of this movie before making a conclusion, but I think this movie has established a new direction for DC superhero movies, and has the opportunity to create their DC version of 'Avengers Endgame" style movies, but it all depends on the reaction of the audience and whether the producer is willing to go into this direction.This movie tries to attract audiences of different age groups, but fans of different age groups have different expectations, resulting in some inconsistent effects of the whole movie, but overall it is entertaining and interesting.In addition, the movie also rationalizes the concept of multiple universes, so it cannot be ruled out that in the future DC comic hero movies ,there can be characters from different eras , different time and space to re-appear in the same movie.As the first 'The Flash' solo movie, it is good overall. Some scenes are shocking enough to watch in theaters, but I believe it may not satisfy all fan's'requirements, because different fans have different expectations, and some hope that a certain character will appear more, some hope that the development of a certain story will advance, and some hope that a certain scene will be filmed in different way. I heard that the derivation of certain plots of this film this time is all due to the voices and expectations of fans. This made the film company want to make this film, so I believe that the future direction of the DC comic hero movie will depend on the reaction of this film,In addition, Supergirl (Superman's cousin) is very eye-catching, but the appearance time is relatively short, but she continue to have the momentum of Superman characteristics. In addition, there are easter eggs at the end of the film, so audience can pay attention.I watch the film in IMAX and it feel so good to watch on IMAX for several scenes.7 marks (10 marks full )

title: For the die hard fans
text:
The most anticipated movie of the year for me so my expectations were very high.The opening of the movie was fantastic. Good action scenes with the right amount of humor for me. But also our first glance at what looks like 'cheap' CGI. ( it gets a lot worse)
Good storyline, some unpredictable turns of events ( for me) keeping it interesting throughout the entire movie, leading to a climax that's a bit rushed.I would've loved to see a bit more from the main villain.Stealing the show of course was Keaton's Batman.But Sasha Calle's Supergirl was also amazing.Glad both had a lot of screen time.Batfleck also had a few great scenes but I don't think his costume was the kind of quality for the close up shots.Great cameos by a range of dc characters, if you're familiar with them!! I loved it but i heard a younger couple next to me wondering who the hell these people were!!Story: 8
Action: 9
CGI: 4
Acting: 8.

title: Not Grant Gustin but still highly watchable!
text: As with many of you, over the last decade we've come to know Grant Gustin as TVs Flash. For many people he IS the character. It's hard not to compare.That aside though and ignoring Ezras private life? He puts in a likeable performance. It's fun watching his interactions with his younger self. You can see how much Barry grows between when he got his powers to the present Barry.Michael Keaton feels like he's never been gone as Batman. It's a shame we never got a proper third movie with him.There are a lot of cameos and blink and you miss it moments for long term DC fans. All in all it's a solid movie and one of the better DC films of late.

title: Horrible Movie
text:
I went to this movie so hyped as an flash fan but ended up disappointed as to what I saw the only things done right in this film where Keatons Batman and Sasha Supergirl
The cgi was horrible at points and the running scenes except for one where horrible even the humour wasn't at all funny.Ezra is not the flash he doesn't feel like the flash nor I believe act like Barry Allen. I've seen better performances from the other flash actors like grant and John through there series.And the cameos for the film you bring back dead actors that isn't good and you show an flash who isn't the real flash like it looks to be John Wesley shipp. But actually has the design and looks of teddy sears WHO IS AN VILLAIN CALLED ZOOM.

title: The Flash And The OG Batman
text: First of all, I just wanna say that bringing back Michael Keaton as Batman was a GREAT choice! The OG Batman is the best! And bringing out George Clooney in the end was hilarious. I was laughing my ass off. And although the CGI wasn't great, I'm willing to let it slide. Seeing how it's the Flash' first movie on the big screen. To me, as long as they can embody the spirit of Barry Allen, it doesn't matter who plays him. And personally, I think Ezra Miller is not a bad choice. He's a talented actor who have performed well as Barry Allen. I'm guessing there will be a second the Flash movie? I hope it'll be better next time. I'll be looking forward to it.

title: One of the worst DC films..
text: Despite being a DC and Marvel fan from an early age; this film is beyond disappointing and it took me 4 attempts to finish it.The plot seemed a little far fetched but set in a different universe I guess this can be somewhat forgiven.The only redeeming factor was Sasha Calle as she brought some beauty to a predominantly male cast.Ezra Miller did not perform well. I'm not sure if it is his lack of talent of poor directing. Either way, very disappointing.I was really looking forward to watch a non animated version of The Flash but I cannot recommend anyone spending money on this film. Wait till it gets out on various free platforms so you can watch it in parts as you might need more than a 5 minutes toilet break from this film in order to get your "motivation" back.

title: Just ok, kinda got on my nerves
text: First of all, way too much language for a superhero movie and partial nudity. C'mon little kids watch these movies. Secondly, didn't like the feminist plug of having Superman replaced by a woman. That's totally a Disney move. Third, Michael Keaton??? He was the second worst Batman in the trilogy. Finally, the Barry from the past was hard to watch because he was so goofy. Altogether this movie was pretty much a bad stand alone movie. Not a big fan of having "kids" as the superheroes that act so immature and basically ruin what could be a good movie. This movie kinda reminds me of the first Spider-Man movies but Toby was an actor you could enjoy his youthfulness but not this guy who complained for the first 15 minutes of the movie.

title: This is how you do it.
text: DCEU finally delivers what it actually intended. It's the kind of movie you play as a trump card when you are in big league. Maybe DCEU wouldn't had to work on a check book that wouldn't balance if The Flash had come any sooner. I'm starting to feel about the places that the brand could go. Andres delivers what we expected. As a fan, very excited with where the company is advancing while Andres already being in talk for the James Gunn's DCU.Speaking about the movie, it was super fun, emotional and complete. Although I would prefer darker and gritty tone for a movie. These are the lot which attracts the crowd. This was the problem which the company couldn't address in the initial days. The Flash will inspire afar for rest of the coming years.

title: A promising film that loses focus.
text: The Flash begins as an intriguing, highly-creative and promising film. Unfortunately, the writers seem to lose focus in its second-half, following a plot line that isn't substantial enough to finish out the story being told. Which is truly a shame, as this story is a good one, and has the foundations of a touching tale. The actors all do a good job here, especially in emotional moments. Muschietti brings some truly unique ideas to the often repetitive superhero genre, at least for the first half. As soon as the movie decides to focus on a battle with Zod, it loses all intrigue.I found the movie to be a lot more enjoyable than expected. The CGI is an eyesore, and almost headache-inducing. I believe if that was easier to look at the film could have been bumped up a star. Alas, the movie suffers the most not from bad effects, but a bad third act, like many superhero movies. The issue with this third act is not merely a dull final battle scene, which it certainly has, but rather the deviation of focus from the otherwise touching core plot line.For me, The Flash is a 6.4/10; enjoyable, despite some major flaws.

title: Entertainer for sure.
text: Okay, I don't understand why DC reveals so much in their trailers. As always they have shown too much of the good scenes in like what, four pre-release trailers?I think this phenomenon started with Batman Vs Sups. If any DC executive is reading this, kindly stick to a single trailer and never reveal your punch moments and characters. Let the fans enjoy it firsthand in theaters and then spread the word.Secondly, most of us know the story about what happens in Flashpoint Paradox. So nothing surprising there. They have stuck to it well. Some MCU fans may even accuse that they did some things first. Well they're wrong. Because DC did it first in Comics.Finally I don't understand the obsession with colors. Almost all DC movies end with a color splash one way or the other. Too much red, green and blue. It's matching the JL costumes, I get it but they're overdoing it in my opinion.So coming back to the review,We know the base story, we saw some good scenes and moments beforehand in the trailers, there are some questionable VFX scenes where I did not understand if it was supposed to be realistic or they wanted it to resemble a digital artwork.YET...What we have is a decent entertainer. The cameos were good and surprising at times. They pay homage to many old franchises.There are multiple moments where you will applaud naturally if you are a DC fan. Not just the new teenage fans but even ones from the 80s and beyond.The action sequences were good. The acting was generally good from all actors. I felt Iris was perhaps the only one that didn't gel well with the rest. The one from the Flash TV series felt more genuine than this one.The best part about the movie was that, it was a fun flick. There are some comic one liners which will crack you up. It wasn't too dark at any point, which is exactly what I expected out of a Flash movie.I wouldn't say it if it was a Batman movie. We know DCU is much "serious" than MCU. So much that the main villain's catchphrase was "Why so...?" 😁Even as a fun-flick the Flash movie is a treat for... no not just Flash fans, but the Bat fans and the JL fans in general.So you can happily grab a pop corn and go watch it ...

title: Ezra miller back to jail
text: Batman is not supposed to kill but in chase scene at beginning of movie he has his motorcycle pop out machine guns and fire away. I mean wouldn't the whole point be to kill bad guys? Also the poor trucker that wrecks and his tanker explodes Batman just passes him on by guess he is toast. Barry Allen works in a laboratory but he has high school bullies and a Crush! When he saves those babies why do all of them look plastic? Ben Affleck looks weird and like they were trying to AI him. I never like Ezra Millers version of the flash to whiny, to weird, to Peter Parker. And his inappropriate mommy love was weird.

title: This is how superhero movies should be made
text: I bought the tickets for this movie with some misgivings - previous DC movies were a mixed bags, always falling short of being a good story.Well, The Flash delivers on all fronts: I've never been so entertained in years, and all the people in my group felt the same.The plot is a bit complex but can be followed without taking notes; CGI is cheesy in the Multiverse Arena (but it's meant to be) and top notch everywhere else.Ezra Miller surprised me with good acting, especially in his interactions with his younger, goofy self and with his mother.The various multiverse versions of Batman were quite interesting (MCU, take note: *this* is how multiverses are dealt with, instead of the mediocre Dr. Strange and the downright unwatchable Ant Man 3)Humour and jokes never fall flat, from the initial scene with the falling babies to the unexpected (but, on hindsight, quite predictable) effect that phasing has on beer bottles.I highly recommend this movie, and indeed I'm of a mind of watching it in the theatres again (something that I've not done in years). I was disappointed by the downward spiral of the last five or six MCU movies and thought that the age of superheroes was coming to an end, but it seems that DC has finally picked up the torch.

title: Bad CGI ruined it
text: Flash is one of my favorite superheroes as his story line is one of the most complex stories to follow due to multiple timelines so i am very disappointed at how warner brothers runied the movie by bad CGI. The movie's story itself is very good and it could have been a 10 out of 10 but the only thing that ruined the overall movie experience was the very very bad CGI. If warner brothers hired a good CGI team then this movie could have overtaken any recent marvel movie.
