title: Just when you thought DC couldn't get worse
text: The flashpoint story is difficult to pull off for so many reasons, yet they tried again. Lets start with the highlights of this movie. Michael Keaton and Sasha Calle. Both pull their sections of the film out from the snore fest that is the rest of this film. Keaton is clearly running on autopilot through out. He doesnt have to dig deep to pull this off.Sasha Calle does great with the material she's given and adding a sincerity to the emotions of her character at each moment, that the other cast members either arent required to do or dont know how to with that character.Ezra miller's fanboy Flash has always been irritating an a stupid interpretation of this character. He takes this to the max with the alternate universe Barry Allen. As such every scene he's in grates on your ears.The cameo's at the end of the story are supposed to bring a sense of nostalgia to the older viewer. When all they do is annoy them further.DC needs to remember their soource content is not PG-13 or 15 rating, its been R rated for the most part with the odd touch of PG-13. Try and make something to fit the PG-13 market and you end up with a travesty. MCU source material is PG-13 with the dose of R sprinkled here and there. As such they can hide those parts more easily, hence make a more widely appealing product.

title: Best DC movie ever made
text: I have been disappointed by many DC movies that were released in the recent years, however, this movie is more than amazing! It's funny, it's action, it dramatic, it's nostologic, it's all I wanted to see in a DC movie. I was impressed by the effects and the music and most importantly by the story. I give it 10 stars and I am happy to say that this is the best movie I have seen this year so far. No pushing of any agendas, just a pure DC movie. I would see go watch it on IMAX theater if you can so thay you can enjoy every aspects of this movie. I hope that DC will take this approach with all of their coming movies.

title: It's a kids movie
text: "I'm getting too old for this bleep", for whom get this reference ;)It is mainly aimed at the kids these days (i.e. Badly executed humor and not that impressive, clownish, main acting and energy). But as the old dude here: I simply loved the cameo's: real actors with a heart and soul for this, bringing some charisma to it all :)I hope the youngters of today appreciate how DC is trying to create a tailor made super hero world for them since all these heroes are simply from my generation.I prefer it if 'they' would write new superheroes for the new generation and keep the old for us, the not-so-youngsters that grew up with them <3.

title: Came for Keaton
text: Disappointed by the movie.The main reason I watched it, was because of the Keaton Batman. He did his part well. His introduction reminded me of that old hermit/monk that has his peaceful retirement interrupted. Best part of the movie.Why did they use the 31 year old Ezra Miller to play both current and younger(18 year old) Barry Allen? Did they really think we would believe he was a 'younger' version of himself? He honestly came off very annoying.The second reason I watched it was to see Kara Zor-el aka Supergirl. However, the movie makes her look like a weaker Kryptonian. She also got very little screen time. Clearly the writers of this movie has little respect for the DC Universe and this was just a checkbox for their resumes.

title: Fun but can miss the mark at times
text: The movie had some great moments and tugs on the heart strings a bit with the main story line. There was some good humour, though the double Barry did get too much at times.Growing up with Michael Keatons Batman, I was super excited to see him a part of the movie. I thought they did a good job explaining the multiverse and how MK Batman made it into things. They missed a good opportunity for Supergirl - she was great but so very underutilized, it was more a token kryptonian appearance than anything else. It's even more frustrating when considering that HC apparently isn't in the rebooted universe. And on that note, while the end was cheek I know, it was way too much and considering that they are rebooting, they lost an opportunity for a recast to instead go with a piss take. Same goes for glimpses into the multiverse - it missed and tried too hard.Overall, enjoyable but a little frustrating because it nearly was a great movie.

title: 'The Flash' Offers Fun but Falls Short on Character and VFX
text: I recently watched The Flash movie, and my perspective on it is a mix of enjoyment and some disappointments. Firstly, the movie was undeniably fun, delivering an exciting superhero experience. However, there were certain aspects that didn't quite align with my preferences.One notable aspect was the portrayal of the young Barry Allen character, which at times came off as somewhat annoying. While character growth can be compelling, it felt a bit forced.The movie delved into the multiverse concept, creating a complex narrative. While this had potential, it occasionally felt chaotic and challenging to follow, which impacted my engagement.Barry's emotional journey was a central theme, but it didn't resonate with me as deeply as I had hoped. His emotions seemed somewhat forced and didn't evoke the intended connection.The plot's central premise involved changes to the iconic Batman and Superman characters, explained through time travel. This added an intriguing layer to the story, although it could have been explored more deeply.One significant drawback, from my perspective, was the subpar quality of the movie's visual effects. Exceptional VFX are essential for a superhero film, and the lackluster quality here was a notable distraction.In summary, The Flash movie provided entertainment but had its share of drawbacks. The portrayal of Barry Allen, the complex multiverse concept, and the emotional depth of the characters fell short of expectations. Additionally, the disappointing VFX quality was a substantial issue. Nonetheless, for fans of the DC Universe seeking a unique take on familiar heroes, it's still worth a watch.

title: I need all dc fans to watch this one, and yes plz protect yourself from spoilers cause you are going to see a lot of surprises
text:
Plz dc fans we need to make a amount near to billion for this effort of dc, use your fastness to book for this one.I could've given it a 10 but i gave 9 because of the terrible vfx at some points which can be ignored but still it deserves some negative for it
The character of flash was the highlight of this movie for me and it absolutely doesn't mean that other character are not good
We got a action packed cool Batman and a new full with raged supergirl.The story is well written and the picture is powerfull with action and feelings
I liked the chemistry between both the flashes
And the scene when the flash got powers was very powerful.

title: Shockingly impactful
text: Given The Flash's tumultuous production, with countless delays, reshoots, and re-writes, it's a true miracle that it works as well as it does. It's fast-paced, engaging, funny, and emotionally resonant.Not every element of the complicated time-bendy story makes 100% sense, and the visual effects are sometimes undeniably impressive and sometimes an unfinished mess. But this film forsakes quite a bit of the tired superhero formula, and I love it for that.The primary conflict of the story is one of priorities, morality, and purpose. I became invested in Barry's journey of self-reflection-literally. He learns a lot about himself by interacting with his past self.Rather than a traditionally bombastic, city-destroying climax, The Flash has a small, low-key, introspective climax that hit me like a shot to the heart.To top it all off, Michael Keaton is better than he ever was as Batman. He's jaded and brutal and he actually has an arc in the script.It's definitely not a masterpiece that's gonna save DC. But I really loved it in spite of its faults, because it felt like a large breath of fresh air, overcoming the trappings of its tired genre.

title: This movie has it all. Bring tissues
text: Without including spoilers, just be ready to cry.This movie was a fantastic blend of modern and classic DC films. It really hit the mark for me as a lifelong fan in every area. It is funny, thrilling, sad and everything in between.Ezra was fantastic in this movie and I would love to see him perform as Barry Allen again in the future.It is a long movie, but for me .. it kept my interest throughout. Never a dull moment.This for me is the best of the DCEU. This is what DC movies needed all along to keep pace with Marvel. Too bad it took over a decade to get there. Hopefully, WB will not shelve this current run and let it continue.

title: The only reason why I like this movie is because Sasha Calle
text: I do want to start off by saying I am not a DC fan. I grew up with Christopher Reeves, a Superman and the Justice League cartoon. Sasha played the best Supergirl I have ever seen. I've always thought the girl next door supergirl was baloney. I hope they bring back. Sasha and give her her own movie. It doesn't matter if it's in a different multiverse. And if they do, I hope they don't give her love interest just to make her relevant. This actress has depth and I'm hoping that they use her talents. The only other favorite parts of the movie that I loved is that they brought back to the old Batmans.

title: Fun, but really bad
text: I had a lot of fun with this movie when it came out in theaters, but it's definetly a terrible and inconsistent movie. Andy Muchietti did a good job with action sequences, but the disgusting CGI ruined almost everything! The characters are funny but a lot of them are completly useless! For exaple Supergirl, that has 10 minutes of screen time more or less and she hasn't iconic scenes to be remembered. I didn't appreciate Michael Keaton's Batman too! He doesn't have his typical charisma and he seems too bidimensional, and his motivation to come back in action is extremly weak.Ezra Miller is a better actor than I tought initially and his comedian scenes with youger hisself actually worked very well! Surprisingly he is one of the good elements of the movie, and this is so unexpected!Zod isn't a great villain, Michael Shannon is always an amazing actor but I think that he worked better in Man of Steel.Definetly not a good a movie, but you're going to have a lot of fun time if you'll watch it!

title: A whole lot of fun
text: This movie starts out with a big car chase, that is a little too on the nose for me and i feared this would be one big cringe-fest, thankfully, it wasn't. The main man himself goes back in time to save his Mother from death, but as time travel usually does, it goes horribly wrong and he finds himself in a worse position than when he started.There's plenty of humour, but it's not over-used (unlike Thor; Love and Thunder) and it's mixed in with a decent storyline that's not too contrived for superhero newbies either. There is a massive hole in the story when it comes down to who killed his Mother and why, so don't expect any awards for writing, but where this movie shines is in it's visual effects, which are literally stunning and must be seen on the big screen for full effect.Sure this isn't Oscar territory or anything groundbreaking plot wise, but it's a whole heap of fun and that's what superhero movies are meant to be, so if you want to see 1 superhero movie this year, make it the new Spiderman, but if you want to see 2, this is a must-see.

title: Not all it could be, but still good work.
text: Highly entertaining, a wild ride from beginning to end, all the cameos and jokes you can eat... but not a great movie. Andy Muschietti, who directed the "It" movies, did what he could to creatively move things along while also tethering the story to its emotional core, but ultimately "The Flash" is a very studio-driven movie. It's good, and I'll probably see it again, but right from the outset the tone is set for silly humor and pop culture references galore.However, this weakness in the film, like not taking itself seriously, could also be a strength. It does feel more grounded to see Barry Allen struggle so much, despite having maybe the most impressive array of powers on the Justice League (outside of any Kryptonian, of course). He is a sympathetic hero, for sure, and Ezra Miller does the heavy lifting needed to have us believe it.Although I know the trailers have revealed much of the plot and some of the characters, I don't want to mess it up for the reader going in unaware. So be prepared for a lot of "no way!" moments, and kind of a deluge of nostalgia, especially if you've been around for a few decades. A lot of stuff is paid off along the way, but particularly at the end.Yes, Michael Keaton is in it, and yes, he is everything you'd hope he would be. Ben Affleck is probably at his peak Batman/Bruce Wayne in this film, Sophie Calle shines as Kara, and Miller plays a second role in the movie that allows for a hell of a lot of introspection within Barry Allen regarding what he should do versus what he can do.The best scenes were the ones with Allen and his parents, and Ron Livingston and Maribel Verdú played them perfectly. This is where I feel the movie excelled: the death of his mother matters because we see her and him having that completely relatable mother-son relationship. In fact, it is such a healthy and natural love that would be so traumatic to lose, maybe if you were in Barry's position, you also would not think about the destruction you could bring about to the world if you had the power to time travel and bring your momma back.So yes, The Flash does things I've always wanted to see in a major motion picture with the Scarlet Speedster as the headliner, and for sure it was fast-paced and funny and trippy and incredibly touching in certain parts, but it could have been better. Considering how long it took to make it and all that was going on outside the set, though, I am grateful we got something positive out of it.Now if I could only get my hands on that Flash ring. And the Flash suit. And the Speed Force.

title: Greatly effects and story
text: I highly recommend this movie due to timing warping side effects and close to the original storyline. I love how they mix in the old Batman movie for the 90s fans and showing the next generation of kids to appreciate older films. I like how they mixed diversity families in the bunch and putting comedy humor in the story. It was really cool showing some older Batman and Superman time zone characters that was from different movie era. I can say I don't agree how they made flash relationship kind of passive and didn't like some blended liberals crowds. Don't like how lately Wonder Woman character seem to come off as a cocky female.

title: Good Story wasted with CGI
text: I liked the movie. The movie explores the concept of the multiverse, which allows for different versions of characters and parallel realities to coexist. The movie deals with Barry Allen travels back in time to prevent his mother's murder and inadvertently creates an alternate timeline. Batman character was so good. It has several differences from flashpoint. Ezra miller acting was convincing compared to previous DC movies. Flash running and CGI was not so good compared to The Flash TV series. The Climax CGI was the main villain in this movie. The CGI doesn't seem good. Maybe they try to complete the movie in a limited budget. But outcome was disappointment. Especially CGI at the speed force was poor.

title: So bad, it angered me.
text: I saw this movie and from the scene with the babies which was horrendously done with terrible SFX I was out. The rest of the movie was an absolute cringe fest. Everything about it. From the character himself to the cheese fest with Keaton. If ever an actor didn't want to be there it was him. Then came the Cameos, the PlayStation 2 SFX all done for Jo reason but to put bums on seats. I'm sure some sick came up in my mouth when they used the deceased Christopher Reeve so try and make a few cheap bucks. The ending as awful, I felt cheated and wanted my money back even though I watched it for free.

title: Some might say I'm a hater...I'm not
text: Overall a fiasco. The only reason you might wanna watch is because of the actors listed and characters aproached in this storyline. I had low expectations, but man...this got them 6ft deeper.The reason/spark/motive of how this all starts is well known from comics, the tv show and even the trailer/ads for this movie. No matter how low your expectations are they managed to make even this feel cheap and unnatural.The plot is lacking with not substance to the story and feels like a suitcase that holds clothes for two people and was closed using an elephant. To be more precise it's rushed with too much time spent on useless scenes and too less on the actual content/acting. Also full of small plotholes here and there on many scenes(it shows that it wasn't thought through from start to end, just pieced together).I don't know who got the idea of that "acting/persona" for the younger version, but I've seen people with real life medical problems that look more normal than that "character" played by ezra. If he tried to play a disabled person(brain mostly) he got it right. Those screams are so annoying and without a reason/purpose. Overall the acting was sub-par at best and I feel bad for the good/decent actors that got dragged in this movie.Soundtrack was so-so. In some scenes makes you feel like you watch some 2001 comedy(but it's a serious scene) and sometimes is just there. Nothing spectacular, but also not necessary bad. The 2001 comedy refference is mostly because they try to make it a funny movie with jokes at every corner, but most of them are delivered bad/wrong or shouldn't be there.In conclusion, for anyone that wants to watch "the flash" should go watch the tv show(as much as they want from it). It won't have those great names(like in the movie) and it isn't the best tv show or anything, but it's infinitely better with more action, plot, history, twists, crossover, comedy and acting than this movie.

title: Pretty good
text: It's got flaws, as every movie does. The MC, played by Ezra Miller is annoying. Some points don't make sense, but...As an overall movie, it is very enjoyable. I respect it. The Flash's main villain ends up being a Flash Villain, not a Superman one, so that alone makes me have a soft spot for the film. The end comes back to the beginning and both are personal for the main character, which plot wise is nice.If they had replaced Ezra Miller, had a Henry Cavill cameo as Superman, and not included George Clooney and Nick Cage (They don't make sense), this would've been pretty awesome. Plus cut some of the CGI to be more tasteful. Thirty minutes could have been cut, easy.Also I didn't think I would like Batman and Supergirl as much as I did in this. The versions they used worked. Miller was not annoying when around them.

title: Decent Movie
text:
Rating: 6.5
Overall, a decent superhero movie as the more micro elements of the movie coupled with the playful tone made the film a fun watch and engaging overall (especially the dual role of Ezra Miller and Michael Keaton returning as Batman), but the overuse of CGI and the pretty predictable plot makes this movie a bit too late in the race to the Multiverse.Decent to Pretty Good Direction (Took a page out of the Deadpool/Spider-man playbook to tell a pretty meta story about a young superhero trying to find his purpose and get past his past traumas; does a decent job in the macro elements, but a better job in the more micro ones; gets a decent amount out of his actors), Decent to Pretty Good Acting (Pretty Good to Good from Ezra Miller (Holds their own very nicely and plays the double role very well; really embodies Barry's role well and does a pretty good job in the more emotional parts of the movie), Decent from Sasha Calle (Her character was kinda written very bland and one-dimensional, so her performance can only go so far), Decent to Pretty Good from Michael Shannon (Not really given that much screen-time to work with, more just plays from experience when he needs to), Decent to Pretty Good from Ron Livingston, Decent to Pretty Good from Maribel Verdú (Played the mother role well and worked off of Ezra well), Decent from Kiersey Clemons, Good from Michael Keaton (Really shows his experience in playing Batman as he has a real genuine joy in portraying the character again and really puts in the experience he has gain from his whole character to play an older version of the character), Decent from the rest of the cast), Decent Story (Structure was pretty solid and laid out well, the main issue is that its very similar to other time-travel/multi-verse movies and is very similar in plot to Spider-Man: No Way Home), Decent Screenplay (Dialogue was decent throughout (some lines were better written then others), humor was pretty good throughout the movie (even though it got a bit meta a times (not a terrible thing though cause its the character)), symbolism is pretty minor throughout; foreshadowing was a pretty good as it helped tie things together in the end (though it could be argued that it follows the template of other time-travel/multi-verse movies)), Decent to Pretty Good Score (Worked in well throughout the movie), Pretty Good Cinematography, Good Sound, Pretty Bad Editing (Fine for the most part but is just bad and noticeable when coupled with the CGI), Bad Visual Effects (The more minor use of CGI was fine, but just felt over-saturated in the more grand elements; the Deep-fake/CGI of people was really in the uncanny valley as it was so obvious that the people were not real), Pretty Good Production Design (Big fan of the Bat-cave and the Batman sets), Pretty Good Costumes (Really big fan of how they paid homage to the old Batman), Plot Structure was pretty standard as it followed a template that other time-travel/multiverse movies uses (with it being clear which part of the story arc the audience is in); the exposition was a bit long, Pacing was a decent throughout the movie (the exposition was a bit longer/slower than I would have liked, but the movie hits its right pace towards the middle of the movie); the runtime for the movie was fine (maybe the exposition could have been 10 minutes shorter), Climax was decent and shows the true revelation of what the movie is trying to show (which is nice as it uses the final fight as build to this rather than it being the climax itself), Tone was very meta and playful (which I did like even though I am not so much of a fan of this style); felt like a mix of Deadpool and Spider-Man, I saw an early screening of this movie (so it was not the final cut)

title: Almost a great movie with horrible CGI
text: I am a 90s kid who grew up on Keaton's Batman. I went through Kilmer, Clooney, was quite surprised by Bale and later Affleck but was thrilled when the announcement of Keaton's return to the role came out. I have always felt that Burton/ Keaton's Batman needed one more outing and with the Flash that was finally possible.The final product was a mixed bag. The movie loosely adopted Flashpoint, which is a phenomenal story arc in the comics. The Flash is actually needed to be seen a few times to let everything sink in. It is definately a nostalgia trip and there it succeeds. To see Keaton's dusty cave and the iconic batmobile is priceless. The score is also great especially in the segments it emulates Danny Elfman's original themes. I do not understand the general hate of the movie, regardless Miller's private escapades he plays a pretty decent Barry Allen and the dynamic between a more mature Barry and his younger obnoxious self is quite entertaining.The problem is that it starts as a Flash movie, but then it gets completely stolen by Batman, so perhaps it would have been better to name the movie Flashpoint instead of Flash.It is emotional, fast paced, funny, nostalgic - all the characteristics of a good movie. For me a potentially great movie with nice score and great acting was ruined by at times horrible CGI. At places the CGI is great but then there are scenes where The Matrix has had better CGI and it came out in 1999.Out of the DCEU this is by far the best movie if not the only one worth watching. Keaton as Batman and Barry's relationship with his mother is so relatable and emotional. Even though I dislike Batman's ending and the original ones would have been better, it kind of fits the entire story.Excluding Clooney and horrible CGI this could have been a fantastic movie, but to me it is a guilty pleasure.8/10 nontheless.

title: There's a fantastic Flash film buried in here
text: You can see the hints of an incredible character-driven film centered on Barry Allen underneath all of the fluff and cameos. Not to say I didn't like some of them, Keaton for one is excellent, but it feels like this was a corporately-designed film to maximize nostalgia and callbacks. There's certainly enough to enjoy here, but I'm left feeling like this could've been a classic.At the heart of this film is a moving, even profound character arc that Ezra Miller does a great job showcasing. The moments of the movie focusing on this are by far the best. The Batman '89 nostalgia is great (that Elfman score really does something to me), however it's mostly window dressing. The same goes for Zod's return and Supergirl's debut. They don't add much to the film and aren't really even given much focus.The humor really does land for the most part, though there are some tonal inconsistencies. Some bizarre editing also adds to a disjointed, chopped up feel at times. Affleck is terrific in his brief role and makes me even sadder we never got a solo Batfleck film. The action scenes are shot with a unique perspective and I enjoyed essentially all of them. Keaton's fight scenes in particular are awesome to watch.Onto the CGI and the cameos.... I really don't think we needed any of this and especially not in the visual effects state we received it. The CGI as a whole is often pretty horrid with the baby scene an odd standout.The Flash isn't the absolute disaster it could have been given all the behind the scenes drama this film endured, but it doesn't quite live up to its brilliant Flashpoint inspiration.

title: Cute, funny, light popcorn movie.
text:
I want to start my mini-review with the fact that yesterday I suddenly wanted to go to the cinema with my father and my choice fell on a new film from DC called "The Flash".Briefly about dubbing:
Dubbing from Flarrow Films fire! I was pleased to hear the same voices that I was used to. The sound is of high quality, the acting is also top.Now about the film:
"The Flash" is a cute, funny, light popcorn movie.Personally, I don't consider the film to be some kind of masterpiece of the 21st century, but if you think about it, it's not the worst film DC; I think they had worse films.Of the advantages, I note:
Great actors and their acting, a good soundtrack, good cinematography, a good plot.Of the minuses, I would note a couple of plot holes.As a result, "The Flash" is not a masterpiece comic book, but it was a tube, cute and interesting adventure for 140 minutes.During this time, my father and I laughed, and even yelled in our voices from jokes, but somewhere we even cried with him.I think someday I will review this film, and I hope that I will buy it in my collection on Blu-Ray Disc!I give the film a strong 7.5-8 out of 10 and advise you to watch!

title: A Speeding Disappointment: 'The Flash' (2023) Stumbles in Its Cinematic Sprint" Headline: "Ezra Miller and Michael Keaton's Charisma Cannot Outrun a Lackluster Scri
text: Ezra Miller and Michael Keaton's Charisma Cannot Outrun a Lackluster Script in 'The Flash' (2023)I'm disappointed to share such a lukewarm review to a film that held such high expectations - "The Flash" (2023). As an ardent fan of the source material, I walked into the theatre with an eager anticipation for the scarlet speedster's standalone outing. Despite the undeniable efforts of Ezra Miller and the electric presence of Michael Keaton, the film stumbles over its own shoelaces, failing to live up to its immense potential.Miller, reprising his role as Barry Allen, proves his mettle as a leading man, carrying his scenes with a good balance of humor and gravitas. Keaton, donning the cape as Batman yet again, is a welcome sight, delivering a performance that echoes his storied legacy in the franchise. The film does have its fanfare moments - a few cool cameos which will bring smiles to the faces of true DC fans.However, the film suffers an identity crisis. The Flash, unfortunately, ends up feeling like a sidekick in his own movie. The narrative, overly focused on Superman's Zod storyline and the world of Keaton's Batman, robs our titular hero of the spotlight he so deserves. The plot feels rushed, lacking a compelling villain, a substantial romance, or intricate backstories to lend depth to the characters.Regrettably, "The Flash" (2023) seems to be the latest casualty of the DC Extended Universe's ongoing struggle to find its footing. It's disheartening to see such beloved source material fall prey to the whims of filmmaker James Gunn and producer Peter Safran. For our group, this might be the last DC movie we invest in, as the 6 out of 10 rating can only commend the effort and the promise of what could have been.In the end, while the Flash may be the fastest man alive, it seems this film couldn't speed away from its inherent narrative shortcomings.

title: The CGI?!
text: The first question that came cross my mind is: Why the hell does the CGI in this movie has the same quality as a 90's PC video game?? Especially when it came to humans and characters, the animation was just dreadful beyond believe that this movie is classified as a DC superhero movie! With multi-million budget.The story is another time travel cliche aith the principal of the butterfly effect theory. And of course using the Metaverse flag again to wave in character from here and there as a way to make the movie attractive. To me the only good thing in the movie was Keaton's Bat man performance!

title: Sorry but I cannot give a better rating to a movie that starts with
text: Sorry but I cannot give a better rating to a movie that starts with The Flash's MAPE (Most Awkward Position Ever) before super-speeding and the horrible green screen technique used to render the Red Lightning's speed while running (those feet aren't made for sliding...) as well as the very poorly animated CGI stand-in for the babies falling from the building: so much so that I thought Barry's task was actually be to find the real baby amongst the army of falling life-like dolls...Otherwise, fun story, a few funny jokes, Michael Keaton's impressive deep "You wanna get nuts?" voice and a great Cousin Barry.

title: Actually not that bad
text: This rather surprised me honestly. Its not that bad, likely the best DCEU movie. OK thats not saying much but they are all pretty terrible, but really apart from some bad CGI and the whole Ezra Miller thing, its perfectly fine.Its no match for the earlier non DCEU Batmans, the WB DC animations or almost all the MCU movies, but its not offensive and isn't grimdark for the sake of it. Its certainly worth a watch if the Miller controversy doesn't bother you.The CGI is really cheap though, you can tell WB pulled back on the budget somewhat, expecting it to fail. Its hardly better better than the Flash TV show. The Batman bike chase looked awful.

title: Really enjoyed this
text: Such a good movie! Great pacing all the way through, character development was perfection. Yes there is a little too much reliance on CGI but it's a roller-coaster ride. Ezra Miller is just perfect in this role, as always. I've been a fan of the Flash tv series from the beginning and I think that helped me understand some of the concepts in this movie but I don't think it's a requirement to have seen it.Some of the cameos brought a tear to my eye and I found them to be very respectful of the franchise. Some are so subtle that I'm sure I missed them so keep your eyes peeled.Overall a fantastic movie, highly recommended.

title: PUT THIS MOVIE IN A MICROWAVE
text: This movie sucksssssssss. I don't know how much they paid Tom Cruise and Stephen King to say that this movie was amazing. I was so excited for this movie because the trailer looked amazing and it was getting amazing praise. It's bad in fact it's really bad and ill explain why you should never waste your money.The CGI is horrible, Ezra Miller is horrible and should I've never been casted as the Flash. The writing is horrible. They literally had the script on a silver platter for them if they just followed the actual "Flashpoint Paradox" storyline. I mean there is literally no villain in this movie. There is no point to this movie. Yes the "letting go" them was good but at least add some good spectacle and story too it. Such a trash movie and such a disappointment whoever is giving this good reviews doesn't know a thing. Only positives to this movie are Michael Keaton as Batman and Sasha Calle as Supergirl. But they are also useless. Glad I never have to see Ezra Miller as the Flash ever again.

title: A lot of issues, but still a fun watch
text: The Flash is a movie that had a lot of issues. We had CGI that was laughably bad, some acting performances that were a bit weak, some very questionable plot elements and a lot of unneeded filler. Did I enjoy it though? Yes.While it had its issues, I can't sit around saying it's a horrible movie. We have a pretty interesting plot with The Flash going back in time to save his mother, but unfortunately causing a large string of events. While the plot is a simple time travel plot, it had its charm to it and kept it entertaining.I'm not going to act like The Flash is groundbreaking, but if you are looking for a movie with some good action, a decent plot and a bit of humour, I'd recommend it. I think the most important element to any movie is to keep the viewer entertained, and to me, it did that. Just don't expect to see something monumental.

title: In the pantheon of awful superhero movies... this ranks highly.
text: I hated it. A carousel of cameos can't hid how bad this film is. I really love the superhero mvoe when done well. Honestly I haven't hated one this much since Batman & Robin. And if there had been Batnipples in The Flash, I'd probably have hated it more. Nothing made sense, Barry Allen was annoyingly written and Ezra Miller was even more annoying to watch in the part. Michael Keaton was 90% there to reference lines from his first Batman film. It made no sense if you thought about for even a second. Just another in a long line of DC films wich have been spectacularly disappointing. You'd think I'd have learned by now that when it comes to the movies DC stands for Disappointing Content.On the other hand, my son is 12 and he enjoyed it.

title: A Flash to forget
text: I was able to see this Flash movie, the truth is that it leaves a lot to be desired.Starting from the actor who plays Barry Allen (Ezra Miller) I do not think he is the right one for it, the Flash played by Grant Gustin seems to me far superior, for starters he does not do that stupid pose before running.The movie is good, it incorporates good material from the comics, those who have read any of the Flash comics will realize what I'm saying, what fails is the Flash of Ezra Miller.I recommend the movie, it's a must see, I think Ezra Miller's Flash is a horror, I don't know what they saw in him that they decided to cast him in the role.

title: Wow, Surprisingly good and entertaining
text: I honestly wasn't expecting this much story, humor, and candor. The flash delivered all three. Of course I should have known it since Michael Keaton was onboard. Despite the lower end CGI, it wasn't distracting enough to keep me from enjoying the movie as a whole. A little more action would have been welcome but overall the movie had a decent balance between dialogue and action sequences.I haven't recommended a DC movie since the last Shazam movie, which was also great. Good job DC/WB. I enjoyed the blend of characters along with the dark theme coated by the humor. This was a good formula. -

title: the flash was little slow
text: The story was good (with lots of holes in it as a time traveling multiverse movie) the acting was good , the action scenes was great and the most important thing which add value to the movie is Keaton as a batman , all of his scenes was exceptional. ,But CGI was very sadly poorly executed its bad as if its a b-movie not a high professional production that meant to be , and me as a DC fan i was very disappointed and it was painful experience watching this CGI.and there was unnecessarily slow moments that absurd in the flash movie !!It also has fun thrilling action scenes and entertaining moments .And please get hans zimmer for the score next time it would be a great enhance for what i just watch.

title: High levels of enjoyment here!!
text: The Flash displays another scientific theory on time travel that I would love to hear Neil Degrass Tyson's take on, but for the most part, it was just a plot device that allows My Batman! Micheal Keaton to appear in the DC Extended Universe that consists of Batffleck.I thought Batffleck was terrific, just not in this movie. Everything about his Batman was lame in this flick.Is it possible that was done to show love for Micheal Keaton? He did not need it. Yes, I'm biased cause I was in the theater in 89 when this dude first said, "I'm Batman!" and as if Keaton needed to prove that was true, he does it here. That 89 movie is 34 years old, and there were things they could not do then, and the strange thing about This Flash movie was we got to see Keaton do things we never thought we would get to see him do as Batman. Like fighting, actually fighting, and those Batwing scenes...It's like a genie gave Micheal Jordon a wish to be 34 again for the 2023-2025 NBA season. Keaton has nothing to prove, but seeing him back in the game was dope.In all honesty, since the trailers dropped, Batman89 was the only thing I wanted to see, but The Flash was a good movie overall. I loved how they visually showed us how Flash uses his powers, even if the special effects could have been better. A lot of Fan service that made me feel like I was reading a comic book. I kept feeling it could have been better, but they were dealing with many stories that did come together nicely.And to be honest with you, I did not care for Ezra Miller. Nothing to do with his latest controversy; I just realized that in Justice League, his version of the Flash was taken in a small dose, but this is his movie, so I get the biggest serving of the Flash, and technically they doubled that serving, and that was a little too much. It took time for him to grow on me, too much time. Once again, I'm biased because he is not my Flash (that Flash is on TV).It's a lot to go through, but it's one of the best comic book-driven movies I've seen.

title: Nice but with poor CGI
text: Firstly, i don't know it is just my feeling, but DC here did copy Marvel big time.DC hero with humor, The Flash. Whereas in Marvel universe it's Spiderman.So last time Marvel brought back all those who played Spider man along with their respective villains. So DC bringing back its old batman.All above on side, it was a treat watching and seeing Micheal Keaton as Batman and last minute entry by George Clooney, but on this pretext alone the emotions at Spiderman were far more higher.Rest movie was fun but one bad and horrible CGI and in super hero world thats highly needed and was being missed in the movie from the start till the end, which made it off at number of scenes.Still worth one time watch.

title: Don't waste your money
text: I'm not sure what movie all of you who gave this movie more than 2 stars saw, but the one I saw was garbage. The CGI was cartoonish, and if this is the reset DC is trying to do, they're going in the wrong direction if they think that actor is good for Batman. The Flashpoint Paradox storyline is good but the execution they did for this movie was sophomoric. Why not use this to bring in a Batman Beyond character? And I'm sorry, that actor is not right for Barry Allen (it's a shame they couldn't use the CW Flash actor, he is much much better). I only gave it an extra half-star for Michael Keaton, which was the bright spot of this debacle.Oh, if you do decide to go see this disaster, there is a final, rather stupid, after-credit scene.

title: Spoiler Free
text: First of all, I have to congratulate Ezra Miller for the two outstanding performances, they've been one of my favorites, as a person, as an actor, as an activist, as a defender and I want them to keep doing what they do best and don't let themselves get lost on the way. ❤I was anticipating this movie on IMAX, I was actually dying to watch it, now I'm anticipating the Blu-Ray! I want it on my hands and I want to watch it as much times as I can, this movie is magical and very special to me.Also the CGI isn't as bad as people pray, it's actually meant to be like that, remember that everything gets distorted in terms of lights and textures when we're using lightspeed, you can simply think of Star Wars when they jump to lightspeed and go into hyperspace, the stars get all messed up.We're basically in the perspective of the Flash, what we're seeing is Barry's point of view.

title: Yet another typical comic book movie, but Miller shines in the lead
text: It's a shame that this was such a box office failure as its main attribute is its star, Ezra Miller, who really needed a hit to keep his career going. As good as he is here, he is just about the most toxic actor in Hollywood at the current moment due to various personal problems which I hope he is able to overcome. He's a very talented young man. The film is typical of all comic book movies, which all seem rather similar as time marches on, and this one in particular is a mess the longer it goes on. It's fun for a while, again primarily due to Miller or in this case two of him, along with some fun help from Michael Keaton returning to the role of Batman after many years away. The plot is primarily about turning back time so that the title character can change the fate of his mother. Beyond that, and there is a lot beyond that, I am not at all sure what the rest of it is about with appearances of various superheroes of the past. Someone told me that I needed to read the book, LOL, in order to understand the plot. For a film of this scale in the day and age, the special effects are shockingly second rate much of the time.

title: Intriguing yet ruined by bad nostalgia and a weak ending
text: As a 2023 release earlier in the year, and a film which has suffered quite a loss at the box office. This film does have certain good things about it.The story is relatively intriguing revolving around time travel and trying to change the past which inevitably alters the future. Even though that concept has been done in movies before, the execution and intrigue level is there. There are certain sad and silly moments sprinkled in.As a whole, Ezra Miller does an okay job as the Flash but we are reminded that another actor could have done a better job and a better portrayal at making the character feel sympathy. The younger Flash scenes with him interacting with himself were well done and were some of the highlights.We see a multiverse of past Batman's returning in this film, blatantly mimicking the outline of Spider-Man: No Way Home, yet some people don't seem to have a problem with it.Michael Keaton returning wasn't great, did not find him convincing or found the chemistry with him and Flash to be any good. Super girl was a solid addition as the actress gave a different yet very needed layer to the character.The film have its entertainment, a solid intriguing storyline but it falls off around the point Keaton appears (around the 1:30:00 mark). The following action sequences felt repetitive. Also a very anti climatic and nonsense type ending. They really could have went with a swerve type ending but ultimately went with the most predictable one.The "surprise" cameo at the very end was sort of funny but will ultimately be a waste as since this film flopped, we most likely won't get a sequel.

title: Hard to believe DC made this
text: As much as I don't like Ezra miller as The Flash, he redeems himself because of the storyline and the writing. Obviously I was awaiting this movie because of the two "nearly" best Batmans (nearly because my favorite Batman Christian Bale isn't there), but I shouldn't take the credit away from Flash too. Everyone has been given their respective amount of story and screentime and all have done their best, even the rumoured super spoiler was worth the wait. There are some specific scenes or I should say scenarios where it seems that the makers CHOSE to keep it a bit less realistic CGI (don't worry, it's not the Justice league moustache fiasco) but it's forgivable if you understand what they tried to do with it. You'll understand more once you see the movie.All in all a perfect combination of seriousness, humour and emotions likes of which we don't usually see in DC movies.I hope they have started on the right path now and don't end up deviating from it in case we are to witness another Justice League in the James Gunn DCEU.

title: DC Mostly Unrewarded...Typical 21st Century Super-Hero Romp...Nostalgic
text: Younger Fan-Boys-Girls Have Become so Jaded by the Expensive, Artistic Pop-Culture Cross-Over of Comics to Film,that Seemingly Nothing Will Remove the Veil of Hating Indifference,for this latest Release of the Never Ending Excursion of Comic-Books Legacy to the Motion Picture Medium.Maybe then the Spoiled Dismissal will Stop the Cynical Crying and Out-Lash of Outrage of Outrageous Hating.The Source Material is a "Comic-Book" Brought to Ever-Lasting Existence for American Youths to Escape the Reality of a World War with Something Fantastical.The Date was Jan. 1940 where the "Golden Age Flash" Leaped from the Pages of Blazing Color and Imaginative "Street-Language"...All From a Medium Less than 2 Years Old, and was from the Creators Sheldon Moldoff, Carmen Infantino, Robert Kanigher, Joe Kubert, and Others,It Leaped from the Pages and into the Hearts and Minds of the Dreamer's Search for Medicinal Relief from "The Depression" and Hitler's Conquering March...It Offered, Perhaps a Window with Which to..."Dream of a Better Land Where All the Brothers Walk Hand in Hand...If They Can Dream."Evolving into the "Silver-Age-Flash" in 1959 which Closely Resembled the "Barry Allan" in this 2023 Version.Where the "Dreaming" Continues and is Mostly "Pooh-Poohed" with Disdain.The Whole Universe of the Medium of "Comics" has Undergone Many Many Changes Over the Decades, as has the Movie Medium.What is Here is an Enormous Endeavor, Employing Thousands of Well-Meaning Folks that Deliver "State-of-the-Art Computer Effects"and Like All Creative Endeavors Reaches People in Different Ways of Appreciation, or Like in this Case, Non-Appreciation.It's a Story About "Time-Travel" and Incorporated in this Expansive Telling is a Time-Line of the Superheroes in the DC Universe.Different Versions of the Dream, that Have Come and Gone...And If that's Not a "Kick in the Head" with its Waves of Nostalgia Pulling at Memory Sticks of These "Stick in the Mud" Haters,Well What Does it Take? To Move these Moderns from Their Feelings of Meh to a Ride of Wonder.It's a Wide-Open "Feel-Good" Entertainment,What With Saving Falling Babies From Disaster, to Family Reunions to Vibrating Color and Electric Visual Images.That are Nothing if Not a Representation Replica of that 1st Issue of "The Flash" and its Desire to Deliver Nothing More than a "Swell" 10 cent Escape."The Flash" (2023) is at Least that, an Escapist Entertainment that is...Worth a Watch.

title: I love it !
text:
Watched this today and I really enjoyed every surprise they gave me through the entire movie.I can't really say about ezra as the flash is the best choice
But even so Andy as a director really made this movie based on the story itself is really really worth my entrance ticket fee.The story is totally not really that crazy complicated and the cameo in it is amazing.The music is also great, you can actually see there's a lot CGI in there but again for the sake of the story I couldn't careless about them.The story, the excitement, the music, the cameo, the speedforce, the pacing it's all what I hoped. Just still wishing they can get another person to play apart from Ezra.There won't be a sequel but it is a good send off anyway.

title: A triumph for DC
text: An engrossing film that lives up to the hype. Several emotional scenes. The CGI was not world class but imagine this didn't have the preposterous Marvel budget. DC needs a comeback badly and this didn't hurt that effort. Honestly I'm burnt out on superhero movies. What drew me here was everything that makes a regular movie great. I am a DC fan and will always root for them. I'm not an Ezra fan but he did a hell of a job. I would highly suggest ignoring the haters. This is a triumph for DC and needs ticket sales to drive further wins for the studio. Marvel has had their time in the sun. They've proven that multi millions can be pumped into a production as a formulaic success. DC has heart and for me that is a vital component in film.

title: The Flash took longer than expected to arrived...but...does it arrived in good conditions?
text: After many years of waiting, finally a flash movie has arrived, but it delivered?Well, the flash movie was called by many people the best superheroe movie of all time...and it's very far from being it, although I do think is the best Dc could have done in their position after Shazam and black Adam, thankfully the flash in on another level, being heartwarming and emotional and at the same time funny and entertaining, it is innovative and fresh with a great intro, it is one of those movies I could rewatch many times, with an amazing and convincing performance from Ezra Miller and a good use of Michael Keatons Batman and an amazing supergirl with great potential that will not arrive anywhere, now the bad stuff, the script felt very weak and convenient at times, a very wacky use of characters and an horrible cgi that felt like watching a play station 2 cinematic, with cameos that in some way are nostalgic and good ideas, this are bad executed and very horrible to watch, some of them being disrespectful and not convincing, at the end of the day it is a good experience to live with you family this weekend, and as a DC fan I have to say it didn't delivered as much as expected.To be honest this film felt like a superheroe movie from 2015-2017 and I kind of like it.Btw there is only one post-credit scene that tease just a little about the future of the DCU...a little disappointing if am being honest but I went out of the theater happy but not completely satisfied and excited with the ending of the DCEU.

title: Michael Keaton is Batman
text: Ok so for me the Grant Gustin will always be my live action Flash. So Ezra Miller took some getting used to. But by the end of the movie he had grown on me enough that I could appreciate his version of the Flash. I enjoyed the movie ultimately but I think that overall enjoyment was greatly subsidized by getting to see Michael Keaton as Batman again. Overall, I think it's a good movie that was let down a fair bit by the CGI used throughout. It's just a shame that when the subject matter of the movie is the Flash it's going to be very CGI dependant. Ultimately I can imagine that there some talented and passionate CGI artists out there who did their best despite having their wings clipped by management.

title: Not quite electrifying
text: While the flash is nowhere near the dumpster fire people were saying it was, it isn't anywhere near the masterpiece that names like Tom Cruise and James Gunn got paid to praise it as, seriously, I have no idea how someone could watch this and genuinely say it's the best comic book film of all time, it's not even in the DC top 10 lol, but it was a good way to finish out the universe.The main point of negativity for this, is the blatant lack of originality, Flash goes back in time and causes trouble, wow, I've never seen that before (flashpoint paradox) but the problem is, this movie thought all it needed to have was every single Batman and Superman to ever exist, filled to the brim with mediocre acting performances, and obviously the major controversy around Miller didn't help at all.And I'm not even gonna put this aside, this movie has some of the worst CGI I've ever seen in in my life, now I know some of you will read that and get mad, but you did the exact same thing with She-Hulk, so don't even try.B-

title: An ambitious film that delivered the intended goal
text: This movie promised to the whole world that it'll be "the best superhero movie of all time" and is that statement true? I'll say yes because I thought it was one of the best superhero movies of all time. The action, the pacing, the characters, the scenery, the intensity, the heart, the emotions, the thrill were all so exhilarating. The only real horrible part about the movie is the CGI. I know everyone dunks on the CGI and I thought they were overreacting. Until I saw it for myself and yeah, it looks bad. But everything else worked so well and I will see it again to tomorrow. I believe it's a rewatchable film that will win fans over time.

title: Amazing new era of superhero movies
text: Best DC film by far. Keaton steals the whole movie Calle is awesome and Supergirl and what can you say other than it was just too short. Loved it wish it hadn't ended.Love the way DC had put everyone in it from the long history of DC films and made a masterpiece of a film.This is one that all other superhero movies will be judged by.You know DC really needs to learn from this and especially James Gunn this is perfectly executed and brings everything a true fan could want.The film has you laughing and crying and on the edge of your seat.If I could give this move more than 10 stars it would have it.

title: Watched it only for Michael Keaton
text: This is the definition of a mixed bag film. Firstly ever since this was announced this has been my most eager film to see in many decades. I loved Michael Keaton as Batman and I loved the prospect he was coming back. In the end I am giving it a 5, for one main reason; Ezra Miller.'They' cannot act. 'They' have no charisma and is simply annoying. The first 20mins of the film I was wincing and grimacing in my seat hating it just hoping for Michael Keaton to arrive.Now what made matters so much worse was Ezra Miller goes back in time and meets his teenage self, who is somehow infinitively more annoying. Quite literally think of Jar Jar Binks and you have the sort of level this was played as. This Jar Jar Binks is in the whole movie. Now to add matters worse was knowing the real life criminality by Ezra Miller and all he has been involved in. It honestly made me feel like I was watching a Mindhunter episode seeing him. It was not appealing. The film should have been reshot with someone else playing the Flash. It wasn't like ''they' is a good actor.An hour in I honestly almost got up and left the cinema. Then Michael Keaton arrived and at first I thought, Warmers have blown it. This is not going to live up to my memory in anyway. However soon that was changed and Michael stole the film completely.What I will also say, on introduction to Supergirl. I was groaning at that too, as she was first seen as a tiny, skin and bones mess. I was thinking to myself, this is supposed to be Supergirl. Why do Warner's cast people like this to play Superhero's. However I need to apologise immensely for thinking that, because as soon as she put on the suit, her body language, charisma and demeanour changed and I was thinking "wow she is actually a very good Supergirl". This is what happens when someone can actually act. They can give people that shock of what they project.In the end I have serious mixed feelings - I loved, immensely, Michael Keaton and I loved Supergirl. But I hated the Flash. Now when the entire film is called the Flash I am stuck. Hence I am giving this a 5. It should have been called Supergirl though and just had Batman and Supergirl in it. If the film had of been Supergirl with Batman helping her I would have given this an 8. Watched it Only For Michael Keaton.

title: An Electrifying Adventure: The Flash Movie Review
text: The Flash, directed by Andres Muscheitti, races onto the big screen with lightning speed, offering an electrifying adventure that captures the essence of the Scarlet Speedster. As a fan of the beloved DC superhero, I couldn't help but feel a rush of excitement as the movie unfolded.Ezra Miller once again dons the red suit as Barry Allen, bringing a unique charm and quirkiness to the character. Miller's portrayal of the fastest man alive is endearing, showcasing Barry's determination, humor, and vulnerability. His chemistry with the supporting cast is evident, especially with Kiersey Clemons, who plays the fiercely intelligent and dynamic Iris West. Their on-screen connection adds depth to the story and injects a much-needed touch of romance.The plot weaves an intricate web of time-travel and alternate realities, paying homage to the iconic Flashpoint storyline. While the concept might be complex for casual viewers, the film manages to strike a balance, ensuring that even newcomers can follow along. The narrative unfolds at a brisk pace, keeping the audience engaged throughout, and the script skillfully navigates the complexities of time travel without becoming convoluted.The film's visual effects are simply stunning. The Flash's super-speed sequences are a spectacle to behold, with lightning bolts crackling around him as he moves through time and space. The action sequences are adrenaline-fueled and expertly choreographed, showcasing the Flash's unique abilities. The cinematography and CGI work together seamlessly, creating breathtaking visuals that immerse the audience in the fast-paced world of the Scarlet Speedster.The supporting cast delivers strong performances, enhancing the overall quality of the film. Michael Keaton's return as Batman is a nostalgic treat for fans, and his presence adds gravitas and emotional weight to the story. Sasha Calle shines as Supergirl, bringing warmth and determination to her role. The ensemble cast, including Billy Crudup as Henry Allen and Ben Affleck as Batman, deliver solid performances that elevate the film's emotional depth.One minor drawback of The Flash is that the movie occasionally feels crowded with characters and subplots. While these elements add richness to the narrative, some of them could have been further explored to avoid a sense of rushed storytelling. However, this is a minor quibble in an otherwise exhilarating film.In summary, The Flash is a thrilling and visually stunning superhero adventure that successfully captures the essence of the Scarlet Speedster. With Ezra Miller's engaging performance, a captivating plot, and awe-inspiring visual effects, this film offers a fantastic journey for both fans and newcomers alike. While it may stumble slightly with its crowded narrative, The Flash delivers on the promise of a high-energy, action-packed experience that will leave you craving more adventures with the Fastest Man Alive.

title: Starts well, but increasingly muddled with fake-looking CGI fights
text: The Flash starts with a hail of babies, and that initial sequence - funny and clever - winds up being the best thing in the movie, even though the action is interspersed with a lesser Batman action sequence.After that, the movie becomes a time travel/multiverse thing, and I've got to say, as someone who generally likes such things, I think the superhero-movie people may have gone to that well one too many times. There is a sense of Deja Vu in The Flash - I kept thinking, didn't I see this in another movie?To be fair, it's still entertaining, as Barry enters a trippy time-travel arena that takes him to the past to change history and meet his alt-history self, who is a bit of a dope. The interplay of the two Barry's is genuinely entertaining and funny, and there's a lot of fun with the speedy-guy stuff.Soon the Barrys are searching for their fellow superheroes. My least favorite Batman, Michael Keaton, takes another shot at the role and is fairly decent in the role. Then there's some big fights, some more time travel stuff, some revelations, a , a lot of ridiculousness, and it's over.As a comedy, The Flash is pretty good. As an action movie, the CGI-heavy fight scenes look like CGI-heavy fight scenes. Normally I don't complain much about special effects in action films, but this literally looks like stiff animations of the characters stiffly fighting. It's clear that no humans swung a fist during the making of The Flash, and it makes me miss the days of stunt people fighting.As a time travel film, The Flash gets increasingly muddled. As a drama, the plot is increasingly unsatisfying. It's also got one of the weakest post-credits tags I've ever seen - what on earth were they going for, anyway?The cast is good. Ezra Miller is excellent as Barry and I really like Sasha Kalle's unusually hostile verson of Supergirl. And Ben Affleck, while only in the film for five minutes, offers surprising resonance and depth.Overall, the end result is ... decent. It's not a must-see movie, but it's an enjoyable time killer.

title: Incredible movie .
text: What an amazing movie . Woww just incredible. I love flash more after this movie . And I don't think so people will notice CGI or VFX . Because people will enjoy this movie without noticing flaws. I want flash sequal for real . The best DC movie after WW , MOS , BvsS. And I watched this movie for 4 times and I will never bored of it . 🍿 And cameos are so gooooood to see . Like when I watch wonder woman in this movie I was like ohh my gooooddd 😌😌😌😌😌😌😌😌 that was sso satisfying to see our favourite superhero character on big screen after long time . And ben Affleck, Michael Keaton, was cherry on the cake 🍰, and supergirl acted so well in this movie . Just woww.

title: A solidly entertaining multiverse adventure, loses steam at the end and just falls short of being great.
text: The Flash is a solidly entertaining, funny, albeit messy multiverse superhero adventure. In its best moments, The Flash offers a glimpse of the DCEU with a fully established Justice League team, despite arriving too late to build meaningful momentum. For DC fans, it is a bittersweet farewell.Like his work on the two IT films, Andy Muschietti skillfully strikes a balance between character-driven drama and big blockbuster spectacle and crafts a light-toned adventure that's unafraid of its profound darker moments. He places Barry Allen's emotional journey front and center and tells an origin story without having to start from the very beginning.Screenwriter Christina Hodson populates the film with fan service moments that are unabashedly geeky and dare to be weird and obscure. The humor is well-timed and organic to the situations, not delivered rapidly to cover up sadness.The story's emotional core, centered on Barry Allen's desire to save his mother, is effectively touching and it emotionally justifies its multiverse storyline over other recent multiverse stories.Ezra Miller's performance is nuanced and multifaceted, showcasing a tremendous range between the comedic and dramatic moments. Michael Keaton owns the Batman role but is locked into repeating his signature lines like a house DJ. Sasha Calle brings a cool dark edge to her Supergirl but would have benefitted from more character development given a late entrance.Plagued by behind-the-scenes problems, The Flash's troubled production sure could have used its hero's time-traveling abilities. With multiple leadership changes and Ezra Miller's controversies, there is a perpetual corporate presence that hovers over the film, most evident in its final act. There's a pressure to set up where the story goes next but paradoxically, everyone knows this is the end. It concludes as an odd little shrug, as if to say, "We don't know. We'll see."Andy Muschietti's aesthetic design of the time-traveling special effects, intended to be plastic-looking, has gone over the audiences' heads, who are visually registering it as Playstation 2-level effects. The final climactic battle is set in a blank-looking desert that distracts from the main storyline of Barry saving his mother.Overall, The Flash is an entertaining film with heart but ultimately falls short of being a great comic book film.A firm plan makes all the difference.

title: Ended so soon
text: The movie is awesome and beyond words it ended very early like the runtime goes very fast you don't even feel it. Yes there are cameos and they are lot of them especially (even from the series as well). There's a post credit scene as well.First half of the movie goes build up and action and the second half goes action action action and boom there's the end.The acting is good the CGI,VFX is great in some scenes and delivers good in other. The costume is foolish type because I've been seeing the series and the custome in series and SNZL is much much better but in this it's not that special it just does the work.

title: a very wasted opportunity
text:
The Flash is one of DC's regular decent movies. One thing I don't understand is the fact that DC has been working on this film for over 10 years, because they want to know that they've been drinking coffee instead of working. The plot of the film is good, but the realization could be performed better, come on. The characters are ridiculed, first of all Keaton's Batman, one of the most iconic Batman reduced as a clown. There were two characters I liked: the Barry Allen of the present and the weird Barry Allen of the past: the only two that animated the film. Supergirl is embarrassing, especially her costume. The antagonist exploited for the film, General Zod, is also embarrassing, I never understood his intentions and what he wanted to achieve with his mission. Ezra Miller does a good test while Sasha Cally is really low level. The thing I liked most about the movie is the story of Barry and his family, that's the only intention I understood about the plot. The introduction of the multiverse is not well explained and seems in some respects a very bad copy of Marvel. The direction is good and even the emotions are present in some traits. The duration of the film is excessive and the ending is horrendous and inexplicable. One thing I think is wrong is that many people say that The Flash is at least not a decent movie, which is what it is for me. This is a movie that I want to watch in many ways, while for others I would really avoid. The Flash is a film wasted on what it could represent, a great superhero film..
Rating: 6.6/10.

title: The CGI and poor writing ruined a potentially good movie
text: I was so excited to watch the new Flash reboot since it has been my childhood favourite since the Flash 1990 TV Show.The CGI was so bad in this new movie, the story was so poorly writtern, the acting was C- grade that I could not watch past the babies falling from the tower scene which is about 10 minutes in and had to leave.His whole superhero Flash suit is CGI and moves so poorly it was painful to watch.Why do movie studios clasify this as a movie, when it is clearly an animated cartoon with few short moments of actors showing their faces!There is not a single screne that is real and the eyes can tell!Even the newer tv show from 2014 is lightyears better than this movie.This movie almost destroyed my childhood hero, almost since I walked out of the theather to preserve my prescious memories of a great superhero chareacher.

title: awesome!
text: I understand all of the negative points people are making but I seriously enjoyed this movie. Ben and Michael are amazing as Batman. Keaton really steals the show and Benjamin did a great job on the musical score. There are some awesome scenes with the flash too! I wish this movie had better CGI and I also wish Ezra wouldn't have gotten in so much trouble before this movie came out. It would have performed infinitely better et he box office if it weren't for those two glaring problems. Anyway, it is still a very enjoyable movie. I recommend it for hardcore Batman fans. I was born in 82 and grew up with the Keaton Batman so I was thrilled to see him again.

title: What film is it?
text: Is it a Baman Movie? Is it Wonder Woman? Is it Supergirl? Is it Superman? It's like watching Leonard and Sheldon from the Big Bang Theory messing around at being super heroes. It's a peculiar movie to say the least. I actually can't stand the fact that the Flash has ADHD or that the whole movie is set in a weird world were the other DC Comic super heros get more screen time. In fact it seems The Flash is pretty useless as a Super hero, his skills fall pretty short of doing anything. And shouldn't super girl have Blond hair? So to end, it's like a long episode of the Big Bang Theory inside Sheldon and Leonards dream...I would say avoid.

title: Just as too many cooks spoil the crock . . .
text: . . . too many Bat Mans are likely to baffle the belfry. The credits for THE FLASH claim that only four dudes don the black cape--geezers named Adam, Ben, Mike and George. Visually, this is equivalent to seeing a quartet of Ringo's sharing one umbrella. That's at least three Ringo's too many for most people. Astute viewers will glimpse even more anonymous Bat Men during THE FLASH. The idea that a caped crusader can be everyone everywhere all at once is not new. The highlight of TO KILL A MOCKINGBIRD, for instance, occurs when all the Civil Rights lawyers in Alabama gather at the scaffold, each yelling "I am A-t-t-i-l-u-s!" as Mr. Peck dangles in the breeze. But if all the Bat Men of THE FLASH began yelling at the same time, I suspect it would ruin their powers of echolocation.

title: Really good
text: This film was fun, nostalgic and deserves a sequel. It incorporated elements of the Snyderverse but also of Tim Burton's Batman.It was great to see Michael Keaton as Batman. Some really fond memories of those films and this didn't ruin them.Loved the opening scenes with Affleck's Batman. So underrated as Batman but awesome nonetheless.The story is touching and the effects are very cool with some great and fun cameo's.I'm not a reader of comic books but I do devour almost anything DC related. I've enjoyed all the films from recent years, flaws and all. Not having read the comics also means I don't come into it expecting it to fit into existing lore and can take the films as they are, going all the way back to Keaton, Christopher Reeve and even the Superman series of the fifties (George Reeves). It also means that seeing a brunette playing a completely different Supergirl is a curveball that opens so many possibilities. I'm looking forward to her standalone films.I really recommend this film. Sequel please and (long hope) more from Snyder and Affleck. Aquaman 2 next. 👍

title: Surprising
text: I honestly had rock bottom expectations for this movie because of fair criticisms I heard about the films narrative, but I was pleasantly surprised. The movie takes risks I don't always see superhero movies take and I appreciated how they executed it overall even if it may not feel satisfying. A lot of the movie could have been cut but it had pretty good pacing, especially since it moved away from the typical Synderverse film. Even though the graphics looked bad at times I felt it was forgivable in some scenes, I honestly don't see how they could have avoided making it look fake. Ezra Miller was both annoying and perfect depending the scene. Some callbacks felt forced and weird but I overall liked the different approach they took on the flashpoint timeline that felt more fitting for Hollywood and more towards something I felt the Snyderverse lacked. Don't get me wrong, it's still filled with plot holes like most in the series, along with cringe, confusing choices, and tonnes of other problems, but the more comedic tone and risks the other movies avoided by just trying to be dark made it more acceptable.

title: Worthy of the iconic character
text: Despite the controversy around Ezra, he puts in a fantastic performance along side Affleck final appearance as Batman. A real shame that Batfleck won't be back - still one of the most authentic versions of Batman we've seen.There are so many wonderful DC payoffs and throwbacks that this will please a lot of long time, hard core DC fans. Sasha Calle's performance as Supergirl was exceptional!Some great style head nods to Richard Donners Superman, and Andy Muschiettis vision and interpretation is great. The suit upgrade from justice league is perfect for the screen.Worth seeing and the perfect launch pad for the DCU!

title: Turned it off
text: Unfortunately, I turned this one off after about 20 minutes. So, take this review with a grain of salt I guess.I don't think I've ever seen a more annoying, less talented, and less charismatic lead in a movie, ever. It's failed attempts at joke delivery, talking too fast, showing no expression, everything.Unfortunately, that's all you see, at least in the beginning. Maybe the movie gets better and has an awesome story. Maybe it doesn't. Maybe you won't be as absolutely turned off by this performance as I was. Reading through the other reviews, it seems I'm not the only one who felt this way, but it was a mixed bag. YMMV.

title: Big hype, but it's a weak movie.
text: Overall, the movie is weak. The plot is interesting, but we have some major problems in this film.First of all, I can't buy Ezra Miller as The Flash. To me, he looks like a teenager in a costume going to the Comic-con. Poor acting.The CGI is terrible, you don't believe for a second what you're seeing is real. Batman's scenes are entirely digital, his movements are completely inhuman, it's like playing a videogame.When the two Barrys are together on screen, we can clearly see the CGI-face poorly put in someone else's body.One of the worst DC Movies ever made, a big disappointment, for sure.

title: Loved the mother and son relationship
text: I am not a fan of super hero movies. I've seen the first two Spider-Man with Tobey McGuire and the two Wonder Woman. That's about it and I only enjoyed parts of Wonder Woman. I did also enjoy XMen First Class and Days of Future Past.I did enjoy this one. I liked Ezra Miller's double performance, thought he was really good and very watchable, and the plot and of going back to change the past was well done. I didn't like the lengthy superhero sequences. The struggle to save the mother and father was the best part of the movie. The mother and son scene was the highlight of the movie.If you have a partner/friend like me who can't make it thru super hero movies without falling asleep or being bored to tears then try this one on them. I really liked it!!!

title: Messy fun.
text: "The Flash" is just a fun, popcorn superhero movie full of great performances. It's not perfect; it's a little messy, but nonetheless, it's very, very entertaining. Ezra Miller is excellent as the two Barrys, and the relationship with the mom brings a lot of emotional heft to the movie. It carries more weight because you know that things are not going to work out in that regard. A lot has been said about the effects, but I just rolled with it, and it really didn't bother me as much as I expected it to. It was awesome seeing Michael Keaton back as 'Batman,' and I got chills when he donned the suit, while Sasha Calle as Supergirl was thoroughly badass. The cameos were fun but thoroughly ridiculous at the same time. Yes, the third act is a little all over the place, but that's just a minor criticism. All in all, Andy Muschietti's "The Flash" is vibrant, full of color and energy, and yes, it's a little manic and messy, just like its titular character, but it's never not entertaining. It's more than a decent goodbye to the era that started with Snyder's "Man of Steel." Looking forward to what Gunn and the team have in store for us with a new, rejuvenated DCU.

title: Entertaining Goodbye to the DCEU
text: We just got out of the cinema and really enjoyed the film. It had everything a superhero movie needs and wasn't a copy of the typical marvel movie.Yeah it had Multiverse in it like marvel recently but DC had it much earlier and more often in the Comics.Ben Affleck had very entertaining scenes.And Michael Keaton - wow. We would have wished for something like this 30 years ago, very impressive.I found Sasha Calle very worth seeing, I actually would have liked to have seen her longer.I found the final resolution a bit disappointing as it made a lot of what came before unimportant.I don't think much of Ezra Miller and I also find his portrayal of Barry Allen inappropriate, but eventually I got into it.Very entertaining with great scenes and flaws here and there. 7.6.

title: You Have To Read This
text: I had doubts as to whether the flash 2023 was going to hold up to it's standards and 40 minutes in, that question was answered.Compared to the series post season 5,this made the series appear to be made by a drug filled grade 5 kid.I don't know why the studio or the producers wanted the flash to be Spanish when he clearly depicted as a white Caucasian in both the series and the comics and thats the reason for 1 point being removed since Warner bros is more concerned with appeasing than good ol film making and insisting on making a political point.The editing and CGI was out of this world,holy it was Soo good,that editor deserves a hugh pay rise,batman was good in both actors of george Clooney and Ben Affleck and the other guy who's older. Nicholas cage making cameo was a nice touch alongside Christopher reeves that suffered a catastrophic cervical spinal cord Injury.2 more points were removed for the fact of unnecessary casting thereby raising the budget,for example,it wasn't necessary to cast in a YouTuber and give him screentime that could have been done by anyone, literally anyone,probably casted in a cast member of the series like Cisco or even elastico and that would have resonated with both the series watchers and the movie watchers making it an enjoyable experience rather than cast in individuals with no talent except making sketches that are inherently childish.The actress playing Iris west wasnt good but since her screentime was less,it makes it forgettable about the whole ordeal.Overall this movie was really good and it shows that DC Is slowly catching up To Marvel that is now sleeping with rubbish phase 4 films&series save some that it's been churning out.It has some swear words so parents should be a tad bit careful.

title: Poor CGI
text: The movie was fun but the visual effects were very very VERY BAD! I was almost embarrassed and I had nothing to do with the movie. Felt rushed, felt very thrown together but Dr strange realist. Save ya money and wait for it to stream. The visual effects were just disappointing. I thought it was so bad that they did it on purpose. Other than that the flash character was great.
