Good story, good direction slightly bad VFX at times and nostalgia and Micheal Keaton and the new super girl steal the show at the same time dynamics between old flash and younger flash was very good. I am not a fan of Ezra just bcoz of how he behaves in public and all the wrong doings. But he is a good actor and flash delivers at every level but I wanted to see Henry Cavill for once atleast. No respect to him, everyone got their credits except Henry Cavill, come on he is the new gen Superman and you should have shown some respect and I gues this is why it failed.

title: Such a great Super hero movie!
text: It's funny, great time travel storyline, great cameos, lots of heart, I love the flash comics and this movie did amazing at telling the flash's story. Also Micheal Keaton as Batman was amazing. Super girl was great too. Don't understand the negativity about this movie. Sure some of the CG was a little iffy but all the movie references was awesome! "Eric Stoltz played Marty McFly" so awesome. I'm sad that I guess we won't get a sequel because Ezra miller knocked it out of the park! Also the director made bold choices. Legit so funny. It's one of the best superhero movies around. Don't knock it until you've seen it.

title: I dont want my money or time back. I want DCs dignity back
text: This had so much positive hype that I cannot believe how bad it was.There was an online statement allegedly by non other than James Gunn prior to its release stating it would be one of, if not the best superhero genres movies of recent times.If that was from James Gunn the he has sold out to Zenu and Scientology and his words I will no longer trust. So disappointed especially after his last movie from the MCU was so good.The Flash movie had potential but it seemed like it was a committee that was involved.A committee that was made up of representatives from other subcommittees that all had different ideas.Some of the different ideas were cohesive with others but most were not.The new costume for Flash was great.I even managed to get over my hatred of Ezra Miller to try and enjoy this over hyped piece of trash.I still don't like Ezra Miller for his off screen issues but he is not the problem with The Flash.The CGI is good at times but at certain points in the movie it's as though there were last minute rushed changes qnd the CGI looks almost cartoonish which in 2023 is not ok.The story is so bad in places I don't think it would entertain a child.The main thing I found in the movie that lacked imagination was when Flash time travelled and the time space continuum he was able to view the time stream from was laid out like a colluseum but a poorly done CGI time line colluseum. It lacked imagination. It lacked vision. It lacked even a morsel of creativity.It did not get me to emote with any feeling other than disbelief at how once again DC has failed.The time may have come for the DCU to end but maybe it had come too late. Too late to leave with a shred of dignity and integrity.The Flash could have been ans should have been a swan song for the ages but just like a lot of DCU offerings there was something akin to reading one of those 1980s "Choose Your Own Adventure" books. It's like the writers had a multiple choice option at the end of every chapter and had to hand it to a different team to choose the next chapter without that team knowing what the previous chapter was about.Disappointed.

title: A better Justice League movie than Justice League
text: The good: The tone, pacing and story beats strike a nice balance. There are genuinely funny scenes, moments of awe, and sadness. Despite Ezra's real-life troubles, here he comes across as a likeable, grounded and root-able character as The Flash. Whilst there are many side characters and each get their moment to shine - this is a movie about The Flash and to its credit the film never forgets that. Side note: Keaton's Batman has still got it - and The Flash respects the legacy of that batverse without trampling on it. Though I felt there was a missed opportunity to showcase some Batman Beyond/aged Batman struggles of the character. But I understand why they chose the path they did.The bad: The plot conveniences annoyed me. I.e., Circumstances or events occurring because the plot demands it, not because it's earned or logical. This is at its worst when it sacrifices character in the name of plot. Without spoilers, an example is contrasting what powers each Flash/Barry reaches in their relative timeframes (seconds vs years). Another mark against the film is the overuse of CG, especially bad CG. For reasons unbeknownst to me, EVERY scene the 2 Barry's are in, they use a CG model for the 2nd Barry, whether the CG version is the focus or not. It's bizarre - Hollywood has been using basic composition techniques to put the same actor in 1 frame for decades. It wasn't necessary and hurts each moment the 2 Barry's are interacting closely.Should you watch it: This is in the top tier of the DCEU. A shame we probably won't get to see these characters / actors anymore but glad the universe is going out on a high note. This is an entertaining comic-book popcorn movie that honours its comic predecessors and does a better job of establishing a Justice League than the Justice League movie. Recommended.

title: Spoiler free
text:
Have you ever loved a film that you were certain you'd hate?Well, I walked into 'The Flash' ready for yet another disappointing DC movie, that was going to be all flash and no bang (pun not actually intended but I'm keeping it).Firstly, I've never been a fan of Ezra Miller - who dons the spandex as The Flash, even before he started throwing chairs at women in Karaoke bars (in real life, not in the movie... that would be even weirder). Then imagine my delight when I heard the plot of this movie... The Flash travels back in time to save his Mum where he teams up with Batman, Supergirl and a younger version of himself - yay two Ezra Millers.I couldn't have been more wrong and even as I'm writing this, I'm still surprised with the amount of joy this film brought me, even before Batman appeared. I grew up with Michael Keaton as Batman and when he swooped back on to the big screen it was like he'd never left, as this feels like an extension of his previous movies, falling back into the character so effortlessly.The new girl on the block was Supergirl and despite having very little to say, was a welcome addition, bringing a stoic strength that female leads aren't often allowed. The film is peppered with cameos and they all seem to be done with purpose, rather than being thrown in because an actor had a spare 5 minutes to kill or was fulfilling a contractual obligation.There's plenty of heart here and it manages to evoke just the right amount of emotion without dwelling too long and I'll even admit to tearing up a bit towards the end.One thing that comic book movies (in fact most movies) often fail at is humour, yet somehow I had more laughs then I've had in a while. I think it might be because it feels more grounded in reality, so when something bizarre happens, it hits the mark.Now I can't guarantee you'll have as great an experience as me, but I really hope you do.By Nick
@WatchItWombat.

title: One of the best dceu movies
text: The wait for DC fans is over and the Flash movie has finally been released. I can say that The Flash was one of the best superhero movies I have ever seen. Flash totally entertained me and I really enjoyed it. Everything was good except cgi which could be much better. We saw a great and perfect Batman in this movie, but Ben Affleck's Batman costume didn't catch my attention and didn't meet my expectations. Cameos that preserved the past and legacy of Superman and Supergirl, Batman and the Flash and presented it in a way that was appropriate for viewers. I recommend that you watch the movie as soon as possible and enjoy watching it. A good ending for the dceu universe and a good beginning for the dcu with James Gun.

title: This is a bad movie
text: This movie was not good. Much like Transformers it has no heart and is just effects. At least I didn't go to the theater to see it. Why are DC Comic movies so bad? Aquaman is bad too but somehow entertaining. I guess Jason Mamoa is fun to watch? DC should stop making movies for a few decades and maybe a new generation can make better movies for them? Ok so I need more characters to submit this review, well, the film was bad. All special effects and no real story. Ok I still need 118 more characters so it was bad as in not good. It was an insult to human intelligence. This film made life difficult. I hope they do not make a sequel.

title: Ezra shines
text: So I went into this movie having read some of the reviews on here prior so my expectations were moderate. I was also away how much of a train wreck Ezra Millers life has been personally.Now putting that aside when I watch a movie I watch it for the experience and acting. What has happened "outside" the movie doesn't resonate with me.Put simply an absolute bravura performance from Ezra Miller. The amount of screen time he occupies in an almost 2.5 hour film where it is predominantly just himself as the actor on screen for almost the entire time - and to pull it off in compelling and endearing fashion is a gift.The movie absolutely surprised me to the upside. 9/10. Would watch again. And will.

title: MASSIVE fan of DC and Marvel
text: As I said above, I'm a massive fan of those two comics! This movie is great in my opinion. It's quite confusing to begin with but if we've watched all of the DC/Marvel movies OR read the comics, then we have a better grasp on how the timeline works. I love alternate universe movies. After I watch these movies, it warps my sense of reality for a couple of minutes afterwards! Lol. I've always thought this Batman Character was always the best actor for this role. LOVE the Flash! Also love Supergirl/Superman. Again, another different version of their reality which is very interesting. Gave this movie 9/10.

title: Just garbage
text: An end to a garbage Era of DC movies with the most garbage human playing the lead role. A reused plot that was better in the Flash TV show, which had a better cast. Keaton tried to save this movie but just couldn't with how bad the CGI was, the writing was and how garbage a person Ezra Miller is. I feel bad for every one in this movie because of who was cast as the lead. Save your money for the next chapter of DC, it may not get much better but has to be better than this garbage. It stopped being a competition with Marvel and more of just trying to survive as a franchise. You can only Reboot so many times before you just fade away.

title: I really enjoyed this film
text: Well i really enjoyed this film, i never likes any dc film since for the dark Knight. I love Sasha as supergirl, she is wonderful in this film, but sadly the ending is bad. I don't care about dc's screwed up projects, but i must say this is a great dc movie, he is full of entertainment but also has serious issues, this type of movie is rare and rare these days. Keaton's Batman was terrific, surpassing even Ben Afleck's Batman. Although there are flaws in the ointment, but his excellence makes me ignore his shortcomings. He deserves higher ratings and box office. I hope everyone can let go of their prejudices and enjoy this excellent movie.

title: One of the worst movies I have ever seen
text: The Flash is really bad, it has 0 good jokes, I didn't laugh once, I couldn't remember anything when I finished the movie, it has nothing special to remember at all, it has to be one of the worst character depictions I have ever seen. The scenes from x-men were they show Quicksilver are more memorable than a whole Flash movie. There are too many plotholes everywhere so the movie also makes no sense in so many levels that it is sad how many website have shown up to try to explain this plot holes and most just speculate but offer no good explanation. I saw the movie 2 times as I could not believe it was that bad the first time and I thought I should gave it a second chance, it was a terrible idea, the movie just sucks if you are over 14 years old.

title: A fantastic movie
text: A movie is not just one person, and despite one being not very good. The rest of the people made one of the best dc movies of all time and that deserves to be celebrated.It's unexpected, fast, fun and emotional.The extreme nostalgia make the movie 10 times better, just the fact that Michel Keaton said I'm Batman is perfection. And he is brilliant all the way through.We also get to meet wonder women and super man, supergirl was fantastic.This is to put it in to perspective, the best superhero movie in years. DC should have found a way forward from this instead of just going with a new comedic universe with will be inevitable with James Gunn steering the ship. Even though Gunn is great he is not "DC" :)

title: Amazing acting, great action, lots of fun
text: Just watched this movie with my eldest daughter and we both had a lot of fun. It is an overall great action movie, with a fast tempo and a good score. The movie has a few flaws (visual effects a bit fake at times, story has a couple of clichés...) and I think for viewers who are not familiar with the Justice League world, some things might be hard to grasp.Of a particular note, I found Ezra's performance absolutely amazing. I am aware of the stories around him (unfortunately!!! Because what does that have to do with his profession?!) and I am shocked that it might be the cause for the bad reception of the movie.He manages to be very intense and very funny at the same time. Quite unique. I couldn't take my eyes off him, trying to figure him out. One could say he really knows how to blur the lines (pun intended)... When you'll see the movie, you'll know what I mean. I knew he is an excellent actor but I was really blown away by his talent.

title: The perfect example of a true 5.
text: Is this movie atrocious and the worst superhero movie ever? No but it is one of the worst, but it's still entertaining. Do the flashes powers make sense and translate visually in this movie? Nope but it is visually interesting. Michael Keaton is great for the scenes with decent to above average scenes like the kitchen but he's also cringe when he says the famous line from Batman 89. The jokes do not all land but some of them are fun, and Ezra is a really good actor but the dialogue is not great but the plot is actually pretty clever and classic. Does it do fan service like stuff at the end and the Superman stuff? Absolutely. But as a movie it's just a solid 5 which is fine but for what it could've or should've been it's bad.

title: Good on many fronts
text:
As a film, very enjoyable story, not too overly complicated or convertibles making it easier to follow and allow you to enjoy the film as films should be.The Flash character, well played and likeable by Ezra, but his alter self is the annoying one who causes the problems becoming the main storyline.Keaton is fabulous and I think I agree, steals a big chunk of the show and I hope this wave of nostalgia in modern superhero movies keeps coming, since Spider-Man No Way Home, I think it proves that true fans love it.SUPERGIRL, fab, well played and deserves the credit
Should this flop because of Ezra or the DC studio strife, no, I don't think it should.

title: Surprisingly Refreshing for DC Films and A Whole Lotta Fun
text: I went into this not exactly expecting much, as so much of the DCEU has been meh, (with a couple of notable exceptions; i.e. Man of Steel in 2013 and The Suicide Squad from 2019) but boy was I surprised by this movie!The Flash movie is the most fun I've had watching a DC Comics movie since 2019's The Suicide Squad! My feelings about Ezra Miller as a person aside, the film is a spectacle from start to finish! The opening sequence of the movie is worth the price of admission alone, as are several fun, funny, and absolutely insanely great moments throughout the movie! I found myself laughing for once during a DC movie, and director Andy Muschietti masterfully blends humor with the high stakes presented in the film.The plot of the film is a faithful adaptation of a major DC Comics storyline involving The Flash called Flashpoint. There was only one very minor detail involving the plot that irked me, as I felt the movie had a major missed opportunity to not include a classic villain central to the Flashpoint story, but that's just me. There are plenty of Easter eggs for fans to spot but even if you aren't familiar with the comics you will still enjoy it. There is even a slight nod to another DC Comics storyline called Red Son within the film.Michael Keaton shines once again in his return at The Caped Crusader, reprising the role from the 1989 and 1992 Batman films, ignoring the events of Batman Forever and Batman & Robin in which he didn't star. He returns in classic and badass style, with a little nostalgia thrown in, most notably nods to the original Batman themes in the film's score. Ezra Miller does an admirable job as the titular character, despite my feelings about Miller personally.The standout performance for me was Sasha Calle as Supergirl, cousin to Superman. In every scene that she is in, she demands your attention and is just as good as Henry Cavill's version of Supes!The movie was not without it's flaws though. There were many times I found a few scenes annoying and dragging slightly, and there is quite a busy third act, and it does get slightly bogged down by all that it's trying to do.However there are a couple of cameos in the film I DID NOT SEE COMING right towards the end!All in all, The Flash is amazing, and proves that in the right hands and with the right screenplay and direction, DC heroes can have their chance in the spotlight! If this is the last hurrah of the Snyderverse, then this goes out in style on a high note! (This movie does reboot the DC films to fit the new DCU now helmed by James Gunn.) This cannot be missed if you are a Flash fan, or a Keaton Batman fan! There is a lot to love about this film, and it FINALLY serves the fans up with a lot to like! #TheFlashMovie.

title: Fitting end to the DCEU
text: The Flash shares a story that stays true to the source material all while adding it's own original twist to it. I loved seeing all of the characters across the long history of DC. But I didn't just love this movie because of its fan service. It was great seeing Gal Gadot and Ben Affleck return to reprise their characters and the story really had some great humor, several emotional moments too. It really paints the picture of actions having consequences even the smallest actions can lead to a domino effect. I loved seeing this more mature version of the flash vs the one that we saw in the original Justice League movie too and seeing the comparison between past and present Barry was both hilarious and just nice to watch. Overall, I'd say this is an appropriate end to the DCEU.

title: It shouldn't be bad
text:
On paper the plot should be awesome but it's constantly undercut by the overacting & goofy script. Some solid moments with interesting concepts, moving characterization, & sleek action. Yet the visuals are wildly inconsistent..

title: A movie which is a billion times better than Snyder's Justice League!
text: "The Flash" is a superhero movie that transcends the boundaries of its genre, delivering an exhilarating and captivating experience that leaves all other superhero films in the dust. From the very beginning, this film takes audiences on an incredible journey through time and space, showcasing the consequences and complexities of time travel like never before.Director Andy Muschietti, has masterfully crafted a film that seamlessly blends heart-pounding action, gut-wrenching emotional moments, and side-splitting comedy. The balance between these elements is pitch-perfect, ensuring a rollercoaster ride of emotions that keeps viewers on the edge of their seats throughout the entire runtime.Ezra Miller's portrayal of Barry Allen, aka The Flash, is nothing short of phenomenal. His infectious enthusiasm and quirky sense of humor bring an endearing charm to the character, while also showcasing his vulnerability and determination. Miller's performance truly makes us believe in the extraordinary abilities and personal struggles of this beloved superhero.The visual effects in "The Flash" are a visual feast for the eyes. The seamless integration of CGI and practical effects brings the breathtaking action sequences to life, making them a joy to behold. The time-bending scenes are mind-blowing, leaving audiences in awe of the intricate details and imaginative visuals that unfold on screen.What sets "The Flash" apart from other superhero movies is its exploration of the consequences of time travel. The narrative dives deep into the ethical dilemmas and ripple effects that altering the past can have on the present and future. It's a thought-provoking exploration that adds an extra layer of complexity to the storyline and elevates the film beyond mere superhero escapism.In addition to its exhilarating action and thought-provoking themes, "The Flash" also boasts a stellar supporting cast. Each actor brings depth and charisma to their respective roles, further enhancing the movie's overall impact. The chemistry among the ensemble is palpable, creating memorable and compelling dynamics that resonate long after the credits roll.In conclusion, "The Flash" is a billion times better than Snyder's Justice League and stands as the epitome of a superhero film done right. It is an absolute triumph, delivering a mind-bending, action-packed, emotional, and comedic cinematic experience. Whether you're a die-hard fan of the character or a casual viewer, this film will leave you thoroughly entertained and hungry for more. Brace yourself for an extraordinary adventure that will forever change your perception of what a superhero movie can achieve!

title: A messy blurry movie
text:
After many obstacles we've finally got to see the Flash and it was a disappointment.The bickering between the two Barry's was annoying and ofcourse the CGI was a laughing stock. Really the only goog thing was to see Michael Keaton as Batman again and even that was not handled properly. The multiverse was badly explained with the spheres.For a movie that's been in development for many years, it is a great example of how Warner Bros. Is
Struggling and cannot make up Their mind in wich direction to go. Countless rewrites, reshoots and than we get this???? For Pete's sake. I think that WB explained to us how what the movie is in the "Spaghetti scene" with Michael Keaton.Enjoyable? Well maybe a few scenes but in general it was really badly written, not gonna watch it again.

title: I'm Batman!
text: This movie is enjoyable. The beginning is a bit fast for me and Ezra Miller is exhausting at times, but Michael Keaton does not miss a step. Keaton is my favorite Batman, so I'm bias, because I'd watch a movie with him dusting his house as Bruce Wayne. The movie does not have any positive or negative consequences per se, but that is kind of the point. Definitely watch it at home on Max if you can't make it to the theater. The parts with Keaton's Batman are the best scenes and he is upgraded to hang in there with today's villains, however, he is still the Burton Batman. I think they should have recasted Miller due to the controversies but what's done is done. Super hero fatigue seems to be setting in also though.

title: A Personal Journey Through Time and Destiny
text: As a dedicated DC Universe enthusiast, the anticipation for "The Flash (2023)" reached its peak for me. Although I missed its theatrical release, I finally had the chance to experience this highly awaited superhero spectacle on December 18, 2023, thanks to JioCinema."The Flash (2023)" bursts onto the screen with electrifying speed, delivering a superhero spectacle that lives up to its much-anticipated DC Universe status. The film offers an exhilarating experience that combines jaw-dropping action, mind-bending time travel, and unexpected twists, all of which had me on the edge of my seat.The cast's outstanding performances contribute to the film's authenticity and depth, immersing viewers in the DC Universe's rich tapestry of characters. Ezra Miller shines as Barry Allen, aka The Flash, alongside Sasha Calle, making her striking film debut as Super-girl. Michael Shannon, Ron Livingston, Maribel Verdú, Kiersey Clemons, Antje Traue, and the return of Michael Keaton as a retired Batman complete this stellar ensemble, elevating the movie's overall excellence.One of the film's standout features is its clever use of time travel as a central plot device. It weaves a riveting narrative, keeping viewers in suspense as the collision of worlds and the repercussions of altering history unfold before their eyes. The result is a thrilling rollercoaster ride of excitement and anticipation.Visually stunning and expertly choreographed, "The Flash" dazzles with breathtaking action sequences that showcase the character's incredible speed and agility. These sequences alone are worth the price of admission, creating unforgettable moments that will linger in the minds of viewers.Beyond its action-packed exterior, the movie delves into themes of redemption, sacrifice, and the unintended consequences of one's actions. These layers add depth to the storyline, making it not just a superhero spectacle but a thought-provoking journey.In summary, "The Flash (2023)" delivered a personal and profound cinematic experience for me. As a dedicated DC Universe enthusiast, the film seamlessly combined heart-pounding action with meaningful themes. I joined The Flash on his journey through time, witnessing the profound impact of his choices on the fate of the world. This movie is a must-watch for both DC fans and those seeking a thrilling adventure at the movies.

title: What if Sheldon (TBBT) becomes the flash...
text: Confusing pacing, especially in the opening, with awkward comedic relief. The CGI is subpar overall, but in several scenes, it becomes embarrassing. However, by far, the worst aspect of the movie is Ezra Miller's performance, which comes across as a wannabe Sheldon Cooper - I'm not sure if it's his fault or the direction's, but it's a pathetic performance. Perhaps the only interesting things were the tributes, unfortunately also marred by the poor CGI. They missed the chance to reboot the DC universe with one of the best comic book sagas; instead, they ended up with another failure. The DCU has once again shown it doesn't know how to make films well.

title: Wow just Wow!!!!!!!!!!!!
text: I wish I could describe in words how amazing this movie was. If you love DC, and if you love the history of DC, you just need to watch this movie to appreciate everything and I'll just leave it at that. If you grew up in the 60s and 70s the 80s, there's a little something that'll bring back a memory for everybody. I'm just trying my best not to give away anything. The movie was well written it's just some thing a comic book fan needs to go and experience for themselves. The special effects were amazing. Acting was great. It's definitely a movie that will win peoples hearts, regardless of whether you like comic books or not.

title: Worse than I expected...and I didn't expect much.
text: There's so much wrong with this movie that it's almost hard to remember it all. Let's start with the acting. With the exception of Michael Keaton, the acting in this movie varies from bad to mediocre. Miller in particular shows himself pretty incapable of doing anything but the quips. And it's not like he's amazing at quips.Aside from Keaton and Miller, no one else really gets enough screen time to do much. Sasha Calle (Kara Zor-El) gets a little time, but not enough...but also doesn't really do anything with the time she's given. Nothing about her portrayal of this character will be remembered by anyone in any way.One of the things I found particularly annoying is how hard this movie WANTS to be funny. Flash was relegated to the comic relief in Just-Us League, so it makes sense that they try to make him funny in this...but the jokes just don't land. There's one good one. I don't want to spoil it, but I'm not sure they intended it as a joke, so I don't think I'm spoiling anything. It's the inclusion of the Nick Cage vs a giant spider scene. I LOLed at that. And that's all. Literally the only funny thing that happens.Which is a problem because the movie tries SO HARD to make the humor. At times, it almost feels like a parody of a Flash movie. Comedy beats that don't really make sense are shoehorned in like the comedic instruments falling out of the van in a awkward way that seemed to be trying to choreograph in a humorous way...but isn't.This brings me to my next complaint - erratic rules. Look, it's superheroes, so I can't hit them too hard on the over the top physics, but if you're going to introduce rules on your magic, you need to be consistent. And Flash isn't.Let's talk about plot. The entire plot in this thing hinges on the movie's rather unusual take on timelines and multiverses. It's explained by a spaghetti metaphor by Keaton and ... it's nonsensical. If you're going to do time travel, the way to make it cool is to put the effort in. Time travel is hard. It inherently unravels the stakes of your movie and has to be handled carefully.The Flash makes ZERO effort to make it's time travel rules make sense, essentially writing itself a blank check to do...whatever, whenever. It conflates the concept of multiverses with that of multiple timelines in a way that doesn't really make alot of sense. It also never actually uses it's gimmick in a way that feels clever or original.The movie often falls into reference checking the Keaton Batman movie in a way that, far from feeling cool or nostalgic, feels egotistical.The movie begins with an extended bit of action where Batman, Flash, and Wonder Woman are involved in random hero stuff that...has absolutely ZERO plot value. And it's not short. This is a LONG extended chunk of the movie that feels like it must have significance given how long it takes...but no. Nothing. Just wasting your time. And what's weird...neither Batman nor Flash come off as overly heroic in it.Let's talk effects. The effects are...REALLY inconsistent. And mostly bad. Now, to some extent, I feel like I want to grade on a curve here because they really loaded up with ALOT of effects. There's SO MANY effects. I'll bet effects shots FAR outnumber noneffects shots in this thing.But there are many scenes where Barry is running in Flashtime and the effects are so shiny and nondistinct that it actually looks like this movie had approximately the same budget as the Flash CW TV show. And...maybe less. Because at least in the early season of the Flash TV show the effects often looked BETTER than in this movie. It was only as the show drug on and ratings fell and budgets fell that the really shiny and bad effects started cropping up. But how does that make it into a MAJOR studio movie. I've heard they tried to claim it was deliberate...and that's laughable because alot of the bad shots aren't the multiversal stuff. The falling babies at the beginning looked so low-res, I almost would have expected that to be a video game screengrab.While I'm talking about the CW show, can I take a moment to say that I hate THIS Iris West just as much as I hate the Iris West in the CW show? What is it about this character that writers insist on making her come off as a total Witch with a B?Scenes also frequently don't make a ton of sense. Why would Bruce Wayne meet Barry in Central City...twice? Barry can come to Gotham in seconds. Bruce needs to fly on an airplane. It made no sense. And why would they be talking in a random alley?Honestly, even the action isn't all that good. Like, this is a superspeedster. You kind of HAVE to live up to the Quicksilver scene in the X-Men movies. And...this doesn't. I'm not even sure it lives up to the CW show.And if you're doing multiverses...how do you not include the Arrowverse NOR the 90s Flash? They spend all this time showing off Superman alternates and Batman alternates. You realize those aren't the main characters of THIS movie, right?

title: One the best movies of this year so far.
text: After all the delays and drama at WB the Flash finally drops in theatres I knew Andy Mussetti was a talented director but I never thought he'd be this good .This movie is a blast from beginning to end. Great acting , great characters and action, emotional story but also really funny and engaging. The cameos will have you geeking out and the arcs of our heroes are incredible. I hate to say it as a huge Michael Keaton and Ben Affleck Batman fan but Ezra Miller steals the show he plays 2 characters that contrasts each other so much I forgot it's the same person. Anyway the movie would be perfect but some of cgi looks wonky but it's a minor gripe.

title: Should have just made a Batman multiverse
text: Michael Keaton was by far the best thing about this movie. Grant Gustin is an infinitely superior Barry Allen. There was no chemistry between any of the characters. The relationship between Barry and Iris was especially unbelievable. The cgi was abominable, if as some have suggested, this was by choice, I cannot fathom why anyone would make that choice. I guess the same person who decided to turn Barry Allen into a whiny, anxiety riddled, irritating loser. If you want to see an enjoyable Flash, watch the series. If you're a big Batman fan, this movie is worth watching for the return of some big names, otherwise, steer clear.

title: About 4 movies in one.....
text: To be honest, it was better than my very low expectations. Warner has done they're best to spoil the plot with all they're promo shots, so there's no news in a new Supergirl and a second Flash. It all happens because DC cant do a single move without copying the boring Marvel formula. This time the disorienting multiverse (which Marvel stole from Back To The Future, which also is referenced here). The fun part is the very meta moment with seeing Nicolas Cage as Superman, since he actually screentested for it. The not so fun is that the movie never can decide if it wants to be funny or serious; the tone shifts every 5th minute. And Ezra Miller's stunts outside, makes some of his lines cringeworthy. The guy is just not very likable. The big thing is of course one Michael Keaton back as The Bat, which is a true joy. If you don't like Keaton back, there's something wrong with you. Watch out for one very great cameo right at the end. Very inspired anf very ironic.

title: Get past the sometimes poor CGI and your in for a great movie
text: Ezra miller does a great job of portraying the same character, in two different ways. One where they have grown up with a mum and one without. The character development of main Barry is so good. Getting to see Michael Keaton batman again and the music at the same time made for a great viewing. The passing of the film felt spot on, never rushed and never slow.Only problem for me was the VFX and CGI, sometimes things that didn't need to be BFX were and for the scenes where they are in the speed force the characters do look a bit crap. The movie itself however is a must watch and a great fan experience.

title: FAST AND AMUSING
text: Fast paced fun entertainment !Dc's multiverse one , interesting plot, plenty of eye catchy actions and some shots are stunning !And performance vice Michael Keaton is rocking and ezra miller did well !Screenplay is confusing at times and some things left unanswered at the end ,hard to accept it !This one has funny moments, good actions scenes ,some incredible cinematography shots, slow motion shots are great !The VFX is decent ,some area it is very good in some places seems weak and the Cameos are pretty nice !music is impressive !This one definitely is DC's recent best outing and worth watching in cinemas !

title: The Flash: Entertaining enough...
text: Back in the old days, before connected universes, ultimate IP exploitation, and the pursuit of monetization before all other considerations, a movie's job wasn't to advertise future movies, it was to be entertaining on its own terms.If you could take it by itself, this movie would be entertaining enough film on its own terms...but a confusing one. And you'd run into an immediate problem: In order to achieve maximum testable enjoyment, you might have to see Batman '89, Man of Steel 2013, Superman II 1980, Wonder Woman 2017, and either Supergirl movies, comics, or the recent TV show--and that's just to know who the characters are and why their significant.If you don't, then you might not understand why certain events play out the way they do or why certain characters take certain actions even though they're not the logical ones at that moment.At the same time, the movie is kind of hoping that you won't have watched the recent Flash Arrowverse show, as the overarching plot, the parts taken from 60ish years of Barry Allen Flash mythology, was also fully covered in the TV show, and done just as well or better.The TV show also fully spoils the eventual outcome of the film (wow, that Iris West sure if a cute acquaintance! Do you think we have to wait until Flash II or Flash III to find out if these two crazy kids can hit it off?).I won't spoil the ending, but I did find it very confusing, and I'm a DC comics fan and understand what happened.And that brings us the biggest problem with all of the DC properties, the one thing I'd say to the Warner Brothers execs if I could, the movies and TV shows have become constant retellings of origin stories, and constant reboots. Marvel has made some wrong moves too, but you get the feeling that they've actually thought about their properties, e.g. Spiderman: Homecoming didn't attempt to retell Spiderman's film origin for the 3rd time in less than 20 years.Ultimately, I was hoping that DC would get its act together, but I just don't know if it's possible at this point. Their movies, even the good ones, are messy, inconsistent, and aren't very fun. But they should be.

title: DC nailed this one
text: Omg. From the start to the end I was on the edge of my toes. Laughing, crying, excited.. and I was on my own so people probably thought I was crazy laughing out loud, but I didn't care!I will be watching it for the 2nd time soon.Great creativity and humor. They knew what to do and when. Even after the credits roll, some funny scenes with the dog falling.They put a lot of time and thought into this one instead it being rushed.I told all my friends to go watch it, and they were like.. ehhh (not knowing that this is a HIT)!They will regret as the special effects were like ohh myyy God.10stars.

title: Exceeded Expectations
text: A fun, energetic, and dynamic film that is exquisitely written.Christina (the screenwriter) knows exactly how to combine action, comedy, and drama in a way that doesn't seem to be three different movies.This is a film that not only is packed with visual effects and action but most importantly it has a story and that story has a soul (characteristics that are hard to find in a movie nowadays).Don't forget that we watch movies to be immersed in the STORY not in the special effects. And if that story gives you something it's double worth it.If you want to have a good time, laugh, and receive a life lesson... go and watch it. It will not be a waste of time.

title: What does Ezra have over this studio?
text: The only thing I can assume is that Ezra miller has some sort of dirt over the studio. For him to be the face of a 100+ million dollar franchise is asinine. His acting was horrifically bad, the scene with him arguing with himself was straight out of a local theatre type bad...Michael Keaton was great! It's one of the two reasons this movie wasn't a 1/10. Supergirl was cast perfectly and she carries this movie as soon as she enters the storyline. SO this movie does have some saving grace with those two elements.Not sure why James Gunn continues to buy into the flash storyline with Ezra but for the DC world to compete with Marvel it starts with the acting then you can plug and play any storyline.

title: AMAZING - EZRA and KEATON are EVERYTHING! MUST WATCH!
text: AMAZING. I'll be honest, I was not expecting to like this given DC's history and the recent headlines. Then I saw the trailer and thought, wait, this looks pretty good. Now after watching it, it's absolutely EVERYTHING. Amazing storyline - we've heard it before on the silver screen, but the way they managed to tell it on the big screen was impeccable. Ezra did an incredible job, and I can understand why this version of Flash was meant for him. He embodied the role perfectly. There were elements of nostalgia, exciting action, humorous moments done well (sparingly and not forced), and heartfelt moments where you truly felt for the character. The character development kept you engaged. Some people egged on the CGI, but I thought it was brilliant. The directors choices in some effects was intentional and it's aligned with comic books, where in Barry's perception, the world looks much different. This is THE BEST DC MOVIE made to date. I don't care about the politics or drama outside the film - the film is perfect and everyone needs to watch it. DO NOT listen to the naysayers. They're simply hating because of the politics. You'll leave the theatre with a smile, I promise.

title: Absolute garbage
text: There's really nothing to say other than this is absolute steaming pile of garbage. It's a lame duck movie from a franchise that's better of being kindly put to sleep and out out of its misery.I have always liked Michael Keaton as Batman, he's MY version of Batman alongside the wonderful Jack Nicholson as The Joker but in this film it's just an excuse to roll out a bunch of Bruce Wayne cameos into a film that does little other than remind us all of a genre of films from a by gone era that did it much better but, in saying that this film went through 6, yes 6 directors, cost $250 million and who knows how many rewrites and reshoots but damn, I never thought it would be this much of a chaotic mess.Personally, I'm glad I waited until it appeared on Sky Movies Premier because if I'd paid real money to go the cinema to watch this, I think I might just have taken to the bottle.

title: The movie was extremely fun!
text: This is what we needed from DC, entertainment, having fun in a theater, to enjoy a movie from start to finish including a good script, hilarious jokes, and dramatic moments between a son and the mother he lost as a young kid. Nostalgia completes this masterpiece along with a great way to show the audience how flash perceived the world when he's in the speed force. Absolutely loved every minute of it! Ezra Miller's performance as well as Michael Keaton and Sasha Calle was absolutely on point. Ben affleck's Batman was perfect! The cameos where fun and surprising! Go and watch it or you'll regret it later!

title: I guess DC forgot about the Zack Snyder cut debacle
text:
The Flash CGI in a nutshell:Henry Cowville as Supalman
Ben Halffleck as Buttman
Jason Nonoa as aQué?man
Plastic babies
Plasticine Cars.Remember the famous Scorpion King scene for all the wrong reasons... compare that to it's timeframe, the flash is soooo soooo much worse because it's full of these scenes.I suppose they did it on purpose so it would shield your attention away from the horrible writing..They did Keaton wrong and he and Ezra somewhat keep the movie crawling while the movie crumbles and DCEU is gasping for it's last breath..absolutely ridiculous... Shame Shame ShameHow could they not learn from the whole Snyder cut release debacle?I'm done, I'm skipping any DC movie that comes out the next decade.

title: A Thrilling Journey into the Speed Force
text: "The Flash" (2023) is a superhero film that takes audiences on a wild and electrifying ride through the Speed Force. Directed by a talented team, this installment in the DC Extended Universe delivers an exhilarating experience filled with action, heart, and a captivating storyline.One of the standout aspects of "The Flash" is the film's exceptional portrayal of its titular hero, Barry Allen, played brilliantly by Ezra Miller. The actor captures the essence of the character, blending his youthful charm with a genuine sense of determination and vulnerability. Through his performance, we witness Barry's growth as a superhero and his internal struggles, making him relatable and endearing to audiences.The plot of "The Flash" is well-crafted and engaging. It delves into the complexities of time travel, parallel universes, and the consequences of altering the timeline. The narrative keeps viewers on the edge of their seats, as Barry embarks on a mission to rewrite his tragic past while facing formidable adversaries. The story strikes a balance between thrilling action sequences and emotional character development, which elevates the film beyond the typical superhero fare.The visual effects in "The Flash" are nothing short of spectacular. From the electrifying speed sequences to the breathtaking landscapes of alternate dimensions, the film creates a vivid and immersive world. The cinematography beautifully captures the essence of the Speed Force, creating stunning visuals that complement the high-octane action.The supporting cast also deserves praise, as they bring depth and charisma to their respective roles. The dynamic between Barry and his trusted friends, as well as his compelling interactions with both allies and enemies, adds layers to the story and enhances the overall viewing experience.While "The Flash" is undoubtedly an enjoyable film, it occasionally feels a bit overstuffed with characters and subplots. Some storylines could have been further developed to create a stronger emotional impact, as they occasionally take a backseat to the film's relentless pace. However, this minor criticism doesn't detract significantly from the overall quality of the movie.In conclusion, "The Flash" (2023) is a thrilling and well-executed superhero film that successfully brings one of DC's most beloved characters to the big screen. With a captivating story, impressive visuals, and compelling performances, it offers an enjoyable cinematic experience for fans and newcomers alike. While it may have a few minor flaws, it undeniably stands out as an exciting addition to the superhero genre.

title: Hopefully the start of great DCU Films
text: Loved Sasha Calle's Supergirl, she looks like a girl. And she looks like a cousin of Kal El, dark and brooding, the return of Michael Keaton's Batman was nostalgic and epic, would love to see him do a Batman of The Future live action film, Ezra Miller's Flash was solid and funny, he owns this character,, i still prefer the Flashpoint comic original version, but they introduce the multiverse in DCU films, very well, the film has lots of funny scenes, and cameos , some cameos had been scratching my head, theirefeerences to other well known time travel films and the special effects for The Flash's speed is superior to the tv show version of The Flash, the film aslso gives us a similar XMen's Quicksilver moment, which is epic.

title: I've seen better effect in Playstation 1 cut scenes
text: These are honestly some of the most half assed special effects and cgi you will see in the year 2023. It is actually kind of shocking that a director, producer, or studio executive would sign off on them and have his or her name attached to them. And neither the terrible effects nor over the top multiverse "cameos" can save an utterly incoherent plot/ending. Due to either the main character's off screen issues or the studio's change in leadership over DC projects, it seems as though the script was written and rewritten any number of times and all the drafts thrown into a pot and molded into a single incoherent mess.

title: Great Movie,Keaton Still got It.
text: Amazing, very funny, great action scenes. Micheal Keaton back to Batman is priceless, Still got it, would like to see more DC multiverse with old cast. Excellent tributes to old heros. The movie is so good that you don't even feel the time (2h:34) pass. Keaton steal the show. Great nostalgia with the old batcave. Great soundtrack and old DC songs themes. I watched in IMAX and was excellent. I would like a more adult film and not PG-13, was a shame, could be a more hardcore in my opinion. Excited and Looking forward to see more DC multivers stuff. The only downside was the special effects (CGI)...

title: Sci-fi movies
text: The Flash (2023) is a superhero film that tells the story of Barry Allen, a science nerd who becomes the Flash. The film is full of action, humor, and heart, and it features a great cast of characters, including Ezra Miller as Barry Allen, Michael Keaton as Batman, and Sasha Calle as Supergirl. The film's action sequences are particularly dazzling, and they showcase Barry's lightning-fast abilities in breathtaking slow-motion sequences. But beneath the thrills, The Flash beats with a surprisingly emotional core. Barry's quest to save his mother fuels the narrative, exploring themes of family, loss, and the power of connection across time. Ultimately, The Flash is a triumph of heart, spectacle, and pure superhero joy. It's a film that celebrates family, embraces second chances, and reminds us that even the fastest man alive needs a little human connection. So buckle up, grab your popcorn, and prepare to be swept away by this electrifying cinematic adventure. The Flash is a must-see for superhero fans and anyone seeking a dose of big-screen magic.

title: Believe the hype
text:
"As a rule I don't care a lot for superhero movies, but this one is special. It's heartfelt, funny, and eye-popping. I loved it."
I concur with the esteemed Stephen King; this movie is something special. Sure, it features the legendary Michael Keaton reprising his role as Batman, brims with nostalgia, exudes hilarity, and exhibits awe-inspiring visuals. However, at its essence, it remains a profoundly poignant narrative centered around an individual grappling with the loss of their mother. Within its frames lie genuinely impactful scenes that, if one has experienced such circumstances, are bound to strike a chord. I am an avid moviegoer, yet it has been quite a while since I've seen something this good.Believe the hype.

title: The flash
text: A lot may depend on your feelings of Ezra Miller. Younger Barry Allen was really annoying, but I think that's the point. I had no issues with them in the role.The stand out for me, was Michael Keaton. When Batman is doing his things and Danny Elfman's iconic score is booming, it's a joy. But make no mistake this is not Batman 3, it's a Flash movie that features Keaton's Batman.Supergirl was good, I enjoyed her, and if she gets a stand alone, I'd watch it. There were some surprises, that I'm amazed have not leaked.It feels it's run time at times and some of the CGI is very dodgy, especially during a certain moment. Considering what they were going for, I can't believe they released it like that. The CGI at that moment is my biggest complaint.They get away with a lot with its rating including nudity and a fair amount of bad language, including the F bomb.

title: Watch it yourself! Embrace individuality! This blew me away
text: Everyone online is slandering this film for mainly its CGI but also as a whole and suggest nobody watches it but this film to be was a prime example of why you should always watch the film yourself regardless of the majority's suggestions not to and come up with your own opinion on media regardless of the majority's takes on it. The CGI didn't affect my enjoyment of this film all that much and it had emotional moments that really really surprised me with how perfect DC managed to pull them off. The fanservice was perfect but unlike a certain MCU project wasn't the entire selling point of the film and excels in fanservice nostalgia enjoyment and enjoyment as it's own thing with new characters like the impressive supergirl performance from Sasha Calle and surprisingly great performance from Ezra Miller despite what he's been up to personally over the last year. I'm not the biggest fan of time travel affecting events taking place before the event change at all but all in all this film's emotional and nostalgic/fanservice moments completely made up for all the problems I had with it. One of the most memorable superhero films I've watched and one that my love for only grows the more I think about it. Watch it yourself!8.5/10.

title: Believe the hype
text: It's as good, or even great as advertised! It's a very emotional, heartfelt story, with great surprises! Acting is top notch, action is superb. Definitely a must see, multiple times! The dynamic of Barry and all the cast of characters work very, very well! It literally feels like you're in the story and in a comic book.it's not the greatest superhero movie ever, but it's actually up there with the greatest superhero movies ever! It's definitely the best DCEU movie by far, and of of the best DC movies ever! It's a love letter to DC, and all above else a story that plays on your heartstrings and makes you laugh as well! 5/5.

title: Lives up to the hype.
text: The Flash continues with the adventures of Barry Allen/The Flash(Ezra Miller), after the events of Zack Snyder's Justice League(2021). Barry goes back in time using his super speed & prevents a tragic event involving his family, from ever happening in the first place. However, this results in the world going topsy-turvy. There are no more superheroes in the world & Barry must do everything he can to bring everything back to normal & safeguard the future.The Flash is a phenomenal film. Director Andy Muschietti has given us a movie that is a tribute to all things DC, through its vast history in media. The comedic scenes will make you laugh uproariously. The action set pieces are mind-blowing. The visual effects are awesome. Ezra Miller is superb as Barry Allen/The Flash. Miller flexes their acting range by playing two different versions of the same character. However, I still prefer Grant Gustin's portrayal of Barry Allen/The Flash in The CW series. Michael Keaton is the star of the show as Batman/Bruce Wayne. Seeing Keaton reprise one of his iconic roles as the Caped Crusader is an absolute delight to watch. Michael Keaton's spectacular performance is the highlight of the film. Sasha Calle is outstanding as Supergirl. Michael Shannon is brilliant as General Zod. Ron Livingston is amazing as Henry Allen. Maribel Verdu is fantastic as Nora Allen. The supporting cast is excellent. Prepare yourself for many exciting surprises. The Flash is a must watch for fans of the DC Universe. It's tailor-made for the IMAX experience. Sprint to the theatres & have a whale of a time!

title: Is it perfect? No. Is it fun? HECK YES!
text: This film deserves the chance to stand on its own, without Miller's mental issues being an issue. The story is full of action, comedy, & heart, with Barry growing & maturing as a person/hero in this film. It is NOT an adaptation of DC Comics' Flashpoint storyline, though it does take inspiration from there, doing it's own thing with the premise, which is "you can't save everyone." Barry learns that lesson the hard way twice, as an older & younger version of himself. The CGI cameos are rough, but they work well enough & are great fun, especially for older fans. It's worth it. Don't be swayed by trolls.

title: Perfect sendoff of Ezra Miller
text: The guy is bringing in too much bad publicity, and even though he did here a decent job, he is no lnger worth keeping, and THIS MOVIE IS THE PERFECT SANDOFF OF THE ACTOR (watch the ending!).I very much hope on the other hand this film doesn't get the unfair treatment just for him, because this is a darn good superhero action-movie, which even renews the time-traveling genre! It's simple, elegant, funny, the jokes are not at the expense of the tension, Mr. Keaton was not another Harrison Ford - way to old person coming back for a paycheck and runing old franchises -, cinematography is great, music is good, editing is worthy, and the fight-coreographies are excellent.Sure, the DCEU might not have the budget as the MCU - but I prefer a good story any time over overexpensive - and still crappy - CGI.I even hope Sasha Calle will be invited to reprise her role. The reviewers all forget about this new, upcoming talent, and she has what it'd take to draw me in, and I'm not (just) talking about eyecandy, plus she is anything but the next Brie Larson or Tatiana Maslany when it comes to PR.

title: A very satisfying Flash story and an excellent superhero movie, but not one of the best
text: The Flash overall is a very great movie with some stunning visuals as well some very subpar ones, has a lot of tear jerker scenes, with a touch of humor that doesn't always work. Would i say this is one of the best CBM ever? No, it has some major flaws, being of course some very oddly looking CGI as well as some questionable narrative decisions, but its balanced out with it's heartfelt and emotional story that drives the movie into high gear, with some jaw dropping scenes complimented with the phenomenal score and with a lot of excellent performances.So really The Flash is a really good movie.

title: Stick With The Grant Gustin Flash
text: The Flash TV show is far superior at least the first two seasons. The movie version of Flash, Iris and the side characters are far superior and fun. The movie opens making the Flash look stupid and it gets worse until they meet up with Batman. I never really appreciated Michael Keaton's Batman until now. This is actually a Batman/Supergirl movie more than a Flash movie. If I didn't know about the Multiverse I'd be lost. I was lost any way at times.It seems like today's movies are at a loss to portray villians with any type of ethnicity. The result is bland and uniform. Somehow the villians are Zod and The Soviets? How did Zod get into the picture? Supergirl looks like an afterthought. Little to know backstory. The directors also pull the "storyline redo" where time travel means superheroes never really got killed. Exasperating.Save your money. Really put a stake thru the DC comics hero verse that the'll never recover from.Oh, and the other reviewers so said the special effects were horrilbe weren't overcritical.

title: Great movie, poor CGI
text: Ok so let's get it out there, let's put the main actors public life aside, the movie itself was fun and a great watch, worth a watch if your into the whole DC universe.The let down though was the CGI, the part that gets the let down is further in the movie with other characters (no spoilers) being very obviously rushed and CG.The rest is actually really Good CG, felt like the part was rushed due to maybe DC's restructure.Maybe not enough time or money but it really hurt to look at and it's obvious that it's fake and doesn't belong in the real world very uncanny feeling.There is also a few more parts that look fake but not as bad as it is later in the movie.

title: not that good of a movie
text: Ezra is not a good actor,affleck good call,keaton was a bad move. Everything else so so replace ezra with grant and replace keaton with bale. Bale is perfect and has the voice and muscle and comic accurate just like grant gustin. I wouldn't recommend this movie this will hurt the franchise more and all dc movies and comics. There's better dc movies and shows to watch plus this was just a knock off of one very similar that was made years ago. So it's bad. The tv show the flash is 10x better and it has a better actor and loaded cast. Even the batman movies have a better cast but the latest batman movie wasn't good either.

title: Extraordinary DC movie
text: Flash is a must watch DC movie with extraordinary storyline and action scenes. The cgi is quality, I don't understand the hate it is getting, ironically the hate is coming from same people who praise Marvel for it's cgi. The movie was surprisingly funny with effective comedy moments for a DC movie. In overall a masterpiece and must watch. In my opinion the movie stands out as the best in DCEU and also the funniest one. Ezra Miller delivered a strong, memorable performance playing the role of two different versions of Barry Allen and needs to be praised for that. The movie was hilarious, gripping, memorable and highly enjoyable. A must watch for all DC fans.

title: The best DCEU movie, but not the best DC movie of all time
text: Ok, I just watched the Flash a couple hours ago and that was a very good film. Not the best Dc or Marvel film, but certainly the best DCEU film of all time. It was a nice love letter to the DC Universe alone and had a lot of heart and soul injected into it. Most of the comedy is great, some are cringy, and some of the CGI is very trash. In light of the cons, I still looked past them because of how good the story is. I thought the swerve they did on who was the real villain was cleverly done even though it felt a bit rushed. Give this movie a shot, I promise you will have a great time and a lot of excitement with the story.

title: DC take back the crown
text: Finally DC get it. This is the best super hero film I have seen and yes Ive seen them all. . So many references. So many amazing scenes.... Yes I'm an older fan and I get why a lot of younger fans miss a lot of what's in this totally enjoyable movie..... I was giving it a 9 and then the last 10min just blew my mind..... 10/10..... I totally got sucked in for the whole duration...... Very touching moments..... Yes yes yes.... oh and SuperGirl is an absolute powerhouse and stunning. I was delighted to see some curves back in a super hero outfit once again. Yes there is a post credit scene at the very end.....

title: One of the worst movies I've seen, not just this year, but ever
text: I really wanted to like this film, but it was the worst DC movie I have seen, and that's saying a lot. I have found most of the DC movies mediocre at best. The all seem TOO cartoonish, and yes I know they are comic book based, but I would still expect them to have some sense of reality.The acting ranges between wooden to over the top. The effects are mediocre, and the story is idiotic. I know it's supposed to be part of the character, but I find Ezra Miller's Flash a little over the top in his representation of what is clearly meant to be autism. The time travel angle and its impact on the future is something that has been done many times, but this is one of the least plausible and least interesting treatments of this trope. Overall, I had a hard time forcing myself to watch past the 1st hour of this. I found almost nothing enjoyable about this.

title: A really good film marketed as a epoch-making one.
text: WB understandably had to market the film somehow differently since they couldn't use Miller. They chose to market it as the best superhero film ever, but it's simply very good. Acting-wise, all the main cast, specially Ezra Miller, are brilliant. Zod and Supergirl don't have much to do, the movie is basically just focussed on the two Flashes. It could have been sooooo much better, but it settles for being really good. Music was a slight disappointment, there is no memorable theme like Wonder Woman or Pattinson's Batman. The DCEU goes out on a positive note, and I hope the future movies under Gunn are just as good or even better.

title: So much better than expected
text: I was very hesitant to go and watch this movie having been disappointed over and over with DC and Marvel movies recently. But I must admit right off the bat this movie had me hooked and it was extremely entertaining and very funny from beginning to end. I had seen an article that the cgi in this movie was intentionally bad which I still dont understand why the director chose to do this but I dont make movies and he does, and this director has no directed 3 movies that I have thoroughly enjoyed with the others being the IT movies. If you are on the fence, go ahead and pull the trigger, I think you will be glad you did.

title: Flashy Brilliance! A Bright Bolt of Cinematic Splendour!
text: Buckle up, folks! DC's The Flash has arrived, not as a meek puff of smoke, but as an electrifying lightning bolt, setting a scorching trail that burns brighter than ever in the superhero movieverse! From an exquisitely designed storyline that flutters close to the original Flashpoint Paradox animated movie, to the invigorating visual feast, this film has redefined the DC cinematic universe!Ezra Miller reprises his role as The Flash/Barry Allen, bringing a delightful blend of unbridled joy and poignant intensity that is both spellbinding and relatable. Miller's Flash isn't just super-speedy; he is funny, emotional, and deeply human, a living embodiment of the saying, "Not all superheroes wear capes."Speaking of capes, let's take a moment to gush about the stupendous return of Michael Keaton as Batman/Bruce Wayne. With his seasoned acting prowess, Keaton reminds us why he was, is, and will always be, the quintessential Batman. His Batman embodies wisdom and resilience, doused in a dark charm that harks back to his iconic 1989 portrayal. The interactions between Keaton's Batman and Miller's Flash are gloriously memorable, packed with humorous moments and heartwarming camaraderie.Now, let's not forget the new kid on the block: Supergirl. Played to perfection by Sasha Calle, our newest heroine soars above and beyond all expectations. Her performance is radiant, powerful, and offers a breath of fresh air to the DC lineup. Her portrait of the character as a troubled and angry powerhouse us just brillant.The Flash offers more than just a character study; it's a thrilling exploration of the Speed Force and its boundless possibilities. The CGI sequences are pure artistry in motion, with breathtaking visuals that capture the essence of Flash's abilities like never before. The speed, the time manipulation, the energy - every element comes alive in a dazzling display of cinematic magic!The storyline, while following the spine of Flashpoint Paradox, introduces unexpected twists and refreshing additions that give the narrative a unique flavor. The blend of light-hearted humor and intense drama strikes a perfect balance, ensuring that our pulses never miss a beat.What makes The Flash the best DC superhero movie to date is its beating heart, its unabashed sense of fun, and its fearless commitment to storytelling. It's a splendid spectacle that simultaneously thrills and moves, often leaving viewers laughing one moment and misty-eyed the next.A toast to DC and all the creators! You've raced ahead and set the bar incredibly high with The Flash. Thank you for this gem, a true testament to the phrase 'lights, camera, ACTION!'.

title: Run Barry Run
text: As the series came to an end only this year, the movie was at a great time for fans who wanted to see something more for Flash and Barry Allen. Watching the movie was an awesome way to say hello to Ezra as Flash and say good bye for Grant Gustin.Loved the plotline, was a little different from the original series, but had the same pain behind it. The plot twists were right on point for me and I loved the movie.The backstory and the how he handled the obstacles that he face during the period of trying to right a wrong was true.The acting was brilliant, the visualization was perfect and it slowly was understood what was actually going on.I love the series and the movie!

title: The extra 2 stars are for Keaton's Batman.
text: This movie has had quite the mixed reception with some Hollywood elites calling it a masterpiece, critics generally disliking it and an audience that is divided into extremes. It is either great or just plain trash. I would like to say that the truth is more like somewhere in between. The movie is not the great masterpiece that some people have said it is but it is also not the trash that some people say either. It is in fact quite average albeit with a good story and some touching scenes.While the CGI can be quite wonky I do not see how it is worse than the CGI of many Marvel movies that are often so color graded and washed out to the point where everything feels so dead and sterile. Here at least the time distortion by Flash's perspective makes everything look plastic-like, which I do not mind. (But oh boy, did the babies look bad.)Speaking of Flash, I do not mind Ezra's performance here because he was not as annoying as he was in Justice League 2017. He in fact made me cry a few times. I honestly also do not care what he is doing outside of acting because we would probably end up cancelling more than half of Hollywood and our favorite actors if we do not separate the artist from the private person.Anyway, I was very happy to see Keaton as Batman again. I felt the kind of magic with movies I have not felt since I first watched Batman '89 and that to me is enough to give this movie 2 extra stars. I had my doubts whether or not an aging Keaton would be able to pull it off but not only did he deliver, he also made me laugh, cry and left me in awe.P. S. The only real gripe I have with the movie is the ending. It has to be like one of the worst joke endings I have ever seen so much so that I almost requested a refund.

title: Keaton Soars Even As The Flash Stumbles
text: The DCEU spent a decade stumbling along. Despite a strong start with Man of Steel (even with the issues of its last act), the effort by Warners and DC to AstroTurf a franchise in the style of Marvel never paid off. For a brief time leading to the summer of 2023, it appeared that it might have a chance to right itself with a film that would allow something of a reboot with a plot inspired by one of the company's strongest recent comic stories: the universe altering Flashpoint. With a host of returning actors and callbacks, the long gestating Flash solo film would have the fate of the franchise on its shoulders.Except that it stumbled, crashed, and burned on arrival.Watching all 144 minutes of The Flash, it isn't hard to see how much it deserves all of the roasting that it has received. Something that was clear from the opening "baby shower" sequence that helps to open the film with puns that perhaps even the 1966 Adam West Batman TV series would have hesitated using. From Ezra Miller being alternatively the blandest or most annoying lead of a superhero film this side of Miles Teller in 2015's failed Fantastic Four reboot to some of the most atrocious CGI and green screen work seen in a tentpole studio film with a budget over 200 million dollars, there's plenty to mock The Flash about.That's without getting into the script. Ultimately, the biggest problem with The Flash is that it's not so much a single film as four competing films taking up nearly two and a half hours. Among those are a Flash origin film and an adaptation of the Flashpoint comic plot line, either of which would have worked potentially in their own right but mashed together don't. Even less so when the film also tries to be an Avengers: Endgame style movie for the DECU with all of its callbacks and returning characters. Like so much of the DCEU, The Flash tries to AstroTurf a gamechanger film into the middle of the franchise, all while lacking any of the emotional investment or stakes that the MCU had built up to for Endgame.Only one of those four movies actually kind of works and it's the thing that The Flash, ironically, lives and dies by. That's Michael Keaton's return to the Dark Knight, a role he left behind 29 years earlier. Now, perhaps because of when my own childhood took place, I've never quite shared the nostalgia for Keaton's Batman that it seems many others about my age share. He was good, great even, but Burton's two films with him seemed far more keen about the villains than Keaton as the Dark Knight. That said, Keaton is the heart and soul of this film, the thing that makes it finally pick up at the halfway point and drives things right up to the moment he exits the film. That Keaton was meant to become the front and center of a revived DCEU is clear from the film and which makes it a shame that production issues, shifting release schedules, and finally Warner's own poor decision making robbed him of the chance to deliver upon how bloody good he was here. For a film that's wallowing in nostalgia and trying to use it to glue a film together, Keaton's Batman is the one thing that actually works, even if The Flash suffers from the same problem as Burton's two films: squandering a fantastic Batman to focus on other characters.If you're going to make yourself sit through the nearly two and a half hours that is 2023's The Flash, it's worth seeing for Keaton. Because there isn't much else worth recommending it for, frankly. Which is a shame, but also a fitting epitaph for the DCEU as a whole.

title: bloody Awesome
text: Well i have read reviews about this movie , i thought i might not watch it , and you know what , im so glad i did because it is a total wonder movie , I coudnt see anything there within the movie that was bad , Not ONE thing , Give it a go i enjoyed it and i will watch it again , I loved the way the movie was layed out , alot of ppl didnt get it i have no idea on why that would be maybe they were not old enough to understand a Multiverse , But the way it was done was just wonderful , and omg so funny in parts i had to shake my head and go what the hell that was awesome , And when it came to showing some parts about the mum , i cried , and laughed and had joy at seeing the best Batman there was thank you Mr Keaton for been you , they all seemed to work well together Perfect for me and my family.

title: Most of the reviews here are very generous
text: As someone who has been a fan of this character his whole life, this movie is a massive letdown. Ezra Miller in no way embodies this character. And the studio literally doubled down on his lack of likeability by having him in this movie twice. He turns in a shockingly bad performance as younger Barry. That, compounded by what are largely awful special FX, really sink this movie. At the risk of spoilers, I will leave it at that.The good - Pretty much everything else. Both Michael Keaton and Ben Affleck are great as their respective Batmen. And Sasha Calle is a very solid Supergirl, who hopefully shows up somewhere else in future DC movies.The one thing this movie never touches on, is who the actual villain is. A gaping plot hole, especially for those who have read or watched the animated version of Flashpoint.

title: Big Surprise. Now let's get Nuts.
text:
Absolutely loved this movie from start to finish,was never bothered by bad cgi as I grew up in a era that had lots of bad cgi before JP & T2 came about.So while their still flaws with some of the writing, I had an amazing time with this film.Without spoiling anything with giving a proper review to give it justice,
I was never a fan of Ezra's portrayal of one of my Favourite Superhero Characters I always gave him lots of chances to change my mind and unfortunately he doesn't really grow on you that much in this film.Surprisingly enough he had an amazing scene at the end of the movie that completely makes up for everything.We have our Beloved "89" Batman in full on action the way we all seen him while growing up as kids,
Keaton was the highlight of the entire movie.

title: Another DC disappointment
text: I'm going to keep it simple.... 1) awful story, 2) awful CGI makes it look like a movie from the 90s, 3) only Keaton makes this movie worthwhile, 4) Ezra Miller version of Barry just comes across as an idiot. TV series is so much better.No idea why DC movies are so bad apart from Batman. But this is another to add to the collection. It feels like a B movie with B movie story line and CGI, but a flagship movie budget. The story is just weak, didn't engage me at all. Already covered in the TV series and the TV series did it better.Does anyone know why the DC TV shows are so much better than the movies?

title: Batman and Supergirl are a notable highlight.
text: The movie is good, but I haven't found it outstanding. The script is quite good, and I quite like it. It rationalizes the absence or likely absence of other superhero actors in this DC universe. The logic of the movie is also well-maintained and not too confusing.As expected, Ezra Miller and Michael Keaton did well, especially how Batman showcased his strength and advantage in this film. Batman and Supergirl gave me a thrilling and satisfying experience. Particularly, Supergirl, Sasha Calle, before watching the film, I had seen some images of her on social media, including in the trailer, and I was somewhat worried about this new appearance. However, when watching, I was truly impressed and loved this portrayal. She is captivating and powerful. Trust me, she didn't feel forced like some other film franchises changing the appearance of established characters, but rather it was reasonable.The CGI and special effects might be a drawback in this film. I heard some explanations that intentionally made the 3D effects look like old 3D animation to reduce the graphic violence. However, I still feel that it didn't look great and somewhat disappointing.I would rate the movie at 7.5/10 on IMDB and look forward to other DC productions with the new director, James Gunn.

title: Just don't watch.
text: Watching paint dry is better than watching this train wreck. The special effects are straight outta 2008 video games. I can't believe they launched a movie and expect people to pay for it.Next up, Ezra Miller and young Flash. He acts like he has mental issues. Literal mental issues. I can only picture him acting like that when he did the thing with the child....This is absolutely horrible. The only good thing about this movie is Michael Keaton. Other than that, this p.e.d.0 shouldn't be in any movie, ever. The people who did the CGI have no place in that industry whatsoever, and the people who let this movie be released, should be jailed for stealing our time.

title: The flash review by gurmukh puri
text:
I just saw the movie named the flash which is relise this year this movie content is very good by acting camera angles vfx and story line the director of this Andrés Muschietti is success to show his potential he do his work very perfectly he perfectly used the acting skills of the main lead of this film Ezra Miller
in this movie we can clearly see the ezar miller funny accent and his emotional attachment with his parents the shots of batman is also promising and apart of this the has some surprising cameos in these the one is give me goosebumps I am not say the movie is best in dc universe but overall the movie is nice for one time watch.

title: The flash review
