text: This movie it's one of the best DC and superhero movies in recent years with consistent reasons, it is a history with a lot of heart Wich has a couple of deviations and inconsistencies but never abandons it's main focus, it is engaging, fun, with a drama, humor with that balanced as well as the comic and tragic that purcues on the one hand the young barry and the original but that connects in a good way and they have a good chemistry between them and all the characters of it,a decent script and development of the protagonists help it, the cgi it's the worst element in this movie the most of the time but it can be worst and it doesn't affect to much at the movie,it leaves a good message executed also thanks to supporting characters, plot twists, exposition, etc... A very good movie.

title: Ps5 movie for the simple fanboy nerd.
text: You have already seen this film without seeing it. Yes it's that kind of a terrible movie. Another film for people who miss there mouths when they eat popcorn but if you are around 205 pounds then you will love it.Miller is just a toxic repulsive person on screen and off screen. I don't know how he keeps getting work. No blue hair in this movie which is a good sign but still plenty of other Hollywood nonsense in it for all the simple minds.It feels like the people who made it know that it's terrible but if they put as a many cgi famous peoples faces on bodies they might get away with it and they will for the majority because of how simple DC and Marvel fans are.There's no stopping the lame gravy train of DC films that will continue to come out but I'd give this a miss if you have half a brain cell.

title: Tv show is better
text:
Flash movie review
Andres Muschietti, who previously directed the It movies, now is directing The Flash. It stars Ezra Miller from the Fantastic Beasts franchise, and Justice League, Michael Keaton from Batman and it sequel Batman Returns, Ben Affleck from Batman V Superman and Justice League, Sasha Calle, Kiersey Clemons, Michael Shannon, and Maribel Verdu.Barry Allen (Ezra Miller) goes back in time because he wants to save his mother. In doing so, it creates an alternate timeline. He seeks the help of Batman (Michael Keaton), Super girl (Sasha Calle), and a younger Berry Allen to help undo the mess he created.I like the Flash, Super girl and Batman, so I thought I would like this movie. However, it was too goofy and there wasn't any character development to make me care about what happens.Younger Barry was really immature, once and awhile it made me laugh, but overall it got annoying and repetitive. Older Barry was more mature, yet, still irritating and not very smart. They made Flash out to be a joke similar to how they made Thor look in Love and Thunder.Flash never developed any friendships with anyone, its mentioned how him and Batman are friends but we never see that. He had an opportunity to bond with his younger self, instead all they do is bicker, which I feel, got old after a while.Miller didn't seem like he fit the role as the Flash, I personally like Grant Gustin in the Flash television show. He seems more charming. Keaton didn't ever convince me he used to be Batman, due to the fact he wasn't ever keen on helping them. Out of everyone in this movie Calle's super girl was the only one I kind of liked. She wasn't on screen for long but she seems tough.Since there isn't a meaningful plot, the action scenes feel pointless and drawn out. In my opinion The Flash didn't need to be two hours and 24 minutes. If you want to watch something with the Flash in it, I recommend watching The Flash television show instead.

title: It's official. I'm not am Ezra Miller fan.
text: Decent story, nice action scenes, loved Batmen and Supergirl. But they kulled the character of Barry Allen, I don't know if it's Ezra Miller or the directions given to him to portray this character. But the insecurity is way more annoying and distracting to me than it helps the movie. Even the feeble attempts at humor were too enforced. The only moment Ezra portrays Barry right is when he realizes what he's done and should do.All credits to Michael Keaton. He did a great job. Even his references to the first Batman movie were spot om!I'm not saying you shouldn't watch this movie but as a comic book appreciator, I wanted to see a different Barry.

title: The Definition of Pointless
text: The Flash is the epitome of "hot mess". The script feels like it's jumping between multiple different versions of itself throughout the film, leaving plot holes and unresolved threads littered across the multiverse like so much Hollywood flotsam.Michael Keaton is the only enjoyable member of the cast, but that may only be because I saw his Batman in the theater as a kid. It certainly had all the nostalgia feels and he nailed the role like it was the 3rd movie in his neverwas trilogy. Honorably mention to Sasha Calle. The script did nothing for her, but it feels like she had a lot more to offer than she was given the room for in this so-called "script". Michael Shannon was given nothing to work with at all. I wouldn't blame him for being disappointed with the final product. His Zod deserved better. Ezra Miller waffled wildly between unenjoyable to watch or downright grating. Not great for the movie's lead.The cameos were ... ouch. I don't even know the point of what they were trying to do there. They just didn't work in most cases and ultimately are more galling with who they omitted vs. Included. To top it all off, the CGI/deepfakery was unflattering. Speaking of which...The CGI, at best, is low effort/quality. It's more often just bad and some scenes are truly awful. I don't blame the digital artists. I think they just got "Marveled". Judging by the script/story, it's doubtful they had the time needed to actually complete polished, professional scenes and it shows.In the end, the movie goes nowhere, says nothing, and moves the characters exactly nowhere. Which is convenient, since it's the penultimate "end" of the Snyderverse and has nowhere to actually go. Much like Superman, James Gunn would be best served by just ignoring this entire thing. Kind of like how the producers ignored most of the source material, character development, and common sense. I know I certainly want to forget it ever happened.If you want to see the best non-comic version of the "Flash goes back in time and hoses literally everything" story, check out the animated Justice League: The Flashpoint Paradox. It stays very close to the story and themes of the original (and excellent) comic run, and is well produced, acted, and animated.

title: Better than expected
text: A good mix of action, adventure and comedy. I liked the script, but would have preferred if they followed the comic at least a little closer. Still, this version worked okay. Smart solutions to some problems. Quite a few scenes with funny moments, without it turning overly silly. Some drama scenes that felt very touching. Most of the action scenes felt good and well produced. The movie felt immersive, interesting and had very few slow parts. However, it took a long time to get to the final threat and that part was over quite quickly. Overall I was happy with the movie but even though Ezra Miller tried his best, he still doesn't feel right as Flash. I don't like when they portray Flash as clumsy, socially awkward and inexperienced. Grant Gustin (TV series Flash) would have been better for the role.

title: Not your typical super-hero movie !
text:
This movie had me smiling like an idiot often. It is not your usual super-hero movie and you will be wondering what's coming next many times. It has cameos, it has funny and sad moments and it has impressive action. This is an intelligent movie : the jokes are not for children and don't consider you as a low IQ person. The story goes fast and explores interesting moments. The special effects are not always the best, but they are still better than Marvel's. You will love almost every character you meet and the dorming DC Cinematic Universe fan inside of you will wake up from a never-ending nightmare and wonder : why did they wait so long to do something good ? (Justice League + Man Of Steel aside)
Go watch this great movie and don't read other reviews than mine ! You'll exit the cinema wanting to watch other movies of this caliber.

title: So disappointed
text: Genuinely excited for the film, and there was maybe or two moments of enjoyment, but truly just awful visuals and questionable story choices make this one that's not gonna be rewatched. So disappointed, and the idea that Andy muschetti might direct brave and the bold has me even more worried for the future franchises. Ezra's acting was the highlight and the low of the movie, depending on which Barry they were portraying. Sasha Calle could have been fantastic but was just lackluster and stiff. Keaton was a high point, but still the whole movie could have just done a true live action flashpoint and been much more promising.

title: It's for DC hardcore fans
text: Ok as a DC hardcore fan, for bold things it did during the movie and specially by the end I have to give it a 10.The CGI was not the best, could have been done better.The jokes were good, the emotional moments and drama about her Mom was handled really well.It's not a perfect movie by all means, but I don't think it was made for general public and casual viewers, but hardcores. It has many flaws but overall a good, enjoyable and satisfying ending to this phase of DC while celebrating their previous movies. And even those that were never made!!The acting is very well done, Michael Keaton is doing a great job, Supergirl I think had enough character development as she needed for the small part she was playing in the big picture.

title: Just for Michael Keaton
text: If this was s Batman only movie with Michael Keaton, i wouldn't care about the storyline. It could be a two movie with him just driving around in a Batmobile. I'd give it a 10/10 in a heartbeat.But nevertheless, the movie was about the flash and as poorly as Ezra acts in every other movie, this was no different. His portrait of Barry Allen's persona is terrible. Why must he act like a bimbo is beyond me. Totally ruins the movie and plot, which in itself was dull.The ending is very confusing so it feels like the movie didn't end or it did but didn't have the storyline that you would think it would have. Strange movie. Thankfully I chose not to waste my money on it watching it in cinemas.

title: Really rather impressed
text: I watched this after reading that it had "bombed" so was expecting the usual from DC Universe but actually I really quite enjoyed it. I think it may be one of my favourite DC movies.Despite all the bad press I think Ezra Miller is quite brilliant and Michael Keaton was a god as to be expected.The plot for me was good, cohesive and wraps up well. There were some very funny moments and I found the emotional connection was there especially for anyone who has experienced loss at a young age and had that burning desire to go back and "fix it". Also hats off to Miller for successfully playing two parts, he did it exceptionally well.A lot of people have complained about the special effects but I didn't really notice. All in all I thought it was a good film, I would happily watch it again. I think DC does need to lighten up. The films where it has tried have been the better one. It's always been too serious in comparison to marvel and for that reason has been unsuccessful. Perhaps James Gunn will be able to turn it around but I genuinely think this film is a success.

title: Just got out of the flash movie
text: The 2023 flash movie was very enjoyable for everyone, it was filled with laughs. And it was great for people who like action filled movie it was directed and put together really well; I would definitely recommend it to anyone. The experience that I had had was very comfy. And enjoyable it was a very eye grabbing movie, it is worth the money to go watch the movie, the best experience to watch it in is in theaters to get the full experience. I would definitely watch it agian that is how much I liked the film. This film is a hit for me. I will watch it over and over. Each part was action packed and fun to watch.

title: The Flash - a Saturday afternoon movie
text: The Flash is one of those movies that's ideal for Saturday afternoon, when a mother drop her kids off at the theater for an hour or two, so she can have some ME TIME! This movie is action packed, doesn't make a lot of sense, but kids don't care about sense. There's no sloppy love scenes, just corny lines, and a few seconds of butt scenes, not enough to worry about. I enjoyed the movie on the pure entertainment of the movie. This is another of those movies where script writers and storytellers shouldn't get anywhere near pencil, pen, paper or a laptop. I gave it a rating of ten for it's entertainment factor, the action scenes and being a fan of Ezra Miller and Michael Keaton. Michael Keaton in my estimation was and is the best Batman to ever wear the suit, cape and cowl. If you wanna sit and waste a couple hours, I suggest you watch this movie for the pure entertainment factor without trying to dissect each scene, you'll find, it's not a bad movie.

title: The superhero equivalent of The Room
text: I just got out of a showing of the flash, and I am in utter shock. For most of the movie my mouth was open. I can't believe they released this film in this state. The acting is shocking, Ezra Miller channels Tommy Wiseau . You can tell they are mentally unwell just by the performance alone. The CGI is equally bad and reminds me of the Green lantern movie- and the movie leans hard on these effects. Some of the cameos are cool, but because the effects are that bad it just makes them laughable.I went in the movie with no expectations and came out physically angry because it felt like a waste of time. I have nostalgia for Michael Keaton Batman and even that was hampered but the effects. Tim burton can make a cool practical scene in the 90s - 30 years later we have cgi that looks like a film student did it.Me and the friend I watched it with both fell to sleep multiple times - usually we'd wake each other up- but I thought "let him sleep- he's not missing anything." The only redeeming think I can think of is that I look forward to the countless memes that come from this movie.I don't write many reviews but this movie forced me- I've seen many articles - "Stephen King and Tom cruise saw the movie early and loved it", " the greatest superhero movie ever made" - how much has DC paid these people?

title: Absalutly brilliant loved every minute
text: I initially only wanted to watch this because Michael keaton has and always will be my batman I however loved all of it ever minute best dc movie I have seen in a long time definitely 1000 percent better than both versions of the justice league in my opinion.The only thing I feel bad about is we won't get another dc movie like this one now as for some reason the heads of the dc cinematic universe seems to not be able to commit to anything and in the process will loose all faith the fans have in them. Sorry this did so badly when it was so good. Thanks for one last big bang from Michael keaton.

title: Refreshing and nostalgic surprises
text: First of all, I love that this isn't a Marvel-gay agenda movie. That said, you can securely bring your family to the theaters without being in a constant worry of telling your children to close their eyes every 10 minutes or having to later go home to have long and difficult conversations with your 10 yo kids.Lots of action, genuine and has some nostalgic surprises.Keaton definitely is one of my favorite Batman, and has a great fighting sequence. Great story and good ending.Some GCI are kind of lame, but nothing that compromises the movie as a hole.The post credit scene isn't worth the wait. You can leave the place and latter check it on YouTube.

title: Ezra Miller can't outrun this
text: Ezra Miller can't outrun their horrible offscreen actions even as The Flash. This is being tested as Ezra Miller's make or break moment and Ezra Miller needs to pay the consequences for their creul and abhorrent actions. It's not even a one and done. They kept doing more actions later as they continued to believe they're a huge star and therefore untouchable. If this movie brings in a lot of money that would only solidify that feeling and might allow DC to make Ezra Miller's Flash role a permanent and reuccuring character.DC can explore options to bring in Grant Gustin or literally any other actor as The Flash. They can just swap actors outright or from an alternate reality if they want to bake it into the storyline.Go and watch Spider-Man: Across the Spider-verse which is the outstanding Marvel/Sony movie The Flash is opening against and one of the best superhero movies created to date in my opinion. Please wait wait till this movie comes out on a steaming platform or find some other means of watching it where it doesn't help to solidify Miller's Flash role.

title: Best Batman Movie EVER!
text: Best, most entertaining Batman scenes ever! The difference? Dry Daylight Batman! Keaton freakin' RAWKS! It's Batman as we wanna see him: butt-kickin', gadget-flingin', smart-alec, and rich geniusin' goodness! Ezra does a great job playin' his parts, no matter what people say or think. It's an awesome superhero movie with all the eggs and cameos! Best DC has put up since Bats 89! I really did like the way they did the Flash's story. Too little of Iris, tho. She felt like an afterthought. Glad they improved Flash's run animation, and the jokes were much better, but in some places the CGArt was way wonky looking. Took away from the overall quality of the movie. Looking forward to seeing what they do next!

title: Nightmare City
text: The Flashpoint Paradox follows child groomer Barry Allen, twice, but also eventually three times, as they go all-in on Hollywood's dead-mommy=character writing fetish by making it their life's work to resurrect their dead mom. Lucky for Barry, he also resurrects Christopher Reeves, Adam West, and George Reeves, ushering in the advent of truly believable AI voices synced with dead-on realistic deepfake technology that audiences will surely come to love looking at for decades and decades and decades, and even decades, to cum. Ben Afflect shines as a Batman, finally getting to enjoy the fruitbats of his labors by getting to play the caped crusader in a production that doesn't shatter into a bajillion pieces during it's post-production period; it goes off without a hitch, as he is highlighted as the dominant Batman/Bruce Wayne, to which I'm sure has left Afflect very satisfied with how he's spent nearly the past decade of his life. Nic Cage reprises his role as Barry's Uncle, Dad, and Clooners is BACK as Superman IV. Zod brings da heat! Born again Flashheads will flock to theaters this Father's Day weekend to witness what only the CEO of Warner Bros has described as "the greatest superhero movie ever." The film is on track to surpass the $1billion mark after only 4 days, making it the greatest thing to ever happen to humans in the history of forever. But analytics by the studios' marketing team already shows that the inevitable sequels are on track to being even greater, making them greater than the greatest thing to ever happen to humans in the history of forever. So come on! Join Barry Allen, again, and finally become happy. Life is approximately 75 years, and then you're worm food. Are you REALLY guna waste all that time and NOT watch our Flash movie????!I mean, *their Flash movie...

title: Too many determined not to like it
text: There are clearly far too many folk determined to rubbish this - marvel fan bits who will give doctor strange 10/10 and yes - Millar for all the right reasons is not a popular person - It's tons of fun - it's a Flash movie - just sit back and enjoy it - this film will stand up to repeated viewing - cinema numbers may be low but when you look at the garbage that Netflix makes and green lights sequels to based on streaming numbers alone - if this was streaming - millions would watch and watch again - then we'd get the new Batman film as well. Michael Keaton is superb - always is - it's got heart and humour. Chill out - put your brain in neutral and enjoy it.

title: I don't know what you people saw but.......
text: I just left the theatre where 3 people around me had to be woke up from their sleep by the person they were with. I dozed off several times. Maybe I'm not into the DC universe, the story was difficult to follow - at times silly, at times down-right stupid and at times, plagiaristic. The main (?) plot of the story appeared to center on the death of the Flash's mother - it bookends the movie. But you never are given a clue as to the resolution of that. Then you have the very obvious error where someone dies in the middle of the film which should have ever lasting effects on the balance of the film, but oh well - not sure how that one ends up. On top of that, they parade thru every person whos ever donned a DC superhero outfit - even Nicholas Cage. Nicholas Cage????? Please! EF are fair; acting is marginal; story and screenplay are poor at best. Someone should look up the meaning of continuity. Advice: don't waste your money, it will be on TV in 45 days.

title: Loved it! Perfect Theatre material! Must watch in theatres
text: The Best Superhero Movie of the year and ever. Don't judge the movie by some haters doing with few poor cgi shorts. This movie has Fantastic visual effects. The Flash is a perfect crowd pleaser. If you love your mother you will love it. I would recommend this movie for people who lost their mother and searching or trying for healing from the loss. Some poor cgi issue is there but many places cgi is mind blowing. Enjoyed with family loved it! The Flash Movie is the best superhero movie ever made. The best CBM of the year. Clears the Spider-Man no way home. This year is sealed by DC.Let's hope the best for DCU future.

title: Not perfect, but a damn great movie
text: Dc really needed The Flash movie to deliver and did it? I think it delivered and then some. The movie is a giant love letter to DC and you can tell Andy took time to direct the first 2 acts almost perfectly. The third act however, is just ok. It kind of didn't make too much sense but the first two acts complement the third one. Most of the comedy lands, the emotion is on 100 in this movie, but that's not to say this movie doesn't have any faults. The biggest fault I can say is the abysmal CGI. The CGI is plain hideous and disgusting. They didn't try with it, but if you can look past the sloppy CGI, you can see a great CBM and a movie that hits all the checks.

title: Worst movie I have watched in my life
text: I came with high expectations due to loving the flash tv show from the CW. With great actors such as Grant Gustin, Candice Patton, Carlos Valdes, Daniela Panabaker,Tom Cavanagh, Jesse Martin, among others. The actors from this movie, with the respect they reserve were super poor. First time in my life I fall asleep, there was no trama, no story behind, just scenes happening, I paid for my cinema ticket and my train transportation to the cinema for no reason. One of the worst decisions of my life. You made Barry in this movie as if he was totally brainless as a human or too nerd, that someone would get annoyed or bored by watching it. No action showed in the movie. Seems like you needed to add Batman and superwoman to try to make it better because it was not enough for you. I would like to get my money back after this disappointment. I don't know what where the expectations from the production side when the movie was finished filming or edited. I ended up very upset for the disappointment of such a bad movie and even left 30 minutes before because didn't make sense keep watching something so boring.

title: Pure garbage!
text: Why was this film even made?The basic story, an adaptation of the 'Flashpoint' stortline in the DC comics, was covered in the third season of the CW's TV adaptation.As for the appearance of so many different characters and actors reprising their roles, it makes this an appaling presentation of the characters portrayed. The main actor, Ezra Miller, has little talent as an actor, as his portrayal (yes, HIS) in Justice League proved.Re-hashing Affleck's version of the Dark Knight, is also evidence that the producers didn't care about the characters, given his portrayal of Daredevil in the film, let alone his appaling take of Batman in previous films!The inclusion of the late actors Christopher Reeve and Adam West as their versions of Superman and Batman, are terrible tributes to both actors.

title: A Fitting end for the DCEU
text: The Flash...what can I say? It was pretty great!First and foremost, Ezra was actually really phenomenal in this movie. The worry I have is when we are dealing with multiversal storylines, we typically would be getting more cameos and nostalgia rather than an actual story with character growth and story progression. We do have the nostalgia obviously with Michael Keaton returning as Batman, but I'm glad to say that the nostalgia doesn't cloud Ezra's performance. This movie made me go from appreciating his character, to loving his character.Like I said Keaton returns and while his character was fun to see again, I was surprised with how sparingly he was used in this movie. He does have some cool action sequences though.I do wish we got a little bit more of Sasha Coelle as Supergirl. She was still a stand out regardless.Overall the film does a good job balancing the multiversal side of the DCEU while delivering a great story with heart pounding action. While the DCEU may be coming to an end, I'm glad that we at least ended (at least in my opinion) on a high note. Easily within the top 5 best DCEU films I've seen, and a well executed multiversal film.

title: Obsessed actually.
text: This movie is great. The effects were amazing, and the acting is so good. I love Barry so much, both of them, and supergirl was awesome. I hope this continues to get the ratings it deserves and gets a sequel. Hilarious. I would and probably will watch this multiple times. The running scenes are so cool and fun to watch, this movie even got me ranting about the sound effects. This movie made me feel like every emotion, I liked this more than so many of the recent Marvel movies and I'm a marvel fan. That movie! I can't! I'll spare y'all my rant about how good looking people are too but the whole movie, everything about it, 10/10.

title: Honestly wouldn't recommend
text: At a time when comic book movies are already becoming very played-out, you'd think these studios would try to create something different from the usual cookie cutter format we've become accustomed to receiving. Alas, The Flash doesn't deliver in that respect (or in many others).In short, the plot is quite predictable (which could be forgiven if the movie was still exciting to watch and looked great visually), the acting is hammy and quite over the top, and the CGI is honestly laughably bad - it really takes you out of the moment each time a big CGI scene is playing (particularly the fight with Zod).It all just comes across as quite rushed and cobbled together, and I wouldn't recommend even to hardcore DC fans.

title: Awesome superhero movie - Top notch family fun
text:
A beautiful super hero movie of top quality befitting Warner Bros. Director Andy Muschietti did a great job and the cast containing Ben Affleck, Ezra Miller, Michael Keaton and Sasha Calle was great. It had everything you look for in a movie - Emotions, Suspense, Thrill, Special effects and rapid action. Loved the idea of the protagonist who loves his family. Finally a good ending. The movie was gripping, moved fast and did not lag. I had total fun and would surely be
watching it again. I saw good number of families with kids around me watching this movie in the theater. Yes, a total family movie indeed with no vulgarity, nudity etc.

title: Zoom on out this weekend and enjoy seeing The Flash.
text:
The Flash is a solid A- for many reasonsThe Good: Lots of nostalgia, a good story, an explainable multiverse. Ezra did really good. So did most of the others. Often it was funny without being over the top, that charm was tempered by heart tugging tones too. All done well, not perfect, but really well.The Not-So-Good: CGI early was a bit lacking, and then again later. Both within calamity/action scenes. And while I didn't care for the acting sometimes around the gal from Krypton, we can chalk that up to having big boots to fill.Bonus, with all the movie posters I've seen online for the film, the freebie one we got was the IMAX version. Still cool.If you know Batman history, it delivers. If you know Superman history, it delivers. If you know The Flash history, it delivers.The only indirect spoiler... and it's a tiny one... is...

Indirect Tiny Spoiler in
3

... if you know Superman history, even the never-produced film (and even deeper, why) there's a lot of cool there actually. Most occurring later in the film, I counted no fewer than four iterations of Kal-El.If you know Batman history, including most of the produced films, there's a lot of cool there too. I counted no fewer than four iterations of the Caped Crusader. Maybe I missed one?Same for the Flash and his history. I counted no fewer than four iterations of the Flash making speedy appearances too.All in all, we're not watching a Mona Lisa in action. Zoom on out this weekend and enjoy seeing The Flash.

title: A Less Than Thrilling Tale of Speed and Time.
text: The Flash is a movie that offers acceptable action sequences but ultimately falls flat due to a mediocre storyline and a less than satisfying ending.Ezra Miller's performance is something that in a better-constructed film would be a highlight. However in this movie it feels like a shining light in an otherwise drab environment. There's no denying Miller's solid acting in the role, however even his performance can't save the movie from its faulty narrative. The lack of depth and exciting script hinders his ability to truly shine in the role. Everyone else is similarly fine in their role with no standout poor performances. However nothing stands out as great and this maybe more down to the story than anything else.The special effects team did a decent job of showcasing the Flash's super-speed abilities. Whether it's running up a building or battling a horde of villains, the Flash's super-speed is presented in a way that is both acceptable and at times visually impressive. However, the choreography and execution of the action scenes lack the wow factor that you may have come to expect from this genre. The sequences feel formulaic failing to leave a lasting impression or generate genuine excitement.The story has an overly complicated narrative that involves time travel, parallel universes and a host of other elements that make for a convoluted and confusing viewing experience. It's a classic case of a film trying to do too much and consequently achieving too little. The intriguing concepts are poorly executed, resulting in a convoluted and confusing plot that fails to engage le you fully. The story lacks a clear direction and fails to fully explore the potential of the consequences they could have on the world around him. It feels like a missed opportunity to delve deeper into the complexities of the character and his universe.Without giving away spoilers, the conclusion feels rushed and underwhelming. The build-up to the climax is poorly executed and the resolution of the main conflict feels unsatisfying and anticlimactic. It leaves you with a sense of dissatisfaction. The emotional connections and relationships between the characters feel shallow and unexplored, further diminishing the impact of the story. This lack of character development hampers the film's ability to create a meaningful and lasting impression after the credits roll.Overall, the movie has a decent enough performance from Ezra Miller but fails to deliver a compelling and interesting story. It's a film that will likely appeal to die-hard fans of the Flash franchise (or DC in general), but for casual viewers it may prove to be a confusing and ultimately unsatisfying viewing experience.4/10.

title: Best superhero movie of the year?
text: Been waiting for this movie for years to come out, but it always got delayed. Movie was refreshing comparing to what marvel have been putting out lately. Not too many pushed jokes or "superheroing is easy" atmosphere. Felt good to have some cold hard action and stunning visuals. Definitely something for hard DC fans (lot's of easter eggs) or something for who hears about the flash for the first time.Movie felt like Spiderman: No way home where you are able to see your childhood hero's once again on the big screen but this movie felt more logical and emotional comparing to that.Overall i enjoyed it, definitely recommend seeing it on the big screen.

title: VERY Very Good!!!
text: Look - Ezra Milller controversies aside - you'd be hard pressed to make a better Super Hero movie than this. This was very well done. Everything in it - the story, the acting, the effects and especially ALL THE CHARACTERS - all the intertwined generations of action stars...is amazing. This is really very very well done and it's a super enjoyable Super Hero movie. I don't care who you are...this one is definitely one of the best of all times. Ezra does a great job in the movie too...it's sad is off-screen behavior has tainted this so much. But cast that aside and enjoy it for what it is...it's really a great movie!

title: BEST DCU Movie EVER!
text: I myself prefer MARVEL and the entire MCU - OVER DCU!I quite strongly believe that this must be the BEST DCU Movie EVER!!I have JUST rewatched it and will probably Watch it again a third time, in a month or two!Because the STORY IS so good, detailed and with mind-boggling time paradoxes!AND THIS is what makes this film so good!IMNSHO - THIS CAN measure up to the BEST MARVEL films!IF YOU have NOT seen it - THEN DO!DC Films tend to be too serious, too broody!NOT IN a cerebral way, but more like in a sulking teenager way!NONE OF THAT HERE!THIS film has LOADS OF - TONGUE IN CHEEK kind of humour and does not take it self to seriously!THESE SCREENWRITERS DESERVE EVERY PENNY!THEIR Writing is SO GOOD - that this could have been BRITISH!A STRONG STORY Combining American glee and playfulness with SOLID WRITING!9 out of 10!

title: DC goes all meta ala Marvel with a dexterous turn by Miller and a welcome back reprise from Keaton
text: THE FLASH (2023) ***1/2 Ezra Miller, Michael Keaton, Sasha Kalle, Michael Shannon, Ron Livingston, Maribel Verdu, Kiersey Clemons, Jeremy Irons, Ben Affleck, Gal Gadot. Miller gives knew meaning to the word dexterity as the dual (or actual triple) roles as Barry Allen and his titular alter ego whose burden of attempting to prove his father's (Livingston) innocence in the murder of his mother (Verdu) which culminates in his ability to time travel via his gifts of super speed whereby the parallel universe proves to indeed be a trixy paradox but gets able support from his 'other me' and Bruce Wayne (Keaton reprising his iconic role after 30 years and providing enough full body chills for the film's inception) to stop General Zod (Shannon) from wiping out the Earth's populace (again). While the visuals are often hit/miss (more on the hit but there's some dodginess particularly the 'baby shower' set piece)and eye-popping when viewed in IMAX the simple giddy pleasures of seeing Keaton's Dark Knight returning full impact with Danny Elfman's 'Batman March' is pure cinematic Heaven's Delight. (Dir: Andy Muschietti)

title: Flash Flawed But No Flop
text: In fact, it may very well be the best of the DC franchise thanks to some remarkable performances from Miller (playing a version of Barry Allen that has no relation to the comic) and Keaton (surprising us again with his unironic take on Batman). Yes, it is seriously and unexplainably flawed by ridiculously poor choices involving shockingly poor production values and CGI effects mostly. A whole segment that conceptually seemed to be a brilliant idea should have instead been left for the deleted scenes extras for the inevidable video release. It will piss you off a bit but the performances and committment to a fairly thoughtful and even progressive storyline are that good that you'll get over it. Is Miller's performance academy worthy? Yup. But the other highlight is the actress who plays Supergirl. Had she had more scenes she would have stolen the movie. All in all a perfect summer fun time movie event!

title: Jumbled Mess of a Movie Like Crushed Tomatoes Going Splat w Overlong Battle Scenes and Unresolved Issues
text: The idea of time streams is a complex one, and whether crushed tomatoes are placed on a certain shelf in a grocery store changes the entire history of the world. But here, 75% of the movie consists of long battle and action sequences of the CGI variety which go on way too long and didn't further the story much. At one point it appeared like a video game, most of which I had seen before. Actual story made up about 25% of the film. An aging Batman/Bruce Wayne, played by Michael Keaton reprising his role of 30 years ago, tries to explain the time stream stuff. And get this: he uses the analogy of crushed tomatoes on top of bad spaghetti! (Keaton's reappearance as Batman/Wayne was my favorite aspect of the movie,) But how the time stream stuff works is never fully explained which made me think the screenwriters hadn't really thought it all through.The story has two plots. The first which we learn pretty quickly so I'm not giving anything away is that the Flash's mom had been murdered and his father has been unjustly accused of the crime. He goes back in time to try to "fix" what happened. But his changing of history has dire consequences. But these consequences have not just Earth-changing significances but also change some of the history of the Universe!The second plot appears in about the middle of the movie, and as far as I can tell, comes into being because of the changing of history. However, this is never fully explained. This second plot was far too underdeveloped to be completely comprehensible and in some ways I found I didn't really care too much about it.. Without giving too much away, it involves the appearance of General Zod, who unlike the first two Superman movies with Christopher Reeve, is more like a cross between Vladimir Harkonnen of "Dune" and the Incredible Hulk. My problem with this portrayal of Zod is that it was flat and uninteresting. Terence Stamp in the first two Reeve Superman movies made his character highly interesting and appealing. Here he's just a slobbering hulk.The biggest flaws of this movie: the baddie and his subplot are under-developed, the characters were not developed enough for me to care about them, and the action sequences were far too long and did almost nothing to further the plot. At many points I was waiting in rapt anticipation for the end of the sequence. Even a great action sequence with CGI has to further the story in some way. If it's just action for the sake of action because studio execs think that's what the 14-to-24 crowd wants, it's a bad storytelling decision.While I liked Keaton's reappearance as Batman, the only aspect which I found entertaining, I felt the overall movie was so in your face in the action department and lacking in story development, I have no desire to see this film again. Yes there are a lot of complex ideas in this film, but a story has to explain them and spend a bit of time letting the audience understand, instead of having superheroes zooming around all over the place going after super-baddies.In the end, I found myself not really caring that much about the characters which is often the ultimate point of any story. In the first Reeve Superman movie, when Superman finally brings up the dead Lois Lane from her car stuck in the ground, we were on the verge of tears. Here I was like, yeah? There are references to other Superheros in the DC Universe and images of other actors playing the roles of Superman and Batman. At one point it was getting a bit much like this was a homage to the whole DC/Warner Brothers franchise. But Zod is not like the Terence Stamp version, my favorite portrayal, and was just not interesting enough to care one or the other. I have no desire to see this movie again and I doubt whether it will be released in a 25th-anniversary edition a quarter century from now.

title: The best of the DC standalone films after the reborn Justice League
text: With Zack Snyder's Justice League on top, and The Batman (with Pattinson) as the darkly best of the many Batman films, Ezra Miller steals the league in the Flash. Ezra is endearing, sometimes obnoxious, always loving, and brings the funny and charming. He's just great. This film is excellent! I went to a matinee alone with absolutely no expectations, and I'm so glad I did. I loved it. The Flash is wildly entertaining in a perfectly balanced way. Action (despite a weird CGI baby or three), compelling family drama, comedic moments, and envelope pushing super hero science fiction that juuust keeps it both plausible - keeping in mind this is a guy who can "run" the speed of light - and exciting. And these fantastic physics bring into the story arc a cast of likable new familiars that aren't just gratuitous walk ons, but integral to the Flash. And to their own separate stories, which you WILL think about after seeing this movie. It finishes on a twist. Not a cliffhanger, but a twist that leaves future casting potentially fluid, which is something these actors are ok with eventually. You can't play Doctor Who forever now, can you?The Flash sets a new bar to the DC world standalone films, in my opinion. Much more fun than Superman, Aquaman, Wonder Woman, and every Batman but the latest one. Now bring back the Justice League, and don't beat these solo films into the dirt.

title: BADASS SCENES WITH ALOT OF HUMOUR AND EMOTIONAL SCENES! True masterpiece.
text: Today I watched the new Flash movie on cinema with iSense,Dolby atmos. And let me just begin with saying «WOOW»! I never tought that this movie would have the potensial to make us feel like we were in it and to build a so great story!The beginning of the movie started a bit off but with many cool scenes until he travels back in time and meet himself in another universe. After that the movie introduced us to a new co-main character if we can call it that. The friendship between these two startet growing and growing from The flash perspective seeing him as an annoying little kid to his loving little brother.But everything is about flash from the start trying to go back in time to save his mom from being murdered. And realized that time travel have consequences...I won't say alot about the movie becaue it is worth seeing it on CINEMA! And alot of the music and the action scenes gave me goosebumps!

title: Victim of Gunn and WB
text: Warner Brothers made huge mistake ignoring the SnyderVerse. Gunn further destroyed the prospect by announcing a full reboot even when the movies from SnyderVerse were still to be released. The Flash isn't half bad but it suffers from the mistakes of the studio.Of course the CGI isn't that great but audiences can forgive it but they can't forgive the fact that the irrelevance of the movie. Without SnyderVerse it's a rudderless ship. I fear the fate of Aquaman might also be the same.Now come to the performance of Azra miller, which was mediocre at best, way below his performance in ZSJL. I fear for the future of DCU because unless they let Snyder finish the SnyderVerse Darkseid saga, make Man of Steel sequels and solo Batfleck movie, fans will continue to Boycott.

title: Flawed but overall just such a fun time
text: I think The Flash is a really unique superhero movie. It plays with the ever increasingly familiar multi-verse trope yet to me it wasn't a cliched story. There was a genuine heart and emotion underneath all these, frankly, stunning, distinctive yet somewhat overwhelmingly bombastic visuals. The story, I felt, was quite messy yet strangely I didn't feel it hindered my enjoyment of the film. I was invested in the characters and their goals and their wants and their histories.It's not the type of film you go into and just turn off your brain and watch and enjoy. You do need to pay attention to what is happening on screen, and it can help to have a bit of knowledge of the wider DCEU, but I feel most people could go into this and find something they enjoyed - be it the story, the humour, the characters, the visuals, the action set-pieces or the surprisingly large amount of fan-service moments throughout.Talking of fan-service, without giving away too much info, in the third act of the film I was just so enjoying what and who I was seeing that I was kind of forgiving the film's shortcomings.The Flash is flawed, yes, but it's really entertaining and a great way to just enjoy a movie. It's got the epic scale, it's got the characters, it's got the (mostly) decent story. It was just a joy to watch in my opinion.

title: PLEASE DCEU just give up!!
text: Didn't think the DCEU could get any worse, but clearly I was wrong. I'm convinced the writers were high on flakka along with the CGI artists. Let alone the coked up producers who thought this absurd abomination was worthy of a nod by Geoff Johns. How could any still g respecting Flash fan give this anything more than a 2. The contrived acting by Miller, the overweight been Affleck, and this tepid and insipid reinterpretation of a dark and gritty Flash story makes this possibly the waist film I've seen in the DCEU possibly the genre.I personally think DC should give up on the DCEU and stick to animation.

title: Cringeworthy
text: The lowest of the low slapstick for about half the movie. I cannot fathom the current average rating of 7 for a movie that has no soul and feels like the superhero equivalent of a laurel and hardy clip.Either people have become overall completely moronic or simply lost all their standards about what a good movie is. Sure there is some adult supervision from Batman, but damn is this flat. I more and more get the feeling like the reality from Ideocracy comes closer every year.Please simply do not watch and do something interesting with your time. Anything. Anything at all. To even have writers for something like that blows my mind.

title: Back to the Future
text: I am not a fan of superhero movies. I found this one to be quite refreshing and original thought. It has a really strong engaging story that takes a route that other superhero flicks dont. Its focus was on story, humor and heart rather then special effects.Which is great, because the special effects sucked. I mean honestly what the heck is going on? Did hollywood start using a new engine for their CGI? Because lately these superhero movies look more like airbrushed ps3 video games.No yeah i really enjoyed it though. It was really fun and pretty funny. It carried a lot of heart with it. Had a sweet heartbreaking message to go along with it all. For a superhero movie its one of the best of the past 5 years.

title: For those about to be entertained
text: I got what I was after, thoroughly entertained.For starters, I enjoy what Ezra Miller brings to the screen.Sasha Calle played her part so well, just a tad dark as was woven into the story.Seeing Michael Keaton reprising his 80's role was such a great twist.Overall I thought the story was clever, packed with close to a century of pop culture references, the Flash variants (e.g. Jay Garrick) and the graphic incarnations of other characters evoked a lifetime of positive emotions.I've since watched this from a streaming platform and I just do not understand the trolling nature from some of the negative reviews. I agree that some of the CGI was 20 y.o. Tech, most likely subject to budgetary compromises, yet the focus on the quality of the character's faces was extremely cool.I was confused by one of the character variants so my son got me to watch the video of Kevin Smith talking about his Superman script, hilarious entertainment in itself.If I could offer a recommendation: Grab some popcorn, open your mind to a brief escape and enjoy the show. Make sure to watch it to the end of the credits as well.

title: i couldn't finish the movie: DISAPPOINTED
text: The visual effects are too bad the acting is terrible!! Its too cliche and awful. The visual effects look like they were from the early 00s and ezra miller is a terrible cast for such an amazing character of a superhero!He doesn't have the charisma to carry such a role nor does his acting is close to being good. His goofy personality in the movie is ruining it for me.If you wanna see a great DC movie go see the flashpoint paradox, its an animated movie but by far better than this garbage of a film.Dc wasted so much potential on a subpar actor and bad directing. If this pitch was given to Marvel, the least they could've done was to deliver great visuals.DISAPPOINTING.

title: Recommended movie
text: The story is simple but the scene process is not simple, not made in a hurry, every frame to frame is very enjoyable, packed neatly and impressively.The drama side is quite emotional, + the comedic inserts are really funny, not crunchy.+ visually stunning super action scenes that will make it memorable and not disappoint.Appreciation for Ezra Miller (Flash) who plays 2 characters Barry Allen (Flash) at the same time, we give a total thumbs up.Don't forget that Batman looks dashing and badass when he fights+vitamin Appearance SuperGirl (Sasha Calle) is also sexy and wildly cute, shining, even though the portion is not much, her appearance is still cool and steals attention.I thought it was normal, it turned out to be an extraordinary film, really good, exciting, entertaining and highly recommended.This is one of my favorite films in 2023 and is the best DC COMICS (DCEU) film in my opinion.

title: End of an Era went with a fiz, instead of a flash
text: Not even Keaton could have saved this film. The plot had no focal point as there wasn't really a main villain or sense of peril for the world or characters. The cgi was laughable, Ezra was just as unlikeable as in the other films, which begs the question of where did the budget go to and why was this film delayed so many times?Kara felt like an after thought cause by the end of the movie, I didn't care what happened to her as the character was paper thin.Aside from those points, it does do alot of fan service so worth at least a watch, especially for the versions of Superman through the years (there is a super special one so keep youreyes out for it). Otherwise skip it and just watch the animated version of flash point.

title: WOW...very emotional
text: I watched The Flash in IMAX and it was nice. This resulted in bright images, especially the galaxy, projected by dual projectors on the giant 42 feet high, 65 feet wide screen of IMAX, completely using the whole screen with a slight chopping of the picture. The images are larger than life. Although they don't confuse the eye but I am still having a strain. Along with 12,000 Watts IMAX proprietary sound system that was used very well for the sound editing!It had a lot of moments. Michael Keaton stole the show. I loved his scene at the end. Needs to improve the time space visuals, though!Would like to see a sequel.

title: Bottom line: Fun movie
text: I was about to pass up this movie because I've seen negative press from sources on youtube I generally agree with most of the time.I'm glad I didn't pass it up.While I don't disagree with many of the points being made, I still really enjoyed the movie. I thought there were good character arcs. For example, ALL of the flashes ultimately realizing the importance of the lessons they learned from Mom. There were scenes that set up later important plot points, etc. Plus I have a weakness for the time paradox plot devices. :-)The biggest disappointment for me would be the opening scene. The made the flash whine & complain about the work he was doing. Why not make the character likeable? He's seen some serious stuff, wouldn't he be more mature by now? Or, alternatively why not make him out to be having fun with this powers & enjoy every last thing he gets to do? Also, it was like they were trying to copy Quicksilver's scene from Age of Ultron, but failed. I can't put my finger on it, but, it just wasn't cool like quicksilver's scene.

title: End Of An Era - The Flash is goodbye to DCEU fans
text: #TheFlashMovie was a damn good experience. The film captures moments of joy and emotion that resonate deeply. Sure, there are some valid concerns about the CGI, but don't let that deter you from giving it a shot. Trust me, it's worth it. Ezra Miller truly shines as an actor, showcasing his range and versatility in the role. And let's not forget the unique concept of the multiverse brought to life by director Andy, which adds a refreshing and enjoyable element to the film. Sasha shines as supergirl, it was a great time seeing Michael Keaton back as Batman. Additionally, I have a few concerns to share. Firstly, Sasha's role as Supergirl felt somewhat underutilized, leaving me wishing for more screen time and development for her character. The climax of the film didn't have the impact I was hoping for. While the story held promise, it lacked the intensity and sense of a life-or-death challenge that truly engages viewers. And let's not forget the CGI, which remains a significant concern. It often fell short of expectations and detracted from the overall immersion of the movie. While #TheFlashMovie has its merits, these issues are worth considering. Despite my reservations, it's still worth giving it a watch if you're a fan of the franchise. Hopefully, future installments will address these shortcomings. Overall, I highly recommend giving The Flash Movie a chance. It's a feel-good ride that will leave you wanting more. Kudos to the cast and crew for delivering an entertaining and memorable cinematic experience.

title: The DCEU's Death Rattle
text: Unfunny, dull, illogical, the antithesis of captivating storytelling. There a lot of ways to describe this corporate product. Rest assured "decent" isn't one of them.At the very least you can hardly make an argument for it being squandered potential, since every single piece of this incredibly lame jigsaw puzzle is broken at it's core.The CGI is genuinely ghastly, and truly embarrassing at times. With the exception of maybe five shots, everything looks utterly artificial, and beyond fake. There are moments where you have to wonder whether, or not it's actually some kind of elaborate meta joke. "Am I supposed to laugh at the disgustingly obvious CGI tears? The music certainly doesn't seem to imply so."The funniest parts are definitely every time the filmmakers try to convince the audience, that there are real emotions being displayed, while most of the cast has a permanently frozen look of boredom, with a hefty dose of apathy on their faces.Unfortunately for anyone like myself, who really appreciates a good disasterpiece, after the 10 minute mark even any surface level ironic enjoyment comes to a screeching halt.At that point most of what we're shown is the powerfully cringe inducing performance by our lead actor, which one might be able to withstand, if it wasn't for the literal doubling down of having two Flashes interacting with one another for most of this poorly conceived SNL skit. It's really as painful as it sounds.This one is a perfect example of a vacuum cleaning movie. As long as most of your senses are preoccupied with noisy housework, you'll have a pleasant viewing experience.Just don't gaze into this thing too long, otherwise this thing might gaze into you.

title: The Flash
text: Ezra was amazing as Flash, Batman was Batman of course. Supergirl was a nice change and the movie was overall great!! The Flash was a great movie for the DC Universe, I'm going to miss those characters and really glad that the movie was this enjoyable. Got to see it in Dolby Atmos in the Theaters and my chair shook from the sound effects, it was awesome! Living as a kid from 80's getting to see my hero's on the big screen that I read in the comics is just the best, sometimes it gets to be too much, but I'm glad they are still coming out and know finally breaking away from the token ones and making movies about new hero's and villains.

title: OVERHATED
text: This movie is just lovely and out of all the movies in the superhero genre that explain the multiversal shenanigans, the Flash actually gives a fantastic explanation and simplify it for the audience. I shed tears during the final moments in the grocery store because it was really powerful. The dynamic between young and adult Barry was fantastic. I know people are doubtful or boycott the movie because of the actions of Ezra Miller, but if you know how to separate the art and the actor, then you'll be able to enjoy the film without nitpicks and bias. Michael Keaton and Sasha Calle as Batman and Supergirl was FANTASTIC. The CG is forgivable as long as you don't nitpick every single scene in the film. Overall, this was a fantastic film and one that I will keep on rewatching for years to come!

title: One of DC's Best
text: This is one of the best DCEU movies. The acting and emotions carried the story in this movie. Ezra miller is a fantastic actor and I would have loved to see him in future flash projects when he is mentally stable again. Andrea mushetti has some of the best cinematography in this movie from the time stopping to the fighting of the young Barry justice league team. The actress for Supergirl is a star and I hope we see more of her in James Gunn new universe and also she plays a main role in the upcoming DCU movie Supergirl women of tomorrow. The only down thing about this movie was the CGI, which was mediocre, but not terrible. Apart from that this movie was amazing 🔥🔥🔥

title: DC fails yet again at trying to copy Marvel
text: I'll start by stating that I am not a DC movies fan. Zak Snyder is possibly the worst director on the face of the planet. So when I heard he wasn't attached to this and that they were doing the Flash Point Paradox I genuinely let myself get excited for this film. Oh how misguided I was.I don't know who it is at DC that thinks you need to CGI 98.3% of their film, but YOU REALLY DON'T! Cgi people fighting cgi aliens while cgi vehicles shoot at each other on a cgi desert. Its genuinely dreadful.The worst part is that the story is pretty good. As is the dialogue. But it's like they went out of their way to emulate Snyder's terrible film making style.They've also tried to introduce the concept of a multiverse. Something that Marvel managed to do spectacularly well but these guys have once again failed miserably.Please for the love of god, stop relying so heavily on CGI and try something original!

title: Flash-Light
text: The Flash was always my favourite comic-book hero growing up and let me tell you I was a big comic-book fan growing up, still am if I'm being honest. I've watched and largely enjoyed many but not quite all the seasons of the recent DCTV series starring Grant Guston as the Scarlet Speedster but must admit I was very trepidatious regarding Ezra Miller's taking on the role, particularly having seen how the character was portrayed in the recent Justice League movie.In the John Broome / Cary Bates-scripted comics of the 60's and 70's I loved, Barry West was a blonde, originally crew-cutted two-dimensional character with almost no hinterland. Happily married and in regular employment as a police scientist, all he had to do every issue really was tussle with a different member of his ever-changing Rogue's Gallery, but of course that just won't play today. So, rather like Marvel's Spider-Man, this Barry West is a geeky young man just out of his teens, with very few social skills or even social life come to that, struggling to cope with the double-whammy of his beloved mother's brutal murder in their own home and his innocent father convicted on flimsy circumstantial evidence of the crime.Because of the character's earlier introduction in the "JL" feature, we're spared the usual drawn-out origin story and taken to the heart of the action, namely the superhero's attempt to go back in time and by changing one tiny element in the past, hopefully save his mother without disturbing too much the space-time continuum leading back to the present day.Naturally things don't go according to plan and he ends up encountering and having to partner his younger self, which requires Miller to extensively double-up throughout the film. There's a lot of Bill and Ted / Wayne's World / Beavis and Butthead (take your pick) - type humour between the two Barry's, which while quite amusing in parts, probably goes on too long and slows down the film.We are of course by this stage, deep in the multiverse and to help them in their quest the duo enlist the help of this time-line's Batman, where it was genuinely pleasing to see Michael Keaton return to the role he first brought to life under the aegis of Tim Burton. Things get worse though and in truth a little overcomplicated, not to say overcooked when, in the now-trio's search for Superman they instead discover Supergirl which is handy considering that super-powered Phantom Zone villain General Zod is that very instant planning to take over the earth.It all ends up with the customary CG-Fest Battle Royal although this is underscored by our two Flashes having to deal with such concepts as time paradoxes, alternate variants and inevitable intersections before they put the universes (almost) to rights albeit at some personal cost but at least get the bonus of righting one major wrong in the present.Listen, there was a heck of a lot going on here plot-wise, especially the information overload at the climax but I just about managed to stay with it. Bits of the film I really liked, such as when Flash 1 and 2 light up the old Batcave and especially the tributes paid to the Batmen and Supermen of the past (it was particularly moving to see the late Christopher Reeve up on the screen once again) although sadly there was no place for Val Kilmer. Best of all though for me, parochial as it may seem, was seeing within the first 5 minutes, the centre of my home city Glasgow, transformed into a comic-book battleground.I'm well aware that this film has not performed to expectations at the box office making it unlikely that the Flash character will return to the big screen any time soon, especially played by Miller who seems to have serious personal issues in his / their life. For me that would be a shame because I actually did enjoy the movie. Miller carries off well the tricky task of playing the same character whose ages are only a few years apart and I think he did so with a good degree of personality.I'm definitely not going to abandon my old child-hood favourite now although I fear for the character's future status in the DC pantheon after the commercial failure of this feature. I guess what I'm saying is that I hope that this outing doesn't prove to be only a flash in the pan.

title: Flash meets Batman
text: Okay, people will say what they want to about this film, and just to be honest I am not a huge Flash fan, except I really liked the older TV show that only lasted one season. So why rate it an 8 and give it a positive review? Simple,been waiting since 1992 to see Michael Keaton to play Batman again. Was I dissatisfied? Nope, not one bit. I think that was the only reason I went to see this film and was it ever the best thing out there. Don't get me wrong the movie itself was pretty entertaining and that is what movies are all a out. But the best part of this was seeing Batman back in action. Go check it out.

title: Why use someone that can't run?
text: Why would they use someone like Ezra Miller as the Flash that has the worse form I have ever seen for a runner? The way he moves when he runs is so ugly and stupid looking. I have to fast forward every time he runs. And what about that stupid pose when he is just about to run? Jesus! I can't be the only person that thinks like this. At least the kid they used as Young Barry runs just as poorly so there is a continuance there. The movie itself is alright but surely nothing to write home about. I would never have paid for this movie. I wouldn't even have gone if it was free and I only had to pay for the popcorn. They need to find someone better for The Flash if they plan on doing others. Someone that can actually run properly. One of the worse movies I've seen in quite a while.

title: A Thrilling Ride through Speed and Heroism - "The Flash" Leaves You Speechless!
text: I recently had the absolute pleasure of watching "The Flash," and I must say it was an electrifying experience that surpassed all my expectations. As a die-hard superhero film enthusiast, I can confidently state that "The Flash" reigns supreme, standing tall as the finest superhero movie in recent memory.The film's storyline had me hooked from the very start. It expertly weaves together a gripping narrative that explores the origins of our scarlet speedster, Barry Allen, and takes us on an adrenaline-fueled rollercoaster ride through the complexities of his life. The character development was exceptional, allowing us to connect emotionally with Barry's struggles, triumphs, and profound sense of responsibility.The casting couldn't have been more perfect. The talented lead actor effortlessly embraced the role of Barry Allen, embodying the essence of both the ordinary man and the extraordinary hero. The supporting cast was equally impressive, each member bringing depth and authenticity to their respective characters. The chemistry between the characters was palpable, creating moments of heartfelt camaraderie and camaraderie that stayed with me long after the credits rolled.What truly sets "The Flash" apart is its stunning visual effects and mind-bending action sequences. The use of special effects to depict the speedster's abilities was nothing short of spectacular. From breathtaking high-speed chases to jaw-dropping confrontations, the film delivered on all fronts, leaving me on the edge of my seat and yearning for more.Director's visionary prowess shines through every frame, delivering a masterclass in pacing and storytelling. The balance between heartwarming character-driven moments and heart-stopping action was nothing short of perfection. Each scene was meticulously crafted, creating an engaging and immersive experience that captivated me from start to finish."The Flash" is not just a superhero film; it is a celebration of hope, courage, and the unyielding human spirit. It reminds us that even in the face of overwhelming odds, anyone can become a hero and make a difference. This film resonates on a profound level, leaving audiences with a renewed belief in the power of good.In conclusion, "The Flash" is a triumph in the superhero genre and sets a new standard for excellence. Whether you're a fan of the comics or a newcomer to the world of superheroes, this film has something special to offer. So, if you're looking for an unforgettable cinematic experience, brace yourself for a journey of a lifetime with "The Flash." Trust me, you won't be disappointed!

title: Seems like we're living on the wrong spaghetti
text: If it accomplishes nothing else, this "movie", much like ANT-MAN 3, offers a glimpse into a not-too-distant future, anticipating what AI-created Hollywood blockbusters are likely to look like. THE FLASH is admittedly not a "movie", however, but an IP monstrosity.Much has already been said about this basically being a soulless showcase for intellectual property, which is concurrently robbed of its original emotional and artistic value by being displayed in this way. And THE FLASH does indeed embody everything that is wrong with modern nostalgia-based content - so much so that one can only hope that these movies will finally self-destruct not only artistically, but more importantly at the box office.THE FLASH is also one of the ugliest films I have ever seen. I don't know what's going on with Warner Bros. And their visual effects studios, but it's like they were told to use the scorpion king CGI from THE MUMMY RETURNS as a benchmark, while at the same time having too little time to finish their work. It's absolutely baffling - and entertaining in a morbidly strange way: At least twenty percent of this thing looks like straight out of a PS2 cutscene, even the actors' faces look artificial. I wouldn't be surprised if Ben Affleck was only on set for 30 minutes and all of his full-body scenes were completely animated afterwards.I'm honestly glad that this movie flopped big time. Seems to be the only positive aspect about this "hot mess".

title: Fun. And worth watching for the 2 Barry's scenes seamless fx
text: I watched this last night, expecting it to be utter mince after the really flat response from its release.I don't know what people want from a SuperHero movie. Do they want them all to be like Endgame? The moment someone makes a bit of fun, it's slated as rubbish?Really enjoyed it, enough Easter eggs (and full on surprise moments) to keep me entertained, and a lot of laugh out loud moments.If you just like a movie to entertain and aren't watching it with the eyes of an IMDB troll, you should at least smile.Oh, and for all the people whining about the CGI - yes, it could have been a LOT better in places, but the scenes with "two Barry's" are next level stuff. So much so, I'm going to guess most people didn't even think about what would need to go into making them.

title: The DCU is finished, fortunately. A long dead universe.
text: The last DC films were a box office flop: DC SuperPets flop, Black Adam flop and Shazam 2 flop, by now the DC universe was in a dying phase, interests few, this The Flash puts an end to this now defunct universe .The film itself is nothing interesting, all things already seen in DC animated productions, nothing new, nothing original. Some characters then disappoint a lot, the Batman of which we see them very often in the trailers, in the movies they are there for just a few minutes. A delusion. The CGI is not even anything innovative, a generic film even technically.Ugly it is not, but it is disappointing in many respects, then Ezra Miller's Flash I never liked. Forgettable.

title: First review in years.
text: I almost never leave reviews, but I feel the director needs to know, this is my favourite dceu movie to date.Followed by the Snyder Cut, then the first Shazaam!9.5/10.Unfortunately after falling in love CW's Flash, I felt the part of Iris West was a bit weak. And one too many cameos undermined the last cameo for me.Aside from that, I loved the level of nostalgia. Batman's first fight scene was epic and felt like I was watching a cutscene of a game.You nailed the level of darkness needed in a DC movie, and almost overdid it with the humour, but that was to be expected in a flash movie so again, bravo. Thank you for your effort, you did great.

title: Really enjoyable watch.
text:
I really liked this film.I went into it abit unsure because i hadnt heard good things.Boy were they wrong.It follows the storyline of FlashPoint but not exactly so i didnt know where the plot was going so it makes for a good watchYeah, not all the CGI is great but its got a good movieI didnt feel the cameos were forced and most of all I really liked The Flash himself (both of em).Ezra Miller does a great job playing 2 versions of Barry Allen and there are some funny, emotinal, dramatic scenes that land well too..Summary
If you like a blockbuster with a good, heartfelt story,
Watch this film.

title: Go to the Cinema and watch it!!
text: The story gets a bit slow at the beginning but eventually will keep going full of action non stop, Ezra Miller's acting is more than good, I still hate the way he runs, nobody suggested, maybe, base the flash movement on real runners movement... any way, is a good/decent fan service, I enjoyed every surprise and mention and is FULL of Easter eggs... the best, Keaton's Batman and super girl... Sasha Killed it!! Hope I see her again on that role. Is one of the the best DC movies.The post credits... a bit awkward, didn't get it and did not see the connection with the rest of the movie but was still a bit funny.

title: I love The Flash!
text: The Flash is not just one of my favorite DC movie, or superhero movies, but one of my favorite movies in general. There are a lot of laughs and sombre moments to have in this meloncolle film. And what I would say is one of the saddest scenes in a superhero movie. The performances were amazing, and I know that Ezra Miller is controversial and has done some bad things. But I think Miller gives one of the best Superhero performances to date. The action was like reading a comic book or watching the justice league unlimited cartoon. The scores/music were really great, felt like old superheroe movies. The scores are as big as the larger than life heroes. The story was fantastic, and unlike what people say the ending does not contradict Barry's arc. The only actual true flaw are the visual effects. 30% of them are done and polished, another 30% are done just not polished, and the last 40% are just starting to get worked on. But what I'm looking at is really great it's like you have a beautiful outline of a painting that they took their time with. But they rushed when they were painting it. Overall love The Flash can't wait to add it to the 4k collection.9/10.

title: Keaton steals the show!
text: I didn't go into this with much hope with how the other DCEU films have turned out (theatrical versions anyway) and with all the drama surrounding Ezra Miller I thought this is guaranteed to be another dud.And how wrong I was, start to finish I thoroughly enjoyed this! Esra with all his personal problems put aside puts in a emotional and comedic performance playing the 2 Barry's, if it's his last performance as The Flash he did the role proud.Sasha Calle as Supergirl although she's not in it that much I think she done well with what she was given.And now last but not least Michael Keaton as Batman he stole the movie hands down, I was there on opening night in a packed cinema and when he came out suited up everyone cheered (not used to that in DC films lol) like when cap picked up Thors hammer, literal chills. Not going to lie I probably wouldn't have liked the film as much as i did if it weren't for him retuning as the dark knight and he slips back into the role with ease like he never even left. Trust me if you're one of the ones only there for Keaton Batman you will not be disappointed!My only complaint with the film is the the cgi looks really bad in some places and it's normally when both Barry's are on screen and one of the faces just doesn't seem right like Henry Cavill mustache cgi in justice league bad but it never stopped me from enjoying the film and I'm booked to go again next week.Finally a win for DC.

title: This is extremely boring
text: Lame, boring, pointless, drags on forever this movie trying to tell too many stories at once and do it fails at all. Anything positive in this movie is washed away by the mess of trying to tell everyone that Ezra Miller is an actor. I fell asleep 3 times watching this. It had a lot of potential and it was all pushed to the side for this joke of a movie. Supergirl is dull and seems to be a Mexican that has been in jail their whole life but is able to come back to full strength with 30 seconds of sunshine. Why is Ben Affleck Batman all CG? Michael Keaton Batman is better and maybe the only interesting part of the whole story. George Clooney Batman was a lame joke. I hate this movie.

title: Amazing movie from the beginning to the end
text: First I love that the movie didn't have too many jokes it wasn't goofy as the most recent marvel movies , I was so happy to see Ben Affleck and Keaton and supergirl , the movie was different and amazing loved all the cameo they put with all the different superman but I was so sad not seeing our superman Henry cavil and that disappointed me but over all the movie is definitely enjoyable so much and it was outstanding but of course rotten tomatoe always hate DC movies for some stupid reason , like there's always agenda behind that anyway don't listen to any of the bad reviews the movie is amazing , more than expected the only disappointment for me is not seeing my superman Henry cavil.

title: So much potential so much let down
text: The film sadly has little substance bad filming and worse cgi. I loved the Flash in Zsjl. However they have destroyed the story. Sadly it's hard to keep attention on the screen with how much terrible your eyes are being subjected to. One good thing was seeing Keaton again but it's to little to late. Sasha's performance was flat and she doesn't look the part of the character she is meant to play. Terrible writing directing and producing. Most of the good reviews are probably bots. Because nobody went to the theatre to see this so how can it have that many reviews. Do yourself a favor see something else.

title: The Flash: A High-Speed Adventure
text: "The Flash" is a triumph in bringing the beloved DC character to the big screen. Ezra Miller's return as Barry Allen is a highlight, as he embodies the Fastest Man Alive with wit, vulnerability, and a true sense of heroism. The film's storyline intelligently incorporates time travel and multiverse elements, exploring the consequences of altering the timeline and raising thought-provoking moral dilemmas. The visual effects are breathtaking, with action sequences that capture the essence of the Flash's super speed. The supporting cast, including Michael Keaton's return as Batman, adds depth and nostalgia to the story. With its exploration of family, identity, and redemption, "The Flash" is an emotionally engaging adventure that cements the character's place in the DC cinematic universe.

title: A dumb-downed version of The Flash
text: The Flash is, without a doubt, one of the worst movies I have ever seen. It stands out because of its budget and hype going into it. You would think, that with so much riding on the movie to be good and with a budget of hundreds of millions, a main priority would be a solid script. The script for The Flash is so horrible, it's as if it was purposely written to be bad. Seeing as there's only a couple things that I liked, I'll break down all aspects of the film.The characters are like exaggerated versions of real people. Most people come off as dumb, childish, and quirky, all for the sake of trying to make the audience laugh. Batman becomes a joke the way he acts around Wonder Woman, and The Flash is the embodiment overacting. Things get worse in the alternate universe as characters become mentally restarted for some unknown reason.The story is paper thin. The inciting incident and ultimate goal that drives The Flash isn't strong enough to carry a superhero story. The secondary plot, that drives action, is mostly in the background since the movie is hoping people know it from Man of Steel.
