Characters come in and out of the story only when they are needed as a plot device. The movie hopes that the action and the jokes keep viewers interests away from the bland story. It also wants to rely on "cameos" to bolster its enjoyment, but most the the so-called cameos are just cgi recreations that lasts a few seconds.The action itself is a failure since it's only as strong as the cgi that creates it. Yes, the cgi, the number one complaint about the movie. It's far from the worst thing about the movie, but it does make the action beyond unbelievable since it separates any sort of physical reality from the fantasy of seeing superheroes doing superhero things.The biggest issue with the movie, is the script. For starters, the dialogue is laughably bad. Not one of the jokes worked for me (nor the audience I was with) and lines are written as if it's meant for kids to understand. I guess that explains why The Flash and so many other characters act like children. Characters do things for laughs, despite them being idiotic. The Flash hides his identity as well as someone blending into the jungle with a high vis vest. Luckily he's surrounded by stupid people who can't realize that it's this birdbrained guy. The rules set forth in the movie are only followed when the script wants them to be followed. The worst travesty is the ultimate resolution bombshell moment takes place in the goofy court scene. The evidence presented at a trial is the pinnacle of stupidity and is a major plot hole.I could write a book detailing the issues with the movie, so I'll finish off with two things that I did like. Any time Michael Keaton was on screen was nice and his explanation of the multiverse using noodles was well done. The Flash is a great movie to illustrate how there's certifiable attributes that equate to a movie being bad, personal feelings aside.

title: Too good to be a multiverse movie
text: Not pushing, but yes we finally got a worthy live-action multiverse movie which i can say is 2nd to Back to the Future.Loved it to the core & this is a multiple rewatch movie.All credit goes to director Andy Muschietti for giving superhero fans a worthy Flash movie.Performance wise, Ezra & Barry Allen are born for eachother, Keaton is a legend as he delivers the awesome Batman even at 70, Sasha as Supergirl is a fresh addition to the superhero roster.Some visuals felt like 2015 visuals but the story & the character arc covered it all, not to forget the screenplay is brilliant & doesn't makes you feel you're watching a superhero movie.

title: Extremely Enjoyable!
text: Went into my showing aware of all of the reviews out there calling the plot a "confusing mess" and "horrible CGI". So I went into it not expecting much at all coming from a big Flash fan who has watched all 9 seasons of the TV Show on The CW and was very surprised.Now The Flash is no where near perfect but the plot is great with the two Barry Allens, Michael Keaton's Batman, and Sasha Calle's Supergirl for the little time she was on screen. The CGI obviously wasn't perfect in some scenes but was not "horrible" or "terrible" I honestly expected way worse going off the reviews I had read. Overall The Flash is an enjoyable and fun experience to watch on the big screen.The only downside for me is ofcourse not having Grant Gustin's Flash in the movie not even for a small cameo, when they were able to add so many cameos in the multiverse scene towards the end. I feel they could of easily added a scene of Gustin's Flash even just like how Ezra appeared on the CW Flash for that one scene with Gustin's Flash telling Ezra's Flash about the name "The Flash" and later on calling himself The Flash. I just feel like this was a missed opportunity for us Flash fans.

title: Another movie written for 12 year olds
text: I hated this movie and couldn't believe how stupid it was. I watched it because I really wanted to see Michael Keaton as Batman (who was great), and the script was beyond bad. I would say that the movie's only targeted audience would be kids between the ages or 12-14, but I still have faith that kids that age aren't that dumb. These studios have given up on putting together a thoughtful and smart script and story. It's all about trying to get cheap laughs from teens. Well I hope there is enough of those type of audience members to support these movies because I can't see too many adults who enjoy them.

title: Miller and Muschietti to the Rescue!
text:
One-sentence summary: Barry Allen uses his faster-than-light speed to travel backwards in time with the hopes of rewriting his tragic past.What sets Andy Muschietti apart as a director is his ability to consistently make quality character
driven films with depth without sacrificing watchability and pace. The Flash isn't going to wow you with an uber-original story, but what might drop your jaw is the steadfast vision and a litany of incredible performances. Ezra Miller has had his troubles in his personal life, but his acting talent can't be denied. He displays a thorough understanding of the character Barry Allen and excels not only in the dramatic moments but has spot on comedic timing as well. His lead performance is further augmented by the terrific work of Michael Keaton and Sasha Calle, who both bring unique mentalities and motivations to their roles. The script is well written and surprisingly digestible, with multiple scenes that had me uncontrollably cackling. Muschietti handles the camera smoothly with natural instincts on close versus wide shots and an affinity for capturing imposing visuals. This is easily one of the most complete movies I've seen in recent years, and I will certainly be returning to the theatre for a second viewing.

title: Breaking point of the direction of the dcu with a fun and overwhelming film.
text: 4 out of 5 stars.The Flash is a good superhero film that is a lot of fun, also delivers an easter egg for the fans of the dc universe, and it is action packed.It may not be one of my favorite dc film especially the universe of the 13th films it has. It is not terrible. It delivers the action, the fun direction, the cameos, and a great cast.The plot follows Barry (Ezra Miller) using his powers to travel back in time to save his mom and his father from being framed. After messing with the time line, he will need the help from Bruce (Michael Keaton) and super girl (Sasha Calle) to help stop a threat from Zod (Michael Shannon).Great plot which it tries to add a bit of emotional connection with one trying to change the past to save a loved one. While there are consequences that can affect the future.The film has plenty of action sequences that delivers. The opening sequence is awesome with Batman in his bat cycle trying to stop robbers. And Barry trying to save people. The action sequences are exciting. The visual effects may be questionable. But the director stated it is supposed to be like that to put the audiences in the flash perspective when he is travelling through time and space.Michael Keaton as Batman was awesome. It was nice to see him back. And taking full advantage of Batmans abilities. Sasha Calle was also the highlight as Supergirl. Even though i did feel like Batman and Supergirl were underutilized in the film. Ezra Miller is good as the character. Making it fun. They may have over done it with its humor.The film does have a lot of fun cameos. From a lot of actors. Also opening up the possibility that dc universe is endless.The film did struggle near the third act. By overdoing it with its timelines crashing. There was barely a fight between Flash and a villain. It was overwhelming. Also didnt have any development to supergirl and batman.Overall, it is a fun film with lots of action and fun cameos.

title: Toss aside the DC and Ezra bias!
text: This is an entertaining superhero movie that incorporates time travel/multiple universes well. The backstory of Barry is some fantastically, and the direction and cinematography pass with flying colors.I did hear rumors of criticism regarding CGI, but I honestly noticed nothing while even going into the watch looking out for faults.The dialogue is incredible and drives the plot amazingly. I'm truly disheartened that Ezra Miller will no longer be a part of this franchise. He plays the character very impressively. Well worth a watch and trumped with the inclusion of Michael Keaton as one of/the main Batman.

title: Not a DC Winner
text: The Flash is an ambitious superhero flick that largely pulls off its plot from the Flash and Batman franchises. The superhero fan service is strong with this one - perhaps too overwhelming and unbelievable at times - and it fully corrupts Barry Allen's genuinely tragic and heartfelt story of grief. Though the visual effects are not always the best, the over-the-too performances and a false earnestness keep The Flash plot in chaos and disappointing Universe of DC movies.The lack of character development made the story seem artificial and two-dimensional (lacking in complexity and failing to keep my interest).

title: This movie is GOOD.
text: I don't watch that many superhero movies, I've watched the first season of the flash (show). But in my opinion, the movie is better than that, the plot and the "CGI" is better. The visual effects in my opinion are completely fine and don't distract me from the actual movie, I think that they are very good. The cast is good, I would prefer the flash in the movie over the flash in the show, and Michael Keaton was great in it too. Also the story is compelling, it's so real with the conclusion Barry has with himself near the end of the movie. The ending was alright I guess, it ended off the kind of serious tone that it had near the end. I would rate it an 8.3/10.

title: It's enjoyable to watch.... Mostly
text: I was skeptical about this movie at first since the review ppl made is not that good.After watching it however, I enjoy it .. most of the time. The plot lines is almost what I imagine it from watching the anime & comic.Even though this movie has been affected quite a-bit by actor Ezra Miller, however this movie made me wishing he get some help soon since he was terrific as the flash.The participant or cameo of "others" are much appreciated as well. It make this movie relatable.Overall .. & again I enjoy this movie l. The ending could be better IMO.Highly recommend this to anyone who like superheroes movies.

title: Not what we expected, but still a good overall movie!
text: Though most people will fixate on the small problems of the film like CGI and slow Content, The moral of the story is ever present and realistic. I think we all forget that DC tends to pull towards scientific reasoning for powers and abilities and characters. That being said, the way this movie was done was the only way they could have done a script of this kind. So... Michael Keaton's Batman was wonderful, definitely could've done more with Supergirl, but all in all it was a heart felt movie with action and a great storyline. Stop fixating on the little small things that are un-perfectible! Definitely would recommend 8.8 stars for me, 2 1/2 thumbs up!

title: A hot mess soon to be a dish best served cold
text:
Scene from a fantasy Awards CeremonyPresenter: "The award for the most unrelatable character in a superhero movie (envelope please) and the Ofscar goes to...Ezra Miller"Commentator: Well folks that comes as no surprise, Ezra has been the hot favorite to win this award since he debuted in the DC Universe.Basing an entire movie on such an unsympathetic unlovable character was just the first mistake, here are some more
1. Bizzaro CGI
2. Weak and wandering script syndrome
3. TMOC (Too Many Other Characters)The beacon of sanity in the middle of this supersludge is Michael Keaton, tied for BBE (Best Batman Ever) with Christian Bale. Now if someone could only recut this movie as Batman Saves Time (with a guest appearance by The Flash) they might just have something.

title: Suprisingly good...
text: I wasn't expecting much from this movie, Ezra Miller is a creepy potato these days and while I am glad that the movie was released, I am also glad they were no longer involved. As soon as we all saw Michael Keaton was back as Batman our interest was piqued again.The Hospital baby scene is amusing but expected, Michael Keaton is both amusing as a homeless looking recluse but kick ass as Batman, Sasha Calle is great as Supergirl and Ezra manages to make two versions of themselves interesting and engaging. The vomit scene from being moved too fast is brilliant but overdone. The many Superman versions are a little overdone and Nicholas Cage has no place in the movie. Despite what others say, the ohmage to Christopher Reeve is pretty much a snippet of his movies and not CGI and the movie is surprising worth watching. Maybe not twice but it's worth a watch to add Barry Allen to the DC Universe properly. Sasha Calle however has definitely put her hand up for Kara to be added properly.

title: A Sprint In The Wrong Direction
text: Let's get Ezra Miller's rubbish out of the way: Now, it's not quite on the same level as the recent chaos created by Rachel Zegler, but that doesn't make Miller's actions any less foolish. His continuous, thoughtless behaviour, and his endless list of legal offences, if it hasn't already, threatens to cast a dark shadow over the DC Cinematic Universe's beloved speedster, much to the dismay of us fans.Multiverse theory and time-travelling have been done to death, and unfortunately, "The Flash" runs right into that brick wall. DC's Flashpoint Paradox event was a dazzling spectacle in comic form, full of layers and twists. But to recreate that on the big screen is already a tough task, and to do it while the superhero genre is already saturated, nah.Then there's the running motion, it's his literal superpower, the crux of the narrative, and yet, it's been botched so profoundly, you'd think it was intentional. Whether it was Ezra Miller or not, the running motion made DC's fastest hero look like a character snagged from a 2010 glitched video game than the humanoid lightning bolt he's supposed to be.On the brighter side, the time-travel-related character twists do inject a bit of intrigue. However, the attempts at complexity often feel like a novice juggler with one too many balls in the air.The graphics in this film were extremely disappointing, particularly when we consider current technology where AI can generate lifelike human figures almost instantly. One would expect a seasoned team of VFX professionals to deliver a noticeably superior level of quality.Time to reboot the reboots?

title: Very good surprisingly
text: I thought it was actually very good. Loved the visuals and the storyline and the humor. Was surprised because I thought it wasn't going to be that good, but I'm going to see it again. I like the storyline that they gave, I don't want to give away too much, but it was worth seeing. I never really liked Ezra as the Flash, but he did really good in this movie. Keaton's parts were fabulous. I felt nostalgic watching him because he was the Batman of my childhood. Supergirl was pretty good too, I hope they bring her back. It ended great and I'm overall very happy with the movie. Cant wait to see it again.

title: Super Awesome
text: The storyline was great and unique (although it have some instances from comics and animated movies but that's good part). I don't know why people think CGI is bad, from my side it was not bad at all atleast, all CGI movies lacks at some point in movie. Flash scenes are perfectly picturized and give goosebumps many times. Last but not the least, comedy is pretty well embedded in the movie scenes.Only thing that can be improved is the ending, DC trying to start over the DC universe, that doesn't seem to be the intention from movie ending.Batman and other cameos in the movie are the add ons for the Fans, and you will love it.

title: Non stop fun from start to finish
text: First things first, up to about 15 minutes from the end I was going to give this a score of 8 out of 10, but then I upgraded it to a perfect 10. Why? Once you see it you'll know. This has the right balance of action and humour. From the opening scene to the end they is no flagging. They did the right thing not recasting Barry, Ezra plays him perfectly and seamlessly acts with himself. The supporting cast are spot on, particularly Michale Keaton. It's like he never was away from saying " I'm Batman " . If I have one grumble it's with the scene at the end of the credits, whilst amusing it doesn't add to the film or take away. It feels like it was added to include a certain character.

title: Comparisons to other comic book movies
text: Super hero movies, many of which I enjoy, have become unoriginal. The Flash dodges familiarity at times it would've benefited from it, and is familiar in the ways it does not benefit from. Aside from the media narratives about The Flash, I wouldn't be surprised if anyone who came out of this movie said they loved it or hated it.There are a lot of problems with this movie and it's a lot of fun. Many people have critiqued Ezra Miller's lead performance but I wouldn't say that's even the biggest problem. The biggest problem with this movie is how bad it looks visually. Some of that HAD to be on purpose. Some of the action scenes really work and some really don't because of this issue. It's loud, it's ugly, it's some very bad editing & CGI.The Flash has a fun plot that drove home a solid point on living with regret or such a desire for the life you could have had. Within 30 minutes of this starting, I realized it probably wasn't that good of a movie based on how it looked and how it pretended the Justice League was this group with momentum rather than a bunch of actors who we know aren't playing them again. The later cameos are lazy and uninspired. Most of this tries to draw on a nostalgia for DC movies that just really isn't there for me, so it didn't really work emotionally.Some people will love this, some will hate it, it definitely makes a lot of INTERESTING choices. I think people should watch it though.

title: A True Review From a True Fan
text: Ignoring the ballad of events surrounding Ezra Miller and judging this film purely on its content, I was pleasantly surprised. Being plagued with controversy since it's inception, I was worried about this film and prepared for utter disappointment. This excelled all expectations. While the popular complaint of the CGI not being up to par is true, it does not take away from the epic, emotional story that this sets out to tell. The entire cast does a phenomenal job and you can tell they were really having fun doing it too. The story quickly gets you connected and invested as anyone can relate to the fear that Barry is feeling and the desire to fix something that never should have been to begin with. It's for the best that this universe got wrapped in a bow and I am glad that we at least got to chuckle at the fate of Ezra and the entire DCEU as it is finally put to rest. Judging this film as a film, this is one that should give true fans an enjoyable ride.

title: Hey guys ... It's Good
text: Don't let other people fool you. The media, reviews, any other negative stuff out there. It's actually very entertaining and a funny movie with lots of Easter eggs and witty dialogue and comedic moments. Everybody the theater was laughing on a constant basis. I was worried it was going to be very very average but it's not it's pretty good. They're saying the same thing about the Indiana Jones movie. It's like they're trying to destroy stuff with all their negative comments. It'll probably be a lot better than what everybody's saying. This movie is the same it's very good definitely well worth the second watch.

title: Michael Keaton Saves This From Being A Complete Disaster
text: The Flash is a mutiverse, time-traveling, bloated, bad CGI, quippy-humor, overlong, nostalgia-baiting, written-by-committee monstrosity that embodies all the worst excesses of the rapidly-deflating Hollywood superhero genre. The title character is an effete, annoying weirdo who spends most of the movie being the voice of reason to a more effete, more annoying version of himself. A few serviceable cameos aside the only real bright spot is Michael Keaton's return as Batman. It's by far the biggest bit of nostalgia-bait but it actually works. The movie's best elements are when it's cribbing sets, dialogue and score from Keaton's 1989 classic and letting him run with his quirky but engaging take on the character. Whatever you think of Keaton's version of Batman he didn't play the lead in superhero movie as a hyperactive 30-year-old virgin. The contrast with Ezra Miller's Flash will make you yearn for better days. Alas Keaton isn't utilized enough to fully salvage what is otherwise a vapid trainwreck of a movie.

title: A real multiverse of madness
text: One of the best DC movie. A complete package of action, comedy, drama, fan-service and many more things. I mean, I really enjoyed the movie, hats off to the director 'Andrés Muschietti' and actors, especially 'Ezra Miller'.If you are a DC fan then this movie will provide you a heaven like environment in the theater. I'm describing it as heaven cause as we know that current movies are facing backlash just because of bad story telling and studio's involvement, but here, it looks like the director had complete freedom to show his work, cause the movie keeps you engaged and clutched, viz. Why movie wont feel lengthy or slow. As for recommendation its a complete 'go and watch'

title: Just not DC anymore
text: The current state of the DC universe is disappointing. The characters no longer resemble their true selves, especially The Flash. He used to embody justice, good morals, and the heart of a hero. It's puzzling how the writers and cast struggle to capture the essence of these beloved characters, despite having a wealth of comics and movies to draw inspiration from. Just look at Justice League: The Flashpoint as an example of how it can be done right. Sadly, the new generation of DC films falls short. Marvel, on the other hand, succeeds by making subtle changes from the comics and ensuring the characters remain true to their core. This is where DC is lacking; both the characters and plots are undergoing significant transformations. As a dedicated DC fan, I refuse to lose hope, but it's clear why Marvel is currently leading the way.

title: Nice entertainer for DC fans
text:
This is a balanced movie with few positives and few negatives.Positives:
Breath of freshness with interesting story: The series had covered many stories and episodes so it was nothing new. Still it was an interesting story.Decent VFX: The visual really good. Time as a physical dimension was mind blowing. Good efforts for the VFX overall.Cameos: The film has many cameos which strike nostalgic chords. It would be an interesting series of film if they come up with 2-3 films.Background score: Background music for Batman is so good. It definitely reminded of Batman animated series.Barry has always been comic relief in other films and series. But the one who travels time in this movie acts mature and feels more deep than just a comic relief.Negatives:
Some scenes feel stretched and boring. Those would have cut short.Younger Barry felt too much childish.

title: DC fan service
text: I can totally understand why a non DC fan and an average movie goer might not connect with it, because they have tried to contain so much lore and so much DCU in one movie, but for a regular DC fan like myself this was an absolute blast. The Easter eggs, the cameos, multiverse and the epic fight scenes were all straight out of comic books.I wonder what this movie would mean for the future specially DCU under Gunn but if this was the last of the palette, they did go out with a bang. I hope to see more of the Flash in future in movies and TV and so I hope this works for the DC fan in me. All in all loved it.

title: Disappointed
text: So many miscalculations and poor decisions. A movie at this scale should be interesting, enjoyable and entertaining, not boring, tedious and uninteresting. Also the VFX should be groundbreaking, outstanding and should be look realistic, unfortunately this movie for some reason opted for mediocre and poorly done weak looking VFX. Up until the third act I have minor complaints, but the the third act totally diminished the quality with its cheap VFX. The third act with the fight with Zod was boring and tasteless. The location and unscrupulous VFX shots with ugly smoke effects ruined the whole sequence + the movie. In my opinion the "best part" in this movie is the first 30 minutes or so before Barry decide to time travel. This movie felt like a Frankenstein's monster with different screenplays and ideas mashed together into one. A convoluted story with unsatisfied and confusing ending. They wasted the return of Michael Keaton's Batman and they should've stick with the comic book storyline. Instead of using deceased actors' likeness for atrocious VFX lookalikes they should've used living actors for live-action cameos.Andy Muschietti should stick with mid budget horror films that he's very good at it. Big budget tentpole films is not his speciality.

title: god dc is back
text: I had the incredible joy of experiencing "The Flash" alongside a group of friends, and I must say, it was an absolute cinematic masterpiece. From beginning to end, this superhero extravaganza had us captivated, with its electrifying plot, breathtaking visuals, and exceptional performances. As a devoted fan of the DC universe, I couldn't have asked for a more thrilling and satisfying cinematic experience.One of the standout aspects of the film was undeniably the titular hero himself, The Flash. Portrayed by Ezra Miller, his rendition of Barry Allen was truly phenomenal. He flawlessly captured the essence of the character, seamlessly blending humor, vulnerability, and determination in a manner that deeply resonated with the audience. Every scene involving The Flash showcased his super-speed abilities in awe-inspiring ways, leaving us in utter amazement at the visual spectacle unfolding before us.However, the brilliance of "The Flash" extends far beyond that. The movie also treated us to a delightful appearance by Batman, skillfully played by Michael Keaton. This seasoned Dark Knight brought an undeniable intensity and gravitas to the narrative, showcasing his unmatched detective skills and unyielding bravery. The interactions between Batman and The Flash were an absolute delight to behold, delivering the dynamic duo fans have long yearned for on the grand screen.Furthermore, the inclusion of Supergirl, portrayed by Sasha Calle, added an additional layer of excitement to the film. Her exceptional strength and unwavering determination made her an invaluable ally to The Flash, and the chemistry between the characters was palpable throughout. It was truly refreshing to witness the seamless integration of multiple iconic superheroes, each possessing their own distinctive abilities, working harmoniously towards a shared objective.Credit must be given to the director, Andy Muschietti, for bringing this superhero tale to life with finesse and meticulous attention to detail. The breathtaking visual effects were a visual feast, elevating each action sequence into a thrilling spectacle. The intense fight scenes and high-speed chases were executed flawlessly, leaving us perched on the edge of our seats, breathless with anticipation.Moreover, the screenplay was an artful blend of humor, heart, and action. The narrative unfolded at a perfect pace, allowing us to forge a profound connection with the characters while keeping our adrenaline pumping. The writers deserve commendation for delivering a story that not only entertained but also left a lasting emotional impact.To conclude, "The Flash" is an exceptional superhero film that surpassed all our expectations. With its gripping storyline, extraordinary performances by Ezra Miller as The Flash, Michael Keaton as Batman, and Sasha Calle as Supergirl, as well as its awe-inspiring visuals, it undeniably deserves nothing less than a flawless rating. This movie is a must-see for both ardent fans and casual viewers alike, as it embodies the very essence of what makes superheroes truly remarkable. So gather your friends, prepare to be astounded, and allow "The Flash" to whisk you away on an exhilarating adventure that will etch itself into your memory for years to come.

title: Ugly therapy dog.
text: I'm not a batman Fan. I was a former Batman hater. I felt it was childish after years of hating on Batman and to hate a fictional character.However, I never felt so happy to see the batman guy. He was the best part in this mediocre movie.Sept 8th 2023What is this movie about?:It's about listening to Flash whine and talk while time traveling to save his mommy and while its barely about battling Zod.The story and the production overview:It's boring. Not much time adventure.Ezra is annoying. He hurts my ears. He's not a good Flash.I didn't like the baby scene. It was too violent and hard to watch.All of Flash's supporting characters were horrid. Iris West looks like a mixture of Rhianna and Valkyrie.Supergirl was. Meh kay.Each batman was cool.I'm not a dc guy or read the comic but this Flashpoint was horrible.Just stick to the animated version if you must.They improved on the Flash suit. It's way better than the clunky one in JL.Highlight: Wonderwoman theme music.Villian: Zod but he was barely in it or had any development. For the time he was on screen he did very well.Genre: Fantasy and superheroSoundtrack: Had iconic tunes.Duration: 2H 24M... So long with very little to discuss.Love it? Okay? Meh? Or Hash?: The movie is Hash.Last Words: I barfed in my mouth when I saw the ugly dog. Overall the movie was boring. Almost 3 hours long with no reward. Ezra Miller is a horrible Flash.

title: There was no other way to make a better Flashpoint Paradox Movie!
text: They hit all the necessary Spots, Micheal Keaton was great, Ben though little did his role perfectly. And MAN, I don't know about how Ezra is in real life but boy that Man can Act. This movie shows that DCEU could've handled a Mutli-Cast Superhero Movie Just fine in the Past too if the decision Makers were in their right mind. But if this is supposed to be the end of DCEU then DCEU ended at a High Note.Supergirl was Great too, If James Gunn wants to make Supergirl big part of his Upcoming Projects then Sasha should be the Supergirl. Cameos were good too but story is the main selling point and not the crazy Cameos.

title: I think everyone should watch it really for the epic Batman sequences
text: The Flash comes at an awkward time for DC universe when everyone is excited for the current Phase (to pick up a Marvel jargon) to end and move on to Gunn's Chapter 1. But, this movie really says something incredible about the DCEU - the issue isn't with the actors at all; the issue has always been the script they were dealt with.The Flash opens right on point after an action sequence just for an introduction of the character. It starts with him exploring the possibility of saving his mom. The movie manages to keep your attention throughout due to the excellent humour and characters' arcs. Michael Keaton is fantastic as the Batman. So is Ezra Miller! I honestly think he should continue to play the role of The Flash in DCU too.The music was forgettable.The movie truly shines the most when it's dealing with elaborate action set pieces, especially involving the batman. They're incredibly genius and to the point, not at all over the top, and keep you wishing for a little more run time!In all, a very well balanced action fun movie with strong performances. Solid 8/10.

title: Exactly as I expected
text: This Flash movie didn't surprise me. That is neither good nor bad. I knew it would be awesome just because Keaton's Batman is in it. But I also knew that aside from Keaton, the film fails to stand on its own.Let's face it, without Keaton, this film is a total flop. Point blank. The Flash cannot carry his own movie, so this required some "nostalgic" help. But being that Keaton is heavily involved in the plot, I suppose you can call it the saving grace of this film.The scenes with Batman and Supergirl were excellent. Everything else was just...... Meh!I have a big problem the fact that the Flash can simply undo all the bad things that happen simply by going back into the past any time he wants. It makes for extremely lazy writing. And you just know right off the bat that this film will end by fixing something in the past. Yes, his mother dies. But in future sequels, Barry can simply rethink about how to approach going into the past again to fix everything that happened in this film. That would make it extremely convenient for ANY character to always come back from the "dead" and appear in future sequels to milk the nostalgia cow.And no, don't get me started on the terrible CGI that was impossible not to notice in some parts!But otherwise, despite all of it's shortcomings, I actually did enjoy watching this film. Not sure that it would ever need any further sequels though.

title: Expected nothing, left surprised
text: Considering all of the bad press Ezra Miller has had recently, I really didn't think this was going to be very good. Instead, I left knowing I had been entertained for an hour and a half. Seeing Michael Keaton in the bat suit once again took me back.to 1989. It was like time had stood still for 34 years. Considering the whole concept of the movie was about going back in time, I truly appreciated all of this. There was plenty of nostalgia for all generations of the superhero genre. Were the special effects great, not really, but they were enough for the film. I thought the addition of Supergirl was excellent. I felt an immediate draw to her. Great job with that. Trust me when I say, it isn't the best movie I have seen, but it is way better than some of the other superhero movies that have been submitted in the past. Worth seeing on the big screen.

title: Bad movie , flash wasn't flash enough
text: Script was bad, flash wasn't muscular, didn't have that sweet Arnold accent to him, the flash lacked masculinity and reminded of those TikTok body self awareness tiktoker. He definitely loves himself outside of the movie, we also can tell that he shares his love by kidnapping little kids and making them watch his movie in horrible conditions. In fact he loved him self so much that he literally castes himself twice in the movie. He definitely lives in his parents house being neglected because to busy making TikToks in his room. Michael however, was a gift from the gods, he played his role perfectly and made me think of masculinity and the gym. He was a perfect example of what a Batman should be. Super women was iffy. That's all lads. Paul Envy, signing out.-Paul.

title: Amazing film that suffers due to expectations
text: I must say, the Flash movie is spectacular, but suffers because of expectations. DC and Warner Brothers should have never hyped up this movie as the "best superhero movie of all time" because it wasn't. Now, this movie is actually really good. Better than I expected really. The story is strong, plot devices work, the usage and creativity of the flash's powers and Batman's gadgets were really clever and I appreciated the little, small details throughout the film. The emotional interactions with Barry and his mom really hit home for me because I'm scared to lose my mom and I'm pretty sure if we all had The Flash's powers, we'd do the same in order to save our moms. Go watch the movie, I promise you'll be entertained.

title: Best DC movie after the original Batman Trilogy
text: This movie feels so light and airy, unlike the very heavy and forcefull Justice League movie. There are some funny moments, exciting visuals, and heartwarming scenes. Ezra plays this character very well, too bad he is so problematic in real life (which might jeapordize future sequels). Michael Keaton stole the show... AS HE SHOULD... such an amazing well-seasoned actor. Ben Affleck looks like he is enjoying himself in this movie (unlike the previous one). Only Supergirl that felt lackluster, i think hollywood needs to stop changing their hero characters, i don't like this "butched up" version.

title: Why?
text: Why did they make this awful movie? So, pretty much everything I thought about this ridiculous movie has already been said here, but let me explain why I rated it a 3 and not the minus 10 it deserved.First of all, seeing my favorite Batman again, Michael Keaton, was a delight. Not sure how Ben Affleck ended up in that part, the worst Batman ever, but Michael Keaton is and will always be my Batman! Then, there was the homage to George Reeves and Christopher Reeve that brought tears to my eyes. I watched the original Batman with George Reeves when I was a kid! He was amazing!What I haven't seen written yet is the weakness of the story, using an amazing actor like Michael Shannon as Zod for about 5 minutes and allowing this mess to revolve around a young man, Ezra Miller, with the acting ability of a flea take center stage! Really? They could not find someone, anyone, better than this awful actor? The TV Flash actor who played Barry Allen, Grant Gustin, was a hundred times better!The CGI, as covered fully by others here, was kindergarten grade, the story implausible, the story was terrible!!! I would have taken away a star for allowing such a terrible actor to play The Flash, but decided to leave it there in honage, 100% to the three actors listed above. One of the worst Marvel, Justice League movies ever made! Not kidding. Do yourself a favor and pass it by. Watch one of the older movies over again instead and be happy you didn't give up those minutes of your life you will never get back!

title: Very good movie
text: First of all, considering all super-heroes movies I have seen in the last few years, this one is definitely very good.A few points which must be praised:It is an amazing movie as it has the three important things for me:

title: Where did those 200$ million of the budget go?
text: To begin with, in the first 10-15 minutes of the film, you can clearly see it with your own eyes, that CGI is on a very low-level. I genuinely believe, that some of the 2013 games look more realistic than this absurd. Even if you compared Unreal Engine 5 vs CGI in those first 10-15 minutes, you would know what I'm talking about.As for the script, well, generaly speaking the concept of multiverse is okay, but there are still some major issues with the way the script is written, some of the things just don't make sense at all and some are very poorly explained. Keaton barely speaks in the film which is a serious drawback.Overall, I would not recommend anyone to watch this trash.

title: "S" stands for "Hope"
text: I saw some very Bad Review and had second thoughts whether I should watch it or not. But I came because I love the Flashpoint Paradox and just wanted to see how they put it in the Live Action.I'm glad that I came because it's really one of the Best DC movie. In the first scene the graphics is little off apart from that graphics is very very good, immersing soundtrack, great dialogues and punchlines, compelling story.Now coming to the negetive reviews.. I really don't know why so much hate? Seems like these negetive reviews are to put doubt in people's mind so that they won't go and watch the movie, because whoever will watch it will love it for sure. Now let's see who'll benifit from that? Rival studios? Movie that released a while ago? Seems like it"Across the Spiderverse" is very very good but tickets are very very expensive for an animated movie. Even "Suzume" wasn't that expensive.Flash' s ticket is very cheaper than that. One week after "Across the Spiderverse", "Transformer" was released and this week "The Flash". Now it all makes sense the very high pricing of an "animated movie" and bad reviews for a "rival movie".

title: Keaton shows super hero films peaked in the 80s/90s
text: It was so fantastic to see Keaton back as Batman and not only back but excelling at the role. Unfortunately other than Keatons parts of the film it is a complete mess.The main character/actor is extremely annoying from start to finish and gives off an very creepy vibe.Once again the film delves into a multiverse which got tiresome after the very first outing.All I've learnt from this film is they are still relying too heavily on CGI over practical effects. They are still trying to over complicate every film.What this film showed the most though was that a Tim Burton Sequel to Batman Returns would still probably outshine anything that has come since.

title: Miller shines....
text: What makes The Flash work so well is Ezra Miller. Simple as that. Sure, the gags are genuinely funny and come thick and fast, the visuals are, at times, absolutely stunning and the plethora of familiar and very welcome cameos are a joy to behold. But it's Miller's sensitive and highly amusing portrayal of a shy young man bestowed with super powers who spends most of the movie totally out if his depth that leaves the most enduring impression.Make no mistake about it, this movie is all about fan service and, to these eyes anyway, it represents a high water mark for DC. James Gunn would be unwise to totally ignore the path this movie appears to be on because I firmly believe the loyal fan base will want and expect more of the same going forward.

title: Everything that was said about it is sadly true..,,
text: Hate being negative about films that people put so much effort into making, and as a long time Superhero geek from reading comic books in the 70's, I have been overjoyed that they have been able to, in the main, do them justice, and make some excellent films. Not having caught up with this in the Cinema, now it has hit rental, I thought I would give it a try. Glad now I did not attempt it on the big screen. Honestly not much at all to recommend it, except for the nostalgia of bringing back old characters like Keaton's Batman. All in all, poor. Dreadful effects. Hate his costume and running style. Poor humour. Lame characters (this really is not the Barry Allen from the books), they have not done Flashpoint justice at all. The *real* Flash character is bad enough, but the different reality Barry is even worse. Not sure what Gunn was on when he said this was one of the best ever SH films. There are worse, but not many. Incoherent. Really do hope the rebooted DC series gets everything back on track, but not hopeful after this.

title: Near Perfection
text: Definitely one of THE BEST DC films out there. Definitely in the Top 5 with: Joke, The Dark Knight, Zack Snyder's Justice League, Wonder Woman, The Flash. I enjoyed every minute of it, Ezra was great at playing the annoying and more composed version of him self. The dramatic moments he did a great job at them.... The film had action, drama, jokes. Ben's Batman is a beast as always. Michael Keaton's Batman 89 is just PERFECTION. We get to see him kicking a$$ like Batfleck and Battinson.(The ONLY bad part was the CGi faces that looked weird, thats the only issues for me)The story was great and everything made sense giving each character a purpose to do what they are doing. Nobody was jus thrown there for the sake of it. The WORLD COLLIDE scene was just a BIG fan service frenzy that i loved till the last drop. I am definitely watching it again. People had laughs and pump reactions in the theater. Is such a GOOD FILM. You got to watch it cuz even if is not in your Top 5, it will definitely be in your Top 10 best comic book films.

title: What an amazing movie, Sorry and thank you marvel but it's DC's time to shine now!
text: I've honestly missed DC movies so much. After having enjoyed so many movies from marvel I missed seeing Superman Batman flash etc on the big screen. They really outshone themselves with this one, yes sometimes the CGI is lacking but overall the movie was unique and a joy to watch. Acting from Ezra was top notch I can't think of anyone better fit to play the role. I really hope there will be another part because I really really enjoyed the movie. It was so good the whole theatre was clapping and IMAX theatres aren't small! Really impressed and I really like how DC is exploring the theme of the wider multiverse as well, general zod looked awesome. Andy Muschietti's directing was really good aswell. I absolutely recommend anyone to watch the movie, it's comedic, fun and full of action!

title: Best CGI. Happy that i watched in theatre, Worthy flim to watch in theatre . One of the best flim of the year
text:
The flash is One of the best movies with perfect CGI and story plot . No lag it keeps me engaged from beginning to end . I can feel the characters in this flim which is very much rare experience.NOTE: I enjoyed this flim even though iam a great marvel fan.But some the details can be missed and confusing for fans who don't follow Dc . It is very big treat for DC fans i can surely say that much, This must need to be a block buster hit , this flim will help other DC flims to getting released successfully
Watch it dont miss !Watch it dont miss !Watch it dont miss !Watch it dont miss !Watch it dont miss !

title: The perfect Flash film, thankyou DC.
text: I sincerely prayed for this movie to be good as I've been a huge Flash fan all my life. Infact, I travelled 200 Kilometres to see it, cuz there's no theater where I live.But man it was totally worth it!DC did absolute justice to Flash's origin story. Ezra Miller was simply phenomenal and just as good as Grant Gustin was in the Flash TV show. I've seen Flash in all the animated films and the TV show and Ezra Miller's portrayal is on par with Grant Gustin's. He brought such earnestness and relatabilty to Barry Allen that you just can't stop yourself from rooting for him. Barry's story is truly tragic yet inspiring. The way young barry looks at everything in the world with a wonder and a dorky smile is ever so inspiring.I genuinely hope that Ezra Miller can learn from their off-screen mistakes and do better in life, just like Barry learnt from his mistakes .P. S Thankyou DC for the perfect Flash film.

title: It's a golden ticket for the DC Universe
text: I went to see The Flash film without any expectations, especially considering the recent unsuccessful releases by DC Comics. However, I was surprised and enjoyed the movie. With its fast-paced plot, action sequences that didn't tire the audience, and well-placed humor, The Flash is one of the most enjoyable superhero films I've watched this year. It's a golden ticket for the DC Universe, which has struggled with its films lately, as it manages to recover and deliver good storytelling without disrupting the flow. The actors' good performances also contributed to the smooth progression of the film. It's worth noting the careful placement of comedic elements, ensuring they didn't overwhelm the audience, and the successful blending of these elements with the relatively dark tone of the story, which is one of the film's strengths. One downside could be that some of the CGI effects used in the movie may fall slightly below today's standards, but they didn't directly affect the film. I recommend watching it in theaters.

title: Kara carried imo
text: Sasha Calle's Supergirl was my favorite part of the movie in my opinion. For the 10 minutes she was in, she was so much better handled than the Arrowverse version, what with her being a lot more detached and resentful to Earth and humans. I also just genuinely liked her (her suit was cool too). That's really it. Other than that, this movie was goofy, cringe as hell and just awful. Ezra Miller is atrocious as Barry Allen and we all know where they should be instead of starring in this movie. GRANT GUSTIN DIDN'T EVEN CAMEO, LIKE WTF?! Speaking of, those CGI cameos looked awful, they were almost vomit-inducing and why did they use the oldest versions of the characters that probably no one cares about??? Very bizarre.

title: YOU WANT TO GET NUTS? LET'S GET NUTS.
text: "The Flash" was actually amazing you guys. This movie destroys expectations and at the same time mends all bridges. Lightning in a bottle. And as great as Keaton and Ben are... Ezra is even better. I have to say that it's not just phenomenal, it's a full on celebration of DC. An emotional action packed ride FULLY FOCUSED on Barry Allen! Supergirl, Ben and Keaton's Batman compliment the film with applauded worthy moments but this is a Flash story. The good towers way over the bad. I loved it. I would easily recommend this to DC fans, and even action lovers in general. I think I have a new favorite movie!

title: The joker was missing
text: I really liked the film because it did something that was incredible, but first I'll say some points that I need to say, some things that are important to make clearScript: I found it interesting, following the basis of the multiverse I found a different proposal, it is not a film that repeats what we already know with the possibility of returning to the past or going to the future, flash approached the multiverse in a different way in my vision where The universes that run at the same time do not need to be in exactly the same year, and these characteristics can be different, for example, if the flash is a calmer person in one, it could be a more fun guy in the other, a different personality.Effects: Simply very good CGI is well done and has good visual effects and also the soundtrack combination is perfectReview: Because it's a Superhero film, the part where the flash from the other universe is practically naked wasn't great, could you approach this in a different way, the situation where his clothes catch on fire, could you change that part or keep the same event just what a different way, just as I thought the part about putting a person in their underwear on the sofa, that was strange to mePositive Point: Believe me, the film is cool, I liked it, but there are things that you will never be able to do again, and whether you like it or not, no matter how many years pass, you end up being marked by several things that become important.What happens is this, some actors fit perfectly into characters they end up playing, also because it depends on how the film was made and how that film was produced, so seeing Michael Keaton again as Batman is incredible, as is Tobey Maguire It's Spider-Man (it will always be), and there's no way to say the opposite, seeing Michael Keaton as Batman again and the film's soundtrack is more than just top marks, it's something that becomes unique and specialWere Christian Bale, Ben Affleck, George Clooney, Val Kilmer good actors as Batman? Yes it was... but the one who really made his mark as Batman is Michael Keaton, and it would be even better for Jack Nicholson to appear as the jokerA cool film to watch and well done.

title: So bad... So very, very bad.
text:
So bad...
So very, very bad.I'd forgotten that films could be this bad. Surely there's a base level of "entertainment" that comes from watching reasonable quality visuals. Surely.But no. Not even that.Never has such expense looked so cheap.The level of cheese on display was truly shocking, with the film's tone sliding haphazardly from "comedy" to "drama" and back at such a rate and in such a clashing manner that neither could take hold for even a second, leaving us, the viewers, stranded and sliding on the slick surface. Yet despite the irksome, flickering tone, it all remained so hideously predictable.So bad...
So very, very bad.

title: A Time Travel Specialist Movie
text: In The Flash, I praised the story and the theme it deals with, performances of all the cast, especially the ones of Miller and Keaton, direction, screenplay, entertainment value, comedic scenes, visual and sound effects, action scenes, cinematography, and ending, which resets the DCEU that we know, to some extent.But regarding the flaws, what I didn't like is the very confusing and missy storytelling at nearly the end of the movie regarding travelling in time and the collision of the multiverse, although I understood the main idea. Also, although I liked the visual effects in most of the movie, in some scenes, they were not so good.But these flaws do not mean that I didn't like The Flash. I liked it and enjoyed it, and I am looking forward to see what happens in the DC Universe in the future. When it comes to the score, I gladly give The Flash 9 out of 10.

title: Amazing Fun Emotion all at one!!!!!
text: The visualization of Flashtime and Speedforce that is presented really spoils the eye, the relationship between Barry and Nora Allen here is also very emotional and full of sadness, Barry's action at the opening of this film is very epic, satisfying acting from the actors and actresses, funny jokes and their placement which is appropriate at the time, the music that is displayed also makes this film even cooler, especially when Barry first time travels, the design of the dark flash costume and the main flash is quite cool and good, the cameo that is shown is also very nostalgic and satisfied, the action from Batkeaton and Supergirl (Sasha Calle) is also very cool, the concept of the multiverse that is brought is also quite simple and different from the others, but the CGI in this film is still relatively rough and there is a lack of screentime on the main enemy.

title: where is grand gustin and the rest of the original cast ?
text: Ok there is no flash without grant. He is the original real tv flash hero and i wonder why the hell they did not hired him to play the role in the big screen too.The actor who played flash was acting like a retarted kid. Terrible choice 4 this role.For me this ruined the movie as also the movie was ruined by the rejection of the rest of the original tv cast of the flash 2014-2023 tv series.I dunno what smoke they smoking those who created the film version but they should take notice the flash tv series run for like 10 years. Not one and not two. 10 whole years and people loved the original actor who played barry allen and it's a huge mistake not to have him play in the film flash too.Same goes with the rest of the original cast.Now if u can skip the fateful mistake and still u can get through the film u will have a regular nice time with all those standart effects and the well known story of barry travelling back in time to save his mother etc stuff but like i said. The movies is ruined for me as i thought i would get to see my beloved original tv cast play in the movie too. How wrong i was......

title: Its 8.5 for me
text: The Best is in Act 1, the opening already makes me wow and goosebumps, the action scene is very solid and cool, they give doubt whether our heroes could do their jobs or not, it felt down to earth, not a perfect being, i think the moments original timeline should have been longer.The story is full of comedy but it placed right, not ruining the emotion and tension just like the MCU did.There are a lot of cameos, some of which are quite influential in the storyline.Final Act, Its good but not on scale of Man of Steel even though the story scene was clearly taken from there. No wonder the Zod actor says he's like an Action Figure, their actions just too few. Only the giant Kryptonian get the better fight scene.The ending was unexpected, unlike superheroes movies in general. Maybe there will be many disappointed with the ending.Biggest drawback.CG in speed force just like PS2 graphics 😂.It's great, but still under Zack Snyder's justice league.It can compete with No Way Home. But if NWH doesn't include other Spidermans, then clearly The Flash is a winner.Note* there is a reference to ZSJL.

title: Michael Keaton meets supergirl, oh and Flash made a cameo!
text: 200 hundred millions costed this??? If they gave me 1 millon I could have made something millions times better, bad script, bad plot, bad acting, horrible music that didn't fix in any scene, my little 4 years old brother could have written something more coherent, epic and trascedent than this one, why the screenwriters are so lazy now??? Me as a writer I feel eager that these writers had such a big opportunity and didn't exploit it, screenwriters these days should receive a decrease in salary, it's a shame, ONE OF THE BEST SUPER HEROES EVER CREATED, EPIC STORY, EPIC CHARACTER, and they forced so much to ruin it??? Come on, this movie wasn't even about flash, batman and supergirl had more epic scenes than the actual flash, a justice league movie with just a flash cameo, that's it, hurt who it hurts, that's the truth, 1/10.

title: A firm step of the DC Universe
text: The new proposal of the DC Universe fulfills what it promised in the trailer. It is an exciting adventure full of adrenaline in time loops and alternate universes with a strong emotional and nostalgic charge to recover what was lost by the protagonist.In fact, it is this emptiness of maternal love that is Flash's main motivation to use his powers to reverse the earthly absence of his mother (a stupendous Maribel Verdú who shines and transmits a warm energy in her brief and substantial time on screen).The tone of the film has a perfect balance between the comedic moments, the inherent tragedy of the loss of a loved one and how it leaves indelible marks, and the fast-paced action scenes fighting General Zod again in an alternate universe created by mistake by Flash in his eagerness to modify events from his childhood.There are great movie winks like when Flash goes through a wall that has the same Raquel Welch poster that Andy Dufresne used in The Shawshank Redemption to camouflage the hole that would lead him to freedom.In the alternate world, Eric Stolz is not fired from Back to the Future and Michael J. Fox is the protagonist of Footloose.Of all the characters that appear in the alternate universe, it's Michael Keaton's Batman who takes the cake. 30 years away, he returns to print that freshness that made him one of the favorite interpreters of The Knight of the Night.He doesn't take down Supergirl. I was not convinced by the choice of actress, however her performance is solvent, showing a brave and supportive Kryptonian.I have read comments on Twitter from detractors of the CGI of the film.They seem unfounded to me as they reflect the perception of Flash at full speed.The final part is emotional by displaying a tribute to Superman in all the possibilities of his existence in parallel worlds.The movie is a firm step forward for the DC Universe.Sets the bar high for future installments.

title: I really wanted to love it but i didnt :(
text: I went in hoping i would see something as amazing as into the spider verse, i really love flash and all the DCEU characters. But for starters the CGI was the worst I've ever seen in any movie... all the characters look stupid, the script is all over the place. All the humor they tried to put in made no sense. A-lot of the lines made no sense, alot of the scenes made no sense, wheres the actual villain in this whole movie anyways...?? I didnt understand anything and i really hoped that i did. Ben affleck looked sick in the movie, as in literally somethings up, why is he so thin. And why does is mask look so weird whats up with his nose?? All the other characters had almost no purpose being there. Im really really disappointed with this movie. Wish i never saw it.

title: It's the bomb!
text: Well, at least the latest bomb from DC. From the start DC has fumbled the ball. What had needed to do was introduce characters, allow people to get an emotional connection to them individually and then create a team centric movie. Instead, they throw characters together in a team setting where there is no emotional connection and THEN have stand alone movies. Doesn't make a lick of sense.This could also be chalked up to genre fatigue. Sure, some Marvel movies open big but then they fizzle out. After 15 years of rapid fire superhero releases (maybe at least 50?) the general public might be getting exhausted by the same story over and over again.Hopefully a change is a comin'x.

title: Just Brilliant!
text: I just got back from movie, it was actually an amazing experience. I've never seen movie with that much vfx and fun. Some of the CGI looks bad on purpose because some of them was an excellent. Movie is almost 3 hours long and you can't even realize that. It was quick and fun with very good and unexpected storyline. This is how superhero movie should look like. I could even feel lightning in my body, even tho it wasn't 3D that movie doesn't need that. You can feel every inch of the movie from flash perspective. Don't listen to marvel fanboys and haters because of ezra miller. Every actor has his private life movie and actor's life is very different things.

title: Excellent way to say goodbye.
text: Fantastic movie with exceptional performances. Ezra is obviously the albatross around this movie; that if you are able to suspend, will provide for a truly entertaining escape. Keaton steals the show and gives the nostalgia bait movie some great moments. Pacing is well done and their's actually some heart to this movie. Closing out the Synderverse in a fitting way with cameos galore. It's a welcome departure from Marvel and most other Superhero movies that have come out recently. Credit where credit is due and this movie deserve credit for breaking the mold and creating a great popcorn flick. Kudos to The Flash team.

title: Cheap Fun
text: And by cheap, I mean the CGI was terrible. Recently saw the director trying to explain it away: 'You're seeing things all distorted from Flash's perspective while traveling at such great speeds' or some bologna like that. Oh really? So what's your explanation for the Atari-level graphics while Flash is standing still? There's no reason whatsoever audiences should reward such cheap laziness in this day and age. Otherwise, I was quite surprised by how invested I got in the story itself and how much I enjoyed it. The terrible CGI, unfortunately, is impossible to ignore or disregard when weighing the film in its entirety. I keep coming back to the point that there is absolutely no excuse for it in this day and age and can only be attributed to utter cheapness or indifference.In my little one-horse town we have a Mexican restaurant that is about 20 years old. Service there has always sucked, and especially in the past 5 years, the quality of the place has just gone into the stinker hole. That is until this year - when word got around that a brand NEW Mexican restaurant was coming to town. Suddenly the owners of the old stinky restaurant seem to care. They've painted the place, bought new tables, remodeled, their menu has improved. All in preparation to compete with this new restaurant coming in.See, they couldn't care less about indifferently shoveling crap at the inhabitants of the town as long as they know the money will keep coming in. It's only when that money flow is at risk do they begin to care. That's how I felt leaving this Flash movie. (See, you weren't sure I had a point.) I couldn't help but think 'They actually believe they can shovel that crap CGI at their audience and we'll just gobble it down and not notice or mind because of all the cameos and whatever else they threw in there.' Well, I think it's high time these studios start suffering some losses for it.

title: A Great movie but not a masterpiece
text: Despite Warner Brothers constantly advertising that The Flash will be the best thing since sliced bread (it's not), they still managed to release a great movie that thankfully ends the DCEU. This movie was not a Batman movie as some would believe, it was a Flash film through and through. Ezra Miller surprisingly gave a really good performance as The Flash and if they were not so controversial, I can see them continuing the Flash mantle. The only real bad thing about the movie is the horrible CGI. Some of them look like a PS2 game and that's no joke. The cameos could have been better, but they were only like 7 seconds long each. Overall, it's a really great movie that I'd recommend, but it's not the best CBM of all time.

title: Dumpster Fire to celebrate a terrible actor!
text: I hope the actor/writer strike goes on forever so we are safe from garbage like this and terrible human being who a celebrated when they are bad actors too!This movie is as much of a flop as Indy 5 because bad writing, plot holes, bad CGI and bad acting! Ezra Miller should be boycotted for being a terrible human being. When Jonny Depp was wrongly accused, Disney kicked him out. When everyone knows what POS Ezra is, he can keep his act! What a world! But at least the movie bombed and it might help DC to get rid of this criminal! Otherwise people will hopefully remember when the next Flash is being forced on us!

title: Disappointing
text: The movie starts with mood and looking in position to be a good movie. But then, the movie slowly starts getting really in bad mood and a really bad shape compared from the start. It felt like everything was off the movie or even feeling like it's off the paper. The atmosphere and background effects were good but were in shape of being poorly executed on a future scene. This movie for me was really disappointing, and Batman looked really different from what he looked like in the movie The Dark Knight or Batman v Superman. The characters looked really different, which dissapointed me. I do not reccomend watching this movie, it is a waste of our time and money.

title: DC is back(sorta)
text: This movie is really great. Not the best film ever like advertised, but it really hits all the emotional, dramatic and funny beats. Ben Affleck's last showing is Batman was done really well, I just wished he had his own solo film. This movie respects Snyder's films and previous DC media. I do believe it should have had Grant Gustin as a cameo. Sasha Calle is very promising as Supergirl and it would be dope if she returns in Supergirl Woman of Tomorrow. The only real downside is the messy CGI, but the whole movie is a love letter to DC and I hope this movie is as enjoyable to you as it is to me!

title: Why why why ?
text: The whole point of creating a superhero movie is to make it believable in front of the viewers eyes. The CGI is the worst I have seen ever in any DC movie. Have always been a DC fan , but with this being such a bad one, I am so sad. Had very high hopes , but was completely disappointed. And after this Muschietti has to say the CGI was intentional, ya dude, admit it , that it was horrible. Supergirl was more like a cartoon walking around in the fighting scenes with Zod. Very very bad. I dont know what Muschietti was even thinking . More like a horrible parody to Man of steel :). Skip this movie.

title: Great film let down by Poor CGI
text:
The cast was perfect. Ezra was amazing! Pretty done with Ben as Batman.Never been a fan of they. Great action film great humour but the cgi.... Soo distracting
Great special effects until a human face was involved and then it was terrible :/
Using a double for Ezra and cgi the head in some parts was also very distracting.I noticed it way too often. And all the cgi cameos were terrible cgi also.. I couldn't believe it ..For a film with such a big budget I'm really disappointed they did that on purpose.Best part of the film was michael Keaton. Should have been his own stand alone filmSo all in all good film let down by the cgi... which apparently was Deliberate :/

title: Fun and surprisingly character-driven
text: "The Flash" is a fun and surprisingly character-driven superhero film, carried by its great ensemble. Yes, some CGI is not really up-to-date, but all in all, it's not as bad as most people try to make it.Michael Keaton - as well as the other 'Batmen' - is the highlight, as it really feels like he never stepped away from the role. Nevertheless, it's a pity that we'll never get to see a standalone movie with Batfleck, as I felt that he really grasped the nuances of Bruce Wayne's pain this time.Also, Ezra Miller as the double Barry was great. He convincingly played the young and dumb Barry as well as the older and more settled version.The only thing missing for a 10/10 was a more faithful adaption of Flaspoint, as Eobard Thawne as the antagonist was really missing.

title: It's not great. Very boring!
text: One of the primary issues with "The Flash" was its poorly developed plot. The narrative lacked coherence and failed to offer a compelling storyline. The movie jumped between different timelines and dimensions without providing adequate explanations or clear transitions, leaving audiences confused and struggling to follow the convoluted events unfolding on the screen. The lack of a solid narrative foundation robbed the film of emotional depth, making it difficult to become invested in the characters or their motivations.Furthermore, the script suffered from weak dialogue and predictable clichés. Characters delivered lines that felt flat and uninspired, lacking the wit and charm associated with the comic book counterpart. The dialogue often felt forced and lacked the necessary emotional resonance to captivate viewers. As a result, the interactions between characters felt contrived and failed to establish meaningful connections.Another major disappointment was the mishandling of the film's visual effects. With a character like the Flash, known for his incredible speed and time-bending abilities, one would expect the movie to capitalize on the opportunity to create visually stunning sequences. However, the CGI was subpar, at best, leaving the action scenes feeling lackluster and unimpressive. The filmmakers failed to deliver on the potential to showcase the Flash's powers in an innovative and breathtaking manner, ultimately robbing the film of its much-needed spectacle.Furthermore, the character development in "The Flash" was sorely lacking. The protagonist, Barry Allen, portrayed by a talented actor, was given little depth and remained largely one-dimensional throughout the film. The supporting characters, including iconic figures from the Flash universe, also suffered from underdevelopment, lacking compelling arcs or significant contributions to the overall narrative. This lack of investment in character growth limited the audience's ability to connect with and root for the individuals onscreen.Lastly, the pacing of the film was inconsistent and disjointed. Scenes felt rushed, lacking the necessary build-up and emotional weight, while others dragged on without contributing substantially to the overall story. This uneven pacing created a disjointed viewing experience, preventing the film from gaining momentum and engaging the audience effectively.In conclusion, "The Flash" proved to be a disappointing addition to the superhero film canon. Despite its potential for an exciting and visually stunning experience, the movie faltered due to its weak plot, lackluster dialogue, underwhelming visual effects, shallow character development, and inconsistent pacing. While there were certainly elements that showed promise, the execution ultimately fell short of delivering a memorable and satisfying superhero film.

title: Another boring and very expensive mess in the DC house.
text: "The Flash" is, yet, another example of how much the DC universe is agonizing at a cinematographic level, compared to the much more serious and professional Marvel Universe: as usual, Marvel intuitions are plundered, rewriting them worse, in a flood of CGI, multiverses, many unjustified Superman and a Michael Keaton, randomly fished out of the Tim Burton era. Andy Muschietti shows all his directorial paucity, already amply expressed with "Mother" or the very boring "IT". It's also really strange to see the lanky Ezra Miller (quite ridiculous in interpreting The Flash) on the screen, multiple accused in reality of violence, drug possession and criminal behavior. In short, yet another ugly and very expensive mess in the DC house, which copies left and right from Marvel (this time directly from the very bad, but better than this Flash, "Doctor Strange in the Multiverse of Madness", to be precise): hopefully the last remnant of the Snyder era for poor DC Comics.

title: Not as bad as some people
text: Just after the release, this movie got a lot of negative reviews regarding the CGI not looking good and not doing justice to the original Flashpoint story. I get it but as a standalone movie, this is one of the best DCEU movies, entertaining throught with something for everyone, hardcore fans and casual movie watchers alike. Filled with a lot of movie and pop culture references. The end might not be satisfactory for evryone but it's necesaary for what's about to come in James Gunn's DCEU next I guess. I did feel the story was rushed in a lot of places but a delight to watch as a DC fan anyways.

title: Fun comic book movie with some flaws
text: Finally a good film from the DCU world. I am aware of all the problems that accompanied this film, before the shooting itself, as well as those problems that remained and were not solved, that is, we are waiting for their resolution. Anyway, I liked the movie, it entertained me, it has a good story and characters, a good balance of comedy and drama.It was immediately clear to me that the film would be based on the Flashpoint comic story with some changes. I think the movie did it successfully, although I have to admit that the original Flashpoint is a better option for me, but that story will probably never be surpassed.There are a lot of characters in the film, some of which we already know, so I didn't see any problem there because this film is actually a sequel to all the other DCU films before. At times it is humorous, and at times it is serious, and the stakes are quite high.What I personally really liked were the numerous references and easter eggs to numerous other characters, the plot and scenes from the DC world in general, I think there are so many that I probably couldn't catch them all in one viewing. I also see how the film was made just for the fans, and that can be a double-edged sword, because if the film relies solely on fan service, then we have a hollow film, but that's not the case here, at least I didn't experience it that way.I complain about two things about the film. The first is that there is a lot of CGI, which in itself is not necessarily a bad thing, in fact it is even expected in such films, but the problem is that the CGI in some scenes is bad, obvious and looks like it was made with twenty-year-old technology years, at least. The other thing I resent is the direction this is going to take because I really have no idea, and I don't think the people involved are either. Considering the ending of the movie, the various problems that follow the DCU and the casting, it seems to me that this can't go in a good direction, but I hope I'm wrong.The conclusion at the end is that I really liked the movie, I enjoyed it, it wasn't boring or stupid, I had fun and that's the most important thing, I don't have any major complaints about the movie itself.

title: A great entertainment
text: This is really a good entertaining movie. Don't believe all the bad press about it. Even if you hate Ezra Miller that doesn't mean you should boycott it because there are other tens of actors in the movie who are worth to be watched. Even if the CGI isn't the best that doesn't mean the story is bad. The story and plot are very good, even Ezra acting was very good. He plays 2 characters with 2 complete different personalities. This is very challenging but he succeeded in that. Some people are annoyed by his fast erratic speech and that's true that the other grown-up Ezra talks about it to his younger self. The final touch in the movie is also very clever too. Which made the ending open to the reset that James Gunn wants to make to the DC world.It really deserves the watch. Ah and I forgot to mention it's very funny too.

title: dun dun dun dun ... FLASH!! aaaahaaaaa
text: So, I am late to the party but I had fun. Little off the topic, I was watching Ghost Rider (Sir Nicholas) and was complaining about how campy super heroes are almost gone. Then I saw The Flash, after hearing all the complains about CGI, lead actor's crime spree and DCpocalypse etc. To be honest the whole superhero genre has become so saturated every single movie has become throwaway one time watch with the exception of Guardians of the Galaxy 3, which I will watch maybe 2 more times. This movie however, I will come back to time and again whenever I'll do DC marathon because for all it's flaws it has heart. It's obviously not Dark Knight or Endgame, not even close but it has all the flavors that I need from a superhero movie.Now, I've seen all projects from Andy Muschietti and this is a complete different tone from his other projects. His style of comedy is somewhat like James Gunn but not quite as dark. For this movie it wasn't as ridiculously overboard as Thor: Love and Thunder nor as grim as Batman V Superman or as dumb as Josstice League. Humor is big part of this movie. Its basically another character but I liked how serious and heartfelt moments were truly serious and heartfelt. Jokes didn't repeat and the performances were overall great.Special shoutout to Kara Jor-El who I was skeptical about but turned out to be great addition to this movie. Michael Keaton, I am not worthy enough to talk about him. I wish we got more of Batfleck but sigh, people would've complained about runtime. I really really liked the Maribel who played Barry's mother. In short screentime she really made me tear up in the climax. Michael Shannon was wasted.I really did not mind the CGI because where it mattered, it was really really great. It wasn't terrible in the sense it was unfinished. It was just terrible because of an artistic choice and that happens from time to time. It didn't bother me and after few years when people look back at this film, it's not gonna matter to them either because othewise this is all fun and great times.Great job to everyone in the crew.

title: A great superhero (origin-ish) flick which is well worth your time !
text:
I'll start this review off by saying, this review of the movie isn't motivated by any personal affairs of the cast and crew and is fully based on my thoughts about
The movie and what I liked and didn't like about it.The movie picks up at great pace with an impressive opening scene with introductions of the main characters and the basic premise of how they are.The Action scenes are very well choreographed, edited and thought out which makes all the fight/action scenes without having excessive jumpcuts making it more enjoyable to watch. This is the criteria the movie mainly excels in over the other parts.While I see many other speaking of how this movie relies too much on cameos and the nostalgia of the older audiences, I felt that the cameos just added more to the experience of the movie without weighing it down by any means by tying up the cameos into the narrative without making it feel out of place and added in just for the sake of it.The biggest gripe I have with this movie is its sometimes horrendous CGI. Although it looks decent or good most of the time, in some scenes they look really horrible.
