Those are in which two Ezra millers are in one shot or certain combat sequences where the facial models look horrible. Sometimes the facial models looked similar to the video game "L. A. Noire" and sometimes it looked worse than that too with the facial models of certain people which I can't reveal here.Overall, The movie is really great and well worth your money if you're looking to have a good time with genuinely praisable performances by the cast and not making it overstuffed. 8.5/10.

title: Please 🙏🏻 just stop making these
text: I really wanted to see this movie. I'm a big fan of the Flash TV series with Grant Gustin. I really thought this movie would be along the same lines as the series. Definitely not. Barely there plot, poor acting. This was a HUGE disappointment. From the previews it looked like this major action movie with all the superheroes working together against evil. Nope. So watered down. A few cameos and not even good ones. The whole thing was actually insulting - does Hollywood really think this is what people want to see? Not me. Waste of money. I think I fell asleep at one point. Reminded me of the horrible Thor movie (Love and Thunder). Same caliber. Do not recommend seeing it. Even the teaser at the end of the credits was a big nothing burger. Stop trying to make these super hero movies into something they were never meant to be.

title: Not worth the time
text: Movie is well over 2 hour long. Felt like 4. The script is a mess and the longer the story get, the more it come clear that they actually didn't take their time to write an actual story. The VFX are terrible (most part of the film) for a movie of this time. I did enjoy the reprise role with Keaton as Batman but I really don't ever get any connection to any of the characters.I don't feel the movie get an ending on the «war» against General Zod either.I would recommend to just skip watching this and watch modern The Flash series instead. It's way better. Thankfully we want get a sequel after Ezra Miller stunts during the production of this movie.

title: Unfinished
text: For the most part I enjoyed the movie. I couldn't help but noticed a couple of things that just really bothered me. Ben Affleck with very little screen time. Every bit he was in was amazing. Costume wise; could have done better. His nose looked huge like it was broken. The cgi throughout the whole movie in fact looked unfinished. The movie felt like it was rushed out. I understand there was a trial and everything with Ezra Miller but post production? I'm pretty sure the people working that was not held back by trial. Seems lazy. Michael Keaton was amazing as usual. I really enjoyed Sasha Calles performance. Would be cool to see a solo Super girl movie.

title: An Amazing Superhero-Movie...
text: Flash, Batman, Wonder Women, Supergirl, everyone was at the right place. Of course, this is a movie about Flash, that was great played by Ezra Miller, and he played just great. This movie was also great, with mostly good sides, but also some bad. First of all, it is a lot of stuff happening, and I wont spoil, but I can tell a little. So this movie tells a story about Flash, he travels back in time, destroy the timeline, and he have to fix it immediately. That is basically the plot, but it is more going one later, that I wont spoil. Liked the movie very much, it was a great plot, character delevopment, and the action sequences were just like it should be in a superhero-movie. I especially liked when they was in the north and fighting with russians. The bad sides was that some of the dialogues did not fit in the movie, some of the dialogues where even stupid, and unnecessary. It is not a big deal, because it was not that bad, but I could change the dialogues here and there. Michael Keaton returns as Batman in The Flash, that I am very happy about. I liked the original 1989 Batman, he is way better than Robert Pattinson, if I have to honest. He played like Batman should be played. Ezra Miller played The Flash good too, but I liked him better in Fantastic Beasts. Supergirl (Aka Kara) played by Sasha Calle was ok, I guess, she did not play too much anyway, so I can not say a lot about her. Ok, I guess. Overall, The Flash is a great superhero-movie. A sequel is not necessary, it ended so well anyway, o gosh, the ending was fantastic! I recommend this movie for every superhero fan, and I can easily say that it was way better than Shazam 2.

title: Hard to watch, literally
text: The movie itself feels empty, we were sold the idea of more complex and deep film, instead, we got a mediocre one that doesn't even live to the bad expectations of a "basic superhero film".The bad storyline, the horrendous CGI and the poor amount of development on characters, and even settings, leaves you with a bitter taste of what could've been an awesome movie.What is supposed to be the climax of the film is disappointing, given that the beginning wasn't strong enough to say it was decent, but it could've set a better path to a superior development.In general the film just doesn't feel natural, the plot feels like it was made for the sake of an original idea, it doesn't go deep into anything, it just lays out what the story needs to make sense in a minimum way. This just makes the film feel artificial and eventually, ridiculous.I have to give it to Michael Keaton's batman, even if his lines sometimes didn't really feel okay, he does set a vibe into the film that makes it more enjoyable, and Ezra Miller's original flash, for the most part, gives out a great performance that also helps the movie.I'm personally sad about how this film turned out, I'm a fan of the series and I've been waiting a long time for this movie just to be disappointed by it, when it had so much potential. I wish I could rescue some things from the film but it just doesn't live up to the expectations. I just hope DC doesn't repeat the same thing with their upcoming projects, otherwise the franchise is looking at a dark future.

title: Cursed film that nevertheless is worth every penny and second!
text: I thought I would write a review because I think this is one of the best written and most fun superhero movies yet, which was cursed by the stupidity and ego of one Ezra Miller, who is good but far from perfect in this role.Still, I think the studio, director, cast and crew deserve a break as they clearly invested a lot of love and stamina in this project, that fell under the curse of not only the Ezra insanity, but also the Snider drama, the Cavill mishaps, superhero fatigue, scope creep and PC BS.I want to explain, why I think the reasons why this film is being hated should not prevent you from enjoying it:1. Ezra Miller: The guy is a jerk, possibly a criminal and belongs in oblivion. But when you watch the movie, you will realize that it was impossible to replace him. It would have meant basically starting it from scratch. No studio could afford that. Yes, they could have scrapped the project altogether, but we would have really missed out. This film is a ton of fun and hundreds of people put their love and sweat into making The Flash come true. Give them some respect.2. Poor CGI: This one is less deserving, but I can still give it a break. I think the project just became a budget nightmare as they added that amazing score(s), cameos, giant scenes and PR damage control, so at some point they had to compromise, and the studio's decision was to use crap CGI for a very specific set of scenes. Every time THOSE scenes play, they will look like The Polar Express. It was clearly not rushed, but a decision they made to make the film's budget possible. Outside those scenes, There's just one scene they decided to also make look horrible, and I did not like it at all, I think they went for "Let's embrace our uncanny CGI nightmare style for fun". That did not work for me. But other than that, and believe me, it's most of the film, the CGI is quite good. At least as good as the Snyder Cut.3. Problematic Cameos: Yes, there is one problematic cameo, but I don't think it was disrespectful at all. Being a longtime Sups fan, I saw it as a warm homage. I think this is where the PC crap chimes in. Let's enjoy some cheap nostalgia for what it is. It's not like people are running to buy tickets to watch a 10 seconds cameo. Come on!4. Confusing/Repetitive script: This is the mildest of the criticism I've heard. Yes, it's like the 5th Multiverse movie in a row, yes, it reminds you too much of a VERY recent movie and yes, it can be confusing, but for what is worth, I think it handled the time travel/multiverse problem elegantly, and overall, I liked it better than almost any other attempt at multiverse. But that's just my opinion.Outside the criticism, the truth is that it really is a very good movie, with tons of rewatching potential, well made nostalgia bait and a very decent story but most of all, really really funny. Go watch it!

title: So much terrible CGI, it's insane
text: If you're going to do CGI, then you CAN'T half-ass it because the viewer immediately notices it, and this movie has a crazy amount of really really bad CGI... i'm talking like 30+ scenes where you can very clearly see the bad CGI... with a budget of 200million I quite honestly don't know what they spent it all on, because it's clearly not the CGI. Maybe they had really really expensive catering on set or something? Yeah, maybe they spent 150million on catering and only had 50million left for the movie, because that's what it looks like. People made fun of the Batman vs. Superman movie because you could see how badly they edited out Henry Cavill's moustache, but this movie has 100 times worse CGI throughout the movie than one silly moustache mistake... apart from the atrocious CGI, the movie has several glaring plot holes and bad writing which just makes the entire chain of events completely unbelievable and unrealistic. This movie is far, far worse than Justice League or B.vs. S ever could have hoped to be.

title: If you've seen a bad review, ignore it. It's fantastic.
text: It's funny, clever, emotional and exciting. The story is good, the script is sharp and it's well made with just a handful of somewhat dodgy CGI moments (mostly in the opening sequence). Ezra Miller, putting all their personal issues and very problematic behaviour aside, is superb as Barry Allen/The Flash but Michael Keaton as Bruce Wayne/Batman very nearly steals the film completely. He is absolutely, and predictably, sensational and when he quotes a line from the first Batman movie it sent a shiver down my spine. There are some lovely fan service surprises which I won't spoil here but one in particular made me very very happy and one made me think 'you've got to be kidding me!'If you like superhero movies this is the best live action one in years and certainly much more satisfying and enjoyable than all the recent Marvel movies. In fact I think it could be the best DC one so far, it's easily on a par with the first Wonder Woman.

title: Probably the best DC movie
text: I was pleasantly surprised as this is quite a good movie with a great story. It kept me engaged through out it's run time. It had some great action and was lifted by it's comedic moments. It was let down by the woeful CGI in places....but that did not distract from the enjoyment....too much. It definitely deserves a sequel. I wasn't even a fan of the Flash... but Ezra Miller brings a unique perspective to the character. The actress playing Supergirl did a good job..it's a shame that DC are now recasting some of these roles in future movies. There were some great and surprising cameos in the movie.

title: CGI bad story GREAT
text: Okay, I expected nothing from this film until I saw the trailers. This movie exceeded my expectations. I don't understand the weird hate it's getting from some. Snyder cultists will hate this regardless.The film has some very bad CGI, mostly when the two Barry Allen's are side-by-side. Other than that, the special effects look great. This movie has a great story, and the actors are deliver big time. Miller, while a problematic figure, is great as Flash. Keaton is phenomenal. Some of the best Keaton-Batman action I've ever seen. Affleck delivers!At the center of this is a emotional story about a boy and his mom, and I was entertained and sucked in for the entire runtime. I was laughing consistently throughout. Great movie with some minor flaws.

title: Why all the hate?
text: I initially avoided this movie when it started streaming because of the bad reviews but was pleasantly surprised. Yes Barry is slightly annoying at first but it's a solid story and Keaton doesn't disappoint. Affleck is unrecognizable in his mask which was perplexing at first (not giving anything away here). In the stale time-travel/multi-verse medium I thought this was a good fresh look. Way better than No Way Home in terms of converging multiverse heroes, and that's coming from a Marvel fan and DC tolerator (I fell asleep during Justice League). There were no "that's absurd and wouldn't happen like that" moments which is rare these days.

title: Bashed and underrated for no reason!
text: I will never forgive myself for not actually paying a ticket to see this one on the big screen. I was unconsciously influenced by the bad reviews and mockery that seemed to flood the entire internet. I am sure that there are many others like, who were unaware of the fact that they are part of the reason this movie flopped at the box office. I finally watched it today, now that it's available for streaming and it was so much better than I expected! The movie is very entertaining, the storyline playing at perfect pace and I'm only complaining about the tonal inconsistencies here and there. There's a bit too much humor involved at times which in my opinion keeps the storyline from having the right emotional impact. The jokes are good though and Ezra Miller gives a solid impressive double performance. I loved everything Michael Keaton related and he was the main reason I decided to watch the movie after all the heat it got, but ended up liking it in its entirety.In my opinion, the second best DCEU movie after Wonder Woman storywise, but #1 when it comes to entertainment factor!

title: The best movie of 2023
text:
I can't believe I am saying this but The Flash was the best movie of 2023 and I mean it.I am and have always been like 80% of Marvel and 20% of DC but.. the past couple years it has been drastically changed. (Some may say that they copy each other but, hey.. the comic characters themselves are almost the same at the first place, so no harm in this.. as long as we get a good picture to look)..
DC movies keep getting better and better and The Flash was a perfect proof of that.The movie is very good, it has drive, no boring gaps, the content is healthy and not messy, cast was great (Ezra was phenomenal.. as always..) and I loved how they inserted and brought back the old characters..
I would give 11/10 to this movie. And I hope that the second will be even better.. fingers crossed.

title: Michael Keaton is everything
text: I did not have high hopes for this. Ezra Miller is a garbage human being, but their acting has been ok in the past. I am angry that they portrayed Barry Allen as a moron, he has genius level intellect. The only positive in this movie is Michael Keaton being Batman again! They should have taken the time to recast this after the whole news break on how horrible of a person Ezra is. Then rewritten Barry at the intelligence level that he is. They could have done so much more to make this a better story. Maybe there should have been a different director, since this one didn't care to develop the character properly.

title: Lord Ezra Miller !!!!!
text: I'm a DC fan Already but I follow Marvel as well, both are fabulous in their own way. So today, I watched this much talked about movie of our "king of controversies" Ezra Miller, and he absolutely nailed it. You'd want to be like him. Damn, you'll fall in love with him by seeing his performance. This guy is literally the best. And most importantly, he is living his Dream life, perfect in all aspects in this young age.The movie contains all elements beautifully, whether it is humour, mind blowing story, awesome cast and cameos, the acting, the direction, the screenplay, the background music, the picturization, everything is by far the perfect and most Entertaining movie of DC.Ezra is the USP of DC and no one could've done it better than him.

title: A very average DC Movie and that is not saying much.
text: I got to the theater on opening night on Friday and expected the place to be packed. Instead there were dozens of empty seats which was very surprising.The first hour of the Movie is probably the dullest part but it at least it makes sense and has a cohesive story.Ezra playing off of Ezra does not make for a good entertainment but it at least has a story that we can follow. By time you get to the last third of the Movie things become a CGI mess and they are literally throwing in everything including the Kitchen Sink just hoping that with enough nostalgic scenes they will make a scatter shot that is bound to hit most fans with some oh wow moment.About the most redeeming factor in this Movie is Keaton and the Super Girl Character. They could have probably spun her off into her own movie and that would have been far more entertaining.Don't waste your time waiting on the after credit scene, it means nothing and adds nothing.Overall I really wished this movie had been good but instead it just felt like a disjointed mess of bad CGI and cameos from anyone willing to take a buck.

title: So damn enjoyable, amazing IMAX experience
text: I just want to point that I have 1,999 reviews I'll most likely make Snatch by Guy Ritchie my 2K review. Anyways this is one of the best superhero adaptions ever Ezra Miller was perfect for the role and I absolutely loved the way the directing was done so much of the movie is epic! The time travel sequences were so good, everything science related is so brilliant to me and from to finish the entire experience stayed enjoyable.I understand bashing Ezra for their personal life but if you void that out you're in for a real treat truly one of the best DC films besides Joker. I loved The Flash a lot and hope others do too! Seriously my review isn't that bad if it makes a difference I have autism I enjoy most movies there's only a handful I don't like this doesn't deserve hate it's so much fun! Come on stop hating on my thoughts even if you disagree entirely with everything it's definitely well directed.

title: Bravo! Superhero movie GOAT. You can't ask for more!
text: Brilliant! Bravo! As a fan of Flashpoint my expectations were high and I must say it hit its mark. It's a gift for fans, so much fanfare my head is spinning. This blows campy marvel movies out the water! The plot keeps you at the edge of your seat, the acting is top tier, the banter is surprisingly hilarious, and the action scenes are original and badass. I love the character choices, Keaton embodies the gritty Batman we all love. Every actor chosen fill their roles so perfectly. I was hooked and filled with wonderment. Superhero movie done right, finally! We need a part 2, marvel take notes! DC is back baby!

title: Should've Been in 3D
text: It is such a travesty this movie had so much awesome CGI and special effects but was not released in 3D. I really tried to enjoy it but it just looked entirely too flat. I just kept thinking in the back of my head how much better it would've looked with depth and just couldn't think about anything else. I hope James Gunn brings 3D back to Warner Brothers because nothing from the studio interests me at the moment. It's very unfortunate because the movie wasn't that bad, my favorite part was the Michael Keaton Batman, he stole the show. I also didn't like how they purposefully left the Henry Cavill Superman out of the movie completely.

title: It's a fantastic movie as a dc fan from watching keaton in childhood
text: Its so nicee as a dc fan myself I was so excited to watch the movie cuz of keaton and all the set they have done and it didn't disappoint not a single part of the story its nice to see affleck and alfred one more time.Sasha the(supergirl) I wasn't expecting more of her but shes done a great job as well and the main part Barry Allen aka EZRA MILLER got me laughing so harrddd and he made it look like a flash filmm i give more credit to ezra I'm not gonna spoil so much so thats it. It has a nice time travel concept. Also its so weird that people are hating this movie cuz of ezras personal life which is very disappointing as a dc fan . A real truthful critic would never do that. That's it also stay for the post credit scenes mark my wordsssss. Thank u.

title: Failed In Every Universe
text: He goes back in time to try and save his mother and, of course, screws up space/time. The movie veers between farce and pathos so badly that it makes you seasick. It tries handwavium to "explain" the metaverse and space/time (this is even worse than Spider-Man and the metaverse). It has the usual painfully awkward Main Character (implies he is on the spectrum); somehow the movie industry thinks the world is full of over-aged teenagers with serious angst. It shoves music in your face (pitiful attempt to attract some age young age group). The only interesting characters are Keaton as retired Batman and Calle as Supergirl.

title: Fantastic movie with sloppy CGI
text: First and foremost, this movie was amazing. The emotional beats in this movie were all hit and the humor was pretty good aside some cringy jokes. The story is the main bridge for this movie because it really holds it all together nicely. Ezra Miller presented a really good Barry Allen, but I don't want them to return to the role. Michael Keaton's return as Batman gave me literal goosebumps. I felt like a kid watching the old man kick some butt. Sasha Calle is a good supergirl. Now, the CGI in this movie is atrocious. It is bad. Some parts of the CGI is good, but some shots were really embarrassing. If people can look past the CGI(a lot of people won't), they can see a movie that was made with care and love for the DC universe as a whole.

title: And they claimed this to be the greatest
text: How is this the greatest comic book movie ever? They botched up the flash point story line. The CGI is so bad I don't want to talk about it and the acting is cheesy at best. I mean flash is a funny character but ezra miller was borderline annoying. They could have made such a great movie if they had put in some effort. Flash point is one of the best stories in the DC comics but the movie doesn't do justice to it. Nolan proved that comic book stories need not be illogical and snyder made visually marvelous movies. The recent DC movies are mediocre at best. Let's see what changes they make hence forth.

title: A good and fun movie that is over-hated
text: The Flash delivers a superhero movie that strikes a remarkable balance between heart, action, and a well-crafted narrative. Anchored by a captivating protagonist and complemented by thrilling sequences, this film takes audiences on an immersive journey through the world of the Scarlet Speedster.At the core of The Flash lies a narrative that seamlessly blends emotional depth and exhilarating action. As the film explores the journey of Barry Allen, viewers are treated to a well-paced story that showcases his growth as a superhero. From his struggles to his triumphs, every step of his transformation is captured with precision, ensuring a captivating viewing experience.The action sequences in The Flash are nothing short of spectacular. With the utilization of Barry Allen's superhuman speed, the film offers breathtaking visuals and thrilling set pieces that capture the essence of the Scarlet Speedster's powers. These moments of intense action are expertly woven into the narrative, propelling the story forward and leaving audiences on the edge of their seats.While The Flash deserves recognition for its merits, it is important to acknowledge and respect the choices individuals make when it comes to their entertainment preferences. Ezra Miller's personal life and the challenges surrounding it may have influenced some viewers' decisions not to engage with the show. It is crucial to understand that personal experiences and beliefs shape our choices, and it is respectful to honor those decisions.In conclusion, The Flash is a superhero spectacle that strikes a commendable balance between heart, action, and a well-crafted narrative. With its immersive storytelling and thrilling action sequences, this film offers an engaging and entertaining cinematic experience. However, it is important to respect and understand that individuals may choose not to watch the show due to personal reasons, and their choices should be respected.

title: One of the best DC movies yet
text: The Flash has become a fantastic film, with the show stolen by Michael Keaton who returns as Bruce Wayne / Batman after 30 years. DC's multi-verse starts very strong and hopefully that line will be continued, because the DC films are actually very volatile. A downside of the film are the CGI effects that seem to come straight from 2003, a bit on the same level as from The Mummy Returns how Dwayne Johnson looked like The Scorpion King. You simply can't get away with that in 2023 and how this is possible with a decently expensive film is really the question. The exploration of director Andy Muschietti was that all these scenes are playing inside Barry Allens head and it was done on purpose, because everything has been deformed in the mind of Barry. Well... i really doubt that story, but well. Don't let that spoil the fun in any case, because that really is not fair to burn the movie only on that detail. The Flash is just a big fat recommendation to run to the cinema for. Oh yes, and of course, stay seated when the credits roll, because after the credits you get to see a nice aftercredit.

title: Just watched the flash
text: I know this movie has a lot of controversy around but that doesn't mean it's a bad film. Barry Allen's journey in this movie is really well done and emotional. Sacha Calle super girl I thought was really under utilised and didn't have enough screen time. But the main star of this film is Micheal Keaton Batman, he steels every scene he's in and it's just great to see him dawn the iconic look one last time. As for the CGI, in most scenes it does look really bad and it makes you wonder where all the money for this film went. The third act for this film is really messy and it can kind of leave you underwhelmed.

title: Not reached it's full potential
text: I like the flash, it's character that evolves, learns from his mistakes, meanwhile being more attached to the people emotionally, this in turn giving him energy, motivation to fight the bad guys.Well, we see traces of this description in this movie, though majorly mixed with experimental, rather childish methods. I like experiments, new, added flavours, unlike many. It brakes the monotonicity, gives new ways to surface, even the same emotions about character, story.And in part it works, the story is compelling, the ending sequence is interesting, it's new way for sure. The older Batman is okay. Interaction with Justice League is short but okay. Action scenes, not counting bad CGI, are okay.About the negative things, why it's just average.First, I don't like Ezra, his acting is sluggish, lightweight, It has chronic "making fun of everything" problem. Too shallow, difficult to build depth for character this way. He is too introvert and extrovert at the same time on screen. Very weird indeed. To my suprise, he played the older Barry better after that Barry took things seriously, which is saviour.Other negatives include: bad CGI, childish dialogues, unfunny jokes, awkwardness.

title: A movie with a heart (Barry) and soul (the other Barry)
text: Seen It! It is not at all the masterpiece that some early reviews have said. However, it is a film, unlike many in the genre, with soul (Barry Allen) and heart (the other Barry Allen). It's a journey for both. And guided by a mentor, Michael Keaton's Batman (proving once again that he will forever be a legend in this role), who gives the film an inescapable gravity. Also the humour is very well placed and mostly lands. And the interactions between Barries are just perfect.Here and there, the pacing isn't the best and some characters (like Sasha Calle's Supergirl, which leaves us wanting to see more) and some story points needed to breathe...... Maybe expand the story a bit and split it into 2? The CGI ain't that bad, because u can clearly see it's on purpose...It's an emotional journey, no doubt. It's not a simple movie where a hero wants to defeat a villain. It's a film with a clear purpose of the central character. And Ezra Miller, despite his problems with justice, is a top notch actor and plays two roles with impressive ease... All in all, it's a solid 7.5/10, with an extra 0,5 for all the Batmen (and i mean all) in it, in a film that manages to have pretty good and inventive stuff in a genre that's getting saturated.

title: Keaton can't rescue this from doom
text: Once the idea of a multiverse was unlocked on the big screen, we knew it was going to take a lot to get Hollywood from resisting tapping into all the possibilities this could open (thanks, 'No Way Home').In 2023's 'The Flash,' we get to see the origin story of everyone's favorite anxiety-prone speed demon as he links up with some familiar faces. Putting aside Ezra Miller's off-screen issues, the actor isn't the worst part of this paint-by-numbers film. It's the fact that Andy Muschietti and his team try to make this into a big budget blockbuster to rival what Marvel churns out on the regular.Sure, it's nice to drag Michael Keaton out of retirement as he dons the bat suit one more time. And yes, there are plenty of cameos that are sort of interesting, but the film itself is a mess. This is the point where it's hard to ignore Miller's impact on the production, as the disruption caused to filming helped turn it into the trainwreck that it is.If this signals that we're almost at the end of the Snyderverse, we should all breathe a sigh of relief.

title: The Flash : No way home
text: This show has a TON of references to all the previous actors who have ever played : The Flash, Batman, Superman, Supergirl, etc. Some of them ( Nicholas Cage, cancelled in a Tim Burton superman movie ) will amaze you! If you are not a longstanding fan of the Flash or Superman, those will go over your head and you will not appreciate some important fan-service for Baby Boomers in this movie.I am a huge fan of "The Flash" on CW and worried that the movie-version would not equal the TV show, but Ezra miller in a tour-de-force takes the top-2 billings in this movie and probably has 4.5 hours of screen time in this film, all worthy of the subject material and his performance is excellent.I sure for his sake and for our sake his personal life can calm down so we can continue to see him in future sequels!Barry Allen travels back in time to bring his mother back to life, and things go awry from there. After exploring hundreds of alternative solutions to allow his mom and the Earth to exist in the same timeline, the consequent solution is achieved. I didn't expect to cry in this movie but it was really an extraordinary moment and it was one of 3 times I have cried in my life.The movie ends much like the slow-mo beginning of "Deadpool" and the price of admission is earned instantly in this short 60-seconds scene.I loved it.

title: ONE FOR THE AGES
text: An action filled movie. With emotion, humor and nostalgia. I had a blast watching this film. I watched it as a flash fan and boy, was I impressed considering what the flash series did to us fans. I can easily say this is the best film in a long long while. The humor was one of the best things about the film because it wasn't cringe or forced. The explanation of the time travel concept was the best one I've seen yet. Oh the cameos. I teared up at one specific cameo. This doesn't leave a door for the man in yellow definitely. And! Supergirl??? I need more of Sasha. She played her part to perfection, bringing a different aspect to the character. Batman being my favorite comic book character, I was getting goosebumps each time he was on screen(whatever version of him). Would I watch this again? Definitely!

title: Now where do one even begin
text: This was the long awaited the flash movie that I couldn't sleep over tracking time cancelling dates and boom they gave us this maniac that loves making jokes about dicks and scrotum of how big round object are and that the nerd got a date with iris without even making a move making me wonder who's time line it is, well not the expectation i would want but whatever the case we get what we get and in the end I bet there's not going to be another sequel to the movie because this one's kind of funny to understand but whatever the case it there money but I poured my heart out telling you it's not worth the money.

title: Loved it
text: Really enjoyed this one. Exciting, funny and with an emotional theme. I went in without any expectations and thoroughly enjoyed it, I even shed a few tears :'-)I'm not sure why people were hating on the CGI, I felt like it matched the type of story and visual style of the film. A couple little scenes might stick out a bit but overall I thought the visuals were quirky on purpose.The story was well paced and didn't feel rushed or too drawn out. Dialogue and action were well placed.Also, great acting from Ezra Miller...really the heart of the film. Some great lessons on what life teaches us and how it builds our character.Happy I went to see it myself and didn't listen to noisy bad reviews.

title: DC universe finally catches a breath!
text: One of the best time travel superhero movies ever. From start to finish the moving hit the mark at every point. Not a fan of Ezra or his antics in real life but he has acted amazingly. Both Barry's character were played with perfection. Supergirl was great too in her small role. The massive highlight was Keaton! It was like Nostalgia. All his dialogues were amazing with sincerity to his Batman role. Affleck was good too in small role. Amazing cameo by another actor at the end too. This movie was a joyride from end to finish. I only gave 9 stars due to their CGI in some places being average. They could have done better with using real scenes in some of the scenarios. This movie is must watch, highly recommended!

title: The best DC Hero Movie so far.....
text:
Yes... I consider this is the Best DC Superhero Movie so far. I tell you why.First of all, there is no stupid superhero fighting each other caused by a stupid reason.To all Superhero fans, we know that Barry Allen is always about his father and mother, but this time it was well plotted in very simple and not too much dragged into the dramatic emotion, just common and natural human way and hope.The digital characters will bring us back to old days cast and fun to watch, especially if we all remember that before Henry Cavill cast as the next Superman there was rumors of some actor casted and it was so fun to watch how the actor would look like as Superman... hahaha...., that was fun.Some of the scenes may feel too absurd and ridiculous but hey man, this is a superhero fantasy movie,
Overall, this movie is so enjoyable to watch, you would not want to miss this.

title: Michael Keaton is the GOAT
text: The movie is very comparable to Spider Man No Way Home. It's a fan favorite for those who love cameo's and connection's to precious franchise films. The CGI is terrible and distracting. However, there are several scenes that are great and excited in such a fun and memorable way. Overall, Michael Keaton's feature in the film brought me so much joy! After seeing him return as the Caped Crusader, not only did he reaffirm being the best Batman on the big screen, but the best superhero actor of all time! The ending of the film also allows for DC to finally do a reboot and closes this chapter of the DCEU. While this isn't exactly the flashpoint paradox like I would have liked, it's a definite must see on the big screen and would rewatch again.

title: It's OK
text: I would of enjoyed this film more if the character of the flash was cast better. When you're suppose to like or relate to the main character in some way, it's difficult because Ezra makes the character so hard to like. He's boring and fails to portray the level of confidence this character should have, even though the flash is a little awkward.People complain about the cgi etc, but if you've watched the TV series, you get past that pretty quick. If only the DC movies didn't stray from the story line so far.For pure entertainment purposes, you'll enjoy the movie, but if you're a comic lover, this'll probably feel unsatisfying.

title: The problem with the flash was the trailer they should be fired whoever did the trailers
text: Update, Here is why I think this movie has not done as well as it should have. First of all don't listen to the critics this probably one of the best dc movies. It was fun to arch great story and great excitement. If the trailer would have shown the action more and then focus on the fun of it. He movie would have reached a broader audience. I am disappointed because his movie won't do well, even though it will make its money back. They won't make a second or a third. Which is to bad. The thing is while the movie could have been reduce in time by properly about 10 to 15 minutes , I loved that the director did worry about showing everything at once and let he audiences decidedly what to watch.To bad ther won't be another one made it was a great showNot sure what people are complaining about. I love this movie and I have not been with the latest superhero movie. It was fun enjoyable movie. The special effects were some of the best i have seen in a long time. The way they blend together. title: Mixed feelings
text: The first part of the movie is just mired with how utterly annoying the character of Barry is made to be, emphasis on made, as he does start to change and grow as the movie reaches second half. And what is most frustrating with this movie is that it has genuine great moments and quite a lot of sacrifice that the hero has to make by the end of the movie, proving that there WAS some great writing somewhere in the beginning of the production. Sadly there WAS, as it seems that over time it just became another DC disaster with god knows who constantly trying to pivot it in different directions, adding unnecessary jokes and tangents where they shouldn't be, constantly pulling the movie into conflicting directions - is it a drama, is it a comedy, is it sci fi? Make up your mind and stick with it.Seems that almost all of the main DCU or DCEU movies suffered from this awol method of movie making, and it's sad that there wasn't a unifying master mind overseeing the whole arc whilst having free reigns of denying unnecessary exec or whoever whims on the spot.Other, non main arc recent movies such as joker, batman (sic...) are a proof that DC has great arsenal of movies, as long as someone fires everyone who had anything to do with decision making in DCEU for the last 15 years.

title: WONDERFUL GENRE EPIC!
text: Andy Muschiett's wonderful genre epic about the wide-eyed, nerdy, fast-talking, and clumsy Barry Allen, wonderfully played by Ezra Miller with wit and emotion, who is secretly the superhero known as The Flash a MetaHuman that is endowed with super speed and is a member of the Justice League which includes Batman, Superman, and Wonder Woman. This film has an intriguing time-travel plot in which Barry using his power goes beyond the speed of light traveling back in time in order to save his beloved mother from being murdered and his father from being wrongly accused of the crime, but by doing so he changes everything and creates a multiverse in a world without superheroes. Barry becomes trapped in this new reality and must find a way to restore what was, he decides to use the younger version of himself in this reality to help him. The two Barrys seek out the reclusive older Bruce Wayne who has long retired his crime fighting alter-ego of the Batman to fight against the odious General Zod, superbly played again by Michael Shannon, who has returned to annihilate humankind from the Earth. The best part of this film is Michael Keaton's brilliant show-stopping return as the Batman and in his old age he has lost nothing and delivers a totally mesmerizing scene-stealing performance that is filled with nostalgia and is the heart of this film, another plus in the scenes with Keaton's Batman is the use of Danny Elfman's iconic score from Tim Burton's classic original Batman. The terrific introduction of Supergirl/Kara Zoe-El, impressively played by Sasha Calle, who aids the Flash and Batman in their epic climactic battle against General Zod is sensation. Solid direction by Muschiett who gives his film spectacular action sequences, superlative CGI visual effects, and plenty of humor and potent emotional scenes. I very much enjoyed this film which was a fun cinematic ride and a fitting ending to the old DC Comics universe.

title: Flash R...R saviour of the universe.......
text: Some reviews seem longer than the movie itself.I shall keep this short.The film starts out where you think 'I'll give it one more minute' then I'll turn it off....but don't. It turned into a great movie that doesn't disappoint.Yes, the main character is a little annoying, but you grow to like him in the end, surprisingly.Michael Keaton is just excellent and works well in his incarnation in the film.Supergirl would work in a stand alone movie, as long as the same team work on it, otherwise it will end up like the Wonder Woman sequel!!!!Basically, stick with it and enjoy the ride...........

title: DC 's best in recent times
text: This is one of the best movie from DC over times. Barry the flash omg , he just won all hearts in this film there are more and many twists and turns with amazing graphics cgi , they have strengthen the story and a flawless screenplay. A good plot. Screenplay is really fast and quick that kept engaged. I loved the film the way it is. An amazing plot. One negative is that i felt at last there was bit slow. But overall a cool superhero movie after ages from DC. Please do watch it in thaters and specially in 3d this will give u an amazing experience. The role played by Ezra Miller is amazingly good, he justified the role. DC is always known for their dark theme superhero movie but this is way too colourful for a DC. Hope they will change it later on the process.

title: Ezra Miller has just raised the bar for actors portraying superheroes.
text: Ezra Miller has just raised the bar for actors portraying superheroes. Seriously funny, real and gut wrenching at times, the FLASH will not disappoint. Raised on reading DC comics, I don't have high expectations for "comic -book -turned -movie" films, but this one made me believe in Santa Claus and superheroes again.Portraying Barry Allen, in 2 realities, Ezra Miller does a sensational job of being vastly different in 2 roles as the same human being.. which I cannot imagine is an easy feat. Having to film scenes solo and then let the film magicians fuse the acting together to produce a single seamless scene, as a viewer, I applaud the fact that Miller made me forget that there is only ONE of him. Aside from that, Michael Keaton's return as the infamous and best loved Batman of all time -delivers a powerful punch to this film as another introverted secret super hero with a tragic past. I loved going through the emotions alongside Barry Allen/Ezra Miller like a silent empathetic voyeur in the dark.I needed to go to the cinema twice to see this one.Bad publicity and nutty public bursts aside, let Miller's personal misdemeanors and juvenile hall antics, be cast aside separate from his pure and fantastic acting in FLASH. It's a whole other ballgame now for the Marvel Comics movie- verse after you see this one.

title: A heartfelt movie and a celebration of DC's past
text: I went into this movie with low expectations. Given the current controversy surrounding the main actor, I wasn't expecting anything to game changing. I loved this movie for what it was. It had simple storytelling, a basic premise and that's just it. It gives the Flash character he's sort of origin story and also humanises him a bit better. In previous movies for both Josstice League and Zack Snyder's Justice league, Flash was mainly there for comic relief but in this one, there is a face behind the mask. I connected with this movie in that I too lost my mother young and I would want to go back in time to try and save her. Michael Keaton was fantastic in all his scenes. He's classic interpretation of the character was still there. SuperGirl has a lot of promise! I do hope they can make more use of her character. Go watch this movie! Don't worry about past films or what the future may bring. Just go watch it!

title: A Thrilling and Heartfelt Must-Watch for DC Fans and Non-Fans Alike!"
text: I just watched "The Flash (2023)" and I have to say, it was a fantastic movie. The storyline was engaging and kept me hooked from beginning to end. The acting was top-notch, especially by the lead actor, who perfectly portrayed the quick-witted and charming Barry Allen.The only downside was the slightly poor CGI, but the director explained that everything was from Barry's point of view, so it's understandable. Nonetheless, the visuals were stunning, and the special effects were impressive.The movie had a perfect balance of action, humor, and heart, making it a well-rounded film that appeals to a wide audience. The supporting characters were also well-developed and added depth to the story.Overall, "The Flash (2023)" is a must-watch for DC fans and non-fans alike. The film left me wanting more. I give this movie a solid 9/10 rating.

title: One of the best superhero movies
text: I don't care at all about what Ezra Miller has done. He was great in this movie and his role in the movie and I suggest you watch this movie starring Michael Keaton.This movie has many beautiful scenes and because of the cameos, it drowns you in your memories. This movie finally ends the DC world. The acting of Michael Keaton and Sasha Kali is great and you will enjoy every moment of this movie. The CGI of this movie is acceptable.Ben Affleck's Batman, although his appearance is short, but interesting, I suggest that you definitely watch this movie on the cinema screen And enjoy the latest DCEU movie.

title: It's a nice film!!!
text: I think it's a much more entertaining movie than the last superhero movies I've seen.It's emotional, it touches on deep issues like the loss of loved ones, how to accept the past, that growing up in one environment is not the same as in another.I liked the story, the cameos were excellent! Michael Keaton was amazing.The visual effects do feel like they left a lot to be desired, the truth is that for a DC movie with that budget, they should have been better, but I'm more interested in the story and the dialogues, etc., than just the effects.Ezra were fine, and the rest of the actors were goll also.

title: A very visual medium.
text: Comics are very visual, medium. Historically characters and their costumes may have received a few visual tweaks based on current fashion trends of the moment. Wonder Woman had a skirt, transitioned to boys shorts, transitions to a bathing suit, transitioned very nearly to a thong for a while, etc. But she was always Wonder Woman and always visually recognizable. Later on in her storyline, other characters took on a similar role, and they looked different, but Diana Prince was always Princess Diana. In the last decade, or so, comics have begun to dramatically change costumes. They've also begun to recast original characters. The movies are taking this one step further. If the source material is so wonderful, why change it? If you can truly say you love some thing so much that you want to bring it to the masses, and yet change it so dramatically, did you ever really love the source material?

title: Flash, Ah-Ah!
text: It amazes me to say but The Flash is easily top 5 of the DCEU!Andy Muschietti delivers fun and engaging story filled with action, heart and laughs, and for the first time truly the DC films feel connected and bigger. This is why it's a real shame this movie comes out amongst a studio shift but I digress.Keaton is back! And new comer Sasha Calle joins the team, both having standout roles. We get to see Keaton as an aged up Batman from his Burton days yet still a prominent action hero, whilst Calle dawns her cape for the first time as Supergirl in lieu of Superman.Yet despite all of this multiversal fun, Ezra Millers roles as Barry Allen/s is the core of this film and whilst I've never been attached to their casting they truly cemented themselves in the role with this film.Whilst it's tempting to skip this one as the cinematic universe faces a ominous reset, any DC fan new or old should definitely check this one out.

title: An Abomination.
text: If there were no DC comics. If there had never been a silver age. If I'd never fallen in love with Carmine, Gardner, Julius and the rest (creators of the stories I read) maybe this, as a stand alone story and co cent, could have worked for me. Maybe.So let's assume this was the case.The opening action sequence would insult a video game. Way too over the top. Quicksilver was done better. This was absurd.Hollywood continues to cast androgynous looking femboys and this didn't appeal. That's the modern world I suppose.The rest was mildly amusing. It shouldn't have been. I hated it.It only gets a 1 thanks to George.

title: Hell hath no fury like a DCEU fan scorned..
text: If the Flash could've moved those legs just a bit faster and got us all back to a point in time where the DCEU management announced a continuation of Snyders Universe - right after the Wild success of ZSJL release, this would've been a 1B film.The shock of Snyders anti-Marvel formula was finally fading, Zack was more popular than ever (the envy of most directors), and what does Warner Bros do? Not what they should have, which was green light ZSJL2, MoS2, and let Affleck have his run at a solo Batman movie.The Flash was great, one of the best comic book movies I've seen in a while. Lots of heart, comedy, nostalgia, and action.The amount of fans that will never support the DCEU ever again is extraordinary, and we've been seeing it since Black Adam. Gunn's Universe is over before it even starts. DC characters need to be boxed up and hidden away for at least a decade.

title: This movie deserves more
text: Thanks to many scandals involving Ezra Miller this movie obviously lacked post-production attention it needed.I suspect - this is why CGI is so low quality in half of the scenes, and especially in introduction act.But some attention to details, on point jokes and many references to DC and other cultural refs are just awesome.I was so surprised to see the best reference to famous Kevin Smith story - probably the best multi-verse thing around.And Batman is just hilarious. With all the original designs and music. It is just a treat for fans.I am very disappointed that this movie got so many negative attention because of scandals and will be discontinued, But it shows that Andi Muschetti is great director and his movies are on top tier list. I am really sorry that he had to go through production hell because of many scandals. This movie could have been so much more,But is still very much enjoyable one.

title: Thanks Twitter.
text: You saved me having to buy a ticket to this Ghoulish monster of a film. Endure as known Criminal Ezra Miller stars alongside known Criminal Ezra Miller for double the teeth pulling agony of their acting. Pretend to be surprised as generic twist after generic turn vomits into your eyes with CGI so bad it's shredding your retina. Watch agape as dead actors are brought back to hideous parody of life in a freakish attempt to pull on not just the nostalgia of the living but the nostalgia of the dead. A pointless, hideous bloated mess and utterly meaningless end to a garbage fire of a DC movie universe. Don't waste time, energy or money. It's not just as bad as everyone has already said, it's somehow worse. Total waste of Keaton. Total waste of time.

title: Classic flash!!! Madness entertainment!
text: This is what dc should be. A classic story with all the elements needed. Indeeed we might have seen the same story with the tv series of flash but this movie still makes you interested. A very unique element to the world of time travel we have seen. Loads of overloaded cameo for dc fans. Best one being the oldest Batman. Ben affleck didint really have a job here. The vfx is getting hate for no reason they might look over coloured but they are visually stunning. Saw this in a avx theatre so had some extra benifit. One of the other good things was Eza miller's acting he portrayed flash in a very organized way. The film had a bit of a underwehlming start tho but then has good stuff. A new way of the multiverse too. Dc is definitely getting their game up. Overall must watch for dc geeks and general super hero genre movie lovers.

title: Blundering Flash Movie Obliterates Acting Standards While Series Laughs from the Top
text: "The Flash" movie truly leaves one scratching their head. It's like they went out of their way to choose an actor who embodies the polar opposite of charisma. Meanwhile, the Netflix series had us all hooked with an actor who effortlessly breathed life into the character. It's mind-boggling that they didn't consider sticking with a good thing. This film could easily win the award for "Most Painful Superhero Movie to Watch." If only they had taken a cue from the show and spared us from this cringeworthy disaster.In summation, "The Flash" movie occupies an ignominious pedestal as an exemplar of how misplaced casting decisions and a divergent artistic vision can culminate in a cinematic escapade that borders on the farcical. It is a testament to the potential consequences of not heeding the resounding success of a prior television iteration and, regrettably, etches itself into the annals of superhero cinematic endeavors as an indelible misstep of monumental proportions.

title: Loved every minute. Baffled by box office results.
text: I loved every minute. Keaton nostalgia cranked up to 10. I am baffled by the box office numbers. It's almost like a campaign was put in place to ensure it's failure. Either that or I was watching a different movie. Looked great, tons of fun, time travel.. and KEATON! Proof you should ignore the Facebook mob and see things for yourself. Mass hysteria is usually pure nonsense. In this case, it was indeed nonsense. Other comic movies "deemed successful" I will never rewatch (like Black Panther lol).. this one I will watch again. I enjoyed it that much. Too bad there won't be a sequel. I would love to see more.

title: I Feel Deceived...
text: I was really excited for The Flash, and for good reason. It's been hyped up by critics saying things like, "The Flash is hands down one of the best superhero films of all time," The trailers also made it appear to be a big movie full of fun surprises as it ultimately resets the DC Universe in epic fashion. However, as I watched, it never actually felt like a big movie, the surprises aren't extremely fun, and the reset is in no way satisfying. It puts the final nail in the coffin of the DCEU while also damaging the hope for brighter days for the DCU.In a recent interview, General Zod actor Michael Shannon said, "These multiverse movies are like somebody playing with action figures." That's exactly what The Flash feels like. Most of the characters and cameos are pointless. It was a whole lot of, "Oh look, it's such-and-such," and then they were gone. The movie relies way too heavily on nostalgia, which actually made the main storyline of The Flash feel smaller and less important. Multiverse storylines can be so fun when they're done right, but this is more of an example of how not to do it. The way they used actors and characters felt cheap, unnecessary. And unimaginative.How you feel about Ezra Miller will really impact how you feel about the movie as he plays both of the main characters. That's a whole lot of Miller. Considering all the praise, I went in expecting to be won over, but I wasn't. I was more annoyed and unimpressed with the two characters. The Flash was a bright spot of Justice League, but even two of them were unable to carry their own movie. He was quirky and actually quite funny in Justice League, but the humor mostly falls flat and gets too samey here. You've got super immature Flash, and slightly less immature Flash. It was overkill. The theater was so quiet throughout a movie that tried too hard to be humorous. The dead silence after that completely stupid and pointless post credit scene was actually a little awkward.Despite how it might sound, I didn't hate the whole movie. I was entertained to a degree, but I couldn't shake my feelings of disappointment at how things were going. The movie needed more Batman and Supergirl and a lot less Flash. Michael Keaton is a true star and makes you want more. His Batman performance may actually be my favorite live-action Batman performance. He was a lot less stiff than Affleck's and Bale's Batmans and was closer to what I've seen and loved from animated Batman movies.Furthermore, Sasha Calle's Supergirl is a super interesting character. If you thought Cavill's Superman was brooding, Calle's Supergirl makes him seem giddy in comparison. But it works! Superman and Supergirl are such impressive characters to watch in action. I wanted more displays of Kryptonian awesomeness. As great as they are, Batman and Supergirl couldn't save this movie because their roles are ultimately too small.Do yourself a favor and go watch Justice League: The Flashpoint Paradox. It's an animated version of this story that is SO much better. In fact, I've given it a 10/10 rating while the best I can do for this live-action Flash film is 5/10.

title: Can't understand why people complain, it was pretty good
text: Came to see Michael Keaton as Batman for one last time, stayed for a good story !The script was definitely good. It does justice to important Flash storyline, and even adds a little bit more.Acting was good, Ezra Miller might have offscreen issues but he does good job on camera, and basically everyone else are good too. Michael Keaton does shine in his scenes as Batman to my delight. Supporting cast is good as well. Lots of cameos here, and they didn't feel forced at all. Some brought smile to my face. Only slight disappointment is there wasn't more of Michael Shannon (General Zod), he is usually a very good addition to a movie.CGI was OK, didn't notice what people are complaining to, and it certainly wasn't distracting from the story.The movie was fun, had it's serious and it's humourous moments (mostly hits) and they were overall well balanced.Last act does feel a little bit below first 2/3 of a movie therefore I'm giving it 8/10 and not more.People should see this in a movie theatre, it is one of the better movies of the year, don't listen to critics.

title: Horrible.
text: Horrible. I can't believe we have to watch a mentally unstable privileged man star in a movie that could be so good. The cgi was so poorly executed it felt like it was an indie film. According to some articles the warped cgi was intentional however this only distracted from the actual film and pulled the viewer out of the story. Ezra miller tried to capture the audience with this performance but fails miserably. Warner brothers should have canceled the flash instead of batwoman. Female hero representation is very prevalent in marvel, why can't DC be held to the same expectation. Very very dissatisfied.

title: Haters going to look bad when people actually watch this movie
text: Amazing movie, for the Haters, you are just going to look bad when people actually see it, the review scores currently reflect that this is a great movie.I watched for Keaton but was surprised at how good Ezra is, i am by no means a fan of his or his antics but he is undeniably great in this movie.The level of fan service is above and beyond just Michael Keaton, for real prepare yourself for many many "whaaaaaat no way !" moments.Fantastic movie, brilliant pace, sooo many laugh out loud moments, best DC movie since The Dark Knight ! And yes the CGI is really bad but it seems like it was meant to be like that oddly enough.

title: Is The Flash the best DCEU film? Should you watch it?
text:
Quick answer.NOOOO!!! The story was....eh? It's a little fun to watch, but the humour of the film is 90% cringe, and the CGI is really bad.Man of Steel is still better in my opinion. Plus, the other Barry is just so annoying, and it's disturbing.The Bright Side.Despite the controversy between Ezra Miller, his acting was really great on this one, not to mention Sasha Calle's incredible
performance as Supergirl/Kara Zor-El. She killed it as Supergirl, her appearance was really strong, while Keaton.....He's the spotlight thief, if
you're a fan of Batman & Batman Returns, you'll sure as hell wanna watch this one.Extras:
Expect to see some "Surprising Cameos," you might end up loving it.I'd recommend that you watch it.

title: Keeton is the only saving grace for this film.
text: Michael Keaton is back as Batman, but in terms of screen time, Miller gets most of it and he simply isn't up to holding the center of a 144-minute feature film. Miller tries for laughs and doesn't get any but is also unconvincing in the dramatic scenes, too. Miller fails over and over. The saddest part is that the story has Miller sharing most scenes with Miller which is too more than the movie needs. I have no words for the special effects, which are some of the worst I've seen in years. It's good to see Keaton again as Batman, but aside from a couple of scenes, he could be anybody driving the Batmobile or flying the Bat plane. After all the hype, after hearing over and over that it's the best superhero film ever made, I can say with certainty that it doesn't even come close.

title: Quit trying to be a comedy
text: I couldn't get past the first half hour because of the terrible special effects and CONSTANT poor attempts at humour. Ezra Miller is not naturally funny, but apparently, neither is the script writer. I felt that any one else could have played the Flash character. I was strangely bored throughout the section I did watch, considering how much was going on. It seemed a bit all over the place.Positives were, costume design was great. Ezra looked good, Michael Keaton was brilliant, in spite of the bad special effects he had to work with. This is a film the kids might like, maybe little ones would appreciate the humour more.

title: CGI is not bad, it's just intentionally stylized in a weird way
text: I really enjoyed this movie. It was a lot funnier than I imagined it would be, and that's not a bad thing. It didn't blow me away and it was generally kind of safe, in my opinion, and again, that's not a bad thing.Now, let's address the CGI. It wasn't perfect, of course, but It was great for 90% of the scenes. I think the scenes where Barry is running is what's irritating most people. But, I don't think it was bad, they just portrayed it in an... interesting way. The other scenes where it was "off" was when Barry is reversing time and seeing scenes play out around him. That was not top notch CGI< ill agree with people there, but to be fair that is some pretty intense stuff to perfect and it only took me out of the movie for like 10 seconds so it's fine. Aside from one particular scene at the beginning of the movie, and the stuff I described above, it was actually fantastic CGI. Oh, and I thought the CGI suit was going to bother me but it didn't, surprisingly.Again, it wasn't perfect but I really enjoyed myself and that's what matters here. But don't take it from me, go see it for yourself and make your own judgements. Don't listen to what other say. I'm sure you're well aware that there's a lot of pop culture fans who's favorite past time is hating and spreading negativity. Anyways, peace.

title: Worst Flash ever!!
text: Terrible acting; boring idiotic script that uses Justice League leftovers ( Wonder Woman aside)-and an annoying time travel screw up the timeline trope /fix later scenario, that seems older than time itself. DC comics should sue for release from Warner Brothers. They show time & time again they have no clue about the comic book characters they own. They ignore the actual comic book writers and hire complete hacks from Hollywierd. This flash doesn't even try to stand on its own feet- it uses characters/villains from Superman along with supporting characters from Batman & Wonder Woman instead of using its own villains and characters. It's a total hack job with a really weak actor Ezra Miller, who it seems who rather be a bad stand-up comedian than an actor. Warner brothers has screwed up yet another beloved comic book character.. sad.

title: Loved it
text: I'm not a big superhero movie fan, however I have an unlimited movie ticket so I go watch everything with an open mind.I went in with no preconceived idea what was what, and only a loose idea who was who and how all the dc universe connects up. I saw no trailers or tv spots.So no story or character hang-ups to think about.I loved it. The story was good, if a little bit overdone when playing about with time travel.I cared about ALL the characters. There were a few emotional beats that hit me harder than I was expecting.Yes some of the cgi looked bad, but the good stuff far outweighed it.I saw it in imax which made the sound so mind blowing.Go see it while you can. You won't be disappointed.

title: Transition from DCEU to DCU
text: I grew up a fan of DC rather than Marvel, so I really wanted DCEU to work. Unfortunately, it doesn't even come close to what the MCU has accomplished over the past 15 years. Still I was hyped to catch the Flash, and I was excited to see the multiple versions of the superheroes. This multiverse concept does allow James Gunn to move the characters/stories toward his direction but we'll have to wait and see if he's successful.The CGI was underwhelming but do catch the Flash if you're into DC. And take others along with you! It's a pretty decent watch, and you can relive your childhood again with all the superhero action.

title: On the same level as Wonder Woman
text: Don't understand the bad reviews. Yes let down by CGI at times but overall the storyline and Keaton's Batman have done a very good job. Being a Flash fanatic, my review is slightly biased but Ezra Miller has unexpectedly done a pretty good job here. Before it was released, I was all out for EM's character to be played by someone else but I am amazed at how good he is now and the change in him since we saw him in Justice League. The way only let down I felt was Nora's real killer was never revealed. Some indication or presence of Eobart Thawne aka Reverse Flash could have made it so much better but we can always look forward to it in the next instalment. Good job anyway folks!

title: GREATEST SUPERHERO MOVIE OF ALL TIME!? Lol
text: A lot of the reviews of The Flash from early screenings called it one of the greatest DC movies ever made and some said it was THE best comic book movie of all time...maybe in another universe that's true, because in this universe this movie is not even top 3 DCEU movie and the bar is not that high.Where did the budget go? Because it's impossible for this film to have a budget of $220 million and have CGI of early 2000's movies. After watching this Ant Man 3 CGI isn't even that bad, this CGI is on the same level as The Mummy Returns (2001), Catwoman (2004), The Matrix Reloaded (2003), Green Lantern (2011), etc.It does have some funny moments but the story, screenplay, the CGI, and the action scenes are mediocre, and the performances are average with a few decent acted scenes with Ezra. I love how DCEU fans laugh at Phase 4 (Yes, there is some below average and bad projects) but still Phase 4 alone is better than the whole DCEU. This is not a good film, it's below average 4/10.

title: I loved this movie.
text: Whatever you think of Ezra Miller, it's think he's incredibly gifted and compelling to watch. I do hope he gets help for his mental illness because he needs to continue on with this character. The movie was exciting, funny (WW has a very funny encounter with Ben Affleck' Batman), and touching to the point I may have cried a little. There are several surprising DC cameos that I'm sure you've already hear about. The pacing was good and Michael Keaton reminded us of just how good he was in the Batman role. My only complaint is that some of the CGI looked a little too animated and I'm wondering if that was on purpose because it was highly noticeable. I hope James Gunn does the right thing and uses some of the actors from the current DC universe in future films. I think superhero movies are starting to wear thing on people, but this one is far better than the last several I've seen. I'm talking about you Ant-man.

title: A Spectacular Superhero Extravaganza: The Flash best cbm
text: Last night, I had the immense pleasure of watching "The Flash" with a group of friends, and I must say, it was an absolute cinematic marvel. From start to finish, this superhero extravaganza had us on the edge of our seats, captivated by its electrifying storyline, stunning visuals, and exceptional performances. As a die-hard fan of the DC universe, I couldn't have asked for a more thrilling and satisfying experience.One of the standout elements of the film was undoubtedly the titular hero himself, The Flash. Played by Ezra Miller, his portrayal of Barry Allen was nothing short of phenomenal. He flawlessly captured the essence of the character, blending humor, vulnerability, and determination in a way that truly resonated with the audience. Every scene with The Flash was a breathtaking display of his super-speed abilities, leaving us in awe of his powers and the visual spectacle they brought to the screen.But the greatness of "The Flash" doesn't end there. The movie also treated us to a delightful appearance by Batman, portrayed by Michael Keaton. This seasoned Dark Knight brought a palpable intensity and gravitas to the story, showcasing his unparalleled detective skills and fearless nature. The interactions between Batman and The Flash were a sheer joy to watch, providing a dynamic duo that fans have longed to see on the big screen.Additionally, the inclusion of Supergirl, played by Sasha Calle, added another layer of excitement to the film. Her extraordinary strength and unwavering determination made her an invaluable ally to The Flash, and the chemistry between the characters was evident throughout. It was refreshing to witness the seamless integration of multiple iconic superheroes, each with their own unique abilities, working together towards a common goal.The director, Andy Muschietti, deserves immense praise for bringing this superhero tale to life with such finesse and attention to detail. The stunning visual effects were a feast for the eyes, making every action sequence a thrilling spectacle. The intense fight scenes and high-speed chases were choreographed flawlessly, leaving us at the edge of our seats and gasping for breath.Moreover, the screenplay was a masterful blend of humor, heart, and action. The narrative unfolded at a perfect pace, allowing us to connect with the characters on a deeper level while keeping the adrenaline pumping. The scriptwriters should be commended for delivering a story that not only entertained but also left a lasting emotional impact.In conclusion, "The Flash" is an outstanding superhero film that exceeded all our expectations. With its gripping storyline, exceptional performances by Ezra Miller as The Flash, Michael Keaton as Batman, and Sasha Calle as Supergirl, and awe-inspiring visuals, it deserves nothing less than a perfect rating. This movie is a must-watch for both die-hard fans and casual viewers alike, as it embodies the essence of what makes superheroes truly great. So gather your friends, prepare to be amazed, and let "The Flash" whisk you away on an exhilarating adventure you won't soon forget.

title: The Trash
text: I'm very disapointed with the amount of expectations i've puted out for this movie. In general, isn't really my thing being comparative to the others superhero movies, but i'll have to. Nothing in this universe works anymore in my perspective. The public isn't buying the narrative that movie makers and big warner's emploois are selling. We can say this without having any guilte, u just can login in all social mídias right now and certainly you'll see the public very angry saying they were played for fool when gave another (and problably the last) chance to DC. That are scenes so weirds that it looks like a team made of people that just began work for cgi's companys only a few days before they've decided what they really want work to when grow old. I didn't saw nothing to be excited for the new DC universe. The future of DC was put in the hands of Ezra Miller like the crimes him had been accused to didn't happened actually. All the critic reviews released until now questioning the weird behavior of EM as the major point to gave a low score were rights. Otherwise, who gave a large low score couting only the other aspects of the movie like CGI, script and the acting were right too. Everybody's that'll see this one in movie teathers are about to drop DC for sure. There's nothing to say to save any aspect. Time, the vilain in the film is the hero of real life. It seems the only way people can get over old superheros DC and beggining to like the new ones. Or dont'.

title: It was good, could have been better if the DCEU had continued
text:
I really did like the film. I hate DC for stopping the DCEU, especially after the Justice League Light opening. That was actually a bit of world building
This could have really springboarded the DCEU instead they do rewrites and reshoots to help end the DCEU and start Gunn on his merry way.The one reshoot that was so blatent and obviously one of the latest reshoots and could be spotted a mile off as a green screen reshoot was the final scene after the court case. Quite clearly Gunn's fingers in the pie late on making sure, yes, it was a good film, but that's the end of the line for you Barry and Ezra.

title: The Flash Did Not Treat Itself Seriously
text: The Flash plot has not treated itself seriously. From different variants of Batman/ Bruce Wayne, preventing Flash's Mom death and Dad being accused of killing his wife, and his power to time travel. Barry Allen is a crime science forensics researcher who is trying to find evidence to prove his Dad's innocence. The movie becomes more goofy when Barry relies on food more of the time than saving people. It also focuses more on Barry's 18 year old self has an obsession of being a kid at heart than focusing on what is important when you yourself experience a canon event and become more mature.Michael Keaton as Batman has its greatest moments, but not giving them a serious role and more screen time kind of disappoints. I did like how the movie explains about changing the timeline and seeing the destruction of the multiverse. I was disappointed with General Zod's screen time and how short it was. The real disappointment is the ending. I almost threw my rubbish at the screen.

title: Best DC movie to date. Don't watch any trailers or spoilers beforehand.
text: Took my wife to watch this as we didnt fancy anything else that was showing at the time. Shes not really into these types of comic action movies, so I was expecting some complaints from her throughout. All I got was laughs and giggles from her all the way though.Pretty much sums up the movie, its funny, light, full of action plenty of nostalgia and lots of past references which if you are old enough and geeky enough you will get instantly.Some of the CGI looks a bit dodgy (first scene particulary), but I wouldnt let you put this off watching it. This would have been 10/10 if the CGI would have been up to scratch.Decent storyline and even the end was a bit teary eyed. Go watch it.

title: The Flash Movie Review
text: One of the best comic book movie adapted from the Flash point paradox. The Movie is crowd pleaser, funny and emotional. The Movie doesn't have any dull moment from starting to end. Ezra Miller did a great job as the flash. Seeing Micheal Keaton return as Batman made me happy. Sasha Calle just stole the show as Supergirl. Each and every cast did their role very perfectly. Cameos part was cool. CGI was very much improved compared to trailers. Speed Force VFX and all the other parts are showed perfectly. Secret ending made me shocked. End credit scene was cool. Kudos to all the crew members of the flash.

title: Waste Of Time
text: A disappointing film that luckily I didn't see in the cinema, so I just wasted some time, but that's too bad because time is precious.The biggest problem with The Flash is, well, The Flash. I'm not a fan of the lead actor, so to speak, and I think he's miscast.The Flash is a likable character, and this actor can't bring that to the screen. On the other hand, the script is bad, and the film is boring at times, and we can't call that boredom "character development" because there is no development at all.What should be some resolution of the plot and the climax of the film is predictable from the beginning, so the film itself has no exciting moments or surprises. All those great cameos can't save this movie.Michael Keaton is good in the role of Batman, other " Batmans " are too short in the film to be able to influence the impression of the whole story. Ben Affleck was great in the role of Batman, but even he cannot save this film.The director tried his best, the direction is not bad, but when the script is this bad, the movie just can't be better than this. This movie needed better writers.Unfortunately, just another waste of time.

title: Ezra is my flash
text: Ezra Miller is my flash no matter what silly things he's should when he's serious in his role he proves it watched it 3 times on opening day fans reaction was amazing laugh and tears overall picture is 10/10 and superwomen did fantastic job and wonderful casting can't wait for flash 2 let's go apart from that movie needed to be longer I hope Ezra miller is the flash for upcoming years fans are actually attached to his character on screen funny personality also in flash 2 they need to improve CGI more better there was a little flows not complaining overall once again best movie of 2023 in my eyes.

title: Best DC movie
text: The Flash is a superhero movie based on the DC Comics character of the same name. It follows the story of Barry Allen, a forensic scientist who gains the ability to move at superhuman speeds after a freak accident. The movie is about his journey to become a hero and his efforts to save the world from a dangerous threat.
