One of the most spectacular and frustrating mixed bags of the superhero blockbuster era, "The Flash" is simultaneously thoughtful and clueless, challenging and pandering. It features some of the best digital FX work I've seen and some of the worst. Like its sincere but often hapless hero, it keeps exceeding every expectation we might have for its competence only to instantly face-plant into the nearest wall.

title: Borefest
text: I found it to be a very boring film. Time travel was done in very poor manner. If you compare it to DC's animated "flashpoint paradox" film, this film stands nowhere.The only positive takeaways for me were Batfleck's and Keaton batman's on screen presence. As a matter of fact, after seeing both the batmen in this film, I strongly feel it'd have done wonders for DC if they had cared to make a standalone batman film with Batfleck/Keaton in lead role and Flash as a side character.Bottomline is, by not going to watch it in theater, you won't miss out on anything.There is still time Discovery-WB, don't let Cavill and Affleck go !!

title: Just separate movie and real life... The Flash very entertaining and hopefully got 2nd movie
text: I understand that Ezra Miller very problematic in real life but his acting skills is undeniable good.... We can cleary see the differences of two Barry.... The movie really entertaining and meaningful movie... I really love his journey in learning let go and healing his trauma... The CGI for me not perfect but still entertaining.. I also love the humor of this movie such as the barbie joke... I am not DC fans and I know DC superhero movie is hard to connect with each other... Hopefully, I hope there will be The Flash 2.... I really really hope I can watch The Flash again in future... I know The Flash not selling well buy the movie really worth to watch...

title: Utter Trash
text: I knew as a whole this movie was never worth my time so I pulled it up just to see the action scenes. Turns out this movie is written for 7 year olds. The grown adults are all clowns, the writing is predictably stupid and every character is as immature and shallow as it gets, the CGI is awful and damn near all of it is CGI, there's 0 realism to anything that takes place in the movie and it simply goes from scene to scene artificially manufacturing one scenario after the other.The main character asks who Superman is then in the next scene is completely shocked when someone doesn't know who Batman is.Then he gets struck by lighting creating a massive hole through his entire body in the center of his chest, heals in 2 seconds flat. Then pretends to hobble around for ages when a single tiny bullet hits him in another scene.What kind of nonsense is that?This is targeted for the same audience that would watch "A Goofy Movie (1995)" and it plays out just as immaturely as that movie.The acting is just like the movie itself, completely forgettable.

title: This movie is very great despite the poor CGI
text: I'll be honest, the cgi in this movie is not good. It kind of looks like a ps4 game and it is kind of embarrassing. In spite of this, the Flash movie's story and heart is the best thing about this movie. The story is so effective because I believe almost anyone will do same if this question is asked: If your mom died when you were a kid and you had super speed that is faster than the speed of light, would you go back in time to save her? I'm pretty sure almost everyone would do the same as what Barry did. I also liked the twist villain in the end because Barry's worst enemy is always himself because he can never restrain himself from saving his mom and dad.

title: Trash movie
text: I'm a big fan of superhero movies, and I've been looking forward to The Flash for a long time. I was excited to see Ezra Miller's take on the character, and I was also looking forward to seeing how the film would explore the multiverse.Unfortunately, I was very disappointed with The Flash. The film is a mess from start to finish. The plot is confusing, the characters are weak, and the action sequences are poor.The film's plot is a convoluted mess. It tries to do too much in too little time, and it results in a story that is difficult to follow. The film jumps back and forth between different timelines, which makes it even more confusing.The characters are also weak. Barry is the only character who is given any real development, and even he is not particularly interesting. The other characters, such as Batman, are either underdeveloped or simply annoying.The action sequences are also disappointing. They are poorly choreographed and lack excitement. The film's climactic battle is particularly disappointing, as it is a long and drawn-out affair that is ultimately anticlimactic.Overall, The Flash is a disappointing film that is a failure on all fronts. It is a convoluted, weak, and disappointing film that is a failure as a cinematic universe. I would not recommend this film to anyone.

title: Speed-force yourself to the theatre now...
text: This movie has grabbed some negative attention in the last few weeks but guess what?..... it's really great. Some reviewers have poured scorn on the movie for no good reason. Say what you will about Ezra Miller IRL but he is great in the movie. It's full of surprises and is a love letter to DC Comics in film over the last 70 years. People talk about fan-service as a wrong and if that's the case I don't want to be right in this instance. It is also a multi-verse movie that actually makes sense, the first one since Spider-Man No Way Home. It is worthy of big screen viewing and more fun than the last 5 Marvel movies. It also puts DC back in the game after the atrocious Wonder Woman 1984 and the soulless Black Adam movie. Matter of fact, it's a great follow up to Zack Snyder's Justice League and the last time I had this much fun in a DC flick was probably Aquaman. It may be a while before we see another DC movie and with James Gunn rebooting everything, who knows what the future holds? Go see it.

title: Insanely Disrespectful AI of Dead Actors...
text: I have no words. Seeing the likenesses used of so many dead actors was honestly really disturbing and horrible, especially in the case of George Reeves...Really disappointing to see a billion dollar company using actors and actresses even after death as part of their money-making machine. Aside from the horrible ethics, the movie overall used a pretty crazy excess of CGI that was pretty weird looking in my opinion, and not very well executed.Sad to see that artistry is so far gone in the industry that is hollywood today and what companies are willing to do at the expense of others' dignity/respect.

title: An Electrifying Masterpiece - The Flash (2023) Lights Up the Silver Screen
text: As an avid aficionado of the superhero genre, I can confidently assert that The Flash Movie (2023) is an absolute triumph, delivering an astonishing and unforgettable cinematic experience. From beginning to end, this film showcases the remarkable potential of the Scarlet Speedster and leaves audiences enthralled with its pulse-pounding action, compelling storytelling, and stunning visuals.One of the most remarkable aspects of The Flash Movie is how seamlessly it combines elements of science fiction, time travel, and comic book lore into a coherent and enthralling narrative. The screenplay deftly balances the protagonist's emotional journey with his superhuman abilities, creating a multi-layered and relatable hero. Through astute writing and poignant performances, the film delves into Barry Allen's inner conflicts, his yearning for his mother, and the consequences of meddling with time. It's an emotionally resonant tale that adds depth and substance to the superhero genre.Ezra Miller's portrayal of Barry Allen, also known as The Flash, is nothing short of exceptional. Miller effortlessly captures the character's intelligence, quirkiness, and determination, bringing a fresh and captivating interpretation of the iconic speedster. His chemistry with the supporting cast is palpable, particularly with Kiersey Clemons as Iris West, who dazzles in her role, exuding charm and charisma on the screen. Together, they create a dynamic duo that keeps the audience invested in their journey.The action sequences in The Flash Movie are nothing short of breathtaking. Director Andy Muschietti masterfully crafts exhilarating set pieces that exploit the Flash's incredible speed and ability to manipulate time. Each sequence is meticulously choreographed, seamlessly blending CGI with practical effects, resulting in awe-inspiring visuals that leave you on the edge of your seat. The film's stunning cinematography and vibrant colour palette further enhance the overall visual splendour, creating a feast for the eyes.In addition to the heart-racing action, The Flash Movie also pays homage to the rich history of the character, incorporating nods to iconic storylines and featuring appearances by beloved characters from the DC Universe. These elements not only delight die-hard fans but also serve to expand the cinematic universe, leaving viewers eagerly anticipating future instalments.Furthermore, the film's musical score, composed by Benjamin Wallfisch, deserves special recognition. The soundtrack perfectly complements the film's tone, capturing both the excitement and emotional depth of the story. It adds an extra layer of intensity and resonance to pivotal moments, ensuring that the audience is fully immersed in the world of The Flash.The Flash Movie (2023) is an absolute triumph in every sense. It embodies the essence of the character while pushing the boundaries of what a superhero film can achieve. With its compelling storytelling, phenomenal performances, breathtaking action, and stunning visuals, this movie stands as a testament to the genre's ability to captivate and inspire. Whether you're a longtime fan of the Flash or a casual viewer, this film is an absolute must-see and a worthy addition to the pantheon of superhero cinema. Brace yourself for a dazzling journey unlike any other.

title: An Average Let Down of A Film
text:
With the DCEU coming up to its end we have finally got The Flash hit the big screen. This film has been one of the most complicated and controversial comic book films ever released but it has now released and I have seen it so here is my review for it. The premise of the film sees Barry Allen go back in time and change the past which ends up changing major factors of the multiverse as a whole.Main Character
Ezra Miller has had plenty going on over the last few years but I have decided to ignore these things when reviewing this film. I thought Miller did a pretty good job as Allen, they are funny and quirky and feel like an appropriate character. The character goes through a real journey in the film and I thought this was one of the best parts of the film. However, Miller also plays a younger version of the character and I really did not like this performance, they were so annoying. I understand why the character is like this way but the majority of the film they are like this and it just misses the boat for me.Supporting Characters
One of the main things people were excited about was seeing the return of Michael Keaton as Batman and he is a real highlight here. Yes, he is pretty cheesy but it just works with his charm and charisma, as a big fan of him in this role it was great to see him return and have some real time to shine as a character he is iconic for.Sasha Calle plays Supergirl for the first time here and I really liked her performance in the role. She isn't a huge part of the film but when she is on screen she is very opposing and fits the role very well. Her character is explored enough for an introduction but I do wish we could have had slightly more here from the writers.Michael Shannon as General Zod was one of my favourite villains in the DCEU, but he is used so badly here. Even Shannon came out and said he didn't enjoy making the film, he feels pointless here and that anybody could have played his role when there was definitely more they could have done with him.Ron Livingston & Maribel Verdu do okay jobs as Henry & Nora Allen but I never felt like they stood out considering how they were an emotional core of the film. They weren't bad but I never fully supported Barry's mission because I never connected with them like I did the TV version of the characters.Kiersey Clemons reprises her role from Zack Snyder's Justice League as Iris West, but she is another dull part of the film. Luckily, the film doesn't spend too much time with the character but even when on screen I never saw any charisma between her and Miller.Story
The film has two parts to its story. When looking at the character of Barry Allen, I think the film shows how his inner conflict affects him, he is somebody who feels below other heroes but wants to do something that makes himself truly happy and selfish. The film presents this well throughout and thank goodness for that. This is because the rest of the films story is pretty bad, the majority of side characters are underused and not given time for us to grow and connect with them. But the major problem I have is that as somebody who has watched the majority of The Flash TV show, I have seen many things that happen in this film in that show and done better. The ending is also pretty terrible and I just think the really missed the mark with all the interesting things they actually could have done.Script
The film definitely had me chuckling at times. There were some actually pretty funny moments and that was nice to see here. There was also some good drama, there were a couple of really effective scenes that made us care about The Flash. But it misses quite a bit too, the film makes no sense a lot of the time, it also just drags out with dialogue that doesn't really do anything.Style
The film has some decent action sequences mainly involving Batman. It is cool to see this same Batman able to be given the time to really show how he can really work as an action star. But this is one of the worst looking films that you will see, the CGI is terrible and has truly some of the worst ever made. Also the pacing is bad, the first 30 mins are all over the place and feel like they are pointless to the film which is a major let down.Overall
Overall, The Flash just about is an average film. It really falls below the standards that were set and promised by the people in charge. It isn't terrible but I really don't think it is worth a watch unless you really like Michael Keaton as Batman and liked the TV show.Rating - 5/10.

title: Best of the Best!
text: This movie was an amazing experience from start to finish. The flash has everything you want from a good superhero movie: Great writing, great acting, good comedy..the emotions omg...some parts had me choking up. The funny stuff was really funny. The tone was on point.Ezra Miller nailed it with his dual roles. He acted both barrys superbly. Keaton and Calle intro and fight scenes were awesome. I was in awe how good the speed force scenes looked. Very creative. Folks complained about the CGI. I went into the movie after reading the comments from the director, they wanted to show the world from Barry's pov so it's looked weird. I didn't find it off or weird at all. Thought it looked great. Great cameos. This is still a flash movie at it's core.Amazing movie. Will be watching again soon.

title: A speedy descent into mediocrity
text: In the face of much anticipation, the latest entry into the DCEU, The Flash, unfortunately proves to be nothing more than a frustratingly generic and cringe-inducing venture. The silver lining of positive buzz that had initially surrounded the film swiftly faded, revealing a lackluster adaptation that left a bitter taste.Ezra Miller, whose portrayal of the titular character once brought a breath of fresh air to the DCEU, stumbles in his latest performance. His attempts at humor fall flat and seem forced rather than coming across as naturally charismatic or even ironically amusing. It's a confounding disappointment, given that Miller's original Flash persona was somewhat of a saving grace in the past DCEU entries. This new iteration, unfortunately, doesn't hit the mark.Ben Affleck's fleeting appearances as Batman feel utterly half-hearted, underscoring the sense that he's ready to hang up the Batmobile keys for good. This disinterest is palpable and seeps into the limited scenes he graces, adding a layer of apathy that the film simply couldn't afford.The brief sparks of joy in the movie come from Michael Keaton's return as Batman, a moment that initially seemed promising. However, even this nostalgic novelty quickly wore off as the narrative became progressively more muddled.Kara's presence, while adequate, lacks the emotional weight necessary to form any meaningful connection with the audience. In fact, the film's entire storyline seems detached, resembling a side story that lost sight of the main plot thread somewhere along the way. The true story, wherever it might be, certainly didn't get its deserved time under the spotlight.An incoherent narrative, uninspired performances, and an overreliance on CGI ultimately culminate in a cinematic mess. It's a disappointing finale to the inconsistent DCEU, which has struggled to replicate the success of its comic counterparts on the big screen.As we look towards the future, we can only hope that James Gunn might be the guiding light to bring DC back into prominence. The current state of superhero cinema is indeed bleak, with both Marvel and DC producing one underwhelming movie after another.All in all, The Flash is a missed opportunity, a disappointing culmination of a franchise that, despite its potential, continues to struggle in the race for comic book movie supremacy. Superhero fans will have to keep waiting for the day when both story and characters are given the treatment they truly deserve.

title: Hope they'll be back in a flash (II)
text: Barry Allen aka The Flash (Ezra Miller) is waiting to be served a sandwich at a diner, when he receives a call from Alfred Pennyworth (Jeremy Irons) with a plea to stand in for Batman (Ben Affleck) who are chasing the thieves of a deadly virus.The problem is in Gotham where a hospital is falling apart, endangering patients and staff. Barry lets sandwich be sandwich and hurries to the hospital, where he saves all, while the building gets destroyed. After that he rushes back to the diner, to get his sandwich, and go to work. His biggest worries are an upcoming trial against his father Henry (Ron Livingston), who is being accused of the murder of his wife, Barry's mother, Nora (Maribel Verdu). An old school pal Iris West (Kiersey Clemons) is now a journalist and she questions Barry, if he has anything to say regarding his father's case, though both seem to like each other quite a lot, Barry won't talk with her because he is feeling misused.Thinking of his incredible speed, he wonders if he can, so to say, run back in time, and hopefully find out who is the real killer of his mother, and perhaps even save her life. He gived it a try, and at first it seems that he is lucky. He is now at his parent's house, and Nora is still alive.But suddenly he finds out that there's something wrong, because he can see himself coming home from school, only as a younger version. He succeeds in stopping the younger Barry. They talk and slowly it dawns on him, that he has arrived in a wrong timeline. Meanwhile Superman's old Nemesis General Zod (Michael Shannon) has landed, he will destroy the world, if they won't bring him the last living Krypton person on Earth. Barry can see he needs help and says he will be trying to contact Superman. But as it turns out, nobody in this timeline knows Superman. Therefore he will try to look up his friend Batman. Together, the two Barry's find Wayne's Manor.To Barry's big surprise, the Bruce Wayne they meet is not the man he knows, this Batman (Michael Keaton) has been retired for 25 years. He chooses to help them, and they find out that the last person from Krypton, is being held captive in Russia. Off they go in the Bat-plane. It shows that they're arriving in a facility with lots of scientists, and learn that the wanted person is being held in solitude, and has been for years.Of course they find the prison, and they discover that it contains a person from Krypton, but it's not Superman, it's Supergirl aka Kara Zor-el (Sasha Calle). Now the three superheroes sets off to fight General Zod, a very exciting and dangerous fight.This is the superhero movie that in my opinion makes the best use of the Multiverse. It also stands out in the way that is one of those superhero films that uses quite a lot of humour, perhaps only outdone by Batman: The Movie (1966), and the two DeadPool movies (2016 & 2018). There's really good acting all around, and it's quite fantastic how Ezra Miller is playing both Barrys. There is a couple of cameos to look out for, George Clooney, Gal Gadot and Jason Momoa. The film has been long underways, but director Andy Muschietti has done a real good job. It also must be said that it's wonderful to see Michael Keaton back as Batman. Hopefully there will be a sequel. A little fun thing: While Barry is waiting for his sandwich at the diner, the radio starts playing the fantastic Chicago song "If You Leave Me Now". Then Alfred calls. When Barry returns from saving all the people at the hospital, the Chicago song is still playing on the radio.

title: Sure the CGI is weak at points, but I don't get the hate
text: The writing in this movie is fantastic. It's funny, even hilarious, in all the right parts. The plot has the very easy prospect of being too confusing, but the execution prevents that and makes it cohesive and keeps you interested.Sure, Ezra Miller has real life issues, but I don't care. He is great as Barry Allen. The dual Barry's partnership was pretty fun. Michael Keaton steals the screen whenever he is on there and I felt downright giddy at all of his meta references.Really, the only downfall is the quality of the CGI. At some parts it's REAL bad. Like, removal of Henry Cavil's mustache bad. I can't fathom why that would be the case when a movie had a budget like this.I don't get why this movie got so much hate. I enjoyed it a lot. It was clever and fun.

title: This is when Hollywood realises that people are bored of superhero movies
text: It is really difficult to find much of anything that I liked about this film. Maybe the Nicholas Cage nod, the George Clooney cameo, but the rest, especially the last hour, was awful.Where shall we start? The CGI was weak in most parts and catastrophically bad in others.The scenes on the battlefield and in the time room thingy went on too long and got boring.Ezra Miller, and his growing list of criminality, is not a leading man. Barry is an annoying character and so to have two of him was excruciating.The use of all time travel and alternative universes should be banned. It usually means that the writers have run out of ideas.Time for a DC reboot.

title: Fun, entertaining, good time!!!!
text: The Flash is purely Ezra Miller. He is fantastic as an actor in his dual roles. The story is one of the stronger ones made accessible to everyone including families thanks to its smart comedic lines. The movie really livens up with entering of Michael Keaton and his action scenes are some of the best Batman action we have seen in a long long time. The story takes on strong emotional tone despite the action and the comedy. Plus the action is never too overwhelming without clouding the story. The biggest concern is the CGI which is just bad at moments given the potential that was available here to make the movie a visual feast. If you can overcome the bad CGI then this is one of the better DC outings in recent past which is a great fun, entertaining watch with family or friends. The throwbacks, cameos are real fun and real surprising so avoid spoilers if you can!!!! Plus Snyder fans should be happy given the prominence and respect given to the world he built.

title: Another Superher GRAPE SHOVEL
text: The best way to start is with a quote from one of my best friends and absolute film connoisseur: "an absolute cheek". Exactly(!), the next comic character will be buried."The Flash 2023 " must be set in a loser multiverse (or rather, in terms of content, in several), because it will all seem alienating to the classic comic book fan. The DC works about the superheroes that appear are serious works that are to be taken seriously, with a humorous interlude now and then if I like, especially with Flash, but certainly no jokes in their entirety. Target audience therefore obviously cinediots, clueless popcorn&cola crowd, everyone else gets one up the bum. Barry is (here) a ridiculous sausage (and double represented, i had to cry), Batman "1" a mud-face with superpowers (yes, not just super-equipment), Wonder Woman, mini-appearance, just visually- and self-indulgent as ever, etc., more on other characters later.The visuals, ugh, I don't mean the main hackface, but the flashy sequences: 2023, CGI expensive as never and bad as never (!?), I think every video game looks better (and more realistic).Phase 1: the standard 08/15 effects patter.Phase 2: plot, the interesting theme of time travel in bad script hands.Phase 3: Batman '89, a small ray of hope.Phase 4: Superman a woman, that too is 2023 , head shaking.Phase 5: Finale, 1-4 into the (dis)blender.Summary: An assessment of The Flash as a Wikipedia allegory, "Ezra Matthew Miller is a non-binary US actor."

title: Illustrious tenant in a chaotic world..
text: According to someone, if the latest DC Studios production has an 'ugly' baluster in terms of special effects is not synonymous with it being a 'bad movie'. "It was done intentionally...", confesses the Argentine Andy Muschietti to the avalanche of bad reviews that the press has reproached him for, whose 'rubber CGI' effects seem to be 'half done'... If the public gives more importance to the details techniques, clearly made on purpose -as the director of the film himself indicates- than the script and the story (written by six hands by John Francis Daley, Jonathan Goldstein and Joby Harold, and whose perfection is more than obvious) is that, really, we have lost all kinds of critical reasoning. The 'bad guys' of real life -those who don't want us to think- have won... And this, said in a prosaic way, doesn't sound as tragic as it really is.It is very difficult to have to do a more or less in-depth review of this film without being tempted to use annoying spoilers for whoever reads this entry. However, I prefer to avoid doing so in order not to spoil the newest surprises (also called easter-eggs) to the potential viewer of the film, rather than having them... Flash is to the DC Universe what No Way Home (2021, dir. Jon Watts) was to the MCU (Marvel Cinematic Universe), only here things flow in a much more organic and quasi-reverential way to the industry of the ninth art (that of the cartoons, naturally).As if it were a macabre joke, Flash's stand-alone arrives a little delay... The film began to be shown in the glorious eighties (when Superman was already beginning to fly plausibly on the big screen and Batman of Michael Keaton stuck out his long-eared cowl from the hand of the legendary filmmaker Tim Burton...). As I said, the great Flash movie was going to be released around that time, although the eventualities of the Hollywood entertainment industry, which has been chaotically reinventing itself, have brought it to a time where it seems that superhero movies are at hand. About to give the swan song...Really, if they are going to do it (give the swan song), The Flash is the ideal film because, in addition to being (as we have said) a proper tribute to the DCEU movies, it is epic, fast, adult and fun to equal parts (even, dare I say, metaphysics - if someone has been able to grasp correctly that the spaghetti metaphor is not only culinary but divine-satirical alluding in some way to the Flying Spaghetti Monster that... really floats through our Universe... ?-The main performances of the feature film are not only at the level of the dramatic corpus of the story (in many moments of Greek tragedy) but also support it in such a way as to silence mouths... The double acting work of Miller -whose recent controversies launched more by way of undercover marketing than to feed the sensationalist press-is at the same level as his partner from the eighties, who here builds his twilight version of the Batman that, without a doubt, will remain to be remembered (with lapidary phrase included...)Also highlight the power and beauty of Sasha Calle giving life to a Supergirl of arms to take, with spectacular curves and 'fashionable' hair, whose "expanded cameo" leaves Wonder Woman in a ridiculous place (Gal Gadot, again) a little touched already by the undaunted passage of time. And it is that time passes for everyone, badly despite us.

title: Best dceu movie
text: The Flash is the last dceu film and presents the direction of dcu. It is the world's only influential dceu movie led by James Gunn. This movie not only organizes dceu and shows dcu, but also allows us to wrap up and continue the big theme of dc. It also allows Aquaman and Flesh to come out the same way in Dcu. I succeed in putting the already made dc movie into dcu. Surprisingly, it is a part made up of only re-filming. It includes an understanding and interpretation of all Dc's works. The homage of "Back to the Future" and "Star Wars" was also great, and it was a work that abandoned all the shortcomings of a boring factory movie. Michael Keaton, Nicholas Cage, Christopher Reeve, Old Flesh, Old Batman, cameos and cgs from gelgadat are also fun. I think it would have been nice if it came out proudly as a Dceu work. It's James Gunn's biggest misjudgment to have this movie out already. I know the idea to finish quickly and start dcu, but if you polish this movie more and release Aquaman in advance, you can connect dcu with dcu and dcu with a new style multi-bus explanation, and a follow-up to dcu (James Gun) Batman and dcu can be fun, making up for the only worst cg. That's too bad. Apart from Ezra Miller's evil deeds, it shows objectively great acting and the character is three-dimensional.

title: Worlds Collide
text: DC finally enters the multiverse the way Marvel did on the big screen. There are many bad reviews of this movie. I did not have a problem with it. I had a blast! Michael Keaton steals the show reprising his role as an old eccentric Batman.Barry Allen goes back in time and ends up in an alternate timeline. Many references are made to Back to the Future. This movie creates a mess of a timeline in the process yet I found it very entertaining. It is filled with cameos. New characters are created and they interact with the old ones that we love.I don't want to give away spoilers. Don't take the movie too seriously. This is a fun movie.

title: I attended a press screening with an audience that was ready for a good time. Within 1 minute, the audience was laughing. Nice!
text:
IN A NUTSHELL:
Barry Allen uses his super speed to change the past but his attempt to save his family creates a world with unintended consequences that ripple into other worlds of the metaverse.The film was directed by Andy Muschietti. Writing credits go to Christina Hodson and Joby Harold.Yep, it's another Metaverse movie. It appears that's what DC Comics is doing all of the time now. It's the 13th movie in the DC Universe with a soft reboot of the DC franchise, led by James Gunn. Any other films outside this new timeline are going to be called DC Elseworlds. Are you still thinking all of this Metaverse hype is fun or are you growing tired of it? Just curious. Comment down below!THINGS I LIKED:
I attended a press screening with an audience that was ready for a good time. Within 1 minute, the audience was laughing. Nice! There was also destruction and tons of action within minutes.Ezra Miller did a fantastic job playing two characters: The Flash and Barry Allen. He gives us two-in-one characters to root for and shows us two levels of maturity with entertaining nuances.I LOVED Michael Keaton as one of the Batmen in previous movies, so I loved that they brought him back for this! I thought it was really clever how they addressed how there could be so many different Batmen in our world by utilizing the Metaverse. Conveniently, this movie ignores the story in the 1995 Batman Forever, as well as the 1997 Batman and Robin to have the 1992 Batman Returns movie make more sense to fit Michael Keaton's storyline. Michael Keaton is now, officially, the oldest actor to play a live-action Batman. He's currently 71 years old. Adam West was actually 88 when he voiced the 2017 animation of Batman vs. Two-Face!Ben Affleck hasn't been my favorite Batman, but he did a good job in this. I loved the ending of the movie that left us all hanging as to who will be the next Batman in THIS universe! Ha ha Ben Affleck had some issues with the Justice League movie but revealed in a recent interview that he really enjoyed his role in this movie, as short as it was.The audience I watched the movie with absolutely loved the montage of Superman actors, especially Nicolas Cage who was ALMOST a superhero in a Superman movie many years ago in real life.Michael Shannon always does such a great job as a villain. His clear mask on his space uniform was pretty cool.Super amusing sound effects.While this movie isn't exactly an origin story for The Flash, we get to learn a lot more about him, his past, and his motivations.Sasha Calle is the first Latina to play Supergirl. Congrats, Sasha!Others in the cast include Kiersey Clemons, Ron Livingston, Ian Loh, and Saoirse-Monica Jack. Everyone did a great job.The movie was shot entirely with IMAX cameras by Henry Braham. The only other DC movie to do that was the 2021 movie The Suicide Squad.Great special effects.I always love the Flash's slow-motion sequences, so I was surprised when the guy I sat next to leaned over and said he thought they lasted too long. I still loved them.I loved the very last scene. What a great cliffhanger.The big bad spaceship looked just like a beetle. Some of the designs for weapons were cool too.THINGS I DIDN'T LIKE:
Gotham City is always falling apart. Ha ha
If you get vertigo as I do, be warned that there will be a few scenes that make you a little bit dizzy. There mostly at the beginning of the movie. I was worried it was going to be like that the entire time, but it wasn't. Drats...I'm getting old!I wanted to hear the audience's reactions throughout the film, but the movie was really loud and drowned out most of the noise from the audience.Surprisingly, there are some fake CGI moments. Some of the action sequences looked like they came straight out of a video game.Some viewers might complain about the unnecessarily long length of the movie.Everyone bleeds from the mouth with fake makeup. Ha haTIPS FOR PARENTS:
A few conversations about intimate relations.A surprisingly high number of crude words. Come on, Hollywood!Some profanity in English and Spanish, including 1 F-bomb
Talk of the death of a parent
We see people get hurt, sometimes with blood
We see a naked guy but no private parts show
We see a guy in his underwear
Someone throws up...a lot. Gross.Lots of violence
Lots of various weapons
Lots of explosions and destruction
High dead-body count.!

title: Ignore the negativity
text: This is actually a fun movie, and I really can't understand where the overall negativity against this movie comes from, except from the general backlash against Ezra Miller, but that shouldn't change the fact that this is a fun ride. There is a LOT of fan service, but given the nature of the story, that should be expected, and the fan service is fun and serves its purpose... FOR THE MOST PART (sigh). The very last scene almost ruins the movie, and (at least for me) calls into question James Gunn's sanity and overall ability to guide the upcoming "Gunniverse" (sorrynotsorry, that's what I'm calling it) because he made an 11th hour change that equates to trolling the fans, not unlike how WandaVision trolled the fans with the real identity of Pietro in Wanda's creation.So, while the final scene leaves a REALLY bitter taste in my mouth, all the fun of the rest of the movie proceeding shouldn't be penalized as a result.

title: Quite A Confusing Mess!
text: The FlashOverall it was a confusing mess of action sequences and the tissue thin story of interfering with the time space continuum just didn't cut the mustard as the driver of the narrative.There were some very funny moments and so deeply memorable ones, the baby sequence or the initial Batman chase on a motorbike but the rest was just style over substance.Ezra Miller was brilliant and unhinged in equal measure, it was just full of exhausting freneticism.I did enjoy it being set in London, thus gave the whole movie a rich texture to often banal scenes.At best this is no more than a 4 outta 10 from me. A great wasted opportunity for a really good movie.

title: This is the DC we've been waiting for years
text: This movie was amazing. I know the VFX and CGI is atrocious but to be brutally honest, that's the only real problem with the movie. Everything else for me works so well. The character dynamics with both Batmen and the flash is great because both heroes lost their parents and their loss made them the men they are today. That's why Michael keaton's batman was a no brained to work with the flash because any batman can resonate with Barry Allen's tragic backstory. I thought this movie ticked all the good movie boxes. I genuinely almost cried at the end of the movie and all the scenes with Barry and his mom. The post credit scene was very bad though.

title: The incredible Flash
text: "The Flash" movie of 2023 is a mixed bag of superhero blockbuster era. The movie is simultaneously thoughtful and clueless, challenging and pandering. The film features some of the best digital FX work, but also some of the worst. The movie puts a lot of thought into what it wants to say and not enough into how it says it. The film warns against a thing while at the same time doing a version of that same thing. The movie is well-paced and plotted, with lots of excitement and plenty of humor. It has several stirring, heartfelt moments. The Flash (Ezra Miller) is the juvenile, socially maladroit dogsbody of the Justice League, and foregrounding him proves to be exactly the injection of irreverence that the series needed. The special effects may not be as polished as expected from a big-budget film, but it's a perfectly serviceable and frequently amusing addition to the ever-increasing list of superhero pictures that unfold in multiverses or parallel realities, albeit one that covers similar territory to the recent, superior Spiderverse outing.In conclusion, "The Flash" movie has some good moments, well-paced and plotted, with lots of excitement and plenty of humor.

title: Disappointing
text: Poor script and complete disrespect to Batfleck. Way over the top comedy, some funny moments but I do not believe this was intended to be a comedy movie. Some touching moments and amazing bit of history / cameos but these were overshadowed by quirky gags that just ended up being annoying. Everything the first JL got wrong this movie did and dialled it up to 11. ZS JL was a different tone and a far better portrait of characters we loved. Henry was clearly snubbed and seeming the whole idea was to potter over one idea - which Marvel have already done.So far removed from amazing source material and a wasted opportunity and another bland repeat of the same story we have see already, executed poorly with a tone that didn't reflect the Keaton Batman which made the movie seem inconsistent amalgamation of very different worlds we have seen.

title: Good start for DC future
text: I liked the movie and it doesn't deserve the criticism that it has received. Compared to other recent superhero movies this wasn't predictable and quite enjoyable. Ezra Miller did a great job acting and his younger self brought the perfect amount of comic relief into the film. I hope James Gunn takes balances the comedy aspect and the seriousness of DC as it tends to be more gruesome.The directors references to past movies was a creative touch.This is a good start to the DC universe and offers plenty of options for the future. I am curious how they will introduce the new Superman and other new characters now.

title: Major step up
text: Now this film has had bad press but what a great film. Its exactly what dc need to be doing more of. It was very nostalgic for me. Why haven't we had more batman like this. Supergirl was really cool. Look passed the cgi and you'll really like this film. Just enough silly and enough serious and sad. This film really hit the mark for me. Without saying to much about the film the story line flows from one scene to another without many misteps unlike a lot of films in the past year. I'm glad the suit was made the way it was as the whole sharp metal style in previous super hero films became a bit too much. This film is really great. If this film came out ages ago we could have actually scene this as the start to more great DC films. But unfortunately it wasn't. Its a must watch.

title: The movie is garbage
text:
The movie is garbage. That aside heres a little about Ezra Miller that you may have missed:
Strangling incident
On April 6, 2020, a video surfaced in a since-deleted tweet that appeared to show Miller strangling a woman and throwing her to the ground. The video was confirmed by Variety to have taken place at Prikið Kaffihús, a bar in Reykjavík, Iceland, that Miller frequents when in the city. A bar employee identified the person in the video as Miller, who was escorted off the premises by staff after the incident.In September 2022, a representative for Miller claimed that the supposed strangulation was a "spontaneous reaction" spurred by "a group of teenagers" taunting Miller over their mixed martial arts skills, and that they did not strangle the woman but "went at her collarbone".Hawaii incidents
By early March 2022, Miller had arrived on the island of Hawaii. From March 7 through March 28, Miller was the subject of ten calls to the police because of various minor incidents, such as filming people at a gas station, loitering on a restaurant's sidewalk, and arguing with people. Eventually, Miller was invited to live with a couple at a hostel in Hilo after Miller allegedly became acquainted with them at a farmer's market.On March 28, Miller was arrested in Hilo following what police said was a physical altercation with patrons after having hurled obscenities at customers at a karaoke bar and was charged with disorderly conduct and harassment. Miller later claimed that they became enraged after being "accosted by a Nazi", but Hawaii Police Assistant Chief Kenneth Quiocho stated that Miller's outrage was caused by patrons of the bar singing Lady Gaga and Bradley Cooper's song "Shallow." Miller claimed to have filmed the incident so the footage could later be used as "NFT crypto art." During their arrest, Miller said that they were being "unlawfully persecuted" and, after members of the police misgendered them, accused the officers of intentionally committing a hate crime.And is the sole person making this claim. Vanity Fair interviewed people in Miller's circle and wrote that "'He professes that he walks through this world with an Indigenous humility and spiritual awareness,' says one Indigenous insider. 'But, point of fact, he doesn't at all. Because he doesn't care.'"Harassment allegations
attempted to serve the mother an emergency care order that demanded the children's removal from her care and the home over fear for their safety... based on a caseworker's affidavit, the State Attorney's office had requested two emergency care orders over the past week that sought to transfer legal custody of the children over to the state." Police and social workers were unable to locate the children or the mother. Miller told police that the woman and her children do not live there, and have not "for the past two months". Contradicting Miller, the DCF caseworker, in her affidavit to the Court, presented evidence that up until late July 2022, the woman had been regularly posting images on social media that confirm that she was living with Miller. The Vermont State Attorney's office stated that Miller's response "seemed like an attempt to 'evade service'" of the order.Burglary charge
On August 7, 2022, Miller was charged with felony burglary in Stamford, Vermont, stemming from what the police report indicated was theft of bottles of alcohol from a private home in May 2022, according to Vermont State Police. According to the report, Miller was identified by police via video surveillance footage. Miller was due to be arraigned in court on September 26, 2022. A week prior to the planned arraignment date, a representative for Miller stated that the home is owned by a former childhood friend of Miller's and that Miller believed that they were welcome to enter the home to obtain rice wine for cooking.The arraignment was later pushed back to October 17, 2022. Appearing in court remotely on that date, Miller pleaded not guilty to the charges. The next hearing on this case was scheduled for January 13, 2023. A day before the scheduled hearing, they pleaded guilty to trespassing, leading to the burglary charge being dropped. On the day of the hearing, Miller's trespassing plea was approved by the court.

title: The movie had nothing to do with the main theme of the TV series
text: This movie was really awful and should not have used the name of the original series. If I had seen this movie before the series was made, I would not be able to watch the series again. The TV series that I have been looking forward to seeing its new episodes for several years has really done justice to it with this movie. In this movie, the audience really feels the lack both in terms of the story and the actors and the movie had nothing to do with the main theme of the TV series. I hope that the director of this movie will not target other popular series and will have mercy on them. Thank you.

title: Live Action Comics At Their Best
text: From the opening shots, The Flash puts the pedal to the metal and doesn't ease up. Full of heart, humor and loads of fun cameos, the Flash entertains in spades. Ezra Miller delves deeper into fleshing out his character and show us a Barry Allen not seen in the comics or TV Shows. The film is fresh, fun and I want to see it again and again!With a running time of 2 hours+ the film speeds by at a steady pace. Some great twists and turns that keep you guessing with some really stellar pay offs.It's great to see Keaton in the bay suit, as said Miller's Barry Allen is different but very fun to watch and the remaining cast brings their best to the table.

title: I just watched & enjoy it
text: I see lot of superhero movie but this one is different, this one movie story goes to like different direction which is never imagined. But it's mind blowing 👌💓, Ezra Miller acting is top notch, that guy played 2 different characters in one frame. & It quite looks different. Love it. I know the VFX is little bad on some place. But just ignore it. Some of Cameo is crazy, sound design is very good. If you watched CW flash & it's quite similar. But i enjoyed & there is lot of Sean are funny & lot of enjoy while watching 😂. If you are big DC fan then don't miss it on big screen. Just go & enjoy it & post credit is useless.

title: P.O.S.
text: Wow. POS. After watching this "movie", I can't get those three letters out of my head. It's uncanny really. How can a movie studio take some of the best IP in the world and repeatedly put out garbage of this magnitude? It has to be on purpose, no one is this inept and still able to function without help, much less the entire collection of people it takes to make a movie. How are these people able to get jobs, much less writing jobs? Every time I saw Miller run, it was just cringe. Dude looks like a 8 year old girl running from Freddie or Jason. Only reason this is not rated a 1 is because that is reserved for Mullholland Drive. That movie made me want to physically hurt myself for watching.

title: The Flash and the Infamous
text: I'm doing a spoiler-free review because this movie has a lot of surprises. Before seeing the movie, I knew very little about the plot besides what they showed in the first trailer. Barry goes back in time and consequently unleashes a mess of events. The posters/ads show Michael Keaton as Batman, so it's no surprise that he reprises his role in the Tim Burton movies. The movie also has a new Supergirl, also featured in the posters.I highly enjoyed this movie and found it one of the best in the DCEU. I don't consider The Flash to be THE best, but it's definitely in the top tier. The humor, set pieces, and emotional core are all very well done. I held off on reading any reviews until after seeing the movie, but I agree with some critics that the action scenes, although exciting, can sometimes pull the viewer out of the movie's heart and Barry's original intent to go back in time. But I also think the movie nailed the landing emotionally, so I can't complain.Okay, so let's address two of the biggest "controversies" surrounding the movie.Issue 1 - Ezra Miller's off-screen bagagge. Replacing Miller and reshooting the film would have been outrageously expensive. The studio had no choice but to move forward and hope for the best. Haters will hate, and cancel-culture advocates will avoid the movie. They are most likely review-bombing this movie with 1-star and downvoting all positive reviews. I thought Miller did a great Flash in the Justice League movies and continues to shine in this film. I would love a sequel, but given what's happening at Warner and the DCEU reset, I doubt that will happen.Issue 2 - Wonky CGI. When Barry moves within the Speedforce, much of the world around him appears filtered in color and clarity. Some have vented that this is poor CGI. The director is on record saying this look is intentional and we are meant to see the world through Barry's eyes. Perhaps this is also a copout, meaning they could be a bit lazy with the CGI effects inside the Speedforce, but I will take the director at his word. The look inside the Speedforce didn't bother me at all. I also felt that the VFX outside of the Speedforce rocked. Seeing Keaton soar as Batman again, using the latest special effects technology, is pure joy.Although the movie has a runtime of 2.5 hours, the story never drags. The script and direction keep the film moving forward. The humor can sometimes come too close to being too much, but it never gets out of control. Also, unlike the recent Thor movies, the characters don't make jokes during highly emotional moments. The film is earnest and heartfelt when required.I look forward to seeing the movie a second time. There are so many jokes and Easter eggs I often found myself reaching for a non-existent remote control to jump back to rewatch a scene. If you are a Flash fan, you will love this movie. The movie can also stand on its own, meaning that if you don't know the history of the Snyderverse or other DC movies, you will still have fun.

title: Best movie ever
text: The best movie I have ever seen, better than all the other movies that have came out this year. I love the acting and unique adaptation to the flashpoint storyline. I was truly mesmorised by the story telling and epic moments, it genuinely made me forgive ezra. I think this has the potential to win many awards as it show great cinematography and story telling. Michael keatons batman was one I have never seen before, after watching him in this movie I am in love with the character and feel an epic presence when ever he is on screen. The cgi and effects were beutiful and accurate, the pacing was brilliant too.

title: better than i expected
text: It is definitely better than I expected. I didn't go to the movies with high expectations because the superhero universe is not my favorite, but it turned out to be fun and exciting. I am glad to see Keaton again since I am very nostalgic for him when quality films were really made back in the 80s but I am quite amazed compared to others, it is definitely a deserved 10. The interpretation of the actors is a crucial factor and this film was a success. This talented and committed cast brings the characters to life and made me connect with them on an emotional level. Convincing and charismatic performances kept me glued to the screen and made me feel invested in the plot.

title: Unbelievably Awful
text: I cannot believe how bad this movie was including the acting, storyline, characters, and the plot. Its as if they rushed to produced this movie just to deliver a finished product.It reminds me of how they used to build cars that were considered throwaway with built in obsolescence. I have no idea how movies this poorly done get past quality control which begs the question of whether or not they even have any quality control at all.DC Comics needs a complete overhaul of writers and actors. I have no idea who gave this movie more than a 3 as a rating but whoever did really needs to raise their standards.

title: Best DC Movie!!
text: I didn't have high expectations for this movie at all. I was disappointed at DC's last to releases but figured it would at the very least be entertaining enough. This movie was awesome from start to finish. I know a lot of people don't care for Ezra Miller but he did a great job in this movie. I haven't been so excited at a movie for a very long time. It had a smart story line and it was very well directed. My husband is a huge comic book guy and he was surprised at how great it turned out. He just went to see Batman and the night wing and he loved it. This is the best Super Hero movies since End Game in my opinion.

title: We need a Batman 89 movie
text: That was just awful. The opening action sequence is good enough, nothing amazing but the film just keeps going down hill, with the exception Batman 1989 but when he is CGI, it is just awful. This whole movie is horrendous and a boring mess. You'll need a pillow to get rid of the feeling of wanting to fall asleep. Speaking of the CGI, it look almost unedited in the second half of the film. They put out an unfinished product, what does that tell you? They know the DCEU is finished. They are literally not even trying anymore. And the actor who played the Flash is unlikeable. You are rooting for the bad guys. Avoid paying money to watch this.

title: Not perfect but back on the right track
text: The flash is far from perfect, I'd definitely say my biggest issue is some of the CGI I'm not sure if they intended it to look that way it's very jarring at the start but once you get use to it it's okay! I'd say the biggest positive is the story and characters! I think a lot of people expected Kenton's Batman to be a massive part of the movie! It's not this is a story of letting go and you can't change something that is meant to be! The chemistry between Barry and Barry is great I know they are the same actor but honestly Ezra miller did a great job of it! Besides what people think of miller they are a great actor and really in my opinion have made me like the flash as this was a character I cared little for! I'd definitely like to see them build on this but with the DC you never know!

title: Fun movie with too much baggage
text: Glad to see DCEU ending with a solid offering. It's an entertaining movie with tons of heart and fun moments. Cinematography was top knotch, didn't mind the artistic decisions on CG either. Batman scenes looked properly epic, but Keatons delivery felt a bit robotic. Haven't watched his original Batman movies so no idea if he's like that in the originals as well.Supergirl looked great. Looking forward to seeing her in some capacity in the future.Like I said the movie is fun, if you ignore the shenanigans of the lead actor in real life. Heartfelt scenes for example would've meant more, with a more likeable actor. If you don't know anything about that consider it a blessing and go watch this exciting movie.

title: Ezra is the worst thing about this movie
text: I went to see this today, good movie, quite a bit of fan service with Michael keaton. Some cg issues at places, but overall visuals are on par with other films being released recently. The story was better than I was expecting based on previous comic inspired story lines they have adapted to the general audience crowd.The problem with it is Ezra. His cringe worthy and wooden acting detracts from the good story and good visuals.There is some things I would change story wise, to make it closer to the comics that enspired the story.I feel a recast of Barry would have made this movie alot better than it was.

title: I Fell Asleep in The Cinema
text: The movie started well, then it got weird and I can say that it ended as a disappointment in the end. The worst part of the movie is definitely CGI, and I'm very serious about it. After a while, I started to console myself that this is an animated movie. There are some points, I can't say because there are spoilers, I even thought of leaving the cinema. Also this movie trying to be funny and bright like Marvel was also a disgrace. One of the best things about DC is its dark atmosphere and Gotham City. Frankly, Guardians of the Galaxy 3 was more gloomy and dark. The script of the movie was not bad. Also, Ezra Miller played the character very well again. The cameos weren't good, I said sometimes it was better if they weren't. I fell asleep for about 5 minutes towards the end of the movie. I won't go into details, watch and see why I fell asleep, if you don't fall asleep. Good luck!

title: I'm furious people didn't watch this
text: People like to let the media dictate what they do and that is a shame. This movie was by far the best DC offering so far. What more could you ask for. It gave you a great story, nostalgia, and humor. It was obvious what was going on in the first 15 minutes, but that in no way took away from an amazing movie. Besides maybe Iron man one, Avengers 1, And the Guardian's movies this is the best comic book movie in years. I know Ezra is a whackadoodle, but that should not take away from a great movie. I clapped out loud multiple times and wanted to immediately watch it again. I hope people will be open to watching it on Blu-Ray.

title: A true blast!
text: A blast from beginning to end. Wonderful story and performances and nail-biting action sequences. Keaton is back and proves he's a Batman to be reckoned with. A true all-timer, we'll be talking about this movie for years to come. Andy Muschietti did an amazing job balancing the tone, from humourous to thoughtful, to intense, to remorseful to sentimental. The visuals are also very stunning and it's so good to see a Burtonesque Batman and world on the screen again. I never thought Keaton would come back but he did and it's an amazing performance. One of the best superhero films ever made! 10 stars.

title: Mediocre in every way
text: I'm a huge nerd who can enjoy something mid-tier if it's entertaining enough, but this film is bad even if you ignore the toxicity of Ezra. I had to fight the urge to look at my phone multiple times during the 2+ hour run time. The first half of this movie is tragically boring, and the second half devolves into a CGI mess of misplaced fanservice shoveled in by the truckload that makes very little sense. I'll never understand how WB, in all their wisdom, can't get it right. They could literally use the animated DC-verse as a template and just put real actors into those scripts, but instead they release these dumpster fires of cinema on us and expect a thank you. Not even from this Keaton fanboy.I'm so very sorry if you paid to see this, it wasn't even worth the points I spent to see it free.

title: Absolute Bonkersss
text: Happened to watch The Flash movie today at PCX Hyderabad. Even though the screen wasn't imax 70mm, it felt like watching in one. Right after the movie starts, you feel an immersive experience. There are hardly any scenes which bore you. The story, the action, the emotions all worked out perfectly and God erza Miller was so good, you start to feel his pain and his sorrowness. The movie doesn't waste any time and quickly takes you to the core plot. The cameos were set up so perfectly, the whole theatre went nuts to so many scenes, so many Easter eggs and references. My theatre was jam packed, audience were so wild(Indian audience usually enjoy movies a bit more than western audience). All the emotions of audience were in so sync, we all would jaw drop and then cheer like wild animals. The movie was a perfect end to the DCEU. 10/10 must watch.

title: Poor CGI
text: The Flash (2023) fails to live up to its potential, with several glaring weaknesses that hinder its overall impact. While its strength lies in its attempt to bring the beloved DC superhero to the big screen, the film suffers from lackluster cinematography that fails to fully capture the speedster's dynamic abilities. The acting, while not outright terrible, feels uneven at times, and the plot struggles to maintain a cohesive narrative. The music and visuals, while competent, do little to elevate the overall experience. A 5/10 rating accurately reflects the disappointment of a film that had the opportunity to deliver a thrilling superhero story but ultimately falls short of expectations, leaving fans hoping for better adaptations in the future.

title: Predictable, but...
text: Went after seeing titles of some of the reviews, aware of the WB & DC cinematic state, reading about Ezra Miller's escapades and most importantly... familiar with the already awesome animated of the same story, so safe to say my expectations were low.The bad... predictable for those familiar with the mechanism of comic's stories and some illogical plot points.The good... everyone's acting, Easter Eggs, the drama, comedy and action, special effects (mostly).Sad to know this is the end of the DC's cinematic universe as we know it. Hope JG will blaze a better, more stable future. Unfortunately, I don't expect the two upcoming movies to be it...

title: Finally an excellent DC film
text: I am writing this review almost 2 weeks after I've watched the film.Going into it I had very low expectations looking back at MOST of the films that came out from both marvel. (It shows because I also didn't watch it when it first screened.)It tackles the story of flashpoint, one of the greatest flash comic stories out there so if you know you know.The film was actually decent and well put together, it was very fun all the way through and I was surprised.Whenever I used to remember flash, a picture of Grant Gustin used to pop in my head but now after the show went into a downfall and seeing a more in depth flash film starring Ezra Miller, he is him.Comedy was perfectly balanced in almost all of the film except some minor sections, the CGI was kinda good and passable since everytime there was a bad CGI moment, we get compensated with an amazing scene almost immediately after.Ezra Miller's Acting was really great, mixing between the comedy and the heavy drama was exceptional.This film really does well when it comes to fan servicing, seeing Michael Keaton as batman once again is really amazing with the small bits of easter eggs and references to iconic lines, it doesn't just fan service the people in that regards but it's way that is more broader revolving around the DC universes and projects that were either processed or were cancelled.If you're familiar with that kind of knowledge and information, you'll really enjoy it in that regards.Since I watched it a while ago, there might be some stuff that I skipped or just forgot to mention because no notes were prepared and written since that time.It had the perfect ending to set up for whatever James Gunn has prepared for us.

title: A race and a flash to the past to change times, yet helped by Batman!
text: I am a comic book collector, and watch most super hero movies, I like "D. C." movies better as I always preferred reading and liking the "D. C." characters better. So watching "The Flash" was a new experience and spin on a character the movie tried, yet the plot and timing twist of the film was a little hard to follow. Still it's main character Barry Allen means for the good as he tries to go back in time to change things and make wrongs to a right, you even feel a little "Back to the Future" parody! All in the meantime he needs and wants to return to the future and continue to be "The Flash" and live with other current super heroes like "Wonder Woman", "Superman", and "Batman"(the current one of Ben Affleck). However the best and most vintage and throwback good parts of the film was when in Barry's back time travel he meets "Batman", and I'm talking the 1989 one and the super great Michael Keaton!(the one that my era can relate to!) And it's a blast as Keaton's dialogue and sayings are from the 1989 film and they bring back memories! Overall I liked the vintage and throwback feeling help, still this was not the best from "D. C." still it's a watch for any fan of comic book movies.

title: Keaton is back and as brilliant as ever!
text: I'd been looking forward to The Flash for a while (mainly to see Michael Keaton back as Batman) and it didn't disappoint.I'd describe it as a bit of a cross between Back To The Future (Robert Zemeckis was originally approached to direct), 300 and inevitably Justice League - if you are expecting a Tim Burton gothic vibe you'll be sorely disappointed.Keaton steals the show as Batman, particularly in his early scenes as a reclusive older version of Bruce Wayne. But when that theme tune kicks in and the Batwing appears...well it feels pretty special.I often feel these modern super hero films lose their way in the third act, and typically revert to the same old 'world destroyer' tropes popularised by Transformers and the like. I thought that was where this was headed, before one of the best 'guest appearance' scenes I've ever seen.It's a shame DC seem to have decided to end this wave of actors as Ezra Miller, Ben Affleck and Gal Gadot are really very good in their roles. Hopefully this does well and a second one is commissioned (rumours abide the script is ready with Keaton returning once more), but I'm assuming all the controversy regarding Miller has put it to bed.But for now I'll enjoy this effort. I might even go and see it again.

title: BEST DC MOVIE EVER!
text: Please go and do yourself a favour and watch this movie! If you're one of the many people who lament that DC movies are unnecessarily dark and cannot evoke emotions, this movie breaks the trend. After the first Aquaman and the first Wondnerwoman movie, this is a great DC movie that was long overdue! This story has every ingredient required for a good story --- amazing actors who make you believe in their character, funny one liners, gut wrenching emotions, redemption arc, and finally the triumph of good over evil. After the overload of the Marvel Universe, this movie was a welcome change and I cannot express how happy and thrilled I feel after cheering for The Flash!

title: It is fun
text: If you set aside, the poor CGI, the movies, fun. I really hope when James Gunn takes over, he picks up on the successes of the recent DC runs. I found all the DC's extremely enjoyable. I believe that the individuals they casted to play. These characters were right in the first place. I really enjoy the character super girl. I hope that in the future they build a DC branch offer her. Maybe even a superman Supergirl, crossover of sorts with the movies. The one item that I really wish that would get fixed and this goes for all movies is that the music is so loud, but I can hardly hear the dialogue when streaming it at home.

title: Great movie overall. Just wished Reverse Flash was the villain
text: The DCEU started off horribly with man of steel, BVS, and Josstice League and it never really recovered. Sure aqua man, peacemaker, the suicide squad 2021 and wonder woman were hits but they also produced some abysmal projects like black Adam, Shazam 2 Wonder Woman 84. The Flash movie however, doesn't fall into the category of terrible dc films. It's actually very good and very entertaining. Ezra miller plays a good flash, Michael Keaton killed it like always and Sasha Calle is very promising. This movie will probably make you cry because it's so emotional and has a lot of heart. But the CGI and VFX are atrocious. It looks like a PS2 game a lot, but overall, it's a great dc and superhero film that I would recommend if you want to have a great time.

title: Absolutely aweful
text: Riding only on the name the flash everything from the acting to cgi was absolutely aweful. Sitting through this was painful and an incredible waste of money. It would have been better to get the actor from the flash TV series to be barrh Allen. The graphics and special effects were obnoxious and cringy. Even the cameos from the rest of the justice league were cringy....the plot seemed rather empty, replaying the flash going back in time plot yet again. But hey at least they checked all the inclusion boxes...don't want to for get those...or cgi....or an actual plot line...for a 2023 film I'm amazed this left the editing stage and someone signed off on this film...

title: Best flash representation of all time.
text: The flash no spoiler review.I enjoyed it yesterday in IMAX.Best flash representation of all time.Made my top 3 superhero live-action movies of all time taking the #3 spot behind Batman v. Superman Ultimate Edition, and Zack Snyder's Justice League.One of the best DC Movies of all-time including the DCAU.I cried, I laughed, I learned, then I cried again, and I laughed again.This movie is not built around nostalgia. It's very emotional. Very well written. Very cathartic.It has easter eggs and nods to worlds that have been, and worlds that never were.Best Batfleck Batman performance. Best '89 Batman performance. But the star of this movie is Ezra Miller front and center!I thought it would be a Batman movie with some flash in it. And I'm glad I was wrong... It's a Flash movie. And not even the Batmen could outshine the Flashes.I highly recommend this movie for any superhero fans. And it's a must see for any DC comics fan. A hardcore DC fan would simply freak out over some of the nods and references in this movie.If you're an uber hardcore DC (not just batman or flash) fan like me... then I have one final no spoiler spoiler for you..."When worlds collide... Look out for his long hair... Yes that's him... Can you effing believe it?!"From one DC fan to others out there. DO NOT MISS THIS MOVIE.And see it in IMAX or MX4D or something... The visuals demand an excellent screen.#flash #dc.

title: Fun
text: An amazingly fun movie that will excite comic book fans no end! I would say the CGI could've been better in some scenes, but overall the special effects were fine, and the fight scenes were fantastic! There was parts with great humour and of course parts that made me sob my heart out. The different characters (no spoilers) excited my partner and I so much. Acting of all characters was also spot on. Overall I would highly recommend this movie to all comic book fans and all lovers of Batman and DC. I almost wish the film was way longer. My partner and I are definitely going to rewatch it again and again!

title: Best DC Movie ever
text: A movie destinate to become a classic. Michael Keaton reprized his role as Batman perfectly, proving exceptional in both dialogue and action scenes. Probably the best individual performance I've ever seen in a superhero movie. Ezra Miller did really well too in both version of the Flash. The plot of the film is full of beautiful moments - sometimes funny, other times dramatic and exciting - and I really enjoyed the various cameos, especially the appearance of Nicolas Cage as Superman. I walked out of the theater really happy like the kid I was in the 90s, and I hope there is a sequel to this story and that there is also room for Ben Affleck in DC's future.

title: Don't waste money to go watch it just wait
text: I am a massive DC fan but just felt so let down by this movie and that's saying something as I wasn't really expecting much going in. The story was terrible, a LOT of bad acting and even worse CGI. The movies only saving grace was two of the Batman actors. It actually ruined some of the previous DCU movies for me. It could of been so much better they had the budget and time to make a great movie I just think there was a few bad casting choices and the team behind the CGI must of just thought to themselves what's the point. I know flash is more of the funnier member of justice league but the comedy what very little there was in this movie didn't even come from flash.

title: Even worse than wonder women1984
text: The cgi level is from1980, and the acting feels like you re watching a WWE wrestling so bad, it was an eye sore. Plot was OK, story line no good but can go along with it, but I always loose interest every 15 min, I have a bad habit of going through the movies if I start them, but I had to due to my nature, batman suits looked good, again it was along movie feet like days passed by while watching. The director did one of the worst movies in his career, and probably added to the shame of the DC universe movie collection, thier movies are mediocre but this had set a new limit that they should not go below, or really choose a better directors and pay more for better CGI.

title: DC Got it Right!!!
text: What a great time I just had watching the premier of The Flash! The storyline was pretty good and they adapted quite a bit from flashpoint, at least more than what I was expecting. The movie had it all, it had drama, action, humor, and a pretty darn good plot.I also rather enjoyed all of the cameo's that DC took the time to add in in order to give some of us fans some much needed closure to past characters and actors over the years. I can't wait for this to be released to streaming so I can purchase and add it to my collection. My only negative feedback was the end credit scene.... Although interesting and humorous, it would've been better to give us a taste of what's to come in the future..

title: Movie unsuitable for kids!
text: I toke my 2 children, 4 and 8 years old to see The Flash at the cinema, as they like super heroes. In IMDB website it is said that the movie is for "all public". Well that is absolutely not true. There is a terrible scene at the first 30min with a kid who discover his mother stabbed with a lot of blood! When my 8 old year son saw this scene, he started to cry and shake. We immediately left the cinema. Until now, my son has problem to sleep at night. IMDB deserves to be taken to court for that wrong information that can have devastating and irreversible consequences on kids life! The film/comics industry has a serious problem concerning what they propose to kids.

title: A Movie like no Other
text:
The Flash is a well done movie,
Fun, entertaining, funny, great cast of super-heroes
And also very human.The expectations was high and the movie give us that, and even more.The AI that they made in the movie is genius !!A whole other level.I love Batman I think is the best superhero,
And seen Ben Affleck back in the role play Batman was a greater idea. I wish we could see him even more.The big surprise of chorus was Nicolas Cage as superman, which was cast in the past to the rule.Ezra Miller doing a good job as the flash, it's very confusing to see him double on the screen as a young kid.Very recommended go see the flash.

title: Excellent, Marvel sucks
text: I recently watched gaurdian of galaxy vol 3 and the flash. I haven't finished galaxy movie beacuse in the mid way I already lost my intrest. I watched the flash few days later, such an excellent story and filming. I enjoyed the timeline stuff very well. I watched same genre shows like umbrella academy, Loki etc I enjoyed them as well and this story too same same but different. I like Nicolas cage presence in the movie I was stunned to see him. And I dont want to reveal the entire plot or the story by extending my comment. But i guess i had said enough to get started. Go watch the movie it's very good.

title: Yes, it's as bad as everybody says. Do not waste your time.
text: I just came back from the theater. And yes, The Flash is terrible. It's unjustifiably bad.Unfortunately, this movie has suffered so much from the bad management at Warner Bros. It's very clear that production was chaotic. We know directors have been changed. The direction of the whole company has changed during production. We had all the Ezra Miller PR disaster. The DCEU is going to be rebooted by James Gunn. So the whole point of this movie was lost. It's a mixed bag of pieces glued together.The idea of getting inspiration from The Flashpoint story arc was not bad. But they only kept the premise of Barry returning to save his mother. We had no Atlantians versus Amazonians war, and most importantly, we didn't have the Thomas Wayne Batman as it was foreshadowed by Zack Snyder way back in Batman v Superman, where Jeffrey Dean Morgan was cast for the flashback because they foresaw him becoming the Flashpoint Batman and Lauren Cohan would play the Flashpoint Joker. While everyone was shipping Negan and Maggie in The Walking Dead, the same couple was supposed to return for the Flashpoint event.We had none of that. Yes, Michael Keaton's return as Batman was very good, and at the very least, I think they didn't ruin our childhood memories. But we are talking about Batman 1989 when we didn't have CGI for special effects. So even cheap CGI today can deliver a good enough Batman action scene. Heck, even YouTubers can do it now. Studios don't have any justification for screwing this up, and fortunately, they didn't. It had all we expected: Danny Elfman's iconic theme song, the best Batmobile ever, the best Batwing ever, and the best Batsuit ever. It was perfect.But this was not a Batman movie. Then we had Sasha Calle as Kara Jor'el, Supergirl. And I think she nailed it. Unfortunately, they didn't give her much to do. I do think she was fantastic in the role, but the screenwriting and direction treated her very poorly in this movie. They called back to Superman 2011 event, but if you didn't watch that movie, you would be a bit lost on this part. The only thing they did to bring people up to speed was a 30 seconds dialogue exposition from Barry. This was very poorly handled.But this was not a Superman or Supergirl movie either. As a Flash movie, even though we had several cameos, at the very least, I think Ezra Miller himself did a good job, given the material he had to work with. I am not into celebrity gossip, and I couldn't care less about his shenanigans. But apart from all the crimes he committed in real life, his mental issues, and whatnot, I think he did a very good job portraying not one but two Barry Allens. In terms of acting range, he displayed a lot of flexibility and talent.
