Too bad this material was not good, to begin with.We have this whole surface-level "oh, the Flash is the fastest man alive, but Barry is always late for everything" shenanigans. It's implied that he has difficulties balancing his superhero life with his real-life persona, but this never actually plays any part in the story. It's just there. Several things in this movie is "just there". Wonder Woman showing up out of nowhere felt shoehorned and unnecessary. Iris West, shoehorned. I felt bad for Iris, as saying she was underutilized is an understatement.The soundtrack was mostly forgettable. I don't remember anything other than Danny Elfman's Batman and John Williams' Superman themes. And yes, it's unfair, as those are some of the most iconic theme songs of all time. But the contrast was big enough to notice.Then, there's the CGI and special effects issue. Remember when I said that even YouTubers can do better than the analog special effects from the 80s. Yeah, but Warner screwed up here as well. I don't remember CGI this bad since, I don't know, The Scorpion King. It was bad, truly bad. The director tried to sugarcoat it, saying that it was "supposed to look bad," justifying that it was a stylistic choice. And I don't think this excuse works. It's just plain bad. It Felt rushed and low-budget. And I think those are the true reasons. Seriously, hire a bunch of special effects YouTubers, like the Corridor Crew. Even they could do better than this.Finally, the easter eggs and fan service. They were exaggerated. I understand they wanted to celebrate the cultural zeitgeist, but it was too much and too out of context. Instead of feeling like they were trying to honor past works, such as Christopher Reeve's Superman, it felt disrespectful and distasteful.I can see that they had good intentions, but the execution was very poor, and I know Warner's upper management is to blame. The production crew did their best with what they had, possibly in one of the most chaotic productions of recent years. I can commend the attempt, but the results were just horrendous. I can't find enough words to say how bad. Very good casting, but very badly written and directed roles.If we cut this movie into pieces, I will remember Michael Keaton. And I will remember Sasha Calle. Everything else was garbage. A very sorry excuse for a bad joke. If not for those brief contributions, this is a straight zero. I will give 3 out of 10 out of pity.Not worth watching in the theater. Not worth the effort to download from torrent. If you subscribe to Max, wait for the streaming. You're not missing anything.I feel sad for this movie and the current state of DCEU. It's the last chapter in the Snyderverse. It started in a high note with 2011's Superman, we come back to the Zod story arc, and this last chapter is a sad reminder of how things could have been but wasn't. Too bad.

title: Fatigue and financial losses, accelerated
text: A key point to understand how the film industry changed during the COVID-19 Pandemic could be what radical social theorists call Accelerationism. Although not a model for induced change, it well defends the alleged benefits of doing nothing, supposedly so that new worlds can arise from hardship and crisis.I see Andy Muschieti's The Flash as an accidental, metaphorical manifestation of that. What this films aims to is not clear, but it surely makes effort to accelerate the DCEU to cinematic and narrative oblivion, by not establishing real threats to care for, diminishing the little impact its predecessors could have, smartly writing off the continuity of the Snyderverse to make room for James Gunn's take (albeit late) and many other corporate decisions.In an attempt to replicate Spider-Man No way home's formula for profit, Barry Allen's first solo (sic) cinematic adventure success at accelerating the audience's fatigue, boredom and indifference at multiversal-level time-bending speed, but it also accelerates Warner's numbers to massive loss, althought it does so with kinky humor, some deference and occasional emotion.

title: You will be thrilled out of your MIND
text: Just back now from seeing The Flash at my local cinema. I'm trembling with the sheer emotional overload. This is the best movie I've seen this year, and perhaps the best movie I've seen in several years. Tight writing and a perfect pace, a truly great score and for all the SF/fantasy/superhero nerds like me, easter eggs that you need a superhero sized basket to collect. Yes, the cameos are legion, and some are rather sentimental, but they work in the story. And the STORY! It is amazing, with literary flourishes like metaphor and symbolism (yikes!). Let me tell you, when Michael Keaton flies out of the Batcave to Danny Elfman's main theme, you will be thrilled out of your MIND. Ezra Miller does a journeyman job of acting for the first act. Didn't really like his character. But canny directing and exemplary acting paid for it as his character grew in maturity and strength throughout. Miller, for better or worse, is famously nuts. And there were squeaky edges. But he's damn fine in this film. I know that the Superhero genre is getting tired and lame, but don't let that generality deter you. This movie breaks the mold. Everything matters. Every moment. My highest recommendation. Oh, and one of those easter eggs? I'm going to play coy, but it's a hero you know well, and an actor you know extremely well, and somewhere in some alternate universe that movie got made. We can only dream...

title: So glad this wasn't a 'FLASH' movie
text: I've always thought of the Flash as one of the weakest characters in the MCU (he's MCU right?) .. anywho, thankfully, this movie had many appearances from other Justice League friends, which made it much more entertaining.The movie was a good action film, with just a bit of light humor - such as how different actors keep showing up in the place of the original, that was just genius writing!Lots of turns and twists really kept you on the edge of your seat. When you think you know what's going on - Nope! The viewers are pulled in another direction. Best action movie I've seen so far in 2023.RECOMMENDATION: Highly recommend, especially now that it's free on HBO, or 'MAX' as they now call it.

title: Awesome
text: "The Flash" brings the beloved DC Comics superhero to the big screen with electrifying energy and an exhilarating sense of adventure. Directed by Emily Johnson, this highly anticipated film delivers a thrilling experience that will leave fans of the Scarlet Speedster satisfied and newcomers captivated.Barry Allen, portrayed by the charismatic and talented Alex Reynolds, takes center stage as the fastest man alive. With his quick wit and undeniable charm, Reynolds embodies the essence of Barry Allen, making the character both relatable and endearing.The film wastes no time in plunging audiences into the world of metahumans, supervillains, and parallel dimensions. From the exhilarating opening sequence to the heart-pounding climax, "The Flash" keeps the pace swift and action-packed. The visual effects dazzle, particularly when Barry taps into the Speed Force, creating breathtaking moments that showcase his incredible abilities.One of the film's standout aspects is its exploration of Barry Allen's personal journey. Beneath the crimson suit lies a young man burdened by his tragic past, searching for answers and redemption. The emotional depth added to the narrative brings a welcomed layer to the superhero genre, making the character's struggles and growth all the more compelling.Supporting characters play a significant role in "The Flash" and are brought to life by a talented ensemble cast. Iris West, portrayed by Jessica Parker, brings charisma and strength to her character, while the enigmatic Dr. Caitlin Snow (Emily Turner) adds a touch of mystery and intrigue. The chemistry among the cast members is palpable, adding authenticity to the relationships that develop throughout the story.The film strikes a balance between lighthearted humor and more introspective moments, injecting levity into the otherwise intense storyline. Clever one-liners and witty banter provide welcome comic relief, allowing the audience to connect with the characters on a deeper level.While "The Flash" delivers a satisfying experience overall, it occasionally stumbles in its pacing. Certain scenes could have been tightened to maintain a more consistent momentum. Nevertheless, the film's strengths far outweigh these minor drawbacks."The Flash" is a testament to the enduring appeal of superheroes and their ability to inspire audiences. It explores themes of heroism, identity, and the power of self-belief, resonating with viewers beyond the spectacle of superhuman abilities.In conclusion, "The Flash" is a high-speed adventure that embraces the essence of the beloved character. With a charismatic lead, thrilling action sequences, and emotional depth, it sets a solid foundation for future installments in the franchise. Whether you're a longtime fan or new to the world of the Scarlet Speedster, this film offers an electrifying cinematic experience that leaves you eagerly anticipating the next chapter in Barry Allen's journey.

title: I didnt want to like it. But its the best movie in years..
text: I had heard this was bad. Like Really bad. I heard about the actors run in with the law and critic reviews were so low. I just stayed away from this movie for a really long time. Until it came out on hbo and i decided there was nothing else to watch. So i gave it a shot.Its funny, its dark, and its not scene for scene taken from previous flash movies and tv shows. Which is really incredible in this movie "Copy & Paste" era.Erza..though does have a really annoying high pitched voice. If only...but you get used to it.I dont like to spoil movies in the review..but i still have 75 characters...and nevermind.

title: Great Cast, Poor Production (No Spoilers)
text: Considering the budget that must have gone into casting for this film -- and featuring nearly every Batman/Superman character since the birth of Methuselah -- the overall production was really poor. Ezra Miller as the lead -- initially awkward, which he's known for, then gradually coming out of his shell as Flash/Barry -- is fine, but the storyline is extremely convoluted (no spoilers for those who have the time to go watch the movie). Seeing our favorite Batman(s) was nice, but Cavil's obvious absence given the multiple Batman/Superman cameos made the film extremely awkward and ridiculous. Of course it gives Keaton a bit more time to shine -- no complaints there. But the reported excuses of "confusing viewers" with too many Superman cameos when they basically threw in everything and the kitchen sink into the movie tells viewers that this is simply hogwash.No spoilers to the plot. The plot will spoil itself.

title: Love letter to say goodbye!
text: This movie is a fun ride and watching Batman fighting along side The Flash and Supergirl is a dream come true. Michael Keaton is always a fantastic Batman and the fights are Superb! The movie is not perfect but is solid vision and is absolutely beautiful.Thank you for all the years and I love how this movie gives us closure to a Universe that had some many fluctuations but I'm glad I was part of this and the Batman Universe. Great ending and I can cherish this moment with my loved ones! I can't wait to get this movie on Blu Ray and all delete scenes and special features for now take a moment and go watch it and enjoy the show!

title: Wow
text: This movie was great and was meant to be seen on the big screen, it utilizes complex ideas very well and makes thing understandable for watchers who have no idea about anything related to time travel, genuinely a great movie and deserves better ratings! Though Ezra is Ezra, he plays Barry very well and his dual role is done in a manner in which you can differentiate between the two, his acting really shine throughout the movie. Reviews that call this a cameo fest are the furthest from the truth, this movie does has cameos but it utilized them in a meaningful and memorable way, honoring the legacy of DC films. All in all a great watch and a must see.

title: Run out to see this one.
text: The Flash is my #2 favorite comic book superhero (Superman is #1). I own every issue of comics with his name on the cover from 1987 to last week.Needless to say, I was really excited to see this movie. Only there was a problem...it's star Ezra Miller. Real world issues aside, I did not care for his performance as The Scarlet Speedster in his previous outings. He was annoying and not what I was expecting the character to be.Then I watched this film and his performance was so much better this time around. He was still kind of annoying, but he had matured as an individual. It had never occured to me that his behavior in "Justice League" was because he was young. He was a stupid kid who was given amazing powers. I definitely would have behaved exactly the same as a young man. Heck, I would act that way now as a middle aged man.The story was mostly what I was expecting it to be. Like I said I have a pretty expensive collection of his printed adventures, but it was a lot funnier than I was expecting. The laughs didn't feel forced and came out naturally with the story and tone they were presenting.As for the cameos, some were known ahead of time, like Michael Keaton's return as Batman, and there were some others I expected but I will not spoil. Then there were some others that took me completely by surprise and I audibly squealed in my seat. But no matter who showed up, all of these little appearances were a love letter to the history of DC.Is it the best superhero movie ever like some people are saying? No, but is is a darn good one and a lot of fun. I highly recommend seeing this one in theaters as its scope and action should be experienced on the big screen.

title: Cut miller some slack no one is perfect
text: First off everyone has something to say about the cgi listen carefully unless your a movie director shut up lol second miller like all of us all have mental issues his are just on display for the whole world to see and judge. His personal life has nothing to do with a movie and it's ability to make it at the box office! The movie was good! It was funny, action packed and had a good story likeSTOP LISTENING TO THE NEGATIVE REViews it's like any other action movie it's good!So all please enough bad mouthing miller. Outside of the movie isn't important just watch the darn movie and be silent.Ps. Also cameos from some pretty amazing actors in the business! Loved the movie!

title: DISAPPOINTMENT.
text: The story is cringe. The CGI is bad. The dialogue is horrendous. These are the things that make up the FLASH. I'd say the only redeemable thing about this is SUPERGIRL and Ben Affleck as BATMAN. This story doesn't adapt the perfectly accepted FLASHPOINT and instead uses a storyline which in an attempt to be something different, fails and is annoying. Adapting FLASHPOINT would have been amazing. Nobody would've been mad, the cast they would've had, would've been superb, and yet they did not take the perfect gold mine that was presented to them. The CGI is one of the worst things to come out in the modern age. How are you going to let MAN OF STEEL, which was released 10 years ago, look more modern than your modern movie. It's honestly a shame. Watch the movie for the dialogue part.

title: This movie is a lot of fun!
text: DC does not have a great track record with their movies, but the Flash character was one of the highlights of the Justice League movie, and it seemed appropriate that they brought his humor, inexperience, and naïveté to this movie. It worked very well for me. There were some surprise characters introduced during the film, and the actors were very good. The script was well written and flowed pretty evenly. The movie was quickly paced: it did not seem like a 2 hour and 30 minutes movie.I recommend the Flash to fans of action hero movies. It has supplanted itself as a top ranked DC comics movie for me.

title: Like a used pencil-it's pointless
text: Through the pointless and honestly mind-numbing plot and horrible and overused vfx at least it had a few good moments (probably around 3 lol). Too much fan service (for example bringing back too many legacy characters) and room temperature acting at least it was kind of entertaining to watch.I'm glad the DCEU ended, especially after this mind numbing experience. Ezra miller's acting wasn't great neither was Sasha Calle's acting felt very awkward and almost out of place. The plot felt overused especially since (just like Batman V Superman) it involved itself too much with the events from Man of Steel instead of trying to be its own installment and feel new.

title: It's not perfect, but it's a great ending to a failed universe
text: The DCEU was its own worst enemy. With the constant studio controversies, commercial and financial flops and the overall low morale and reputation of the DCEU really hurt the Dc brand and Warner Brothers for the foreseeable future. If this movies came out a couple years ago, it would have saved the failed Dceu because the flash is really really good. It's better than my expectations and while it surely isn't the best superhero movie since the beginning of history as James Gunn and Tom cruise said, it is really a love letter to the Dc property and history. It has great emotions that hit close to home and it has mostly great comedy. The cgi isn't ideal but it's not as bad as most people say. The fight sequences were cleverly done and I liked the attention they put into the flash's powers. Go watch it, I promise it's a good fun film that is rewatchable.

title: The FLASH
text: I greatly enjoyed this film. As a big fan of superhero movies, this is one of the best not only because of ghe comedic elements, but also the dynamics of the characters together. Sasha Calle, Michael Keaton do a great job in their roles and act very well. People who take points off because of Ezra Miller's off screen are ridiculous as he had a pretty good performance in the movie. The movie also came with a lot of surprises everywhere such as Dark Flash being the other Barry. Despite the sub par cgi, the acting comedy and other elements of the film make this not only a truly great DC film but also a great superhero movie.

title: Yech...
text: I gave this movie four stars: one for Michael Keaton, one for Sasha Calle and one for George Clooney. The last star is because it nailed me right in the nostalgia seeing George Reeves, Christopher Reeve, Adam West and others as well as Nicholas Cage. That was pretty cool. Ezra Miller is lousy and unlikeable as Flash. Additionally, I'm more than a little annoyed that Hartly Sawyer was cut from Flash the series for some stupid tweets (yes they were sick and twisted and his excuse of wanting attention is lame) but Ezra is a pig, pervert, and one accuser called him a GROOMER OF THEIR 12 YEAR OLD but he doesn't get cut? Ok, to be fair, those are accusations and one is presumed innocent until proven guilty, but I guess I'm just personally ranting because I like Sawyer's Ralph MUCH better than Miller's Flash. It also bothers me that the series is all about redemption and second chances and Sawyer gets dropped because of some nonsense even after he apologized. Yes, Miller apologized, too, and is seeking help and I hope he gets it. But the double standard kills me. If Miller preferred he/him instead of they/them, would he have been recast? Something to consider. I apologize that this went from a movie review about Flash and became a rant about fairness. With or without Miller, this movie was awful. The Batman and Supergirl parts were cool and that's about it.

title: It's a really good movie
text: The Flash bombed at the US Box Office in the first weekend. Obviously because of bad marketing of WB Studios. But still, this is a great movie and Ezra Miller is having a great performance. For all who have doubts whether to watch the movie or not, just watch it! And if you feel after the ending you need to watch the old Tim Burton Batman movies, this is a very natural feeling and totally normal :)There are some critics about the special effects, I don't understand them, the movie is providing a great story and the story is what we are actually missing in so many action movies like this one.

title: Boring storyline and poor CGI
text: Best to watch animated movie called Flash point paradox. Better story and you won't regret it but this one just don't make sense. Poor story, boring as hell. Very little action scene. Nothing exciting. Waste of 2 hours and money. Acting is also terrible. Super girl was pretty useless and not much scene for her either. Compare with animated movie, just don't make sense. 2 flash. One with power and the one without power. Apart from running around like a headless chicken, nothing special feature or ability of flash. I couldn't believe how poorly adapted from the animated version. You might like it if you haven't seen the animated version. Anyway, worst DC movie ever.Only Aquaman, Man of Steel, Superman vs Batman and first WW are good. Shazam and Black Adam are also terrible but this is worse. Don't recommend.

title: The death of Super Hero movies
text: Disney has cut back or put on hold it's planned Marvel projects and DC should follow suit with its future super hero projects also. The Flash isn't the worst super hero movie made but Ezra Miller isn't up to caring a movie by himself. He's a supporting character at best.The idea of the movie is interesting, along the lines of Dr. Strange's Multiverse or Spider-Man's Spiderverse but as usual DC is once again playing catch up to Marvel with diminishing returns. The one bright spot is Micheal Kenton's reprise of Batman which makes it worth the watch just for that.The CGI is horrible in spots. I mean shockingly bad. Like they ran out of money in post production. I've read a review where it was suggested that they intended that but honestly why intentionally sabotage your production like that?

title: Still Better than any Marvel Movie
text:
Sorry but not sorry we have been fed the Marvel crap for too long. The Flash and every other Dc movie has more heart, the best villains and the greatest stories. Ok enough bashing the Marvel Disney stuff..
The Flash was a excellent story the effects yes were not the best, but most movies the CGI is not really that good. It has gotten too cartoonish, Hollywood needs to go back to building sets and miniatures.Michael Keaton, of course is amazing. It was cool seeing Ben Affleck as Batman again Kara did awesome it was cool seeing her as Supergirl she did such a great job. Some of the story felt rushed probably could've been edited down a little bit, but most superhero movies are a little too long.Otherwise it was an enjoyable Movie and that's what you want in a movie.

title: It's a Hot Mess
text: At certain level you almost feel bad for the movie. The Flash movie was plagued with production problems since day 1. From the time they announced the film, they made a whole CW series of the Flash that ran for 9 years. This movie went through 9 different directors. It kept being delayed for COVID protocol. The studio kept changing its mind about the DC direction after each movie release. Actors contracts expired and just a whole mess of things. That mess certainly does show in the final product. That's not to mention the lead actor seemed to have some sort of mental breakdown and could not stop going to jail. It's at that point that any pity that you had going for the movie is replaced with disgust.On the short list of positives, there are a handful of little details that the movie does right. I smiled at the joke where the title screen gets interrupted, or when Flash goes to cut off the ears on Batman's cowl.With those out of the way, let's dig in. The CGI in this film is some of the worst I have seen in any big budget film. This is "Mummy Returns" level of bad visuals. The comedy in this movie is irritating. First you have the Flash, and then you have a somehow more annoying version of the same character. It has some of the most desperate attempts of nostalgia bating "member berries" I have ever seen. I grant that the comic book logic isn't going to make sense, but at the very least it has to stay consistent to its own rules, and this film fails at that. And it concludes with an over the top nonsense CGI battle where the heroes have no plan for success. The tone is all over the place. Given the film's troubled development I would not be surprised if the finished product was an improv game where each director tried to finish the sentence started by the other. When I think of the theme that the movie is trying to teach, it is a bit insulting. It is like they are wanting to have their cake and eat it too. The whole thing does not work.I think Batman summed it up best, when in the movie he stated: "For the record, I think this whole thing is insane."

title: Watch the Animated Movie Instead.
text: After hearing all this buzz by WB/DC executives, you would have thought this was the rebirth of WB/DC. Well, it looks like those executives were on the same stuff as Aaron Rodgers. Watch the animated movie, Justice League: The Flashpoint Paradox since it's far better. The Supergirl and Batman sequences overshadow Flash to the point, where Flash felt more like support character. I wouldn't be surprised if there is a Supergirl movie in the works. But WB/DC will probably screw that up even with new leadership from Gunn, who had his own issues. It's just a messy movie with such a large budget of $200M, why is the CGI so poor? And I haven't even factored in Miller's controversies, which should have gotten him fired. And the Batman running joke ended with easily the worst version of Batman ever.

title: "You want to get nuts? Let's get nuts." - Batman
text: Barry Allan uses the speed force to travel back in time and save his Mum. But on his return to the present timeline he gets knocked off course and finds himself stuck in an alternate timeline where Superman is not around to stop Zod's invasion of earth.I was not expecting much when I went in to watch The Flash. The DCU had never really grasped my interest outside of Wonder Woman, Shazam, Zack Snyders Justice League and Suicide Squad so I was pleasantly surprised when I walked out having enjoyed this so much! The Flash is sort of like the DCU's version of Avengers Endgame in that is references and rewrites various events from movies past... and not just recent movies either but ALL DC related films or shows going back to the 50s. The humour can be a bit on the nose at times, but there's also some genuine comedic observations about the other Justice League characters. Although the overall plot is quite emotionally heavy and deals with loss, grief and the role pain plays in our development as people, the story is told in a light and breezy way making it very easy to watch. Generally time travel storylines get very confusing, but the explanations given in this film are quite different to how other films deal with time travel and I found it slightly refreshing. It did start to get a little confusing right near the end with what was happening inside the time bubble thing and worlds were crashing into one another but outside of that small sequence, everything else made perfect sense to me. It was great to see Michael Keaton return to his role as Batman, I can't say I was overaly happy with his portrayal mind you as it was almost too comedic but it was still "cool", I got giddy. There are a few other interesting faces that show up and events refrenced from movies past and I don't want to spoil it for others but it was fun pointing them all out... to a point. That was also the movies biggest let down. I don't think they needed all those cameos particularly from historic DC franchises. It just felt a bit much, they over did it and it lost some of the impact.Final Verdict: Action packed, funny, emotional when it counts and just an all round easy watch. It does start to get a bit self-indulgent right towards the end and the humour didn't always land but its one of the better DCU films in a long time.

title: People are Calling this a Good Film with Bad CGI
text: This isn't a good film, it's a bad movie. It has none of the character, depth or character needed for this to be a film. No one will be speaking of this movie in the next decade let alone when the unforgivable sequel comes out.How most cinema goers perceive a movie is based on the quality of CGI. That's to say if you take the same film with varying CGI quality, people value the quality of CGI more than the content. However this changes when the quality of the content is decent/good (i.e. The Thing & The Matrix: Reloaded). The fact that the line is the sand for whether a blockbuster is good or not is the CGI underscores what has gone wrong with modern film in general. At least when my parents brought me to watch Monsters Inc. I could take away something valuable from what was unsaid, and so could they.Honestly after this monstrosity of a film I cannot for a minute believe that Warner Bros or any other company in this space is going to pull out of this nosedive. Modern film is all pop-culture references with no substance. Please, I urge to go back and take a look at the first Iron Man for just a few minutes, then come look at any of the sequels. Infinity War was the only one that came close, then it's legacy was ruined by Endgame. Lord forgive these writers, producers & directors. The flash was a mess, ingratiating itself at the feet of the common viewer like a pug but when it comes down to it, it shouldn't have ever existed in the first place. Us as the people who pay for the tickets, recommend movies to others, and bring our children to the Box Office have forgotten that we're in charge of the $h!t show. We bred the pug and The Flash into existence, and it's deformed shape is no longer morally justifiable, it's time to undo this mess.This is while trying to ignore the controversy involving some of the cast. I genuinely gave it a fair shake and I want a refund.To quote a true graphic novel adaptation. "Blake understood. Treated it like a joke, but he understood. He saw the cracks in society, saw the little men in masks trying to hold it together...he saw the true face of the twentieth century and chose to become a reflection of it, a parody of it. No one else saw the joke. That's why he was lonely."

title: The Worst Superhero Movie Ever!
text: WHY?! Why do studios insist on making Superhero sequels that are so bad that they ruin multiple franchises simultaneously? This is most definitely the worst superhero movie ever made! It's worse than Batman & Robin w/ George Clooney's nipples. It's worse than Danny DeVito & Jack Nicholson as bad guys w/ Michael Keaton as a pitiful Batman. It's worse than Adam West as Batman. The Flash in this movie is an OCD neurotic that makes you want to erase him from the "Flashverse" permanently!It's a bad portrayal of superheroes and villains alike. The only reason it's a "2" are the CGI effects.Please don't watch. Ever.

title: Good Flash Film led down by poor CGI
text: DS:MoM used Americ Chavez as a plot device while The Flash actually had a great plot. The Murder of Barry's Mom is what makes Barry The Flash and the film did a good job portraying that.Ezra Miller's acting was top notch. Ben Affleck is probably like my 2nd favourite Batman after Rob. Keaton was Keaton. Sasha Calle deserves to be the Supergirl in the future DCU.THe comedy didn't really felt forced, the action sequences were good, but OMFG, the CGI. They really shat in that department. I don't know where they spent all that money but not in CGI, that's for sure.I am excited to see what Andy Muschietti has in store for the DCU Batman.

title: It's a solid 3.75/5 for a general movie goer and a 5/5 for a DC fan.
text:
I don't speak for Ezra of their actions off camera. But they literally carried the movie. Even for a movie with multiple batmen and supergirl. It was flash movie thru and thru.. Andy killed it. Now I understand what he is the frontrunner to direct the brave and the bold. He shines.CG in the movie looks great for 95% of it. 3% is obvious face replacements that you can expect when same actor plays 2 characters who interact with each other all the time which is for 2 good hours in this movie.. And 2% is the style of CG not reckless CG.I suppose that's how film makers chose to show how time travel work and how the outside looks from the inside of the speed force..
It's was fun movie with a lot of heart.One of the few movies that is completely plot driven and doesn't loose it's sight for 1 min even.It's a solid 3.75/5 for a general movie goer and a 5/5 for a DC fan. You'll just love the references and the cameos.Keaton killed it. He once again proves why he's the best BATMAN there is..
Sasha was born to play supergirl. They dealt with her really great for the short time she was in the movie.. They couldn't have done a better job..
If this is the last time we see Sasha as supergirl. It's definitely a sin.

title: 🤦IT WAS AN ABSOLUTE DISASTER🤦
text: It's Possibly the Most Stupid Superhero Film Ever MadeHere are the Positives -1. Alot of the Action Scenes were anywhere from Good to Great and 2 Really Outstanding Sequences, (Both Keatons)2. Super Girl was Great to See and her Action Scene on top of the prison was Great to See also.Problems -1. Why was Kal-El sent to Earth if Supergirl had the Codex? What was the point of Kal-El Then?2. Why is Zod Having Meetings with the Army General if he Knows that Supergirl has the Codex and not Kal-El?3. Flashes' Mother, errrmm what happened? Who killed her then? And don't just say we don't know or it doesn't matter. That's not good enough.4. Reverse Flash was Cut out of the Film.5. When Zod and Faora See Supergirl in the Sky, why didn't they go after her if she has the codex?6. Cavills Superman was ment to meet Supergirl at the Very End. Didn't Happen 😔7. Keaton was Meant to Step out of the Car at the End, NOT CLOONEY. (They did reshoots and changed it) (Also this CLOONEY Scene sums up this Entire Movie, 🤡 it's an absolutely Pointless Inconsequential Film)More Problems -1. Why wasn't Zod, Faora and Super Girl Given more to do? I Needed Dialogue Between Those 3.2. After Experiencing Black Adam and the Eye Popping Visuals and Stunning Energy within the Slow Motion, you can't go back to this Lower Level.Overall, It's one of the Worst Superhero Films Ever Made.

title: I give this a 3 star to counter all those 9 stars there seems like kid today just put 9 and 10 so rating movies are useless now
text: Well i'm happy that it was it was not just me growing older but everyone else think it's the worst superhero movie ever made (The Flash has become the worst box office flop in superhero movie history) It's really childish like they try to copy the first guardians of the galaxy humor where it don't fit in and.i thought it couldn't get more cringe than Juggernaut in X-Men: The Last Stand or deadpool with 2 sword arms in X-Men Origins but i was wrong. Don't pay to watch this movie seriously your wasting your money. I only finished it so i could leave a rair review otherwise i would've walked out way before.

title: Better than recent Marvel and other DC crap
text: Storyline is strong. A different flavour with all nostalgic actors and scenes. Tried to setup all broken DC universe. I think it's bit underrated. Felt bit refreshed story compared to recent super hero movies which all runs on same story line. Erza miller suits for the role and should continue. Storyline is strong. A different flavour with all nostalgic actors and scenes. Tried to setup all broken DC universe. I think it's bit underrated. Felt bit refreshed story compared to recent super hero movies which all runs on same story line. Erza miller suits for the role and should continue. That concludes my review.

title: crap movie with crap actor in title role
text: How do you write 600 characters or more for such a load of crap as this? Well, according to thedirect, "The Ezra Miller-led epic reportedly will force Warner Bros. (WB) to lose upwards of $200 million, despite all the hype from the studio leading into it." So, there is that. I really don't know how so many people gave it such a high rating, although most of those are saying that Keaton stole the show, and they're right. That was the ONE bright spot in this otherwise crap movie. Miller is a horrible actor, and apparently and equally horrible, if not more horrible person. One look at him, and you can see he is a deeply disturbed, drug-addled individual who has apparently been led to confusion about many things in his life, and maybe that has led to some of his apparent rage and acting out. But, he's an adult, and needs to own the bad things he's done and make corrections to become a decent person.

title: It's good.... but...
text: On the whole, I really enjoyed this movie. After all of the bad reviews, I skipped seeing it at the theater. I finally watched it on Max.Right from the start, the story was good. Miller did a very good job at being a likeable character. But right from a start, I had a problem. I tried to figure out whether the special effects were the problem, or if it was something else. The big scene with the falling babies was just bad. I finally decided that it was the direction. I just didn't like it. In another scene with the Bat-Cycle, it just looked.. wrong. Again, I analyzed it and decided that it wasn't the effects, it was just that things don't work that way in real life. The Bat-Cycle is powerful and can slam off walls without damage. But it just didn't look like it was happening in our world.But then we get into the main part of the story, and I really enjoyed it. Miller did great playing off himself. It made the movie light and fun.It went dark (a bit) in the story, but that was necessary and appropriate.I loved how they presented the multiverse, and I enjoyed the cameos.By the end of the movie, I found that I had really enjoyed it.

title: Worst movie ever
text: Do NOT waste your money. Barry is horrible, he acts dumb the whole time. In the series Barry is intelligent and likable, this movie missed that completely. I like Keaton as Batman, but that moment has passed. Iris, uninteresting and weird. I guess they had to make her ugly because Barry is a weirdo in the movie. Barry is cast to be a "creeper". Weird special affects that don't really work with the movie. It is almost like they were trying to make The Flash a Bill & Ted's excellent adventure movie.Supporting cast is equally useless. Plot .... Zero! Even the post-credit trailer is bunk. Leave to DC to mess a whole movie! It isn't worth $6 to rent it.

title: The True Multiverse of Madness
text: This is what one would actually expect by a title like that, this is what should be called: The Flash in the Multiverse of Madness, not that dull Doctor Strange movie which only had a few characters introduced to the multiverse.In spite of not having a great script, The Flash is both funny and highly entertaining, and also a box after box of surprises that never crossed my mind to see in the movie.The trailer looked great simply by seeing Michael Keaton's Batman was in it, I mean that was the best hook for us old schoolers (millenials if you will), buuuut all the other appearances and cameos, physical or digital, totally left me in awe.No spoilers here, go and experience this madness of timelines by yourself, you'll love it specially if you are an 80's/90's kid/teenager.

title: Beautiful Movie with perfect appreciation to all Batman & Dc heroes
text:
Being a true dc fan after long time seen a movie perfect with action and humor. Ezra Miller is perfect for flash and should be again cast. This movie has perfect blend of emotions, action, time travel topic. Deserve a part 2 flash.Some movies deserve 3d effect and this movie comes in that category
Would have been treat to watch in 3d, but none the less must watch movie. Especially the Micheal Keaton scene gives goosebumps. Being a true batman fans enjoyed every bit of the presence of all characters
Dc is back with good content.Hope more content are coming like this!!Must watch movie for all Dc fans and everyone.

title: It's so so so so so so so so so so so so so so so so so so so so so so so so so so so so so so so so so so so so so so so so so so so so so so so so so so so so bad
text: I wish I could say something about this movie was good in any way other than in an ironic sense. The cgi is bad, the actors are (mostly) bad, the writing is bad, the action is bad, even the idea of the movie was bad. Why did the bring Ezra miller back AGAIN??? The amount of crimes he's committed should effectively blacklist him from hollywood, but apparently DC has to keep using the actors they used prior despite james gunn basically now being the DC film's new overseer. Bringing a multiverse into a pre-established film franchise has been a very bad idea, as seen with the mcu. Spider-verse did it all incredibly well twice, how do other companies keep messing this up???This movie, no, this flick, is appalling, don't watch it unless you want to see microwave baby.

title: Rating-wise, I've gone back and forth between 8/10 and 9/10 - it narrowly nabs the latter
text: I fear I may be turning into some sort of DC fanboy because... I thought this was great.Like with 'Shazam! Fury of the Gods', I was not expecting much from these DCEU films as I only decided to watch them so I could catch up on this universe before the 'Aquaman and the Lost Kingdom' finale next month. I guess I was subconsciously anticipating these to be as flat as a pancake due to the suits upstairs focusing on the upcoming DCU. Yet, I've had a terrific time thus far - 'Blue Beetle' pending.As for this film itself, I'm not someone who has any interest in comic books so my only knowledge comes directly from the films. All I knew beforehand was the rather dodgy life of Ezra Miller (just look at their Wikipedia!) apparently affecting production. That's a lot of words to simply say that I have no clue how well of an adaptation this is from the comics, though simply as a film it give me entertainment, it really did.'The Flash' features a strong performance from Miller, who portrays the aforementioned with quality throughout. I don't remember Barry Allen from the other DCEU flicks, so I'm pleased to have something memorable from the character with this. Elsewhere, Sasha Calle is very good as Supergirl, while Michael Keaton is much fun as Batman. There are some solid cameos in there too.I will say that I personally would've shaved some of the run time, it does overrun ever so slighty. That is my only proper criticism though, given everything else from the story - which brings heart - to the special effects to whatever is done to a positive standard. Rating-wise, I've gone back and forth between 8/10 and 9/10 - it narrowly nabs the latter.

title: Pretty Bad AND Confusing
text: Ezra Miller isnt such a good actor. He almost reminds me of Jerry Lewis with his mugging as the Flash. Plus the movie is more of a Justice League movie than a Flash movie in that they had to have Wonder Woman and TWO Batmen in it to get people to go see it!And then there's the Flash's back story -- when did his parents become hispanic? I don't remember that in the comic books. And considering his name is "Barry" it doesnt even make sense. And when did he have to eat in order to run fast? This is not the Flash of my childhood.And the past/present/future thing is annoying. I wish they'd stop doing that.

title: Why can't people see it for what it is funny and a good movie
text: I like it and find that many apparently find this movie lacking. Why ??? Why can't everyone see it for what it is a good superhero movie and not be so critical I'm so tired of everyone been a critic of movies. I loved it and like the narrative of looking for redemption for more than one character. Watch it and stop find so many flaws every time a new movie comes along in this genre.It makes a good story about time travel and the possibility's of making changes and thing goes array.Love the premise for the plot and I still like Ezra miller even if people find him strange give him a chance........

title: Entertaining superhero movie
text: It is a great movie, it leans a lot on current and past nostalgia, the story is captivating and entertaining, Ezra Miller is great as Barry Allen, his performance is very convincing as the serious and mature Flash and the teenage Flash, the comedy is constant which helps a lot to follow the plot as it is intended, I left the cinema very excited and satisfied, my expectations were covered quite well, the hero in this movie is also the leader that you did not expect him to be, dealing with other characters that are generally the leaders is not easy, the end, although predictable, is the breaking point of the hero who hopes for redemption in some way by accepting his destiny and the destiny of those he loves, I hope that the new DC universe is as good as this one.

title: How did this get rated above zero?
text: Is it possible to rate less than one? An incredibly STUPID movie. The only way it could have sucked more is have a Strange man in a cape wave his hands around for two hours, mumbling. Here we have a man who runs faster than light and something so incredibly inexplicable happens that there is no attempt to make it explicable. The way to enjoy these movies is have a lobotomy first cuz it's just to painful to make sense out of them if such a thing were possible. Don't let your dog watch either, it's dumb enough as it is. Your cat will like & understand it though.There it's padded enough to get posted ..

title: Brilliant! Had SUCH low expectations.
text: The reviews for this movie aren't good at all!I thought I would watch it to kill some time.I don't usually review movies, but this deserves kudos!This was better than all Marvel movies apart from the first Iron Man.It was funny, original, emotional and incredibly entertaining!LOVED IT!Brilliant humour, great action, even better story!I am a very big fan of Tim Burton's Batman, so having Keaton in this and the WAY they brought him in, with the music, the sets, it was brilliant.Best Super... "Person", don't know why but immediately liked this version of Superman.Loved it, well done to all involved!

title: Great sense if humor
text: I have to say that it was the first long movie that not only I didn't get tired watching but I also laughed many times! Great sense of humor! And as for some face visual effects not so perfect I admire the effort of the whole movie so I easily pass by! Brilliant scenario, great acting...all things that reminds me that only Americans hold the craft of making great cinema! I don't want to add anything else and at this point the platform shows I have 150 required characters I must write. That is way too much...Pls change this rule of platform. I only keep writing cause I need to say my opinion for this great movie!

title: Kind of a letdown
text: It was to much like a spider verse movie , why can't Hollywood be original instead of copying its competition Marvel and D C just basically copy each other .They might as well just be the same company .I think they are blaming the failure at the box office on the stars legal problems but I think its because people are tired of the same old plotlines .Now that the flash flopped I garentee the powers that be will figure out a way to rehash the same old stories. It would be great if Dark Horse or Image would start competing with D C and Marvel maybe somebody will figure this out it the future basically everybody is tired of superhero movies.

title: Childish and contrived
text: This is complete trash. 48 minutes in and what has seemed childish and contrived has now become so cartoonist. So much time is wasted on slow motion, bad cgi, long exposition and horrible immature dialogue and antics in the first hour. This wouldn't be so bad if it wasn't what the is centered around. SO MUCH WASTED TIME!On top of that this whole thing comes about as an accident that he then pursues because; where are the responsible adults?I am going to finish this mess but the critics were right about this movie and the state of the DCEU and as an extension, Hollywood and further extension our nation.

title: A DC fan very annoyed , The justice league flashpoint much better
text: The story is so poor and unconvincing ,i believe if they used the story from the flashpoint movie would be much greater .Keaton batman was actually the best thing in the movie , maybe the nostalgia is talking right now but he did better than i expected .Ben affleck and the suit of batman was so poor and actually made batman looks like a joke.I can not understand why supergirl , poor character very weak personality i'd rather henry's superman every day of the week .Cgi level on the movie was very very poor , immature level and weak .I'd loved to see this movie from the perspective of zack snyder he was doing great but DC has another plan.

title: One of the Better DCEU Movies, with Major Flaws
text: The Flash is not the best DC movie by any stretch. It's not better than Wonder Woman, Shazam, or The Suicide Squad (the 2021 version of course), but I'd be lying if I said I wasn't entertained. That said, it has some flaws that prevent it from being a truly good movie, with the biggest disappointment being t doesnt have any original Flash villain. The Flash has excellent villains, and none of them gets even a mention, making the Flash look like the least appreciated member of the Justice League. Hell, even Shazam, a supposedly less important DC character, was given his own villain. The CGI is not the best we've seen in a DCEU movie, or any movie for that matters. And yes, the Flashpoint Paradox animated movie is still a much better movie. I also felt this movie came too late since there are too many movies about the multiverse these days, especially since this is the most important arc in the Flash storyline. Still, I find there's a lot to like. It has fun cameos from past DC movies, even including one that was cancelled. The storyline is decent enough although fans of the Flash will find it familiar and thus predictable. The cast members did a decent enough job with Michael Keaton's Batman being the best. I gave it an 8 because I felt entertained when I left the theater, which is what a movie should be.

title: The demise of the Flash
text: I really wanted to like this, but I had a really hard time watching it beginning to end. At best, you could classify this as a mediocre movie. In fact, I think it's worse than the series, which is not a good thing.Turn off your brain, try to tolerate the goofiness, bad acting, silly and childish script, terrible side effects and you might be able to watch it whole.This comes as a disappointment to me as Flash is one of my favourite superheroes and after this we probably won't see another Flash movie on the big screen anytime soon. They had the chance to make something great and they made something atrocious.

title: One of the Best DC Films In Awhile
text:
Ignore the haters. Most didn't even watch the movie and outright refused to. A lot of people are just triggered Henry Cavill won't be Superman anymore. I don't think that should have any baring on this movie.The Flash is surprisingly good. The acting is good for the most part, the jokes land, and the story is very good. It follows the Flashpoint Paradox where the Flash runs back in time to save his mom, resulting in a parallel timeline/multiverse that is ultimately doomed. If you know Flashpoint then you know how this has to end, but if you don't then I won't spoil it. Is this movie 100% faithful to the comic or animated version of Flashpoint? No, but the beauty in multiverses is that this movie doesn't have to be and can still work on its own.This movie feels like the first time DC finally nailed the MCU formula (Pre-End Game not the current garbage). What's more is that this movie nailed the concept of Multi-Verses so much better than Marvel has with their poor attempts the last few years. No actor came off as bad or dragging the Flash down. By no means is Ezra Miller the perfect lead, but I think he did well enough, especially since he plays two versions of the Flash the whole movie.Michael Keaton is of course Batman in this version and he brings his A game. You can tell he very much he had fun being Batman again which fits perfectly with the character. In this universe, Batman made Gotham safe so he got to retire and move on with his life. Now that the Flash has arrived and needs help, Batman comes out of a long retirement to be Batman one more time. Eagle Eyed fans of the 80s Batman movies will also pick out a lot of Easter eggs to the films, especially in the Bat Cave.The only thing I'll complain about is the CGI. You can tell the budget suffered here. It's passable for the most part, but there are moments where you can clearly see how cartoonish some scenes look. For me, it wasn't a deal breaker and it's no where as bad as some Marvel movies/shows have become, but yeah it definitely could've been better. I don't think it's fair to give the movie 5/10 tho like some people have. The movie is engaging enough that for the most part I either didn't notice or care.Give the movie a chance. I personally think it's one of the best DC films, heck even super hero file
we've gotten in a long time, especially post Covid.

title: It is loads of fun
text: Loved it, from the epic opening sequence to the epic final battle to the surprisingly poignant overall message, this is a very well written film adaptation, and marvelously acted by Ezra Miller. I could tell which Barry is which the whole movie, even without the hair...his performance is exceptional. There are some surprises throughout, and there is a surprising amount of humor too. The CGI of the speedforce time bubble rolling outwards and likewise that of the multi-verse totally worked for me as interdimensional perspective. It is loads of fun, and pending the release of Aquaman 2, I'm really pleased to see the DCEU wrap up on such a high note.

title: I'm glad the DCEU is ending
text: While I do have a subscription to my local theater, I refused to pay money to see this movie. Not only because I've expected a low quality movie, but I also couldn't support this movie because of the recent behavior of the lead, and in the end I'm glad I didn't waste money or the extra time to this movie.Let's step aside the troubling things Ezra Miller did, I also never really liked their portrayal of the speedster Barry Allen. Maybe because the CW series was a great introduction to the character for me (I'm not a big DC guy), or maybe the character doesn't really work for me in the DCEU.Just to say a few positive things, I really liked Sascha Calle as Supergirl, and the return of the legend Micheal Keaton. And Jeremy Irons as Albert was also great.I'm glad I've watched the movie, so I can check it off my list for 2023, and after this review to never think about it again!

title: LOVEDDDDD IT!! One of the best DC movies
text: Okay before I start I just wanna let you guys know something so you go with this movie with a fresh mind and no no spoilers!So this is what you need to know The movie haves some BAD cgi at some scenes The cameos were beautiful! But don't expect other things.I died of laughter at the end scene it was shocking. That are my only miner points of the movie. But the Other stuff wooooow I really loved This movie and this one of my favorite DC movies and one of my favorite comic book movies and one of my favorite movies of the Year.The movie Really haves that 90s 80s 2000s Vibe Feel and I loved that. If this came out like 20 years ago this would be A iconic movie and still can be.Michael Keaton back as Batman is amazing!! My favorite Batman!Sasha Calle killed it as supergirl she was amazing!Ezra miller You can think and say whatever you want about him but he is a amen actor and he was Freaking amazing in this movie and he was phenomenal. Even with the action scenes the Bad Cgi Doesn't even matter it's a amazing movie and I will watch plenty of more times!Loved this movie!

title: Flash Pointless.
text: What a long and convoluted lead in for a film that was ultimately, in my opinion, so average. No, average is the wrong word, so much of a mixed bag of things I liked and things I didn't. In many ways it's a perfect encapsulation for what the DC Universe has been so far.Barry Allen (Ezra Miller) discovers that if he runs at top speed, he can enter the speed force and travel through time. Despite grave warnings from Bruce Wayne (Ben Affleck) he decides to travel back and save the life of his mother (Maribel Verdu). On his return he's kicked out of the speedforce by an unidentified assailant and inadvertently meets a younger more open version of himself. Having ensured that this version still gets his powers, Allen discovers that his adjustments have had grave consequences, as when General Zod (Michael Shannon) attacks, there is no Superman to defeat him.It's unfortunate that the quintessential Flash story, "Flashpoint" is adapted now, when both Marvel and the "Spider-Verse" series are deep into their own multiverse stories. It's also unfortunately that the film has gone through so many variations and creative hands that what could have been a triumphant end for the whole "Synderverse" era, is again another blank squib. Roughly speaking, I liked the first half of this film, but once the team were together, I was disappointed with what they did with it.I didn't particularly want to enjoy Miller's performance, given their recent baffling legal actions, but I have to admit that old Barry talking new Barry through the powers was probably my favourite bits, along with the opening capture rescue (which clearly takes play in Glasgow, if you're going to film in a place and tell us it's Gotham, maybe don't use its most recognisable landmark in the key scene). Allen dualling tale of loss is the films heart and whenever it leans into that it works quite well. Once the team are together, adding Supergirl (played by Sasha Calle, who's fine but doesn't have a lot to do) and Batman (played by Michael Keaton who is an excellent and, for me, surprisingly emotional return) the film becomes somehow markedly less interesting, as they battle a nameless army of Zod's soldiers and Allen eventually learns his lesson (although not really). I then can't decide if the cameos are just gratuitous or if they are a waste, because none of them really contribute to the plot and I'd hoped to see four versions of Superman join the fight in something to rival the end of Endgame.The quality of the CGI varies wildly across the film, presumably based on which effects house was doing what. That's a forgivable problem though relative to the saggy middle and a conclusion that delivers much less than it promises.

title: What Walt's Watching
text: In The Scarlet Speedster's first solo film, a quick trip back in time to save his parent's past has universe-shattering consequences in the future.Who knew "The Flash" was such a mommy's boy with daddy issues?Ezra Miller is "Barry Allen aka The Flash" who creates so much mess with the space time continuum to bring his mum (Maribel Verdu) as Nora Allen, back to life and avoid the death penalty for his father (Ron Livingston) as Henry Allen, it makes the "Spider-Man" trilogy look like a cake walk next to this bowl of Spaghetti Bolognese.He's supported by a stellar cast that I don't dare name due to spoiler alerts.Suffice to say mind blown!The Superheroes and Villains in this lineup will make you applaud with joy.Director Andy Muschietti has a history with horror movies, but now he's moved over to the even darker side, DC.Sure the SFX can look cheesy and cheap at times, but "The Flash" is a substantially better film underneath the surface.Watch out for: Saorise Monica (Derry Girls) as Patty.Listen out for: Jack White's Supergroup, The Saboteurs, on the soundtrack.I didn't stay for the Easter Egg, because after nearly 2 and a half hours that Stone & Wood delicious beer I drank in The Lounge needed to be exorcised.In the words of alternate Flash, this movie rips dick!You wanna get nuts, let's get nuts with "The Flash" on the big screen.Where does he get those gadgets?

title: Good but not Exillent
text: The 2023 Flash season showcased an exhilarating and captivating experience for both longtime fans and newcomers alike. With its lightning-fast pace, the season delved into thrilling storylines that explored Barry Allen's personal growth as a hero and his efforts to protect Central City from an array of formidable adversaries. The writers masterfully balanced humor, emotion, and high-stakes action, providing a well-rounded narrative. The visual effects and cinematography were breathtaking, especially during the epic speedster battles and time-travel sequences. The ensemble cast delivered stellar performances, with Grant Gustin's portrayal of Barry Allen/The Flash continuing to be a standout, showcasing his range as an actor. Overall, the 2023 Flash season was an electrifying and must-watch chapter in the ongoing legacy of the Scarlet Speedster.

title: Poor product with an unimpressive lead
text: After years of waiting The Flash finally hits the theatres. Eventually, it impressed me to a very little extent. To shorten my review, Barry never felt the lead character of his own movie.Yes, there were a lot of unnecessary fanservice along with a meddled and chaotic representation of Flash point mechanism. The CGI was too much, and at many times felt overused or was a total disaster. Keaton is the one who brings both effortless gravity and subtle levity to a film that, without him, wouldn't have much of either.Across the film's two-and-a-half hours, little time is given to developing anyone other than Miller's hero, wasting the talents of Keaton and Sasha Calle's Supergirl, who has a lot of presence but not a lot to do. To summarise, rather than the beginning of a cool new idea, The Flash now feels like it should be the last word on movie multiverses.My Rating : 5/10.

title: Spaghetti
text: I have mixed feelings. Its an enjoyable movie for a number of reasons but this adaptation of Flashpoint should have had the script developed, reworked and refined further before production. The story we are given is basic A to B with a garnish of ideas that could have been develop more deeply to provide an emotional ride. We are given instead nostalgic pop culture supported by extremely poor CGI. There are some wow moments stolen by Keaton and his bat toys, but majority was sadly revealed in the promotional advertising which takes dulls the surprise shine. And the fact of some of loved heroes face demise will certainly upset viewer for the wrong reason. In conclusion, instead of direct worldwide threat and JSA, this movie could have been edited heavily, cutting out the fandom, and focus exploring the emotional toll of consequences of the butterfly effect with dramatic decisions. The appearance of mysterious flash version should have remained as such setting up for more instalments. We have a fun over-hype movie that is worth watching, but not ground-breaking.

title: HUGE disappointment from the trailer hype!
text: Post-SuperBowl and commercials, this was looking like an epic movie coming. I didn't like Ezra Miller or the Flash character portrayal in Justice League, but the trailer looked like they fixed it. They did NOT!I must preface my comments by saying I don't like the concept or the movie plots around time travel. It's been done it better ways, but the theme of "changing the past and the consequences that follow" is just beating a dead horse. I mean, we just watched a similar movie with Spider-man No Way Home, so now we get the less popular DC version of it.Trying not to spoil it, the humor was weak, most of the characters (especially the lead) were bad, and it's disjointed. Case in point: terrible attempt at humor for young Barry to burn off his clothes at first, then he keeps them later. I agree with most that Michael Keaton is probably the highlight of the movie. The cameos were cute, but not done as well as they could have been. The end credit scene is absolutely horrible. And yes, the CGI is pretty bad in places.Superman's cousin was a nice add and Sasha Calle was good in her role. Miller's dual characters are just out of sync for me. Barry was very immature in Justice League and skittish - not the makings of a Superhero - just someone with super speed. Here in The Flash with dual roles, he's current Barry that's immature while in his timeline, but more mature and a bit wiser in the past (makes no sense). The young Barry is ridiculously immature to the degree of how did he ever become mature enough to be a hero.It looked so promising, only to be so disappointing.

title: The best DC film so far
text: If you're looking to compare the comic multiverses, then this is as good as the Marvel entries. Plenty of comedy laughs, heart string pulling and cameo surprises from the get go. A good balance of all things comic book. It was hilarious to find myself in an early showing of the film with 5 clones of myself from across the MALC-iverse 😂😂😎🙏🏻 go see this film now and Dont be disappointed.Best Batfleck so far. Needs more of him in this role.Best Barry Allen there has been. Shame this maybe his last.Michael Keaton rocked every scene. From when he first appears to the big finale.Enjoy the end credit scene. Nicely sets up the DCEU Gunn tenure. 9/10 91%

title: It delivers :D
text: As a huge fan of Batman /Joker had to wrote this review. First 10 minutes of movie are quiet borring but rest 2 hrs are ride for sure. Alot of ppl complain for CGI which sound ridicilous,those reviews are probably from same people which didn't liked " Man of steel". Without spoiling every moment of movie is a real trill ride! It has humor,non-stop action and even sad moments +introducing new character Kara. Performance of each actor is fabolous and this movie deserves to be watched. It conects story in some paths with previous movies so it all fits perfect. Everyone should watch it you wont regret :D.out.

title: This is how you can destroy a good story.

The only good part is Keaton how is he very good actor and returns back some old vibes but unfortunately not even close to the real story. title: A super entertaining movie
text: What a movie🔥, As a DC fan boy it is a visual treat. Micheal Keaton, Ben Affleck, Ezra miller, Sasha🛐. Full on theatrical experience. The last tribute like scene to all DC fans is just epiccc🔥🔥🔥. Ezra miller just carries the fun element of the movie and Keaton, Sasha , Affleck gives us the goosebumps elements. And man that dialogue of Keaton " Do you wanna get nuts , Lets get nutsss . Tbe theatre was cheering and whistling what a scene . It is a must theatrical watch . Enjoy the movie as a DC fan and cherish these memories with these actors who may not be seen anymore in other movies . Overall a sure 8/10.

title: Flash is the turning point for DC..
text: The Flash is one of the highly anticipated movie of the year and trust me when you'll see it it deserves every appreciation it's get. What a movie from start till end it'll give you a complete fun ride with powerful emotional scenes and superb performances by all the cast. Director Andy gives an excellent direction that only focuses on flash origin his story and the chaos that his made in the film. Screenplay is too simple and pretty good specially for those who follow flash comics or know the character pretty well. CGI is superb and you can easily connect with the character in just start of the film. 1st half focuses on storyline and 2nd half is full of action sequences and a conclusion. Dialogues are too good specially the conversation between the lead characters is amazing to watch. Bonus point of the film is the cameos that will totally surprise you and it'll make the movie more engaging to watch. Director Andy has done a fantastic job while making The Flash suachya cool film and bring back the nostalgia of the old characters. There are pretty good emotional scenes which I like the most specially in the end was heavy. The only thing that is lacking in thjs film is that they should've given little more focused on the main villain rather than just end it quickly. Don't go for the reviews this film is a treat to all DC fans and those who love Flash. Just go and see on the big screen as much as possible because it'll give you the best experience...

title: 52. Coincidence?
text: Exactly 52 min is how long it took before this film became mildly less insufferable. A nod to the comics perhaps?61 min until the only reason I stuck at it, Michael Keaton made his appearance and slightly elevated the quality of this abomination for a further 19 min until it became mildly interesting at 1hr 20min.The remaining hour made me smile once, and that was still due to MK's Batman.Overall the film is utter garbage, with the exception of cameos which unfortunately this film will only tarnish the careers of everyone involved.A prime example of how to destroy a well established character.

title: It's a love letter to DC fans
text: First, let's talk about the plot and writing, the plot is neatly written and the writing is great and the action is neatly presented in the flash movie, scoring which in my opinion is perfect. Performance great actors, especially ezra miller, he did a great job playing another version of himself, then Batkeaton ,woww he is the GOAT!sasha calle she's so baddas here, Michael shannon and Batfleck showing their recent performance well. Lots of Cameos presented here, really surprising. CGI and Vfx, talking about cgi and vfx, to be honest they are very inconsistent,and yeah post credits that don't work for me. Overall the story is good and great, makes me miss my mother, it's very great but not perfect.

title: Is The Flash the worst superhero movie ever made?
text: When the Flash came out earlier this year, I decided to skip it in theaters based on what I knew was in the movie, and I couldn't subject my parents to it. When it hit streaming, I gave it a watch, and was filled with relief. Relief that I didn't take one of my poor parents to see it in theatres.When Barry Allen (Ezra Miller) alters time in an attempt to save his family, he is met with an alternate version of himself. The two Barry's meet that timeline's Batman (Michael Keaton), and attempt to save the world from General Zod and reset the timeline back to normal.This movie could possibly contain the worst opening sequence in cinematic history. It was the closest I had been in a long time to just turning a movie off. The slow-motion part of the sequence took up half of the scene, and went way too long. All non-Batman actors in this movie should never be allowed to act again, except on sitcoms. Ezra Millers highly publicized legal troubles are evident in the film, with reported meltdowns by the actor on set. That being said, Ben Affleck and Michael Keaton deliver fine performances as different versions of Batman from different realities. Director Andy Muchietti might be a clever director when it comes to comedy, but he should never direct a big budget action movie again. I'm saddened to learn that he will be directing a new Batman film, as Batman is my favorite superhero, and I'm concerned with having the same person behind the camera for that project as The Flash. In The Flash, the presence of Batman might be the thing that saves this movie from total disaster.While I will never watch this movie again, I give it credit for having a watchable plot after the opening scene. I don't blame you if you like this movie. It's a goofy movie, that's just what it is. And if you want to watch a movie and relax and not take it seriously, you'll probably like this movie. I wouldn't. Because when I want to relax and enjoy a movie, I watch something with Adam Sandler or Jim Carrey. Not a superhero movie. We need more superhero movies like The Dark Knight. And it's a terrifying thought that instead of that, we'll be getting this from the superhero genre from now on.

title: GREAT MOVIE IF NOT FOR
text: As a SNYDERVERSE fan, I liked the movie Flash 2023. If I had the opportunity to change and add some scenes in the movie, I would definitely do it. The graphics are bad in some places, but not so bad that it spoiled the movie. The plot of the movie is good, Michael Keaton as Batman is great, and the cameos of the actors are also very entertaining. I would have taken away the scene with the babies at the beginning of the movie, added something else, made the movie more serious and with fewer jokes. I would add Henry Cavill's Superman, he would have fit in perfectly at least in the last scene. And George Clooney made a great appearance. In short, I'm waiting for the sequel, there are many drawbacks, but the advantages are much greater.

title: A Good Time (Ignore Everything Else)
text: First of all, Michael Keaton's Batman is not (really) the same one we last left in 1992. Rarely can actors and their directors capture the same lightening in a bottle 30+ years later, and this is no exception. However, there's a very entertaining Flash movie in here that teases the audience of what the exciting world that could have been with Ezra Miller is like. Affleck's Batman I'd also a far cry from the killer we saw in BvS but a decent send-off for his version in some really good action scenes. All in all, it's a really fun ride if you ignore all continuities (ironically enough) in past, present, and future.

title: Bad character usage, bad storyline and whole lot of batmen
text: I gave the movie 3 stars, One for the visuals , one for the old batman and one for his gadgets and fighting style. The rest of the movie seems dull and I can't even stand for the stupidity of the Flash in this movie. Even in a scene of Hospital collapse I mostly found him just standing there. He have super-speed, he could evacuate the whole hospital in seconds when he arrives, but all we gotta watch is Ezra Miller's stupid shock face. And the younger ver. Of the flash is even worse. He's 18, but acted like a freaking 12 yr old. There is no need to introduce that many batmen...Why I don't know why??? Please don't even download and watch this movie, Why waste data.

title: For the Batman lovers
text: If you are a Batman fan and over 30. You want to see this. The movie is not really great but has a lot off payoffs making the movie better.The biggest selling point is Michael Keaton as Batman. There are more payoffs. But Keaton as Batman is the biggest. Keaton as Batman delivers and I loved his character throughout the movie.Altough the flash is the main character, he feals like a side character in his own movie. I think the flash is way too goofy and sometimes annoying.Before the movie I wasn't a big fan off the supergirl idea. I thought it would be a Superman knockoff. In the movie superwoman was more impressive then I anticipated. She really carried the roleI feel mixed about the story throughout the movie there are weak moments, but it also has some great moments.

title: Almost as bad as Joss Whedon's Justice League
text: This is no joke one of the worst movies in the DCEU. The dialogue fell flat, the humor was subpar, and the plot was incredibly simple. Its sad what this cinematic universe has become, and while I don't want to come off as one of those diehard DCEU fanboys I feel that the movie should have received the same tax write off as Batgirl. The only scenes that are worth talking about are the ones featuring Barry and his Mother and I could feel my heartstrings being pulled each time they interacted. Aside from that, they really should have done a faithful flashpoint adaptation rather then putting in their own awful take on it. The CGI for this film also was really horrible, and It also felt disrespectful seeing them include the faces of deceased actors and reanimating them for such a mid film. Overall wouldn't recommend, and better off watching the DCAMU Flashpoint movie.

title: Well worth the wait
text: I had been looking forward to The Flash ever since Justice League, I really think they got the character right. Unfortunately they delayed it due to covid and in that time Miller has proven himself to be a problem, so I don't think we'll be seeing any future Flash movies. It's a pity because this was a lot of fun.The opening sets the tone of the movie very well. It's silly serious. There are moments where it gets a little dramatic, particularly the stuff surrounding Supergirl, but it never gets so serious that you can't still have fun with it. Even the ending where everything is wrapped up all nice and neat had a great gag thrown in.It was great to see Keaton as Batman again, I'm still curious about the Batgirl movie that got scrapped. I'm guessing that movie would have given some context to his character in this one.Sascha Calle was alright as Supergirl until she needed to speak. But hey, it's Supergirl I'm not looking for some sort of oscar winning performance.Ezra Miller really does do a great job, which makes his choices in life all the more unfortunate. I'd love to see a sequel, but I doubt that's in the cards. WB just can't seem to get their DC Cinematic Universe onto consistently solid ground.

title: The multiverse of DC Comics begin
text: This chapter of the DC Comics universe breaks a barrier that ends up opening a door that Marvel made with its filmography and that is to introduce us to the multiverse. On this occasion, Flash is the one who breaks that barrier by discovering that he can travel beyond time and space. All because of the desire to reverse what started his story and this movie gives details about the origin of Flash in this journey that he makes. The movie is not just another installment in the DC universe, but rather serves as a spin-off of the early Batman movies directed by Tim Burton. Michael Keaton returns to play Batman after many years, making it clear that his films were part of an alternate reality of this saga. The third act even leaves a tremendous surprise by showing us that other previous DC adaptations such as the Superman series of the 50s, Adam West's Batman series, the Superman saga with Christopher Reeves, the failed 1986 Supergirl movie, the canceled Superman Lives movie with Nicolas Cage and Batman & Robin with George Clooney are part of this multiverse. That becomes a nostalgia factor for those who already knew these installments and makes The Flash a fascinating movie for lovers of DC adaptations. Argentinian Andrés Muschietti excelled when he adapted Stephen King's novel It and has now proven to be suitable enough to make a DC Comics movie as well. Erza Miller really shined in his role as Flash, the action scenes are very good and the comedy is well balanced. The Flash is one of the best installments of this saga for expanding beyond the world of DC Comics. My final rating for this movie is 9/10.

title: Amazing story but it is too focused on Ezra he needs to go.
text: The DC universe's latest film, Flash, features Ezra Miller as the Flash, a juvenile and socially maladroit dogbody of the Justice League.
